dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Speaking of twins, do you have any siblings?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. I have a brother and sister.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ooh nice. How old are they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My brother is 27 and my sister is 22.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do they do for a living?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My sister is in college. She wants to go to law school after she graduates. My brother is a microbiologist.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, they're really motivated! I have two brothers. One is 21 in college for nursing and the other is a truck driver who is 26.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great. What are you future plans, considering you're only 25 years old?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Probably to progress my dreams of a musical career.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great. Are you in a relationship or married?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I live with my boyfriend. He is very supportive of me. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a girlfriend. She is in medical school.

s1.value: She is the Speaker at this event.

s2.value: His girlfriend is in medical school.
2. His brother and sister are 25 and 2

dialogue.author: 15178: I
dialogue.text: st bought an extra large pizza and two orders of alfredo, why am I like this?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Omg YUM! So much food. I'm jealous! lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm jealous you get to make this stuff, I don't think I could be around it all day and not constantly eat. I am still having trouble finding a job that works around my schedule any ideas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should try to get a job at Domino's! They're almost always hiring and you could work nights after class. That is, if you can avoid spending your entire paycheck there

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah that would be difficult, but just having a paycheck to spend would be nice. Do they pay their drivers well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: As good as anyone else, I guess. Fast food workers aren't paid great to begin with. But I know they get tips so I'm sure that helps!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's true, I just like the idea of getting paid to drive around in my car listening to music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes that would definitely be a perk! What kind of music do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been on a hip-hop binge lately, but I enjoy most music except country. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I tend to gravitate mostly towards pop-country, but I actually listen to podcasts way more than music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been trying to get into more podcast, any good recommendation on ones to listen to?

s1.value: They live in a suburb of Chicago in the middle class. They're not wealthy and don't have good jobs.
2. They like pizza and alfredo.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has been driving with Domino's for 15 years.
2. The pizza company is the largest pizza chain in the world.
3. The company also owns Taco Bell and Pizza Hut.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How does it feel like to be a youtube influencer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is really fun and really stressful.  I feel like I have pressure to put videos up every week.  Have you ever thought about putting some DIY videos up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I can entertain enough to do DIY videos, I just enjoy doing it myself. Especially after I was taken hostage!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That had to be stressful.  How did you get away

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I remembered my dad's training from when he was a policeman. It was scary!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet you were terrified.  Was your dad proud of you?  Since my dad is a pilot, he doesn't really understand why I like to do makeup videos on Youtube!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can understand his division, with him being a pilot. Too bad he doesn't enjoy your videos, but as long as you do that's all that matters!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree.  What is your high score in bowling?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I once scored a perfect 300. It was great!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's amazing.  My high score is 122.

s1.value: He is from Cleveland and has a history of high school basketball.
2. His high score is 12
2. He won the state championship in bowling.
3. He is a self made youtube influencer.

s2.value: Speakers role is to deliver instructions to his viewers. He has a YouTube channel and is a successful YouTuber.
2. His videos are funny and very informative. He has a small YouTube following, but he enjoys his job very much.
3. He is not that skilled at bowling.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have started a new DIY project to build a book shelf for my dad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds nice, does your dad ever do DIY projects for himself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He actually doesn't, but I always nag him to do some easy DIY's. Have you ever tried doing DIY's?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've fixed my own HVAC system before, but that was pretty complicated. Do you ever build chairs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It even sounds complicated. I've never built chairs but I intend to in the future, maybe when my current chair breaks lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Don't do it! Chairs are evil. We'd all be better off sitting on the floor more often. It's good for your back.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Really? What benefits have you experienced? I also heard sleeping on the floor is good as we get connected to our earth somehow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not only is it good for your back but I also think it makes you more intelligent. Most furniture is made by the global cabal trying to control society.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I see, that makes sense. This is gold information I will surely try it and hopefully witness the benefits myself. I can see you're quite intelligent yourself, is sitting on floors your only secret?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I also like to read electrical manuals and things like that. Tell me, do you know a lot about tin foil or radio waves?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not at all actually, but I would like to learn.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think about a lot of that stuff while I drive around in my car. I just wish my taxi didn't have a seat. It's a real conundrum.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a man and is into DIY projects.
2. Speaker 2 has never tried building a chair.
3. Speaker 1 is a man and is into DIY projects.

s2.value: He started a DIY project to build a book shelf for his dad.
2. He also fixes electrical systems.
3. He's not very interested in books.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is the name of your cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: it's named fred. i got him from the shelter so i didn't pick his name..i figured i'd stick with what he was used to!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's probably best for the both of you. Do you like the name that the shelter gave him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: hum it's not a name i automatically think of but i got used to it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wouldn't think of Fred at first either! I've switched the names of a few of my pets that I've adopted

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: what names did you switch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of my two dogs was named "Lady", but when I adopted her at 6 months old...she certainly didn't seem like a "lady". I instead named her "Jazzy"!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ah that's cool, who is the other pet that you changed names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Another name I changed was one of my four cats. Again, the pet was at a young age and the name "Bongo" seemed like a better fit than "fluffy." Fortunately, both pets picked up on their names pretty quickly

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: how long did it take for jazzy and fluffy to adjust to their names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Jazzi (the young puppy) took about 3-4 weeks to fully adjust. Bongo, however, seemed to take a month or two. That cat was much more stubborn that that dog!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ah probably also because older pets take longer to learn things!

s1.value: Speaker 1 adopted fred his cat from the shelter when he was 7 years old.
2. the name "Funny" was picked by the shelter and she's known as Fanny to most people.
3. Speaker 1's husband adopted her when she was 19 years old.

s2.value: He doesn't like to be called "Fred" and prefers "Fred" to other names.
2. He prefers not to have his picture taken, preferring to be "left alone"
3. He has a bad temper sometimes and likes to yell when he is mad at his brother (he calls him "Fred", his sister "Freddy" and his sister "Freddy")

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's your favorite horror movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Call me biased if you want, but it's the first Friday the 13th movie. Maybe if you met my dad you wouldn't be so terrified of it. He's a major nerd.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Possibly.  I would like to meet him. I could use some pointers on my own film work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's actually really supportive of new film-makers. He knows how much help he got from people around him. Have you made any new ones lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have actually. I made one that starred by boyfriend. It's about a man that travels to the future. I know, it's been done a lot but I think my take on it is a little unique.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Two birds with one stone right? Get his career going and yours! I love science fiction. What's your new spin on things?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, instead of being a hero or changing the time line for people now a days, he brings reality back to the people who have been living a fantasy. They have been deceived by their government for over 100 years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So he makes changes in the future, not the present huh? That definitely is different. Do you have any idea when you'll be able to release the movie? I'd love to see it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Soon. Yeah, he makes changes but here's the kicker- he wants to go back instead of staying in the future. Usually people always want to stay in the future because it is so great. In this, it's not. The past is what is great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I imagine some of it involves wanting to be with the people that matter to him. That's what I love about science fiction. It has so much fantasy, but so much of it is about human relationships.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know exactly what you mean and totally agree.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you make a cameo in it? Are you like Hitchcock, Allen, or Tarentino putting yourself in your films?

s1.value: He has written several children's books.
2. He has made numerous films for children and teens.
3. He has also written several fiction books and non-fiction books.

s2.value: He's a major geek.
2. He was a child actor.
3. He got his start in the film industry in the 1980s while doing a dance recital.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just won an important basketball game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome, what game did you win?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I play in NBA and we were playing against LA Lakers. Tough match dude! How is everything at your end? it must be cold up there in the mountains these days, huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Super cold, I haven't wanted to get out of my bed for day. But someone has to wrangle the kids and dogs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I see. I've never lived in the mountains, just casual trips up there and I barely remember staying the night there. I come from a hot city!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Which hot city do you come from?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Phoenix, Arizona baby! :))) and where are you from? Alaska or somewhere?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Right outside of Denver, in a town called Golden. Arizona is a nice dry heat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: cool! so it shouldn't be that cold, right? How come did you decide to live in the mountains by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is where I am from and where my family is from, why mess up something that has always worked?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: your'e absolutely right. I always wanted a kinda getaway house in the mountains. can you help me find a cosy one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think you might be looking for a relator, why be so cheap. You are in the NBA right?

s1.value: He is a professional basketball player.
2. His is currently ranked number one in the NBA.
3. He has won an important basketball game.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I moved there to live, it doesn't matter where. I've never stayed there.
2. Speaker 2: I live right by the mountains, if I get a cold, I want to curl up in the couch.
3. Speaker 1: I won a basketball game, I'd rather be on my couch watching my team play than up there in the mountains.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got my airline license.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congratulations! Your dad must be so proud. Where will you take your first flight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Probably somewhere nearby to start and then I will start to venture further and further out. I live in Florida now so maybe I will travel to California to get a grasp on a decent distant flight. Is there anywhere that you'd like to travel to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great idea. I like cold climates best. I would love to travel to Finland or Norway. I have been saving up for a while to travel to Europe.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing! How has work at the party store been? I bet it had been hectic during the holidays. A nice break to Finland or Norway would be a great for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You're right, it was very busy. Christmas, New Year, Lunar New Year, and Valentines. But it will hopefully be quiet soon. Although people like to tip a lot more during the holidays. Last week I made a custom order for 1000 balloons for a birthday party and the customer tipped me 150$!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's so great when people are generous and show appreciation for your hard work and efforts! Sometimes it's better for things to be busy. Maybe we can see if we can plan a route to one of your vacation spots and I can fly you there!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It would be great to fly somewhere together but perhaps we can try somewhere closer first. What kind of vacation spots do you like best?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like places that have a beach where I can sit out in some nice weather and relax. It's a bit opposite of the colder climates you prefer. A beach will be my first stop when I land in California.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We are definitely opposite! Still, any vacation is better than no vacation! I'm sure we could find a common ground. A city break perhaps?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A city break sounds like it could be good. Maybe a stroll around the beach side town towards the evening. We can see what restaurants are around the beach.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I enjoy dining out at restaurants. I was never very good at cooking! What kind of food do you like?

I like cold climates best. I would love to travel to Finland or Norway. I have been saving up for a while to travel to Europe. What kind of vacation spots do you like best?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I played my violin for a few hours.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's nice. What songs did you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I played "The Devil Went Down to Georgia." I'm sure you've heard it lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, that's one of my favourites to play too! Have you just learned to play it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been playing it for a while. I've never heard it played on the piano. Do you play it at the bar?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We have open mic nights every month and if it's slow I usually play. That is definitely a firm favourite with our crowd.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's the most popular food there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We don't really serve much food - most people come for the beer! We have the usual bar snacks like wings that most people enjoy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I love beer. Me and my husband love to go and have a brew every now and again. What's your brand?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not a big beer drinker but the most popular at the bar is probably Red Stripe or Bud. What is your favourite beer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's Miller Lite. Trying to watch my weight here haha. I ruin it by eating too many wings. Do you make wings at home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love cooking things like wings, tacos and homemade pizza. Definitely not diet friendly!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is only 25 and has not been performing professionally for long.
2. She has never been on stage for more than 30 min at a time.
3. She plays the violin.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had chocolate cake that was made with cream.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds delicious! I have to try it next time we hang out!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Absolutely!  It was fantastic! I know you will love it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank goodness I can eat whatever I want and stay skinny. I would hate to give up my cheat meals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are so lucky! I am definitely jealous! Why do you even have cheat meals with your metabolism?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I try to be mindful of my health. It is important to get in some nourishment instead of just junk all the time. I feel guilty about all of the soda because I hear it bad for bone density.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Really? I always have sodas with my hamburgers. What does it do that's bad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Apparently it weakens the bones. I am trying to cut back on soda, but it is hard!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I should cut back but it would be really hard for me to to.  I wonder if taking some kind of supplement like calcium would help so that we could keep drinking our sodas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Or just add extra cheese to those burgers that we love and get our calcium that way!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a great idea! Who doesn't love extra cheese?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cheese belongs on everything. Sometimes I will grab cheese sticks and just cruise around in my Honda and eat and listen to music. It is very relaxing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had band practice today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What instrument do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Guitar, but sometimes I play bass too. I switch off with a friend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What a fun hobby! I wish I could incorporate music into my outdoor hobbies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a great way to scratch that creative itch. I'm sure you could! You could always listen, or sing or hum. Heck you could even carry a little acoustic or uke around.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you play music for your mom?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do sometimes. It's always a bit embarrassing haha, but she enjoys to listen when I practice sometimes. Have you seen your mom recently ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I went skiing with her last month. It is a hobby that we share and bond over.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's really fun! I'm terrible at skiing, but it's such a fun way to spend a day. What difficulty slopes can you do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hit the black diamond with mom for the first time! It was challenging, but fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's super impressive. Your family must be athletic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We are. We have always been very athletically active in outdoor sports. Do you like outdoor sports?

s1.value: I have band practice today.
2. I sometimes play bass guitar.
3. I also do improv with a friend.

2. Speaker 2: What instrument do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I flew to the Bahamas.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! Is this your official first trip flying yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes it was! So excited to finally take my plane out for a spin. It was a long flight but totally worth it, the beaches in the Bahamas are gorgeous

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds beautiful! That was a great choice for your first trip. Not too far but still exotic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks, I'm very happy about my choices. Wish I could've brought you with me but those small planes need a pretty specific weight balance. A cigarette on the beach sounds fantastic

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish too! But knowing you, I'm sure that you'll have tons of pictures to show me, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh for sure. Every single palm tree and shell got a snapshot. I get so locked on in beautiful places like that, so much to capture. If I come over for dinner one night I can bring my photos along!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! Definitely plan on dinner. What are you doing this weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have a concert I'm excited for! I'm going to see 100 gecs, I dont know if you have heard of them. They are kind of a weird band but I love there music, they draw influence from a bunch of different genres

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I've never heard of 100 gecs. Are they alternative or indie? I like both genres with some pop too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are technically a "hyperpop" band. A fun mix of pop and alternative and EDM even! I recommend it. What are some of your favorite indie and alternative bands? I'm a huge fan of both genres, too

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like I should check out 100 gecs! As far as my favorites, they're not so obscure. I like The Killers, Vampire Weekend, Twenty one Pilots, Tones and I, stuff like that. What else do you like?

s1.value: Speaker 1 flew to the Bahamas.
2. Speaker 2 is their first ever tour date.

s2.value: Speaker 1 flew to the Bahamas. Speaker 2: Very cool, I would love to have flown too! What are your plans for this weekend?
2. Speaker 1: I have a concert this weekend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is school going? Did all your studying pay off?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: School is going well, but it's a lot of hard work. My mid-term exams are coming up, and I've been studying non-stop between classes, my part-time job, and sleep. I'm confident that I'm going to ace most of my exams, but I'm worried about my biology exam.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you like biology? I love botany, I find that you do best when you enjoy what you're studying.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I really don't like biology. I prefer the sciences that deal with a lot of math, like physics and chemistry. I'm mathematically inclined, and I think that helps me play the flute well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I see. Yes I've heard that music and mathematics have a lot in common - scales and all that. I've never been good at math, or playing an instrument for that matter, but I love listening to it. I think my plants love music too, I feel that they grow better when I have the radio on for them in the mornings, but that might just be my imagination!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ha! That's hilarious that your plants seem to love music. What types of music do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, I mostly listen to church music, but I like instrumental too, including the flute..  have you heard of Terry Oldfield

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I haven't heard of Terry Oldfield. What type of music does Oldfield make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sort of relaxation music, but he plays the flute himself, I love listening to him play. And so do my veggies! Actually, since you're into fresh produce, you should try growing your own sometime.. and come to think of it, it might get you interested in botany too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm going to check him out on YouTube sometime, most likely while I'm studying, since you mentioned it's relaxing. I should grow my own vegetables.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I recommend starting with something easy, like tomatoes - they grow really quickly, and don't need a lot of care at all, so they won't take up too much of your study time. What do you plan on doing after your exams are over?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll keep that in mind. After my exams are over and I have gotten my grades back, I'm going to celebrate my friends and just chill. Of course, I'll be working at my job, too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I painted a tree landscape yesterday that I'd love to show you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to see it. That's so cool!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I spent 3 hours outside painting the landscape view outside my home. I was hiding from my wife.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you ever talked to your wife about how you have a passion for art?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have talked to her about it, but she doesn't seem to care. She thinks art is a dead-end street and won't go anywhere for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well that stinks. You said you won the lottery, so you can't be hard up for money right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I did. I've got the winnings put back in my savings account. It's why I've tried to pursue art. It's really hard to follow your passion when your significant other isn't supportive of it though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't understand though...why isn't she supportive if it's a passion. If you didn't have money I'd get it, but you're still supporting your family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You're asking the questions I've been trying to get the answers to since I started. Maybe she is still stuck in the head space that "art is for girls." Or maybe she thinks it's taking too much time away from here. I mean I did spend 3 hours straight outside painting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well maybe you can compromise with her. Maybe she is upset that you aren't spending enough time with her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's why I've tried including her in my art. Tried getting her interesting in it. So it isn't just me doing art. It would be US doing art.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well hopefully she comes around over time I guess.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a painter.
2. Speaker 1 spends 3 hours outside painting every day.
3. Speaker 1 has a 3 bedroom, 1 bath home.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a man.
2. Speaker 1 was painted by a woman.

dialogue.author: 15616: Ha
dialogue.text: you run into any interesting people at work lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Always. As a waiter, I see many interesting people all day!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of food does your restaurant have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I work at a diner. American soul food is what we do best! You should swing by and I'll treat you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love it! I don't eat out much, but I will to see you!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great! Just give me a message and we'll have a table for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome! I love patty melts!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We'll get that for you and a nice cold beer! How are you today anyways?

s1.value: She is a waitress at a diner.
2. She works in a diner that specializes in American soul food.
3. She is an introvert and likes to stay home by herself.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a bus driver.
2. Speaker 2 gets many good tips at work.
3. He is a waiter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a crazy day. I was going for a walk with my dog and kids when my kid let go of the dog leash and the dog ran away. We had to chase after it, but we eventually got it back home safely.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my, that must have been wild! I'm so glad you were able to it back.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! yes we must have chased our dog for a few blocks.  It gave us good exercise!  Have you been able to take your kids hiking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we try to go at least one a week. The kids love it too. We're planning a big camping trip this summer. Maybe you'd like to join us?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome, yes absolutely! we would love to.  It'll be a nice get away and we'll feel comfortable having a doctor and a nurse with us! just in case ya know?  Would it be okay for us to bring our dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha, yes that is a good comfort! Of course, that kids would love to play with your dog. They've been begging for one but I'm not sure they're ready for that responsibility yet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hear ya on that...maybe my kids can show your kids what its like to take care of a dog?  Walking them, feeding them, picking up after them, etc...then see if they're still interested.  How have you and your wife been doing at work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be a great introduction for them. It's been okay, stressful as usual but I wouldn't want to be doing anything else. How's work been for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes totally, work has been okay for me.  My students are learning and thats what matters, they're a great bunch of kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great to hear. Are you teaching summer school this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No i won't be teaching summer school this year but maybe next year.  Will you continue working at the current hospital this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we'll be there for a while. It's close to home and the kids like their school so I don't think we'll be making any changes any time soon.

s1.value: I had a crazy day and I was going for a walk with my dog and kids when my kid let go of the dog leash and the dog ran away. We had to chase after it, but we eventually got it back home safely.

s2.value: Speaker 1: The kids enjoy hiking at least once a week. Speaker 2: They love taking the kids camping and hiking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finished my book, It was very suspenseful.  If your interested, you can borrow it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is the book about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is about the life of David Beckham. I didn't expect it to be so suspenseful, but it really kept you on your feet, with a lot of twists and turns about his life.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: David Beckham, is that the soccer guy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! I think you might really like it because of your love of soccer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: that sounds great. I'd love to borrow it sometime. Maybe we can meetup for a bite to eat and I can get the book then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes absolutely! That sounds fantastic. I know that you like to eat healthy, would you prefer a lunch date of maybe salads, or would you like to go to a seafood restaurant for dinner?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Salad lunch sounds wonderful right about now. maybe we can find somewhere that has salads and tacos.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! I absolutely love tacos. That sounds like a great idea. Maybe some kind of Mexican lunch spot. I would love to have some Guacamole too! Avocados are really healthy, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are! they have lots of good healthy fats! Mexican sounds great. What day should we go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds perfect! Maybe tomorrow, if you are free?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Tomorrow works for me. What time?

s1.value: David Beckham is a soccer player.

s2.value: David Beckham is a soccer player.
2. The book is about his life.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been saving up money to go, I just looked at packages for travel there, now I just need to take time off work to book it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: that's nice! what do you plan to do there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Im going for a surf trip, they have such a good waves. did you go to work today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: sounds amazing! No, I did not. how about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yeah righ!. yeah i did it was pretty busy today, I am so tired

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can imagine. What is your favorite type of food?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yeah you have no idea. Mexican food. what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Any Asian cuisine, but mostly Korean.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh thats pretty good too. how is your dog doing /

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: he's been pretty sleepy today. Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: he love to sleep. yeah two they are pretty crazy and big

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha, must be kinda crazy around your house with them. I think I might get another dog, he's so lonely.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a travel addict and is saving money for a surf trip.
2. He has 2 dogs, one is a poodle, the other a pug.
3. Speaker 1 is a travel writer and spends a lot of time traveling.

s2.value: He has a dog.
2. What kind of dog is he?
3. What is his name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How have things been at the newspaper? Find any good stories?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Things are good there, but it has been a slow news week for sure. Have you been able to cycle this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been slow for me this week too! Well, excluding my crazy pets of course! They are very needy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am curious. Are the dogs or the cats more needy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmmm, that's a really great question. If I have to make a choice I think I would say the dogs! They seem like they understand everything that I say! It can be annoying! lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I believe they can understand you. I was thinking of taking a puppy yoga class. It's yoga but with puppies in the room. Doesn't that sound fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! That is really crazy so therefore I love it! I have never thought of adding pets to yoga! It might be a little bit dangerous?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It might be. Thinking about it more, it could make a great write up for the paper!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: OH, nice idea for a paper or an article! I would be your source and I have a lot of experience plus it would help me out for when I am trying to meet people!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe you could bring your needy puppies! They might like to get out too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like so much fun! My pets are super pets! They love new people and they love to explore places and that sounds super exciting! Awesome!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope the cats don't get lonely at home.

s1.value: Speaker 1: How have things been at the newspaper? Find any good stories?
2. Things are good there, but it has been a slow news week for sure. Have you been able to cycle this week?
3. What are your hobbies?

s2.value: Speaker 1: How have things been at the newspaper? Find any good stories?
2. Speaker 2: Things are good there, but it has been a slow news week for sure. Have you been able to cycle this week?
3. Speaker 1: It's been slow for me this week too! Well, excluding my crazy pets of course! They are very needy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Someone at work showed interest in my artwork. They want to put it in a movie set!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's so awesome that it's going well! I would love to come see some of it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You're welcome to any time! California misses you! How is life in New York treating you? The hubby and kids doing well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing great, definitely keep me busy! New York is good, I'm settling into my new job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! Well, they're lucky to have you--the best meeting coordinator I know! I'm glad it's going well. Have you thought any more about a Seattle trip?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to fly out soon. Maybe you can come too, and we can find coffee houses that might buy some art.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great idea! It would be so nice to do that and visit our favorite city! I have to see if I can get off work. This next few months is the busy production time right now at the studio.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That must be so exciting to be involved with such a big studio! Do you have any exciting projects you're involved with coming up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, a couple of superhero movies, of course. Some more Spider-Man, if you can believe that. Plus a few romantic comedies, which are more my speed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I feel like superhero movies are all I see advertised now! That's so cool that you're in another Spider-Man movie, maybe your role will be even bigger this time!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I get to stand next to an ambulance and point and gawk at an accident scene--kinda fun! Yeah, it's a good job. Your kids would get a kick out of it, I'm sure, if you ever come here to visit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My husband would probably like it even more! Would it be possible for the kids to see any of the Spider-Man set if we visited?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a meeting coordinator for a big studio.
2. The Studio is renting out a movie set.
3. Someone at work showed interest in House Speaker 1's artwork.

s2.value: California misses you.
2. Do you have any exciting upcoming movie projects?
3. Would the kids like to see any parts of your Spider-Man set?

dialogue.author: 5178: How
dialogue.text: re your dogs and chicken doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing fine. I take my dog out once a day and make sure to feed my chickens and clean their pens.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you feed them? You yourself do or someone else for that? Are you interested in that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You can feed chickens a whole lot of things! Grubs are my preferred meal to feed my chickens. I do so every morning, just throw their food on the ground once they are out and they dig in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you cage them in the night? Any concealed housing ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a shed that I keep locked up. I have shelves that the chickens sleep in. Plenty of hay and the like that they sleep on. They're a real joy because they're relatively low maintenance animals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you have shed for dogs also or they just wander?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I keep the dogs in the house but let them out during the day. They really like being outside anyway. I take them for walks through the neighborhood. They really like interacting with new people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do the dogs provide security in the night? Do you actually need it? or just for pet purposes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I mean that are great at alerting me if something is amiss. I suppose you don't need any animal but they're great companion animals. So they serve a dual purpose.

s1.value: He has two dogs and three chickens.
2.  He owns a chicken coop.
3. His chickens are kept in a pen in the family's backyard.

s2.value: He has two dachshunds and a dog.
2. They are all very good dogs.
3. They keep the house very clean. They are very trained.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got a call from the zoo I work at, one of the monkeys escaped from its cage!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my goodness! Does that happen a lot?! How do you catch them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: This is a pretty rare occasion to be honest! We have to call animal control and be very careful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I bet. I'd imagine it's all hands on deck until he's back in the cage. What other animals have escaped, or is it always the monkeys?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We've had a few birds manage to get out but it's rare we ever see those again. The monkeys are pretty easy to get back in, it's just that finding them in the zoo is hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet. Once the birds are gone they're gone, but I'll bet the monkeys get hungry and tired eventually, lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah the monkeys just go around and eat a lot of food. So what have you been up to today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not much, to be honest. I watched some hockey, might play some basketball later. What are your plans once the monkey has been caught?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hopefully we can get him back in his cage by the time school is out. I have to pick up my daughter from school then I'm free for the evening.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's nice. Well time is of the essence! Make sure to pick up some bananas on your way to the zoo, lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's not a bad idea! Hopefully they are nice and full already so it isn't an issue.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well if they get hungry, they'll know which zookeeper to call. Best of luck. You're much braver than I am!

s1.value: Speaker 1 works at a zoo.
2. One of the monkeys escaped.

s2.value: Speakers 1 and 2 are employees of the zoo.
2. they are both strong opinionated.
3. they are always in motion.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a blast at the comedy club we should go again I heard about the next showing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure.  Who is playing there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: i have no idea yet

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, okay.  It should be fun anyway.  I could get some my friends to come and we can go as a group.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that's a good idea, we should all go and have fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Afterwards would you like to go to a dance club?  I know a great place for singles close by.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: really? that sounds like a good idea too...…..lets party!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah.  Hopefully I'll meet someone there unless you have some single friends you could bring along, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: of cosyou will.....i'm coming along with my friends

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool.  I'm sure we'll have fun regardless. I can't wait!  See you then.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: me too....see you at the show buddy

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome!  Have a great day.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a male.
2.  Today Speaker 1 is meeting another male named Speaker
1. They are both going to the same comedy club.

s2.value: He is the son of a pastor, played by Chris Meledandri

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went Christmas shopping and spent a lot of money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh fun! Did you get anything for yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did buy myself a few little things, but was able to find the exact Gucci purse my wife's been asking for.  She's going to flip!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's fantastic. My wife and I have been waiting to get a PS5, if they ever come back in stock somewhere.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We were able to by one off ebay for the kids, but it was marked up.   Had to pay almost 3 times the list price.  It's crazy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I waited a while to get the PS4 back in the day too. I'm sure we'll get the new one by next year

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure you will.  Hey, how's you new hobby going? I heard you were learning to bake cakes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's tougher than I thought it would be. But it's still a lot of fun. There's a lot of sciency stuff to learn, but it'll be worth it when I master it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well if  you need someone to practice  chocolate cake on, I'm your guy. Just don't bring it to  my house. The wife would kill me. She still tries to keep Miss USA figure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh man, it's tough to stay in good shape. The older I get, the harder it becomes. It seems like I have less and less time to exercise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I totally get that. It's an uphill battle.   Did you ever look into getting the laser eye surgery so you can get out of contacts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, trying to see if insurance will cover it. It's pretty pricey so hopefully they'll deem it medically necessary

2. I'm sure my wife is excited about the Gucci purse I got.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just had my daily yoga session

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice. How did that go? I'm going to be getting ready for mine soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was great, definitely feeling it in the muscles now!  How's your yoga going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It goes well. When it goes. Spending a lot of time chaseing kids around lately. Must be nice to not have that problem!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yep! Though maybe someday. Extra exercise and less sleep sounds appealing in strange ways! How is the family at the moment?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are all doing well. Busy, but well. There is always something going on. And the older they get, the crazier it gets. Thinking about whats for dinner. What will you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine! Maybe a chicken salad, how about you? Trying to keep it healthy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The kids have been asking for meatloaf for a while, so that is the plan for tonight I think. The challenge is to make it healthy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds delicious! I might do some potatoes with my salad for the earthy taste. I've been thinking about becoming vegetarian but your meatloaf would totally break me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The chicken salad sounds good to me. What do you put in yours? I don't know how long I would last as a vegetarian...

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually some herbs for the chicken - a fajita or cajun mix is always tasty, and then some vinegar type dressing. Yeah, it's a big decision for sure! Not sure I could go vegan though...

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We do alot of salads, but everyone always wants meat. Potatoes sound good. Maybe they get baked tonight. How about yours?

s1.value: Is a yoga teacher.
2. Has 4 kids.
3. Lives in San Francisco.

s2.value: He has a dog named Jack.
2. He is a yoga teacher and a member of the Yoga Yoga Sivananda Retreat.
3. He was elected Secretary of the Yoga Yoga Sivananda Retreat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you read any books last night?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I didn't I was tired after a long day at work. I love me some good seafood, sorry you are allergic to it. so do you cook the pasta and chicken yourself ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually yes, but I have a project where I'm trying to visit all restaurants in the country to see where I can find the best pasta! Do you have any quirky projects?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh wow, that's an interesting way to go about, italians do it the best. Yea, I'm trying to get my home renovated and wish I can do some of the things myself, it is very expensive to contract it out, do you do things for yourself or contract it out ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I am absolutely horrible with handiwork. Fortunately I don't have to do much myself since I am renting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh I see, I'm not good myself either and the handyman that I know who can do it for me is charging me arm and leg to get it done, I'm still shopping hoping to find someone who can work with me, do you have any suggestions

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, sorry. I never had to deal with those issues. Do you think your cats will approve of the renovations?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure he will, but got to work with him on the scratches on my doors, you need to see what he did to it. Anyways I guess, I will keep shopping around or better still I will go and learn myself you never know. So what other foods do you like ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you tried getting one of those scratch trees? Maybe that will distract him from the doors. What other foods.. I guess I like a good BBQ, you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, now that you've said it, I will definitely get one for him hoping he will leave my doors alone. I love BBQ, but some fried rice made with shrimp, beef and chicken will satisfy my me anyday anytime. Do you like fried rice ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like fried rice but I try not too eat other carbs so I can treat myself to lots and lots of pasta!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: aha!, I don't blame you pastas are calorie dense food, I tried to eat it sparingly although it is hard sometimes. Eating salad prior to eating pasta makes it much easier on me

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope that your college classes are going well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They're okay, might need some tutoring in maths. Are you good at maths?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to think I am, why do you need help with some?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not understanding how to do logs. Might just make some cake and try to figure it out again. Made any new peices lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cake is always a good solution! I can send you some links for some videos that might help with the understanding. I have just started a new landscape painting this week.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be great, thank you so much. If anyone can relate it to making cake, I could probably figure it out! Lovely, you should visit Dublin sometime. We have some amazing landscapes here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet, I would love to travel overseas more. I need to get selling more items on ebay and start saving. I've never been to Ireland! Have you visited the US before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been to NY once as a kid. Everything's so massive. I prefer the countryside more.  What have you been selling on eBay?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I mainly sell clothes, I try to wear second hand and resell. Sometimes I list some art supplies too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's cool. I might look into that. Too hard to work full-time while in school. Do you live in the city or country?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm about two hours from San Francisco, still a built up area but not like a massive city. I would love to live nearer the city, especially for selling art, but it's so expensive! ahh, school is important though,  you've got to try hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You'll make it there, you're rather clever. Yeah, I know, just a bit overwhelming sometimes. Need to finish to get a good paying job though.

2. Speaker 1 is also a writer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I thought of another talent I have. I can touch the tip of my nose with my tongue.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You have many talents!  Do you like to play video games?  There's a goofy one I've send on roblox where you burp alot.  You can also dress like superman in  it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds a lot of fun. However, I feel video games are for kids. I like to play with real people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you have any pets?  My corgi and I play alot of games at the local dog park. There are alot of other adults there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I don't have any pets and I don't plan to have it. Too much to care for. I like exercising though. What else do you do in the park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to walk around and see others there, but generally keep to myself.  I have a hard time approaching people.  There's one area of the park I go to that is a pretty high cliff.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet there would no one except you at the tip of the cliff. Do you get a nice view from there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, it's lovely. You certainly don't want to go up there if you're afraid of heights, though.  How is your girlfriend doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She is doing great but makes worry a lot as she is very pretty and I do not have good track records with girlfriends. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No one for me, currently.  I just don't know where or how to meet girls.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You go to park. Start from there. Let girls play with your dog and make relationships. Pretty easy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I had  your confidence. Maybe one day I will try that.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I thought of another talent I have. I can touch the tip of my nose with my tongue.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a cat person.
2. Speaker 2 is very nice and very funny.
3. Speaker 2 is a cat person.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Would you like to come to my 26th birthday party in May?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably, is it going to be on a weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yep! It will be the second Saturday in May.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can do that. Where is the party going to be?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I'm going to have it at my new house, if I can get everything settled by then. I should be able to, since I move in next month.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's so exciting. I have the perfect gift in mind for you. You're going to love it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Aw, that's so sweet, thanks! You can bring someone with you, if you want!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe, I can't plan my love life that far ahead though! You know how I am.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hahaha, true, true. I'm trying to think of a good theme for the party. Do you have any ideas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think you should keep it very upbeat and neutral where everyone will feel comfortable. Maybe a politics theme?!?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: LOL, definitely not! I always wanted a My Little Pony party when I was little, but that would probably just be weird now, at this age.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is totally weird...you should do it! But, only if you agree to dress up like a pony yourself!

s1.value: She is an amazing conversationalist and can hold a conversation with anyone.
2. She has no idea how old she is.
3. She was born on may 2, 199

s2.value: They were born on October 9, 198
2. They were part of the Nickelodeon show, iCarly.
3. They are now adults with their own children.

dialogue.author: 24512: Wh
dialogue.text: do you plan to go to the zoo next?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not that soon, I don't have much money to spare since I'm currently looking for a job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a smart move. Saving is a must, especially when unemployed. I was unemployed for a few months which is why I live with my mom, but I will soon be back on my feet. What job are you seeking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd prefer a trades job like an electrician but there doesn't seem to be much work, what job are you seeking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am seeking a musical part time job while I am attending Boston university. I applied at a metal music store and am waiting for  a call. Your job search seems like you may have to look elsewhere.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea it's going to require some searching, have you applied to many places?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just that one. My mom said I do not have to find a job, but I know I need an income to help. My dad passed and I feel like I need to help my mom out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that must be tough. How are you paying for university?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Luckily I got a full ride scholarship. So no matter what I can go to school. How long have you been searching for a job? Hopefully you have more options than me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been searching for around a year, doesn't seem like I have many options and might need to move or go to university and try to get a degree in something. What type of degree are you looking for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am looking for a bachelor's degree in biochemistry!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was thinking of getting a bachelor

s1.value: She is unemployed and living with her mom.
They are looking to buy a home, but don't have much money.
She wishes to become a sound engineer.
She also plays the cello and likes to try music production.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is unemployed.
2. Speaker 2 is looking for a job.
3. Speaker 2 is studying medicine at Boston University.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite style of novel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favourite is probably science fiction but to be honest I like s good fantasy or thriller as well. And sometimes even romance. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love sci fi and horror books!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, horror books are too scary for me. I can't sleep afterwards. Even worse with horror movies. Don't you have the same proble?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No. I've been obsessed with them since I was a kid. Sometimes, if it's super scary I'll watch a funny cartoon before sleeping.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good way of getting your mind away from it. I have to try that next time. Any good horror movie you could recommend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love watching the classics. Old Disney movies like Alice in Wonderland or Peter Pan. Do you like cartoons too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love cartoons, always watch them with my sister's kids when I visit. Sometimes I think I am enjoying them more than the kids. My favourites are Toy Story and Shrek, so funny, I can watch it 10 times and still laugh.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like Shrek too. I think the soundtrack is one of the best parts of the movie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree, it definitely makes the cartoon even better. How is your business going? Everything ok?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's great. I spend a lot of time working these days. Is it the same for  you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, the same. Too busy I would say. No time to find a girlfriend even. I need to try the internet dating I guess.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a fiction writer.
2. Speaker 1 writes for magazines.
3. Speaker 1 lives in London.

s2.value: She always has a black cat.
2. Likes to read a good thriller or fantasy novel.
3. Likes to watch classic Disney cartoons as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Starred in any more films recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I peaked with the Hobbit. No one even comes to New Zealand filming anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sorry to hear that. As you know that now-a-days the budget allocation mostly goes to the lead protagonists where as the producer has less amount of money to spend it on further expenses. So, how is New Zealand's local film doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's mostly indie films recently. A lot of horror films, too scary for me. Are you involved in the film industry?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, as I previously mentioned that I'm mostly into boats and fishing. I wish I could have more inclination towards film industry.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There's always plenty of opening in the film industry if you every change your mind. Not much work for 4'9 actresses though. Do you sell many boats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I usually sell around 5-6 boats per annum. I am really passionate about these stuffs. I'm not that much into movies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I could visit your island sometime but every time I have been on a boat, I had gotten sea sick. Do you have any tips?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes definitely, you should visit my island at least once. I would love to show you around. You can have antiemetic drugs before boarding. It really helps preventing sea sickness. It worked for most of my regular customers as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll give it a try and hopefully it works! What kinds of things are there to do on your island? I would love to go fishing

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There's so many things to see like a carnival park, beautiful breath-taking scenic views in the early dawn as well as fresh air and clear skies, even the stars are fully visible during the night.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing. You are so lucky to live there. I love to go hiking and it sounds like you have many things there to see. I will be free for a weekend in a couple of months. I would love to visit you then

s1.value: Starred in any more films recently? No.
2. I peaked with the Hobbit. No one even comes to New Zealand filming anymore.
3. How is New Zealand's local film doing?

s2.value: Starred in any more films recently? I peaked with the Hobbit. No one even comes to New Zealand filming anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you like volunteering at the animal shelter? The animals must be really cute, but it must be hard not adopting all of them. Houston must be pretty nice this time of year.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah they can be really cute and I struggle to not come home with them all haha. But its always nice to see them get adopted and leave with a new family. I think this is my favorite time of year actually feburary going into march. How is it back in Boston?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is cold! We have had several snow events this year as well. I bet you don't see that in Houston!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No we havent haha. I miss the snow though its always really pretty and can be pretty fun if youre feeling childish haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it has it moments. But I wish winter would only last a month or so.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aww no I miss it. It's part of Boston! Maybe you should move to the Caribbean that might be more you

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well then I would get no winter at all! Do you ever consider moving?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do sometimes consider going back to Boston. My family are there and I like the city so maybe one day. But at the moment Im settled and I can always visit when I want. How about you? Would you move for better weather?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Possibly. I would be able to bike and hike more often in a warmer environment and that really appeals to me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like hiking places when I travel. But with working night shifts I never really find time to go out walking or biking when Im at home. Im either at work or asleep during the day. Its not the best :/

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The late nights do make it more challenging, I'll give you that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How do you find all the nights? Any tips for how to survive?

s1.value: How do you like volunteering at the animal shelter? The animals must be really cute, but it must be hard not adopting all of them. Houston must be pretty nice this time of year.

s2.value: The other days of the week Houston is pretty nice.
2. It snowed quite a lot this winter here in Boston.
3. Boston is home to the world's largest snow crab.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey there! I'm listening to a new record. This is really good, you should listen.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What do you like about the record?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love the melody.  It's so uplifting and upbeat!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to give it a listen! I need to go out and buy more headphones though. I misplaced mine and playing it out loud would definitely annoy my parents again. How is Mr. Whiskers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got some wireless ones off of Amazon that I love.  I should send you the link for those!  He's doing great, cuddling up on my lap as we speak.  How's your cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, a link would be awesome. I bet the wireless feature is pretty convenient too? I think I hear mine downstairs meowing at something. Hopefully he's not messing with my mom's plants again!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok I'll send that on over.  Yes I love wireless, I would never go back to wired.  Haha my cat loves plants too.  My Christmas tree can't stay up long with him around.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a good thing they make up for their behavior with being super adorable. Do you have any new mechanic projects?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes absolutely!  I just bought a old junk buick that I'm gonna try and get running.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice! Do you think it's going to be a long project?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't looked too much into it yet.  If it is what I'm thinking it is, it should only take me a week or two to get it going.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow that's great. I bet being able to repair things like that is super useful!

s1.value: Is a motorcycle mechanic.
2. Has a large collection of vinyl records.
3. Makes speakers.

s2.value: Spoke at a science fair about how "motorcycles can work as vehicles and even bicycles".
2. Speaks on a mic so you can hear him even when he's in the bathroom.
3. Speaks a lot

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I completed my computer programming test

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congrats! Are you taking more computer classes going forward?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! I want to finish my degree in it eventually but I'm going slow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's ok, I'm sure you are super busy. Did you have background in computer science before you started taking classes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, but I've always enjoyed messing with computers in my free time! Do you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't take any classes, but I was raised when computers were making their rise, so I have always been around them. I've pretty tech savvy for the most part.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah nice. I've always lived in a rural area my whole life, and I remember my first time interacting with a computer!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's crazy how far they have come over the last 20-30 years. I remember my Dad bringing home his computer tower and huge monitor to work at home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Me too! My grandfather thought it was crazy when they came around. He was so excited for me to take the classes

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm really sorry to hear about him passing, by the way. I bet he would be proud of you for working so hard at school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you! I appreciate it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No problem at all. I know it can be hard to lose someone you love. At least he lived a full, long life.

s1.value: Speaker 1 completed their computer programming test.
2. Speaker 2 doesn't take any classes but she is tech savvy with her devices.
3. They have been together for over 15 years.

s2.value: Born in 1972 and raised in Pennsylvania
2. She is retired and lives in Pennsylvania, with an 11 month old son and 5 year old dog, who play together a lot
3. She is a mommy to a big, goofy, lovable, little boy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I heard back from one of the publishers and they want to publish my book!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is the best news, how exciting!  What is this book about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The book is a suspense thriller. It's about a serial killer that tries to live a normal life and he only kills people that have committed crimes and gotten away with it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like exactly the kind of books I love to read!  I kind of think that kind of vigilante justice should be allowed lol.  How cool!  Are you meeting with them to discuss it or what happens next?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'll be meeting them next weekend over brunch. I'm really excited! What type of food do you think we should eat for brunch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very cool, good luck with that and definitely keep me posted on how it's progressing, I want to read your book!  Hmm...for business meeting I would usually recommend, something light and easy to eat.  Maybe a place nearby that has good salads and soups?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ooh yeah that sounds good. I'm thinking Panera Bread would be a good place. I like their soups. What do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly!  Panera is a perfect place for something like that!  You don't want to go somewhere that will detract from what you need to talk about.  It's a nice, clean place with good food.  Great idea!  I love their soup too, they are always so unique!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Speaking of food, what kind of soups do you like to cook when you go hiking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually go for cheese broccoli!  It's a favorite when I'm on the trail!  Or a nice yummy stew!  Keeps my energy up for the rest of the hike!  Do you ever go on hikes yourself?  Sometimes it's really fun to go to a beautiful, secluded place and take a reading break!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've never been hiking before, but it does sound interesting. I think it would be a good idea to sit and write, just me and nature. How often do you go hiking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, exactly!  It helps me clear my mind and I feel so focused so I think it could definitely help with your writing!  You need to try it!  I always get out Saturday mornings when the weather is decent, and I try to go at least one more time a week.  I like to go on hikes that are about 10 miles :)

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have a book that I want to publish. The book is set on a murder mystery, and about a vigilante that tries to live a normal life.
2. Speaker 2: How cool!  That sounds like a book I like.  When are you planning on writing the book?
Speaker 1: It's scheduled to be published this fall 2017! I'll meet with the publisher this weekend next week over brunch!

s2.value: Speaker 1: I'm a native of Brooklyn, NY.
2. Speaker 2: I live in Manhattan, NY.
3. Speaker 1: I have a Bachelor's degree in creative writing from NYU.
3. Speaker 2: I have a degree in English from Queens College.

dialogue.author: 19481: I
dialogue.text: aded some student math tests.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Were they up to standard or must try harder?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think overall they did a pretty good job! Some of the kids are natural mathematicians. For others, it comes a little harder, but they excel in other studies like English or Art, kind of like you!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just can't deal withat whole 12345 counting thing. Words are where we're at. So, no dunderheads in your class?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I completely understand. No, no dunderheads, but I do have a couple of young boys who like to cause trouble. Passing notes, and talking during class time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Boys who cause trouble make up 90 per cent of the people at comiccon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure they do! Are you going to be there again this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course. Tell your 8th graders to look out for Bat Girl this spring.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I will! I think I've seen a couple Marvel comics in their desks, but I'm sure they would love to branch out!

s1.value: I graded some student math tests.
1776: I graded some student math tests.

s2.value: They are very creative.
2. They are natural mathematicians.
3. They get to be at Comic Con in the Spring.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm going to go for a swim later. Want to come with?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure I'll come. It has to be before 7pm though, I've got a lot of money riding on this basketball game tonight.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope you win! Okay, we can do it soon. I wanted to take a little hike, then swim nearby in the community pool. Maybe we could meet up in an hour or so?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: OK, yeah that sounds good. I guess I don't have to be back in time for the game, but it would just drive me crazy if I didn't know the score. How strenuous of a hike is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Pretty easy. Just enough to work up a sweat, after which we can cool off in the pool. I don't want to be out too late, either. Gotta work tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ugh don't remind me, I've gotta get up early to start my new job too.  My new boss can be very demanding. How's your job working out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Fine, I have no complaints. Besides the early morning wake-up, but I suppose that'd be true of any job. It's a short week for me, though. I'm taking off early Friday, which will be nice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds good. Doing anything fun planned? The only good thing about my job is that I am able to go on nice long walks during my lunch break.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice, good to have an outlet for relaxation like that. Yeah, Friday I'm going to a Lukas Graham concert. Actually if you're interested and you can get off work early, I have an extra ticket.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not sure who that is actually? But I'd love to come, based on the outcome of tonight's game I may or may not have the money to come though lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, it's on me. Like I said, I've got an extra ticket and it's already paid for. They're a Danish pop group. Really catchy tunes, just fun stuff. I think you'll dig it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh very cool -- I'm definitely interested then. Thanks for the extra ticket, I guess I'm coming either way then!

s1.value: An author of several books, including The Power Of Positive Thinking, Speaker 1 has enjoyed a long and successful career as a speaker and spiritual advisor in many fields, including parenting, marriage and self-help.
