Speaker 1: Pretty easy. Just enough to work up a sweat, after which we can cool off in the pool. I don't want to be out too late, either. Gotta work tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you figured out a way to communicate with the ghosts in your house?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not yet, I have been trying several things though. Last night I tried using a spirit box, but only caught a few muffled voices and choppy words.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that sounds crazy. Being a ghost must be freaky, you know how I feel about invisible things

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I don't blame you. I really wish I could get something back, like a sign or message, from the ghosts, but I don't think I would want to be one wither.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just eat my vegetables and mushrooms to stay healthy. I wanna live for a long time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds good! What all have you been doing to stay healthy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just eating well and exercising. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I stay active with my dogs. I take them on walks at least every morning, and sometimes in the afternoon if the weather is nice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are the 4 rascals? Doing well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, they are all happy and healthy. They keep me busy though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: how much money do you spend on them a month?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It really depends on how many toys or accessories I buy them! I probably spend at least $100 on food each month and then sometimes another $200-300 on grooming and toys.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a ghost.
2. She was never good with ghosts.
3. She keeps a busy schedule with the 4 dogs.

s2.value: is a ghost
2. Speaker 1 has been trying to get a communication from the ghosts in the house with nothing to no avail.
2. Speaker 2 has had a lot to think about recently because he really wishes he could get something back from the ghosts.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not. I don't find that I have much time for leisure reading lately. Robotics sounds fun! What do you like about it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really like the world of possibilites that it opens. There is so much that robots can do that humans cannot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes that is true. I have a hard time wrapping my head around it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is complex, but really I think anyone can learn it if they want. Have you taken any late night walks lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love to walk! I enjoy the quiet of the night and the feeling of solitude. Luckily I live in a safe area to be able to do that. Do you like walks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like walks through nature a lot. I don't want to walk at night, but give me a good hike through the woods anyday. Do you see anything good on your walks/

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see more during the day and I love to hike also. Sometimes I play a mindfulness game and focus on colors of the rainbow. I find I notice a lot more in my neighborhood that way. Things I wouldnt notice otherwise. What are you going to do after graduation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that's so interesting I will have to try that. After graduation I am going to take a year off to travel. Travel is my number one passion in life, and I want to get some in before settling down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats exciting! I wish to travel more. Where is the number 1 place that you would like to go to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Japan is number one on my list. Their culture is facinating to me. Where would you like to go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Japan would be very interesting to see. I want to travel to Alaska. I hear it is beautiful

s1.value: Speaker 1: Have you read any good books lately? Speaker 2: I have not. I don't find that I have much time for leisure reading lately. Robotics sounds fun! What do you like about it? Speaker 1: I really like the world of possibilites that it opens. There is so much that robots can do that humans cannot. Speaker 2: Yes that is true. I have a hard time wrapping my head around it. Speaker 1: It is complex, but really I think anyone can learn it if they want. Have you taken any late night walks lately? Speaker 2: Yes, I love to walk! I enjoy the quiet of the night and the feeling of solitude. Luckily I live in a safe area to be able to do that. Do you like walks? Speaker 1: I like walks through nature a lot. I don't want to walk at night, but give me a good hike through the woods anyday. Do you see anything good on your walks/

s2.value: Speaker 1 said they have not read any good books lately.
2. Speaker 2 enjoys robotics and the possibilities it offers.
3. Speaker 2 is going to take a year off to travel.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I spent the last hour practicing music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh nice, i know you are in college for it but i don't remember...what instruments are you playing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I play the piano. It's my passion. Do you do live concerts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yes, i wouldn't be able to make a living off my music if i didn't go live.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I like live concerts too. Where was your best concert ever?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: 2019 for sure. what were you practicing on the piano?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like jazz and classical pieces. Beethoven is my favorite. Do you like classical music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: it's okay but it sure doesn't beat country! how many years of school do you have left before you graduate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am in my second year, one more to go. School is hectic but for sure worth it. Have you ever taught the guitar?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh wow you can do it you're so close. don't give up.  i've done it here and there but since i can't do everything on the guitar it makes teaching tricky

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you. I am motivated. Do you do runs on the beach every day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: well i don't always have time to do it, but i make sure to go to the beach once a week to do my runs.

s1.value: He goes to school and plays the piano.
2. He has done some live concerts with his band.
3. He lives on the beach every week to do his runs.

s2.value: Speaker 1 spent the last hour practicing music.
2. Speaker 2: i don't remember but i do remember being in college for it.
3. Speaker 2: is going to grad school for it.

dialogue.author: 14630: Wh
dialogue.text: is your favorite Elvis Presley song?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really love Hound dog. Do you like Elvis?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I've never listened to his music. He seems cool though, I heard he likes peanut butter and bacon and banana sandwiches

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I tried that once, but it wasn't as tasty as he had claimed. I would rather have the bacon on the side.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, banana and bacon seems like an odd combination. Now I'm hungry haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me too! Have you had breakfast yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not yet, I'm still lying in bed and don't want to get up. What do you usually like to eat?

s1.value: He is a speaker.
2. He likes peanut butter and banana sandwiches, though he hasn't tried one from Elvis Presley.
3. He is not good at eating.

s2.value: His favorite Elvis Presley song is Hound Dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of dog would you want?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love a dalmatian or a poodle. Do you have any dogs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I don't have one now. Last month Rob died due to kidney infection. He was a poodle

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! I'm sorry to hear about your dog. Pets do really become part of the family. I was told poodles were hypoallergenic which is why I am thinking of getting one because my mother is allergic to dog hair.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's true Rob was our family member. We miss him so much. with poodle you want have any issue. Make sure he won't go in your neighbor's backyard. LOL!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I need to make sure of that. My neighbors are quite dramatic. I can't imagine the drama if the dog happens to go on their property by accident!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can understand. Sometimes it's really hard to cope with neighbors. Thank God my neighbors are nice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You're so lucky! My neighbors are not mean, but they do take things very personally with everyone in the neighborhood and it has caused a lot of misunderstandings in the past, so I just avoid them at all costs. How long have you had these neighbors of yours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's what you can do and is the best strategy.  We are living together for last 8 years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's nice! Eight years is a long time and enough to build a lot of trust. Sometimes you need good neighbors for when you have emergencies or when you need someone to receive a package for you for example.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We are like a family now. When I need help, first I think about that. Hope one day you and your neighbors relationship improve. Try to do their make over. haha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are actually getting married soon, maybe I can do the makeup for the bride at a discount and gain their friendship!!! What a great idea.

s1.value: Rob died to kidney infection due to cataract. Rob was a poodle

s2.value: I would love a Dalmatian or a poodle.
2. Last month Rob died due to kidney infection. Rob was a poodle

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had an interesting day at work

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yeah? what did you do at work, what happened?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had to break up a fight between two women who were drunk.  Eventually, we had to call the police and they were both taken into custody.  I suspect one of them will need a good attorney.  It was pretty wild.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yeah it sound pretty wild woo thats crazy compared to me, i was just playing basketball

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Being a part time bouncer is sure interesting.  The bar I work at is a college bar, so things do get a bit crazy at times.  For now though, while I am in school it puts a little money in my pocket.  I am studying law.  What do you do at the law firm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: everything about law. are you trying to become too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would like to be a trial attorney someday.  First though I need to get into law school.  I have applied to several but haven't heard back from any of them yet.  What law school did you go to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am done already about to retired an play with my kids but i know you will be one soon. I just spend time with my kids now

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great that you have had a successful career and were able to retire.  I hope to do the same one day.  How many kids do you have?  Were you playing basketball with them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know you will. yeah they love so play almost everyday in the afternoons , but i am getting old man haha they have so much energy

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I used to play a lot of basketball and I miss it.  Now, between school and part time job, I don't have much time to play anymore.  I haven't been around young kids for so long that I forgot how much energy they have.  On the other hand, they keep you young!  How old are your kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yeah they have a lot and it sucks cause i don't drink sodas anymore

s1.value: She's a bar bouncer and works at college bar
2. She's a student at school and does a lot of other things besides being a student

s2.value: She is an attorney
2. She has a part time job as a bouncer
3. She plays basketball and her children have an abundance of energy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went surfing, I did not drink any beers because my doctor told me not to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That really stinks.  I'm sorry you have to stay away from beer.  I'm glad you got to go surfing to take your mind off it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I love surfing and beer so I couldn't help thinking about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense.  How were the waves today?  I've heard that Florida has some good surf.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They were mild. I've had better but it was a solid ride. I would love to surf in California.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should come visit me in San Fransisco.  There's some great surfing in the Bay Area!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah have you ever tried it yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I want to, but a friend borrowed my surfboard and never gave it back.  What a jerk.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, I guess they are not much of a friend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know, right?  But maybe it's for the best.  Whenever I go surfing I track a bunch of sand back into my apartment, and I really want to keep it clean.

s1.value: He's a doctor.
2. He does not drink beer.
3. He surfs.

s2.value: Started using marijuana at an early age.
2. Worked on a food truck.
3. Lost most of his teeth when he fell in a mud pit in Mexico.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been studying for college?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's what I've been doing the last hour. My parents have been really on me about it. They say I'm spending too much time with Luis, and not enough with my studies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's really good, what subject have you been studying?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really want to be a chemist, like my grandfather.  But all those molecular compounds are just so hard to remember, I've been thinking about dropping out, but I don't know.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well if your grandfather can do it then I'm sure it runs in the family! Maybe your parents are right about spending too much time with Luis, would you possibly take a break with her until your studies are finished?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a lot to ask, she is so special to me, but she can be kind of high maintenance. Maybe I should drop the band instead? We haven't been doing as much together since High School.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, if you're not doing much with them then it makes sense to drop it, but I don't think that's going to free up much of your time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Man, you're hitting me hard with all the straight talk today. I can see how you get all those people in shape!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Exactly! Not everyone wants to hear the truth. I use my abruptness to get people to think more carefully about their food intake and amount of exercise they do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, maybe you're right maybe I should spend a little less time with her to focus on college. I just don't know how to break it to her? Truth is, she's kinda my first girlfriend, but sometimes I think she only wants to be with me because of my Mustang.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can't blame her, Mustangs are awesome. How long have you been together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We've been together since Junior year of high school, so almost three years. Just around the time my parents bought me the Mustang for my 16th birthday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What are your kids' names, do they not like tomatoes either?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My kids' names are Mark and Gracie. Mark is my kid who uses a wheelchair. What about your children?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have twins, both hate tomatoes! Which is such a pain as tomatoes are my favourite things to cook with. What kind of activities do you and your kids enjoy doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm the only one in my family who hates tomatoes. We like to make a lot of puzzles together and play board games.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds fun, and perfect for when the weather is rubbish like it is now! Actually the weather is usually pretty terrible here in the uk. Do you enjoy going on walks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear about the bad weather. I'm in California where the winter is pretty mild. I love walks around the lake. Do you take walks with your family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've never been to California but would love to go. Can you recommend a particular area to stay? Yes, we try and get out on a family walk once a week at least. I love them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should visit! I love the Bay Area and highly recommend you stay in San Francisco. You can walk in Golden Gate Park with your family when you visit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's an excellent idea, we have family in San Francisco so it's quite silly we have never visited. I think it's the cost of the long haul flights that has always been a problem. Have you ever been to England?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I haven't, it's such a long trip and like you said, so expensive. Maybe someday I can make it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be nice, maybe we could finally meet up in person when you do!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yay! I look forward to that!

s1.value: He is a wheelchair user and his kids like tomatoes.
2. He lives in California.
3. The weather is terrible here in the uk.

s2.value: Speakers are known as the one to "turn" on to a topic by saying "Oh, oh, oh" or "My, my" etc. This is often followed by a follow up question with a slightly more precise answer.
Speaker 1: My husband, he works a lot, he can't really be with me all the time, so he's been traveling. What kind of activities do you and your kids enjoy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just had a ballet recital.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How did your recital go? Did you have fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a blast! I was the lead ballerina. How is your husband, daughter and grandchildren.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My grandchildren are having a good time in school! My husband and I are in the process of passing our upholstery store to our daughter. How is your nursing school going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is going good I have exams comming up and they are tough so I have a lot of studing to do.  How is your daughter doing with the upholstery take over. Is it hard reliquishing the reigns or are you excited for your new chapter in life as well as your daughters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am excited to see how she will get on! I am looking forward to being able to retire at our home next to the lake with my husband. My grandchildren are in a christian school and I remember you went to one too, did you enjoy it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do enjoy it very much. It is very enriching and gives you a more faith based view instead of a secular. Your home on the lake sounds beautiful. It will be wonderful to spend time with your husband and grandkids in such a peaceful and tranquil place.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you! I am looking forward to it, my husband and I love fishing on the lake. We are wondering what colour we should paint our house, what is your favourite colour?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you, my favorite color is red I think you could do an ancent wall wall in red that may be nice. I have never beeen fishing I hear it is very relaxing though. I hope you enjoy yourselves.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you! Do you have another ballet recital tomorrow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, but I have a ballet practice tommorrow that should be fun. Will you be doing any painting or redecoration you home on the lake tommorrow or will you be helping your daughter learn the ropes of the upholestry business?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will probably be supervising her to run the business for the first few weeks and then I will retire to the lake! Maybe I could come and see you perform sometime, I love ballet!

s1.value: How did your ballet recital go? Did you have fun?
Speaker 1: I had a blast! I was the lead ballerina. How is your husband, daughter and grandchildren.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has been married for 41 years with one daughter and two grandchildren.
2. Speaker 1 teaches upholstery for a living.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good news, I finished my math homework!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great! Good to hear it. I hope my students finished the science assignments I gave them. You never can tell!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Lol why is that. Do most of your students not finish their homework? Maybe science isn't popular among the kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It depends -- they're usually pretty good. But there's always one or two kids who didn't manage to get it done and they've got sob stories to explain why. "Our basement flooded and I had to help my dad." "My dog ran away." And so on. But it comes with the territory -- I still love my job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure they are still good kids at heart, probably just unmotivated or have trouble at home. It's not easy being a kid. I did not do well in grade school either like some of those kids so I understand. But you seem like a great teacher and they're lucky to have you. How long have you been teaching science?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ever since I moved to Georgia. So about seven years now, I imagine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, where did you used to live? Is it Wisconsin since you're a Packers fan?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, you guessed it. Fon du Lac. Nice city, but I don't miss it all too much. Go Packers, lol!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Woo, go me haha. How are the Packers doing? My Texas Longhorns did not do so well, but I am still a fan for life!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not too bad. They're 13 and 3 right now, so I can't really complain. Are there a lot of Longhorn fans at your college?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yep, I would say 9 out of 10 people are fans. Even my 1 year old niece is a fan! Who is your favorite football player?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that would have to be Aaron Rodgers. Hands down, without question.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I finished my math homework.
2. Speaker 2: Great news, I finished my math homework.
3. Speaker 1: Lol why is that. Do most of your students not finish their homework? Maybe science isn't popular among the kids.

s2.value: They live in Georgia.
2. They're a Packers fan.
3. They're a professor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We have recently booked Jacob Sartorius to play at the Casino. Are you interested in going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. I am definitely interested. How much are the tickets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are normally $60, but I can get 25% off for being an employee. Do you want me to pick you up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I would be very grateful. I have wanted to see him in concert for years, but haven't been able.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! Have you been up to anything fun recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually started taking a pottery class at my local community college. I'm thinking about making my own pots and dishes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like a blast. How often to do go to the class? I'd love to learn how to make pottery.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I go three times a week. I am in the beginner class but they have different levels. So how are the kids doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are great. I miss seeing them when I work at night, but you have to pay the bill, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I imagine. Are there any higher paying jobs that you can do with your statistics degree, or do you have to go back for your Master's?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A masters degree definitely would be more useful. I just need to find the time to go back to school and get it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nowadays they make it more convenient with lots of online options available. My sister is getting her Master's from Emerson University currently. She does class in her pajamas, lol.

s1.value: He is an actor, singer, musician, and comedian who's a friend of Rush Limbaugh, and has appeared on The Daily Show with Jon Stewart, The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, 60 Minutes with Michael Moore, and The View.
2. A native of New York, he now lives in New Jersey.

s2.value: She is 19 years old.
2. She is an English major.
3. She works as a cashier at a local bookstore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you have an autograph from any baseball players?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do! I got one from Barry Bonds when he was on the San Francisco Giants.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! I was there and tried to get one in his last game in 2007 but sadly could not.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah too bad. Is San Francisco your favorite team?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's one of my favorites. I am not from SF, but I do follow Giants, Seattle Mariners and LA Dodgers, mainly. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not too into baseball so I just follow the popular teams like NYY and Boston

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool. Anyway, how is your diet going? Did it help you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah I already lost 5 pounds this week. I think you should try it if you can afford it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would totally love to! And 5 pounds in a week! That's great! Way to go!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha thanks! I'm also trying to exercise more because it goes in hand with the diet

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's for sure. Sadly, I cannot give time for both. It's either the diet or the exercise for me. I jog every day, but it hardly helps keep the weight in control. Having a balanced diet will help, but I really don't think I can spend anymore time in meal prep. Sigh!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish you the best friend. In these times we get whatever we can take.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a baseball enthusiast.
1. Speaker 1 used to be a baseball player.
1. Speaker 1 has an autograph from Barry Bonds.
1. Speaker 1 has an autograph from San Francisco Giants player.

s2.value: He gets autographs from baseball players all the time.
2. He has lost 5 pounds in the last two weeks.
3. He drinks a lot of coffee.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How did your wedding go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was the most magical day of my life so far, and the reception was a party even you might be jealous of. Go to any good parties lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No good parties lately, I'm afraid. Been mostly keeping to myself. How is work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not so great, I was working at a florist so I could get more experience to become a wedding planner one day but all the bouquets for funerals kept bumming me out. I told one person that it seemed a waste to be putting flowers at a gravestone and they fired me. Can you believe that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's crazy! Some people are so stuck up. I work at a retail store and I've had annoying bosses like that too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am sure you understand then. Like they want your opinion until suddenly its telling them that gram gram won't enjoy those roses and they will just wilt away like she did. Where do you work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work at a large retail store. It's brutal hours given the pay. I'm looking for a better job for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully you find something more your style. Where would you like to work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I want to be a lawyer! It'll take a lot of studying though. But it'll be worth it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lawyer does sound awesome, and I hear they like to party hard as well if you know what I mean. What kind of law would you want to practice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Copyright law, since it's a growing field. Some people might hate me for that, but oh well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not hate you but I was hoping you would say something like environmental law or something got to keep those bees alive long enough to make the honey. So you just want to practice law to make money?

s1.value: The speaker is getting ready to get married again.

s2.value: She's a florist.
2. She's had to let her job go.
3. She works at a retail store.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Is your band playing anywhere soon that I may go see you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Depends where about you live, I mostly perform in greensdale in South Africa. We play every other weekend. How's your garden?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's struggling a lot! I feel like I have a very black thumb, but I suppose pratice makes perfect. Probably like guitar! Which instrument do you play in your band?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am actually the lead singer! My little brothers play guitar and the keyboard, we make quite a good trio if I do say so my self! I'm sure Jake could give you a hand learning guitar if you ever needed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds lovely! Make sure to give him my number if you get the chance; I've been having a hard time picking it up. Where did you learn to sing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been singing since I was a kid. I grew up listening to the beetles and begun to love them. After a while a had learnt all the songs of by heart and the rest was history. Are you any good at singing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, I'm afraid. I've been trying to learn so I can sing along with my guitar, but I think I'm always off tune haha. Probably one of things that takes a lot of practice, I'd guess?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I guess so, took me over ten years when I think about it, I'm sure you'll get the gist of it if you keep practicing though. The guitar should do the most of the song for you anyway LOL.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I guess it's always easier to sing when you have something to follow! Maybe I'll try singing along to some Ween when I'm gardening! Have you ever had a garden?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have before when I was a kid, my mum used to do a lot of gardening and thought me some stuff, she even had a greenhouse and a veg patch, maybe I could teach you some time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds like you and your brother have a lot to teach me! Maybe you could come over soon and teach me guitar, singing, and gardening at once!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha sounds like a plan, I'm sure it'll be great!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a singer living in South Africa with his brother and sister.
2. Speaker 1's band plays every week and performs in South Africa, but they are based in Greensdale.
3. Speaker 1's brother plays guitar and keyboard.

s2.value: Speaker 1 has performed in greensdale in a band called The Temptations and now tours internationally.
2. The Temptations are a pop group consisting of J, K, M and D.

dialogue.author: 24155: Ha
dialogue.text: you considered speaking to a psychiatrist about your cannibalism?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I didn't mean it in that regard, just figurative speech! How's that repair going with the car?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Car repairs are not like it use to be. Everything is modular and electronic, but I still love it. Been working on my bicyle retuning the spokes. Do you go hunting often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I try to go hunting on the weekends with my boys as much as I can. Have you ever been hunting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not my thing. I love animals. But isn't it strange, that I would buy dead meat at a supermarket! Your way is probably more humane. What do you kill?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I use every part of animal, nothing goes to waste!  It's a lot cheaper as well! Mostly deer and pheasant.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Never tasted either one. But that's great that you utilize everything. Do you use the skin or feathers when you sew?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I do, I like to make native american style clothing.  I know your probably wondering how a person who likes Katy Perry and sews, jokes around about cannibalism right? Because if I were you I would be wondering that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sorry but I did not know who Katy Perry was. But I was worrying about the cannibalism. You mentioned your boys. Are you teaching them any of your skills?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have one boy that's interested and one boy that's not, which is fine by me, we all have to make our own path in life, don't you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is true. Wasn't sure if "your boys" were your buddies, or your children. Nice to see you recognize individualism. How old are they?

s1.value: Does she go hunting often? No. Not my thing.
2. does she enjoy sewing? Yes.
3. does she eat cooked meat? Not usually.

s2.value: He's 24 & always talks about animals.
2. His two sons are into hunting which he likes as well.
3. He likes to sew & is a vegetarian.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you like living in Texas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes i do. where do you live. i am not a fan of Trump, he has traits of a narcissist.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like Texas, I've visited a few times for business. I live in New York. I like Trump because we run similar businesses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a daughter who i really adore. Separated from her dad so we are all alone. do you have kids? i mean you sound like you have a busy schedule

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No kids yet, I'm always traveling. How old is your daughter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She is 5 years old. do you have plans for the summer? with your busy schedule do you take out time to relax?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No fun plans yet, I have a few business trips over summer so probably just that. I like to gamble to relax. Does your daughter like horses as much as you do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes she does like the thrill riding on them. Texas spirit Lol. okay your whole like revolves around betting and gambling. with the human rush in New york, how is the weather?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that's cool, horses are fun. Yeah I have a few bad habits, but who doesn't lol. It's not too bad in New York. a bit chilly but pleasant.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I naturally love the pleasant weather. I visit Newyork a lot. I have a couple of family and friends over there. I know right, we all have our bad habits. do you currently have any pets? i know you already into horses, so any pets to talk to while at home? Lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No pets unfortunately, I'm on the road too much. How many horses do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: passed down from family a total of 5.I basically lease out some and get paid for it. Also have two guys working for me as attendants to the horses.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I live in New York and live in close proximity to Trump Tower.
2. Speaker 2: I live in Texas, i also own a building.
3. Speaker 1: Do you like living in Texas? Do you live in NYC too?

s2.value: He loves riding horses.
2. He likes gambling.
3. He is passionate about horses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I tried a new type of beer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? Craft or the regular kind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was a craft from our local area. Quite tasty. Do you enjoy beer too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I have to watch my consumption these days, though - too easy to get bloated with all that gas! It's why I prefer spirits like the Martinis!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I drink them on occasion. Do you have a preference in your flavor of martini? I know there are quite a few choices.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Apple ones are the best, but I like the French ones too (with pineapple juice).

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Apple martinis do have just the mix of a little tart and sweet. I haven't tried the French ones yet. Do you have plans to visit Paris soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really - they're called "French", but they were actually invented by some guy in New York!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I didn't realize that. But, I've never been too much on martinis, just on occasion. I usually stick with my favorite, beers around the world.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah. I think the best beers are German - you should try the Oktoberfest in Munich (which is actually in September)!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll do that. I heard my favorite singer ke ha is going to perform there. I would love to go to the concert. Do you like his music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I used to listen to him a lot, but not so much recently. It'd be awesome to see him in Munich, though!

s1.value: Spoke about trying a new type of beer.
1.5: Craft or the regular kind?
1.4: Apple martinis do have just the mix of a little tart and sweet.

s2.value: He likes craft beers, but not so much lately.
2. He's not a fan of martinis, but likes the French ones.
3. His favorite singer is Ke Hae.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How has school been going for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It has been going ok. Last week was really stressful. There is always so much to learn and do. How is work going for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh the flower business never stops. Especially now that Valentines day is around the corner.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good thing! I am glad business is always booming. I feel there would be something calming about working around flowers all day. You must sell a lot of roses right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yes, definitely. I love my job. Are you getting some flowers for your girlfriend this Valentine's Day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She is actually allergic to a lot of flowers. So I can't ever get flowers for her or have flowers around. She is also allergic to a lot animals, and you know how much I love them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that is a bummer. Well maybe when you are a doctor you will be able to afford a rare animal for a pet that she is not allergic to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lol. That is a good point. That will be my motivation. You are always helpful. What is your favorite flower?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do love arranging roses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are lucky that you get to do something you love for work. I know so many people who hate what they do and dread every day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is true. Do you enjoy your current job or are you really just looking forward to being a doctor?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really do not enjoy it at all. But I need to work right now so that I can pay for school. So, yes I am just waiting to finish school and be a dr. and be able to help people.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is the owner of an online flower shop and sells roses. Speaker 1 is also the inventor of the rose petal diffuser.
2. Speaker 2 is a student nurse at a local college. Her current job is stressful. She is allergic to certain flower petals.
3. Speaker 1 is a student nurse.

s2.value: Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 both love roses. Speaker 1 has to work around them everyday.
2. Speaker 1 is allergic to a lot of flowers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: So how long have you been in the service?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I joined a few weeks after my 19th birthday so it's coming up on 6 years. It's hard to believe it's been that long!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you want to join the service since you were young? Any family in the service? I have wondered what it would be like when was young.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was just a job opportunity for me and a way to make money. I was in school and it was a way to help pay for tuition. I do enjoy it now, though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I always wondered what it would be like to join the service. What did you study in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was in school for electrical engineering but that's not what I do in the Army at all.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you do in the army? Did you have a fascination with electric engineering since young?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Right now I work in logistics. We make sure the right piece of equipment is in the right place. Electrical engineering was never my passion. Did you always want to be a baker?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I always had a fascination with baking. I guess I get it from my mom. What was your passion when you were young?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I spent a lot of time hunting and fishing with my dad. I can't wait to do the same things with my son.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I never went hunting and I do wonder what it would be like.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: If you like being outdoors in nature, you might like it. It's a combination of excitement and relaxation.

s1.value: It's been 6 years now since I joined the service.
2. I joined a few weeks after my 19th birthday.
3. I enjoy the military service.

s2.value: Speaker 2 joined the Army after college
2. He enjoys working on logistics and getting the right equipment to the right people
3. He has a son

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you enjoy travelling, any places you'd reccomend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love to travel! Can't wait to get back to Europe. Highly recommend Venice

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish I had enough time to take my family there. It must be nice to travel only for fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, travel for fun is great. Wish I had some family to take with me...

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should get out there and meet someone! You never know if someone you meet might be your future spouse.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So true. Maybe I'll head to the beach soon. Florida has so many great options.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you ever been beach camping before? It's amazing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I haven't. That sounds like a lot of fun! I did go camping once before with a friend in school, but that's been years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Were they one of your college friends?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Actually it was a middle school friend, so throwing it even further back. My college friends would rather hang out in a big city like NYC

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense. Maybe we could go camping again sometime? Better than trying to have a good time at a party together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: As long as it's at the beach lie you suggested. That sounded much more fun. But both options would be better than a random party

s1.value: She is a travel blogger who has been blogging since 201

0. She is from California, USA and originally from Ohio, USA. She has lived in Costa Rica for 6 years now. She's a member of the blogging community of Blogosphere.com. Speaker 1: She has been blogging professionally since 201

0. She is from California, USA and originally from Ohio, USA. She has lived in Costa Rica for 6 years now. She's a member of the blogging community of Blogosphere.com.

s2.value: They are both male.
2. They live in Florida.
3. They live together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you learned anything interesting in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've been having a lot of fun with my biology classes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What sorts of topics are you covering in biology right now? I really like to study ecology.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Right now we're learning about cell division. What got you interested in ecology?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to hike in local parks and look up the different kinds of plants I find. That's lead to more in-depth research of relationships between plants and animals. Cell division is fun! Have you seen the meme with cell division depicted on cupcakes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's really neat. I haven't seen it yet, but my teacher showed us a graphic of a disco pug to help us remember things.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha that's great! I've never had a pug. What kinds of dogs do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have golden retrievers, I love how soft their fur is. Are you thinking about ever getting a pet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will once I'm more stable. I work a lot of hours right now, and I feel like I don't have the time or money to support a pet. I love visiting my friends' pets, though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Visiting pets is nice. One day I'd like to foster animals to help them out.

s1.value: He's studying biology.
2. He also likes to hike.
3. He likes to watch videos on nature.

s2.value: She is in her second year of college.
2. She is an ecology major.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am currently reading a good one. It was written back in the 1700s and is a romantic fiction novel that was pretty popular in it's day.  How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds exciting! I am currently reading a collection of Essays by Noam Chomskey. Who wrote the book you're reading?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Samuel Richardson.  What is your book about? I haven't heard of it before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've never heard of him, I'll have to look Samuel Richardson up later today. My book is mostly about hegemony. It's very enjoyable.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice.  My book is called The History of Sir Charles Grandison Bart.  I haven't really gotten deep into it but supposedly the hero is written to be the perfect man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha "the perfect man" that sounds like an oxymoron. Hegemony is also about the context what defines a 'perfect man' so it's cool we basically are interested in similar topics. Mine is more about the sociology behind the construction of a perfect man than any individual person though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds interesting and really thought provoking. I will have to check your book out when I get done with this one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Guess we should switch reads. I will admit I'm not a huge fan of romance books though. I'm not particularly interested in fiction.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do like it but I have to admit this time I am reading more for the historical content. I am curious about life back in the day and this book is known for being historically accurate on that level.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, well in that case I can understand the appeal. I really like history too. I read a book about Erzebet Bathory not long ago and I really appreciated the historical relevance. Do you read any nonfiction history too, or mostly fiction?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Both.  I love reading about Egypt and the pyramids. They are my favorite exhibits at the museum also.

s1.value: I am a speaker.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a writer.
2. Speaker 1 has been a medical doctor for 27 years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you finished building your house of matches?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I finished it a while back. It was a nice way to pass the time, but I think I prefer watching others do it instead.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's understandable. I found an old match stick airplane while cleaning out dad's things the other day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh,  your dad must have been quite good at crafting things out of matches. I haven't checked my attic in a while, I am not sure what I will fine if I do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He kept a ton of old things up there. We plan on donating a lot of it to goodwill. If you'd like to come over, you're welcome to go through it. We could have a yard sale and I'll split the money with you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds good. I think the money would be good thing to have, if I do end up traveling this year. What about you, do you have any plans this year that you need money for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really. I suppose it wouldn't hurt to do a bit of travelling as well to help get my mind off things. Maybe we could arrange a trip together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a great idea. Do you have any place that you want to go? I always wanted to travel to Spain, or even Portugal.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hadn't really given it much thought. I have always wanted to visit Europe. I have some friends that live in England. What attracts you to Spain?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The culture mostly, I always wanted to try authentic and traditional food in Spain, as well as see the historic sights in the country.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I see. The history of Europe is what attracts me as well. I suppose since my HS spanish has mostly been forgotten I hadn't given much thought to Spain. Are you fluent in spanish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really, I also only learned Spanish in school. I think its good enough to have some basic conversations with. but I don't think I am at the same level as a native spanish speaker. Still, it shouldn't be too much of a problem.

s1.value: He is a Speaker, and has a home built of matches.
2. He does not live in a house with friends, but prefers watching others do it. He lives alone.
3. He doesn't speak fluent spanish, and is planning a trip to Spain for the 1st time.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Found an old matchstick airplane while cleaning out dad's things the other day.
2. Speaker 2: I haven't checked my attic in a while, I am not sure what I will find if I do.
3. Speaker 1: I don't think I am fluent in spanish.

dialogue.author: 21832: Wh
dialogue.text: e's your favorite place to get a cheeseburger and fries?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We have a small local restaurant called Fred's right down the road which is excellent.  Are you a fan of burgers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love a good burger, what type of fries do you like? Thin or thick?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't mind either.  They are a lot different from Mcdonald's burgers.  What was it like working there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My coworkers were friendly, but it was very busy. Paid my bills while I went to school. Speaking of, what do your parents teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like a nice way to earn some cash.  Where are you working now?  Oh, and my parent's both teach at the local public high school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm currently a secretary at a local vet's, which is helping pay my way through college. It's nice that your parents get to work together, do they teach the same grade?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They both teach English.  Their classes contain a mix of grade levels.  What are you in school for?

s1.value: His favorite place to eat was Fred's Burger Joint.
2. Freds' right down the road is excellent.
3. He works as a secretary at a local vet's.

s2.value: She is from an upper-middle class, conservative upbringing.
2. Her father was a business owner and her mother a teacher.
3. She is a graduate of the University of Colorado.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Where do you travel to in your private plane?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I often fly to the coast to visit local Taco Bell stores

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That must be adventurous for you, isn't it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can be adventurous at times. I dress up in disguises and do surprise inspections on the Taco Bell stores for my husband.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a tricky technique. Can you secure a job for me at Taco with your husband influence?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have no influence on job hiring. I'm strictly a "secret Shopper". Why would you want to work at Taco Bell anyways?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My take home at Pizza place is quite low.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Pizza is a rough gig. I worked pizza ovens when I was in college - the ones with the long wooden paddles.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Since you do not have the capacity to assist me, I will have to continue managing the job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sorry about that. How many cats do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have seven cats, they are more than yours.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Seven is a lot of cats. Would you like more?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a private speaker contractor for Pizza Hut Worldwide, Inc.

s2.value: She travels a lot in her private plane.
2. She sometimes visits local Taco Bell stores.
3. She keeps seven cats.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's new with your gun club?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So far we have a decline in members. I think it's because it's starting to get too cold for our outdoor gun range

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enjoy going to the gun range in the cold.  Maybe I will join your club.  Do  you have many law enforcement members?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be great! Yes we have quite a few cops and some vets as well. I'll have to get you a fun colored gun. What color would you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love red or green.  It will make me look festive for the holidays, so I can pretend I like them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha! Do you have to work over the holidays?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do not have to work, but I do have a bunch of maintenance to do on  my Ford.  Are you working over the holidays?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't have any formal work to do as the students will be on winter break. But there is always one thing or another I have to do as a professor

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I imagine you have alot of papers to grade.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes especially with literature classes. But the upside is usually the papers are quite interesting. Many students write original poetry or stories

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that's neat.  It must be fun to interact with kids.  I never  had any... so feel a bit of a void thre.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well you're not missing much! College students are quite grown but they still act like big babies. Many see me as a parent and not a professor

s1.value: Speaker 1: I enjoy going to the gun range in the cold. Maybe I will join your club. Do you have many law enforcement members? It would be great. Do you have red or green colored guns? Red would be my favorite color.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Speaker 2 is a retired law enforcement officer
2. The club began operating in September 2003
3. Speaker 2: The most successful students have gone on to pursue law degrees, law careers, or law enforcement careers

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got some new glasses!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice one, How much did they cost? I really hope they look better then the previous ones

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, they look great! When did you get your last pair?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Half year ago. As I am wearing monthly contact glasses subscription I got 50% discount. Bought myself Ted Baker glasses, spoiled myself for a once

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice! What was the last movie you were in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The last one was Godzilla vs Kong, this one was best experience I ever had and a lot of cupcakes for free.  Next month Transformers 7 starting to film so if you are interested you can join as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! So anyone can just join? What do I need to do to get in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You just need to pass Criminal check, Apart from it there is no other requirements as far you are not mental. My brother is into it as well and we can cover each other lol. Sometimes it's good to have a twin brother

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha. I always wished I had a twin. That sounds amazing. Do friends often mistake you for your brother?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Heh, yeah we have some benefits to share. Friends are quite confident to recognize us but new girlfriends are not really hehe

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha. Have you ever been able to fool your parents?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Only if we try very hard hehe. Anyway how are you today? Any plans for this afternoon?

s1.value: Speaker 1 got some new glasses!
2. The last movie he was in was Godzilla vs Kong
3. Next month Transformers 7 starting to film

s2.value: She bought a pair of Ted Baker glasses as a monthly subscription. Second pair was Ted Baker glasses, she has 3 pairs, bought one pair free of cost for herself. Speaker 1 is also a Ted Baker glasses lover too, bought one pair free of cost for herself.
2. She has two children, her eldest is 16, her son is 1
1. The youngest is 9

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've started reading Harry Potter. It's really good, however the second book is a little "meh".

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is such a good book! You are going to enjoy it, it is such a great book series. I have read all of them and love the last book. Too bad you don't like the second book, is there another book you are reading that you do like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love To Kill a Mockingbird.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me too! I read that book a few years ago. Have you read other genres? I am steering away from my favorite book series and getting into vegetarian books. I really like eating out, but want to learn how to cook my favorite meals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yes. I love romance, mystery, fantasy, of course. You totally should! I bet you'd be great at cooking. Tell me about your family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope so! I am learning a special recipe for lasagna using my favorite white sauce. My family loves the idea of cooking with me. I have a daughter who is a little chef and my baby boy who is the taste tester. How about your family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is so nice. I have five sisters and a mom. They're all great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are so lucky you have 5 sisters, I only have 2 sister and 1 brother. I am the only one in the family with kids. I love being a mom.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope to be a mom someday. I love kids. Hey, what kind of books are your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My all time favorite book is The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks. I studied biochemistry in college and this book has stayed with me as my favorite one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so cool. You seem very smart. Your family is lucky to have you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you! I'm sure your family thinks the same about you. Have you thought about a gift for Valentine for your family? I want to get everyone a frame with a picture of all of us.

s1.value: He is a teacher, who is married to a teacher. He has 5 sisters and a mom.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just had a great workout session.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool are you training to enter the next Olympics ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I intend on being the most powerful Russian in the world. I beat my PR by 10 kilos earlier.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow it would be great if you won gold then i could brag that i know a gold medallist ! I just took my kids to the beach it was hot i am to embarrassed about my fat weight to take my clothes off but my kids love the beach so i will suffer for them

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well the first step is putting yourself out there. How many kids do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: True... i have 10 kids all boys named bob i get pregnant easy i think all the babies is why i am so overweight .. well that and the 50 pizza's i eat in a day

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh dear! I eat a lot myself, but mostly because I burn so many calories while working out. Have you ever tried contraception?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No that has never entered my mind but its a good idea , how is the weather in Russia at the moment ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's quite cold, there is probably 2 meters of snow piled up on my car. It's OK though, I use it as an excuse to jog to the gym. Where are you from?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats a lot of snow ! i am from the amazon jungle i live in a coconut tree

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, I think we both know that's not true. How could all the kids fit up there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are to big to fit up there so i make them sleep at the bottom of the tree , how often do you train then ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been researching for a trip to the Galapagos Islands.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice. Where is that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its an island in Ecuador.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds exotic! What draws you there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They have some crazy wildlife. It would be very cool to see.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome. That actually sounds amazing. I think they also have those big headed statues too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think you are thinking of Easter Island in Chile.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yes! Sorry about that. Either way, interesting places to visit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I am looking forward to it. Where do you want to travel next?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Australia! You've been right? What was your favorite thing about your trip?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh the Outback! I haven't been. I am scared of the all deadly and poisonous things waiting to kill me. Have you been there before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not. It sounds great and interesting though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Things have been super busy at the hospital.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: why do you think things have been busier than usual at your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well it's spring break around here lots kids come down to this area to have a good time and oftentimes when they do they get themselves in trouble are they get themselves hurt and they and I end up at my hospital

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ah okay. is it harder to treat kids than adults?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Describe what you mean by kids

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: sure, you said duuring this time of the year kids come to your area to have a good time. i meant those kinds

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah but there are many different kinds of kids what kind of kids are you thinking about what are their characteristics and features

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: the kids that travel for spring break.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No adults are harder to treat then children are because adults are free thinkers where kids or more or less programmed to comply what's adults and what they say is right for them but an adult pints to make up their own mind and decide what's right for them

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: dang so that means work has not only been busier but more diffcult for you huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No quite easier actually because the age group that we are treating are easily managed

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh that's a relief! when work is smooth it makes the day better. how do you de stress from work lately>

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's super cool! What part are you playing in Les Miserables?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: the roles hasn't been decided yet, I'll let you know once i have been assigned a role

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh sure, that makes sense! Have you ever had to dye your hair for a production?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes i have. I dyed my hair in the last production we did. i played the role of a barbe doll so i dyed my hair pink

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's exciting! That's the same as my hair, though you probably didn't have any highlights, I assume? Is your hair still pink or did you dye it again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: oh nice! i dyed it again to black

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I started writing a new song!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's great, what instrument do you play?  I always wanted to play guitar.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I play piano. Who is your favorite guitarist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really like Van Halen. He can shred.  Have you ever fired a gun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dad had a lot of guns but I never really liked them. In fact I wished he had sold them because he could've really used the money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I own a lot of guns, I use them for work, I'm a police officer.  What kind of guns did he have?  Some are worth a lot of money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I know, I don't remember the exact models but he wasn't a police officer. Do you like being a police officer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do sometimes.  But right now it's not a good job.  I want to make a difference but not everyone thinks that way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It seems that way. I'm glad you are one of the good ones. Are you in the market for a new truck?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just bought one a brand new Ford F-150. What kind of car do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I drive a Mazda 3. Its a really good commuter car. Gets me to work, got me to basketball practice back in the day. Did you play any sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't, I'm not any good.  You know what else isn't any good? The holidays. Hate em.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you like to do for fun besides teaching?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are several things I enjoy. I like simple things, like just a walk in the park, but I also love to plan extravagant vacations. I play poker so I like to visit places with casinos.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long have you been playing poker for? My wife and I vacation often, but we usually travel locally. Where do you normally vacation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been playing poker since I was young. I used to play with my parents for pennies, lol! I love Las Vegas, but have also been to casinos in Tunica, Mississippi. A casino is not necessarily a prerequisite, I also love anywhere with a coast.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's funny I often play cards with my nieces and nephews for pennies. It's a lot of fun with quite a few laughs. I enjoy anywhere with a coast as well, love to beachcomb. Las Vegas seems so overwhelming with all the activity.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! You should get them trained early like I was, haha. I bet those are some good times and will be memories they will cherish forever. Beaches are perfect, and sometimes you just need somewhere quiet to relax and watch the sea. That is the total opposite of Vegas! It can be overwhelming the first time, but it gets easier to navigate with each trip.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope they do cherish these memories, I certainly do. Okay valid point, I could see it being not as overwhelming once you get adjusted to your surroundings. I hear the outskirts around Las Vegas are interesting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are several other areas to explore around Vegas if you are not up for all the hustle and bustle. Lake Tahoe is gorgeous and there are some smaller casinos in Henderson. But if you make the trip you have to stay on the strip at least one night to get the full effect.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've heard wonderful things about Lake Tahoe. I figure if I find myself in Las Vegas I would want to experience it fully. Crowds may not be my thing, but I do like to let loose and go with the flow and experience new things from time to time. Thanks for reminding me about Lake Tahoe.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure! It's definitely worth a trip out there, and you can find a place to escape the hordes of people. The Hoover Dam is also a marvelous engineering feat, I bet your nieces and nephews would like to see that. There is something for everybody in Vegas.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would be scared to bring the kids out with me at first, I'd feel like they'd get lost since I am not very familiar with the area. I've seen the dam in photos and its impressive, I can only imagine what it looks like in person.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can understand that. Sometimes it's better to have an idea of what to expect yourself prior to inviting any other guests on a trip. It really is amazing. You can even take a helicopter tour over it and get the best aerial views ever!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I filmed my pet and it made a very funny video.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's funny, I really love pet videos. What did they do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I let my cat out into the snow for the first time and he freaked out. He's fine but I think it surprised him a lot

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's hilarious. Did he throw his paws up or jump?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He raised his paws up slowly at first and then started jumping around. I'll post it on Twitter later.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's funny, cats have the funniest reactions to things. I saw one recently where a cat was in a closet nest hissing cutely and not wanting to get down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, my guy has gotten stuck on top of the kitchen cabinets before. Do your pets do anything funny?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My dog hates the beach - if I take him there he also throws his paws up. I should really show him the snow soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do it! And record it. Dogs usually love the snow after they get used to it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I'm sure. It's hilarious the things pets do outside. I'm thinking of getting a cat soon to be honest. What breed is yours?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an audio engineer and producer for Youtube.
2. My cat is a Norwegian Forest Cat.
3. My cat washes every day.

s2.value: I got my cat from a shelter and he's a mix between a tabby and a shorthair
2. He has some blue spots that I found when I picked him up out of the grass and put him in a carrier

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you wrote any new poems?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't written any poems recently.  How are the kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's too bad. Maybe you could write one about your experiences as a Marine or bartender! They are okay. It is hard to get them to pay attention to their schoolwork. But I started letting them help me cook in the evenings!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You're absolutely right.  My time in the Corps would make for some interesting poetry.  I'm sorry you're having difficulty getting them to pay attention to their schoolwork. At least with you not working you're able to dedicate more time to them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I have a lot to be grateful for! I cooked a vegetarian eggplant dish last night that had honey, basil, and ricotta cheese with it. Do you like to cook vegetarian dishes for yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds delicious! You know I am a vegetarian after all.  I do cook for myself from time to time when I'm not lost in a good book.  You know how I love to read!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good! It is so rewarding to eat a nice meal that you prepared yourself! Yes, I remember that. I do too! What are you reading right now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm currently reading "A Brief History of Time" by Stephen Hawking. It's extremely interesting. I'm glad to hear that you enjoy reading. I know it's something you don't get to do too often.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that sounds so interesting! Stephen Hawking had a brilliant mind. Yeah, even though I enjoy it, I don't get much time. I usually use any free time I get to go running in the local parks. The fresh air is wonderful! Do you like to get outside often? Maybe read at a park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't made it to the park recently since I've been so busy bartending. I have picked up on baking in my free time though.  Do you like to bake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do not like to bake, unfortunately. I like to improvise when I cook, and with baking, if you don't follow the recipe closely it can result in disaster. I have really made a mess when I have tried! What is your favorite thing to bake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Anything with peaches.  Just like Nicholas Cage from my favorite movie "Face Off", I could eat a peach for hours.
