dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of my cats did something really funny.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love cats, what happened with yours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My youngest, Muffin, really wanted to play, but I was busy doing case research, so she brought her furry mouse to another of my cats, Gizmo. It was really cute!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is cute, animals are really social, sometimes I can't believe what I see animals doing with and for each other. That is really cute.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It made me laugh! Do your cats get along well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They do for the most part, one is much older so the youngest has more energy to play but the older one puts up with it..until midnight, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Lol, I love cats! Each with their own personality and set of likes and dislikes. They are the perfect subjects for all kinds of photography projects!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh i have never thought of that, that is neat. I have seen funny cat videos but not many cat photography, still that is.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love getting action shots when they play together, and there is nothing cuter than pictures of them all cuddled up, sleeping together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is neat. Do you make calendars or sell them in any way? I bet that could be profitable, there are many crazy cat people out there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't, but that is a really good idea. We have a lot of craft type fairs here during the summer. I might have to look into that, thanks for the idea!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course. You can also print them onto canvas for a fancier touch. I love craft shows, going to an animal type one would be good too.

s1.value: One of my cats did what her brother thought was funny.
2. I love cats, what happened with yours?
3. I like photography!

s2.value: Has one cat, named Muffin.
2. Does case research on the internet.
3. Likes cats.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Where is your favorite place you've travelled to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite place I have traveled to is Florida. I like to take a trip there with my daughters and take them to Disneyland. So how is the weather in Arizona ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've always wanted to go to Disneyland. Arizona is hot. it's okay as long as you have air conditioning and a swimming pool.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I understand an air conditioner is essential. Kind of reminds me of the weather from my childhood. A little advice, when you play tennis, always hydrate. you do not want to end up dehydrated !

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: great advice. I always keep a jug of water with me everywhere I go. thankfully we have indoor tennis courts here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see you are always prepared, that is what I admire about you. Your ability to always be ready for any situation. How is it that no one has considered you as a lifetime partner! Any luck with your dating ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've had lots of dates but always seem to find the duds. I wish I knew where to look for the good ones.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well have you considered online dating? I hear it has worked wonders where I live.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've tried it all. I think the worst dates come from those dating apps actually.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Keep your head up ! I too went through hell when I was single but I eventually found the one. Trust me the right one will come.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: thanks for the encouragement! I'm sure my perfect match is out there. but until I find them, I'm okay with it just being me and Corky. he likes the extra attention anyways.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, corky is a wonderful companion. I wish I can have pets but my wife does not like them. I hope I can convince her down the road .

2. They divorced in 199
3. They are still friends today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was able to finish all of the homework!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well done that's nice to hear. Now in a free time what are you up to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I may go practice my unicycle. I have a performance for the circus this weekend. You should bring your daughter to see it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Would be nice to see your performance. I will definitely bring my daughter if there are no animal performances in your circus.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nope.  No animals any more.   I wouldn't be able to work with them if they continued using them. It's inhumane.  How's 1st grade going? How are the kids this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You know it's every year the same some kids are very quite and some are very loud, can't blame them though they are just kids. When you will have one you will know about it hehe. by the way what time is starting the circus on Sunday as I have to go to church in the morning otherwise my dad will be upset.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do look forward to  having kids one day.  It starts at 2pm.  If  you're a little late, that's ok.  The opening show has a loud number by Metallica. Guess who  picked that one?!?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: OMG you are very happy that you boss allowed Metallica song, to be honest happy for you every good moment matters. I will probably come little bit late although I am fine with Metallica but don't think it's very nice for my daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha... true.  Don't tell your Dad about the music!  If you want to come over after to see my kitty, your'e welcome to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to, my daughter also likes cats. If it will be raining that day you can recognize me by my favourite purple coat

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love that purple coat!  make sure your daughter wears the blue one i gave her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course that's her favourite one, next time you can give her blue pants to match the coat

s1.value: Speaker 1 was diagnosed with a learning disability at 2 years old because he couldn't spell his name. He was raised by his grandparents. His first girlfriend was a boy. Now he works in a circus and teaches unicycle classes.

s2.value: I am a former student teacher.
2. I love to be outdoors.
3. I have a cat.

dialogue.author: 21315: I
dialogue.text: vanced in my career.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's fantastic! Finally got the promotion you deserved?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been so dang long. Binding books is hard graft. Hoping to save to move to DC someday soon. How's the move planning going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Going pretty well! Washington is a heck of a lot smaller than Texas so I'm going to have to sell most of my displayed art to fit everything into the new place. I'm just hoping the the dogs are going to be ok with the move.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's true! They say you can drive for days and still be in Texas. Shame about the art - someone out there will appreciate it for sure and the cash could help. How's the pups?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They're doing great, but I am worried about the lack of running around space they will have after the move, guess I'll just have to find a nice doggy park to them to each day. Was it your mom that lived in Washington? Maybe she'll want to join me in taking the dogs out some time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Getting out will be good for you too - give you a chance to explore for sure! And yes indeed - she'd definitely appreciate that. Think she's been down recently but she loves dogs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awh great! What's been getting your Mom down if you don't mind me asking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think Dad's passing has really affected her. It's been a few years but it's only just hitting her. She'd like to see the dogs for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry for your loss, I'm actually moving to Washington to be closer to my father after my Mother's passing. She can definitely see the dogs when ever she likes!

s1.value: I advanced in my career.
2. Got the promotion you deserved.
3. Hoping to save to move to DC someday soon.

s2.value: Speaker 2 advanced in her career.
2. Washington is a small town, but they say there is plenty to do outdoors.
3. Speaking 2 is moving to DC.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My bmw broke down, so I've been working on it the last few days.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear that. My motorcycle broke down a while back as well, and I had to take my horse to the vet. I know your pain. How are the repairs going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no I'm sorry to hear that too.  It's going slower than I would like but it's coming along.  How is your horse?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Beauty is doing okay. I just had to get her shots and stuff. I rode her around my property! We have 30 acres and a farm! Where do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad to hear she's doing ok. Oh that sounds so nice!  I grew up in the country and always have wanted to live there again.  I live in Milwaukee now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've never been there. I bet it snows a lot! I always wanted to see the snow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes we do get quite a bit of snow in the winter.  I love the snow, except for driving in it.  You should definitely come and experience it sometime.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I plan to! I'll just have to leave 'ol Beauty with my wife. She likes to ride too. And yeah, I assume you'd never take that beautiful BMW out in the snow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you each have a horse and go riding together then?  That's nice that you share the same interests and hobbies.  Oh no it definitely gets stored in winter.  I have a 4 wheel drive truck for winter driving.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: At least it makes the winter driving easier! And yeah, she has a horse too. Hers is Misty. Are you married as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes it does.  That's awesome!  That must be so fun to go riding together.  I have gone since I've been a little kid.  I am engaged and getting married in August this year.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's exciting; congratulations! And you should definitely try it when you get the chance. And you're making me want to buy a classic car and fix it up too. It's fun to work with your hands!

s1.value: I'm a mechanic.
2. I have a BMW motorcycle.
3. I have a Harley Davidson motorcycle.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a male speaker.
2. Speaker 2 is the only speaker in the series.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I heard some jazz covers of rock songs the other day. Thought of our conversation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not a big fan of jazz but that might be interesting to hear since I've listened to a lot of covers from other genres turned into hard rock.  So, what kind of programmer are you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I write apps for phones.  It is cool to see someone using an app I programmed.  I remember that you make models for video game and animations.  Which one do you like best?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of apps would that be?  Have you ever programmed for a game?  There was a fantasy rpg game I worked on last year and I had so much fun making the models of fantasy creatures.  There was this really epic demonic pegasus horse I had done for a mount to use in the game, that was my favorite.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that sounds cool.  I love playing games.  But I program teaching apps.  I realized that people aren't learning basic life skills like making a budget or how to cook, so I made an app - Life Skills - that help learn those skills.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Those are basic things that we should be taught in school, so I'm glad to see someone is trying to help in that regard.  I might have to check this app out I have never been good at cooking so I don't like to do it, but if it can help me out that would be great.  How long ago did you start working on Life Skills?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: About two years ago.  I was reading Reddit and people were talking about not learning life skills and it gave me an idea.  I remember you were telling me about a show on Netflix that you were watching.  How is that going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you make any money off of your app?  Hah, I used to love Reddit but then it started to feel more toxic so now I don't like it much.  Great that it was able to inspire you though!  I was finally checking out the show Stranger Things, ever seen it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Stranger Things is an awesome show.  I binge it when it comes out.  I wish they would do more than a handful of episodes but I feel good when I'm done watching.  I make enough off the app to support myself and the app.  It is a full time job making updates and helping people with it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have liked it so far, I made it through the first season and I think I will continue watching it.  Netflix shows always feel like they are lacking on the episode count, not sure if Amazon Prime shows are the same but I know Disney Plus shows also have short seasons.  Have you started a small company and hired help with the app or are you still doing it all by yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I handle it all myself.  The app is my baby so it is hard for me to let someone else do work on it.  What is your favorite Italian food?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can understand that!  Does it have a fee to get the app?  Hmm, sometimes it can be difficult to choose, my mom is from Italy so she always makes fantastic dishes.

s1.value: I'm a software developer and make apps for phones.
2. I made a life skills app that teaches basic life skills.
3. I did some work for a video game company as well.

s2.value: He is a programmer who likes to make apps.
2. He made models for an animation company.
3. He made a fantasy RPG game for a game publisher.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went for a long skateboard ride. It really put me in a great mood.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How often do you skate? Do you have a place where you usually go or you just take your skate and go where it brings you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am more of a chill guy so yeah, I just take my skate and go with the flow. I like skating in parks, it just helps me to relax

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's nice...And do you skate by yourself or you are part of a community?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mostly by myself but sometimes I run into interesting people so we just skate together. What about you? Have you been hiking recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really. I have been more focused on improving my English. I found an interesting book and I started to read it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am glad to help you with English if you need. Oh, that's interesting, what is the name of the book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would help me a lot. Practise is the best way to improve a language. Anyway the book is "Fluent in 3 months" of Benny Lewis. He's talking about tips and techniques. I wanted to give it a try

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have never heard of this book but I believe you have made a good choice. It is really nice to see people willing to learn different languages

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I found it online. It was highly recommend. Learning different languages I think is the key for our generation. We are so open and we can travel so freely that it is always good to know as many more languages as possible

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I for sure agree with that. I personally believe everyone should be able to speak at least two languages.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you speak a second language?

s1.value: They went for a long skateboard ride.
2. They skate and just take care of themselves.
3. They go hiking.

s2.value: They live in a small neighborhood of a city and usually go to their local skatepark for long rides and relax. Speaker 2: I go for a long skateboard ride. I really put me in a great mood.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Would you like to go on a walk with me today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to go for a walk.  Would you want to walk to the hospital you work at and show me around?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's a great idea! There's also a park across the street that we can walk around after I show you around the hospital.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great!  What kind of park is it?  I love the kinds that have a lot of nature to enjoy instead of playgrounds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's exactly what it is! There's a lake in the center with a fountain and a walking trail that goes around it. There are also some beautiful flower gardens. I think that you will like it a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: This park sounds fantastic, is it your favorite park?  I hope it's not where you met that vampire though!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's definitely one of my favorite parks, not my absolute favorite, but one of the best. Definitely not where I met the vampire. Shockingly, I actually met him at the casino.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite park is one of the national parks in Washington when I go to visit.  I want to move there one day!  Wow!  The casino is the last place I'd expect to see a vampire!  Was he nice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He was actually a dealer and was really nice. Washington would be a great place to move to. There are tons of great national parks. What part of the state is your favorite park located in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope he didn't bite you and turn you!  The Mount Rainier National Park is my favorite, I love to go skiing there.  Have you ever been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Luckily he didn't bite me, that would've been my luck. I've never been to Mount Rainier National Park, but I've heard of it. I don't enjoy skiing, so don't think I would like it as much, but I'm glad you enjoy it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He just took all your money instead!  There are a lot of trails there too for walking.  It's really beautiful and worth a visit even if you don't like to ski.  I haven't gone skiing since last year because I had a minor accident last time.

s1.value: Would you like to go on a walk with me today?
2. Would you want to walk to the hospital you work at and show me around?
3. What kind of park is it?
I love  nature and play in the park with my friends.
I really hope you enjoy our walk.

s2.value: His favorite park is the Mount Rainier National Park.
2. He met a vampire there when he was visiting Washington.
3. He has a minor injury from a skiing accident.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went fishing and caught several fish.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! what did you catch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A few large carp, they should make a tasty dinner. Have you been fishing before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds delicious! I've gone fishing once or twice as a kid, but I never ate anything that I caught. What type of pancakes do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should try it as an adult, it is very relaxing. It might even inspire some poetry. I love my pancakes smothered in maple syrup, yum!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should also try pancakes with strawberries and strawberry syrup. It is delicious. I think I will try fishing. You're right! I think it'll help me with my writers block.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yum, I love strawberries, I will give that a try! What was your last book about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was a book of poetry from different artist and it was beautifully illustrated. I know you work as a lumberjack. I hear people see mysterious things while they're in the woods. Have you ever ran into Big Foot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds interesting. I haven't seen Big Foot, but I have heard some very weird noises out in the woods. It can be very creepy sometimes!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, but the woods can also be very peaceful. Do you process the wood right there in the forest?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We have a lumber mill close by, but I just cut the trees down. I really enjoy using a chainsaw.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah. l love tools. especially chainsaws. Do you work on a team or alone?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I went fishing and caught several fish. I also caught a big dog!
2. That's great! what did you catch?
3. What are your favorite foods?

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a writer.
2. Speaker 1 likes pancakes.
3. Speaker 1 has never been fishing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: what is your favorite cheese

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hands down, it's gorgonzola. I really like all Italian cheeses, but gorgonzola is my favorite to cook with. I can't think of a single Italian dish that isn't made better by gorgonzola cheese.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do love Italian cheeses too, especially provolone and mozzarella cheese. I'm not sure if I've ever tried gorgonzola cheese. What does it taste like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's creamy but sharp at the same time. The more you age it the sharper it becomes. It really adds a lot to sauces. Next time we get together I'll be sure to make you a sauce with gorgonzola in it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mmmmm! That sounds delicious! What dish will you make with gorgonzola for us?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite is a penne with broccoli and chicken in a gorgonzola sauce.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love penne and all pasta really. My mouth is watering just reading that! Did you sample any yummy, exotic cheeses during your travels to Germany?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did do some cheese tasting while I was in Germany. My favorite was probably the limburger. It's really strong.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Limburger is notorious for being really stinky! Did it smell really bad like everyone says?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It definitely has a really strong smell but 'stinky' is in the nose of the smeller. I think it smells delicious. Have you ever tried it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I haven't tried it yet. Maybe I'll pick some up next time I'm in the supermarket. Does your 2-year-old daughter enjoy cheese? Or, is she too young to eat adult food?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She likes cheese, but wont try any of the more 'adventurous' types. She's mostly into string cheese. Maybe she'll try some of my favorites as she gets older.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We found out the sex of the baby!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! Are you going to tell me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it's going to be a baby boy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great news! I'm still in high school so I'm not thinking about kids at all and as of now I'm not that interested. What if your new son wants a dog one day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't have dogs but maybe I will get one one day. First things first though, gotta prepare for the kids!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How has it been moving from base to base? Or do you like the adventure?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hectic! I'm just starting to get used to Ft. Carson but we may move again soon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Colorado Springs is pretty ugly but the scenery just outside the city past Manitou is incredible.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I'd like to explore the area but it's hard focusing on getting ready for my baby.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. Where does the rest of your family live. Will they make it for the birth?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: In the country like me. Yes, they'll be there. I like the country.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The country where? Like Kansas, Virginia, Tennessee?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of brothers just called me, he is getting married!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my goodness!  That's so exciting!  Does that mean you get to be a bridesmaid?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I do! It is going to be so exciting , my parents will both be able to be there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's wonderful!  Are you married or have any kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I am married and I have 2 kid's a boy and a girl.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not married nor have children.  I'm a little bit jealous, you have such a big family!  I bet the holidays must get crazy with so many people, huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Holidays are insane! There are so many people we have to rent a hall. We have so much fun thought it's also alot of work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, wow!  I didn't even imagine not being able to fit everyone in one house, that is insane!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes we usually rent out the church activity room .

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's nice.  Are you and your family religious?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, we are non evangelical Christians. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I believe there's something up there, but I'm not religious per say

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I spent some time in the greenhouse this afternoon and then packed up a couple of soap orders.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow you got quiet a bit done today then. Have you managed to sort out the website for your products yet or is it still word of mouth?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I sure did. I haven't unfortunately, could you send me the details of the guy who created your website again please?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah no worries, of course I can. I will send them through text tomorrow for you, pass my name on and he you may even get some discount, you know you should really have a chat with my manager to see if we can stock some of your products to.. It increases sales so much ! Also while you at it, can I send you some of my new comic strips over for your review please.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thankyou, that would really help. I'll pop by tomorrow and have a chat with him because I'm struggling at the minute. I can drop you off a bar of my soap too, see what you think! Are you working at the club tonight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nope I am off tonight so you can actually drop it round tonight, if its anything like your previous products they are going to rock! I think you just need a little bit of traction in your sales and you'll be good! We will get you there dont worry. I am actually thinking of giving up the bar work, to many angry people around these days looking for a fight.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately I can't, I need to repair a smashed window on my greenhouse before any insects can get in. That is very true, must be something in the air ha! Your comic is coming along nicely, how long until you finish do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ahh yeah, need to get that done first. They could wipe out all of your plants very quickly, didnt that happen last year?! I would say I am about 3/4 the way through it but I am running out of inspirations. You may have to help me, you have a good imagination.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It did twice, it's becoming a pain now, I need to invest in some stronger glass. We can brainstorm over coffee after you finish work if you like.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Done, Ill put the pot on as soon as I get in from work. I bet it is such a pain as where you grow natural products you cant use any pesticides! Stupid nature, its a love hate relationship haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great stuff. It's a risk reward really, homegrown taste far better than what you get in supermarkets, but can completely fail. I'll finish making this batch of soap and make my way to your place, see you there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: See you then! Wait... How many sugars do you have in your coffee?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hello Just got back from a walk, i was inspired by you to get into shape.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yay! That's great! I'm so proud of you! You haven't done anything like that since you walked in the cancer walk right?  Now you will be running marathons with me in no time, ha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, I would not necessarily say I'm ready to run in marathons with you, but I can do another cancer walk.  So tell me, have you ever done a triathlon, since you're good at running and swimming?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't yet but I am thinking of doing one, there is one coming up and since I'm doing a lot of swimming and running I may as well try it, I've got nothing to lose. I've always wanted to do one! It's fun to take risks! How are your corvettes coming along by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good to hear that.  I'm sure you'll give that triathlon your very best.  As far as my corvettes, I couldn't be happier.  I spend hours and hours remodeling older models and I take them to car shows.  I usually get prizes for my work.  And it's not just trophies.  I actually win cash!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's great! I don't know much about cars but I do like to drive them, especially in the winter here in Alasaka! Ha!  Probably would not drive a Corvette in the winter though!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's right.  I cannot imagine living in Alaska, let alone drive in the snow.  How long have you been living in Alaska, anyway?  Were you born there or did your family move there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been here all of my life. My parents moved here when I was a baby and then they had 2 more children after me. I just love it here!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, glad to hear you enjoy your life in Alaska.  What do you do in the long, winter months?  Do you by any chance have a pool table at home?  I'm sure that would help time pass by quickly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't have a pool table, do you still have your pool table and card table?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I sure do!  Can't imagine not having them at home.  I invite my buddies over at least once a month and we play pool and cards.  And of course, we talk about Corvettes.  The evening cannot get any better than that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a fun time! I figured you still had it!

2. she has been going to cancer walks for the last 3 years and she was inspired by her.
3. She does have a pool table at home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's hard to choose, but I'm a big fan of any of the Lord of the Rings books.  How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, that JRR Tolkien series was excellent! Do you think the movies did justice? My favorite book si probable Count of Monte Cristo, such a epic tale of revenge!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that book is also amazing, one of my favorites too!  And yes, maybe the best book-to-movie adaptation of all time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I once though of naming my Dog Bilbo, but got talked out of it by a Twilight fan. I remember you have cats, what are their names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's funny, I named my one cat Samwise!  My other cat is named MJ.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice names! I ended naming my dog Mordor. Hmmm I think I might order takeout tonight, what do you think should I get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good name!  You mentioned you like italian food, that's always a good choice.  Maybe you could also try giving Mexican a shot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Italian food is amazing, I would like to try Mexican food but I'm anxious I'll get a bad stomach!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are many dishes that aren't spicy, and it's worth it believe me.  All mexican food is extremely flavorful

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok I will give it a tequila shot, what should I order?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should start off with some chicken enchiladas with mole sauce.  It's not very spicy, but very flavorful

s1.value: Speaker 1's favorite book is the Lord of the Rings series.
2. Speaker 1 has cats.

s2.value: Speaker 2 loves all the Lord of the Rings books.
