3. Speaker 1 has cats.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Would you want kids in the future?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would. I gotta have a wife first though

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is how I felt before I met my wife. Now I have 3 kids and wouldn't change it for the world!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope to get there someday. Did you get to make any necklaces today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am in the middle of making one right now. I am trying to figure out what colors to do for my next one. Have you written anything today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did. I am working on a novel, and as a writer you simply have to take the time continue to write. I'll revise some and write more tomorrow. Did you get to go for a run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not today, but I am going to get up extra early to run tomorrow! Did you get a workout in today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did earlier. I got a new PR on Deadlift. It was interesting thought because I saw a guy at the gym that had a weight fall on his shin. I think he had to go to the hospital

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no! That sounds awful. I hope he is okay!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think he will be fine. He wasn't paying attention and when he dropped it landed right on his leg. I had never seen that before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've had a few bad injuries myself, but nothing like that! Have you had any bad injuries while working out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just some sholder issues in the past. I take it lightly with upper body now. Where is the best cheesecake you have ever had?

s1.value: She is in the process of getting married soon. Her husband would like children, but needs to establish a wife first.
2. She had three children before her marriage, which she loves to have with husband.
3. She's written a novel and hopes to be able to get published some day.

s2.value: She wants kids so badly.
2. She has 3 kids.
3. She is in the middle of making a necklace.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Listened to any good Prince songs today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I listened to Purple Rain today

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice. I love it! Do you dance when you listen to the music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, of course I danced! And how about you, did you go running today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did. That's my daily routine. I cannot do without running. And the best thing is I get to breathe in the fresh air at the park while running.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's amazing! I'm sure the nice breeze feels good while running in the park. Alas, I was at home eating fast food LOL!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha. You sure love fast food a lot! Got any new pair of shoes recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I do! I recently just bought some new Nike's! They're so fresh and clean, and I got to enjoy a day at the mall!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's wonderful! And you actually inspired me to buy a new pair of running shoes as well. I got a purple pair of Puma's and I am so happy about them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome! I'm so glad, Puma's are a great shoe. And you got them in your favorite color! I'm sure they look so cool!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They do! I am looking forward to try them on for my tomorrow's run. I am so excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am sure you'll kill it! Have a great time!

s1.value: He's a famous musician who can play the piano, bass, guitar, and now he's even taking to singing.
2. He's not only a great dancer, but also a runner.
3. Speakers new pair of running shoes are fresh and clean as well.

s2.value: She is a very attractive individual and loves fashion. She also likes to wear cool, fresh looking clothes.
2. When she listens to Prince, she feels more confident. She believes in the power of the music.
3. She likes to dance a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you heard this new rock song?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is it the newly released song?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, "Letter to You" by Springsteen. I wasn't sure what to make of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's certainly a new sound for the band. It arrived to my island yesterday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long do you have to wait to get things delivered there? I would hate to wait months for new tunes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can take a bit for things to be delivered. Longest I had to wait was 7 months. I heard you got a new car by the way, did you get a different color or is it black again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Black again, I just can't get myself to like any other colors. Do you need a car to get around or is your island small enough for a golf cart?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually use a golf cart, it's a bit of a pain to use a car. Did you see the newest Apple product? I'm pretty interested in seeing what other features it will have.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. What are its features?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It apparently has a high definition camera, a new way to find it if lost, and the capability to record video even when its locked.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I am the leader of the E Street Band.
2. Speaker 2: I work as a real estate salesman.
3. Speaker 3: I am a real estate lawyer.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is not famous and doesn't usually record anything.
2. He has a record producer and a few writers, and sings a little in the band.
3. He has never broken up and only gets better with age.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My studying for the biology test is going well

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is good. Do you feel like you are ready? When is the test?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The test is in three days. I will meet up with my study group tomorrow to go over the most difficult parts, but other than that I feel super ready! What about you - what is museum life like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good for you. I am sure you will do well on the test. You always do. Work is going pretty good. I am working later today. I like being around art all day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I surely hope so. I need an A on this test to pass the class. What is your favorite type of art... modern or more classical?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like such a variety of art styles and types. My favorite is pointillism. We are having a pointillism display next month. You should come check it out. I am excited about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! Never heard of it! I'll be sure to check it out. Is it free? or do I have to buy tickets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are tickets. But i can get you in free, if it is during when I am working. I work Tues - Sat from 2pm- 8pm. Just let me know when you want to come. Have you started any new books since we last spoke?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I started a memoir called Educated. I saw it advertised a few years back in the New York Times and I finally got around to it. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How is it? I am looking for new books to read. I just finshed reading The Alchemist, which is one of my fave books. I read it every few years. Have you ever read it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like it so far! Very eye opening. The Alchemist is a great book. I read it in school - it was required reading!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, really? That is interesting. I never had to read it in school. I discovered it later. Let me know if you recommend Educated after you read it.

s1.value: In school, Speaker 1 was always a science and English major. He also has taken classes in biology and the history of art.

s2.value: Speaker 1 has been working as a teacher the past 9 years.
2. Speaker 1 is a science teacher at a local community college.
3. Speaker 1 had a class called "Rationality" where he challenged his students to think logically.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I played with my puppy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did you get outside at all? I'm so glad I don't live where all the snow is these days!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea the weather has finally gotten nice enough to go out! Have you been riding lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A few times on the horses but only once on the motorcycle this week. Work has been busy so not a lot of free time. What kind of puppy do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have yorkie. I totally forgot that you had a motorcycle. What kind do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a Triumph Tiger. I love Yorkies. My mother in law had one named "Puppy." What's your dog's name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: His name is brownie. My daughter named him. Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cute name. I have a cat, a calico named Mischief.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Super cute! I might be going to Portland for work and was thinking a little longer just to sightsee. Where do you suggest I go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That depends on what you want to see. If you like the outdoors I would definitely go to the Columbia River Gorge. There is also a beautiful Japanese Garden, very peaceful and serene.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for the recommendations! How's the weather this time of year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's cold but when the sun is out it's beautiful. If you dress warmly you will be fine. Of course the weather is so crazy everywhere you never know!

s1.value: I played with my puppy.
2. I bike often but no motorcycle lately.
3. I have a Yorkie.

s2.value: She plays with her puppy.
2. She has a Triumph Tiger.
3. She is a Yorkie and the owner has a Yorkie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How's your new job at McDonald's going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is okay, other than dealing with people all day.  I got to know about french fry reasearch.  How is that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: French Fry research is interesting.  We are developing a new fry for Del Taco.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: French Fries at Del Taco?  You might put us out of business!  We used to have really good fries and then they started to worry about health.  Do you like working at Del Taco?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do enjoy Del Taco.  The fry we are developing will have various levels of spice.  This makes it complicated.  McDonalds does not have that complication.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is true.  We apparently have a lab at corporate that makes up all the meals.  But they seem to lack flavor.  What is your favorite item at Del Taco?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Give me a few street tacos and I am a happy person.  I found an interesting book about women's studies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Tell me about this book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The title is Mediocre: The Dangerous Legacy of White Male America .  It is pretty funny.  Want to borrow it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds interesting.  What did you get out of the book?  I would be interested in barrowing it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found out that fixing cars is about the only thing men are good for. Hah.  I can let you have the book next week.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, men can be kind of one dimensional at times.  I look forward to the book.

s1.value: He drives a car himself.

s2.value: He is not a very nice person, and he does like to work at McDonald's.
2. The new fry he is developing will have various levels of spice.
3. He is a man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went fishing and caught a huge fish! Would you like to see a picture?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, did you measure the fish? We're going to fishing in the mountain river as soon as it gets a little warmer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a tape measurer and scale that I use. It was 4 feet long and weighed about 30 pounds. It was the biggest fish I've ever caught. If you want any salmon, I've got quite a bit!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, you must have had quite a time trying to reel it into the boat! Yes I would love some salmon. I can dehydrate some in my dehydrator to take on our camping trips.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like a perfect way to store it. You won't have to worry about it going bad. Since I live on an island, I never really have to go far if I want to fish.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've always wanted to buy a private island, but it would require homeschooling our boys. Maybe when we retire.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it takes a lot of effort. Fortunately I don't have kids, so I don't have to worry about that.  You're lucky that you're at least near mountains though. It's a real hassle for me whenever I want to go to the mountains, since I have to get off the island.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, living near the mountains is probably the next best thing. We are isolated enough to have peace and quiet and see plenty of nature. But our boys can still attend school and sports.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like the best of both worlds. How is your dog doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She is still as active as ever. She is nine years old but she still gets around well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great. My white lab is only 4 years old and is loving life on the island. He really loves to jump and play in the water.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did you decide yet if you're going to get that other dog? I actually saw a really adorable chocolate lab up for adoption online.

s1.value: I have a large dog and a big house.
2. I live on an island.
3. I have to get off the island to go to the mountains.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I love her. I've been trying to be with her since I was five years old. To be with her is like being in a dream. It's amazing the time that we spend together.
2. Speaker 2: I have a chocolate lab of my own - she was left as a puppy. I actually saw a golden retriever online that looked just like her. Should I get her?
3. Dog's are known for their loyalty. How well do you think you will bond with Speaker 2's dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I won a gaming tournament!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What game did you win the tournament in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was League of Legends, I play in tournaments for it a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very nice, does it make you travel everywhere?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes but I enjoy travel so it's ok with me. Do you like to travel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I like to travel to warm places like Spain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing, when did you go there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I traveled there about 3 years ago, it was very warm and lots of fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you traveled anywhere else in your life?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have travelled to a few different places including England and Canada.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am very jealous, one day I hope to travel. Did you go with anyone.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I took just one of my younger siblings because it can be expensive to travel.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a former competitive gamer.
His primary interests are League of Legends.
2. He enjoys traveling so he traveled to Spain 3 years ago.

s2.value: She once won a gaming tournament.
2. She enjoys traveling.
3. She enjoys travel to warm places like Spain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you having a nice time off work? Did you have tacos for dinner?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, it's nice to relax. Of course we had tacos--Taco Tuesday!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It must be boring to work on Sundays.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's not boring to work on Sundays but I miss chances to hang out with friends. Did you watch a movie this weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes.  I spent Sunday evening watching thriller movies.  I pick a different theme each week.  What kind of tacos did you make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We had hardshell tacos with black beans and salsa verde. What's your movie theme for next week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am watching Lifetime movies next Sunday.  Those tacos sound yummy.  Do you make a different type each week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It all depends on what we have on hand. We had a lot of black beans cause they were on sale at Kroger. We'll probably have black beans for the next few weeks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wouldn't that get repetetive?  Or do you really llike black beans?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's comfort food. We don't need too much variety when the old favorites are so good. You know what to expect, and you save money by buying in bulk.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good thinking.  I love carnitas on soft taco shells.  I might make some next Sunday for my movie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You could watch some Mexican movies while eating Mexican food--make a theme of the movie and the meal!

s1.value: Speaker 1: Are you having a nice time off work? Did you have tacos for dinner?
Speaker 2: Yes, it's nice to relax. Of course we had tacos--Taco Tuesday!
Speaker 1: It must be boring to work on Sundays.
Speaker 2: It's not boring to work on Sundays but I miss chances to hang out with friends. Did you watch a movie this weekend?
Speaker 1: Yes.  I spent Sunday evening watching thriller movies.  I pick a different theme each week.  What kind of tacos did you make?
Speaker 2: We had hardshell tacos with black beans and salsa verde. What's your movie theme for next week?

s2.value: They live in an apartment with their spouse and two children. Speaker 1: The house is right next to the grocery store and there is a nice bench out front too.
2. They attend church every Sunday.
3. They are active in their church and they sing in the choir.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Work has been tough this past week.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry! What has been happening at work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The diner has been overwhelmed. Too many customers, not enough staff.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that is not a good combination for a restaurant! Are the managers currently trying to hire more staff?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I honestly don't know. I hope so! How's your online work going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully the situation gets better for you. Work has been okay but I am just trying to finish up some marketing projects for a client.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you have any time to play guitar or Pokemon Go or Zombie Run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do have time to play them but I also recently started some old games I have like Skyrim. Do you play anything to destress from work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't play many games, just go for activities outside. I enjoy the fresh air.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lol that's probably much healthier than sitting down and playing games. Where do you normally run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually around my neighborhood. Well, Pokemon Go makes you get up right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah you definitely have to explore places to find pokemon. So it ends up being a good way to explore new places and get some walking in.  Maybe you'd like it!

s1.value: Is working at a diner a bad idea?
2. What has been your busiest week as of lately?
3. What do you do in your spare time?

s2.value: Speaker 2 worked at a diner last week and things went badly.
2. They are working on marketing projects which has not been very well received.
3. Speaker 2 does have time for playing Pokemon Go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you eaten anything good lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not yet, what sport do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am starving, I really found that I love thai food. I havent played a sport in a long time, I do enjoy watching basketball though. what are you planning on eating later on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am planning on eating fast food, my favorite! What sport did you train for in the Olympics?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: fast food! yum! I am currently obsessing over wendys 4 for 4 deal, have you herd of it? I did win a gold metal in gymnastics, those were good times. are you training right now for the Olympics?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: WOW! A gold win is amazing! No, I am not very athletic. I like to watch it on the TV every 4 years though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I was only 17 when I won, I had been training since I was 5. Now that im old and boring, my major hobbies are cooking and watching cooking shows. are you familiar with Hells Kitchen?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am! I love Gordon Ramsay. I used to binge watch his shows whenever they were on TV! My favorite show is Criminal Minds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ramsay is a savage, isnt he? he cracks me up. Have you seen the cooking show with kids? he is so gentle and KIND! a whole different side to him. I have not watched criminal minds, what is it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have seen his kids shows! I agree, he is such a different person to children than to adults. Criminal minds is a mystery/detective show about the FBI. I wanted to be a special agent growing up!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I want to watch! I will definitely watch tonight, I use to be obsessed with the ID channel, have you watched?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not. What is that?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I am an Olympic athlete. I train in gymnastics.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a female.
2. Speaker 2 is a female.
3. Born in 1976 at Mount Laurel, New Jersey.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been thinking about buying a tv.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Which brand do you think you will get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, I'm a bit clueless to everything I need. Have you got any recommendations? I fancy something that will last me some time

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a Samsung TV and I love it. It's a reliable, modern brand with some really cool tech. Do you have Netflix or Hulu? If so I would get a smart TV so you can stream them via wifi

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've got netflix, and I think I've got amazon prime (mostly for the free delivery!). A smart tv sounds like the sensible option. How are the kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The kids are as rowdy as ever haha. It's OK though since my wife and I are both studying and not working full time. It's a bit easier to care for them. Any tips on how to deal with crazy kids - given you're a teacher and all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe you need to get them their own TV? lol. Thankfully because I teach art the kids are generally a bit older and quite happy to be doing something creative instead of learning maths or physics. I think I've found a TV I fancy, its a samsung (you've convinced me!) and I can use prime to get it shipped quickly

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah that makes sense. Oh good! How big is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: 32" not the biggest, but I live alone and don't watch it a lot so it'll do me perfectly. It seems that it'll sync with my phone. I swear technology is magical these days!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good size. I feel like some are just much too big! Oh yeah the tech is crazy - you can even use your phone as your remote! Do you have any other gadgets or devices in the home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, I guess having a background in art has made me a bit of a technophobe. Though some of the students I teach have been showing me the art they've done on these tablets and things. I guess being in medicine you must be quite used to all the tech.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see. I was going to say that you could link the TV to other devices like smart speakers and that sort of thing haha. Yeah there's so much tech in medicine these days. I'm learning so much about robotic surgery at the moment. It's incredible how advanced we're getting! What type of art do you create?

s1.value: She is a teacher in a primary school, and has a degree in education.
2. She has four children, one boy and three girls.
3. She makes art based on her experiences as a child and teaching a young adult.

s2.value: Has a Samsung Smart TV and loves Samsung products.
2. Enjoys Netflix and streaming services.
3. Has a lovely family with a bunch of kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My blood sugar was really high so I had to take medicine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry, that's very unfortunate. I don't have any major health problems, but I can empathize. Do you take your dogs for regular walks? I hear that even light exercise can help regulate blood sugar levels.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do take my dogs for walks, and I ride my bike.  I think I need to focus on my diet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense. What is your favorite kind of food? I love Mexican food and BBQ. Neither of which are probably good for my blood sugar!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You seem to be health, though.  My favorite foods are steak and potatoes.  Maybe I should cut back on the starch.  I am thinking about going low carb.  What do you think about low carb diets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think low carb diets are probably healthy, but I don't ever want to have to do it. I love my carbs too much! I tend to just snack on potato chips while reading comics. Do you snack on junk food much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, way too much!  I think if I cut out the junk food that I would probably be fine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, if only they weren't so delicious. My cat tends to steal snacks from me, so that might be okay. I also have a sister, and her cat does the same thing - maybe our family subconsciously trains our pets to steal snacks! Do your dogs do the same?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dogs will take food right off my plate and run to the corner to eat.  They mainly do this with pizza for some reason.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They must really enjoy pizza. What's your favorite kind? I generally just go for pepperoni pizza.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like Taco Pizza from Pizza Hut.  It is so good!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, I'll have to try that next time I go to Pizza Hut. Have you ever tried to take your pizza home by bike before? I have a bike but not a car, and I'd like to try picking up a pizza sometime.

s1.value: I'm married to Bill and I have two dogs. Speaker 2: We are also married and have two dogs. Speaker 1: My blood sugar was really high so I had to take medicine.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has a blood sugar imbalance.
2. Speaker 2 is not overweight.
3. Speaker 2 will not be taking her dogs for walks anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I took my dogs to the park

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, how nice. I went on a hike. I would love to have a dog to take along.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh! I had never even considered the idea of taking a dog on a hike! That sounds amazing. Panda, my biggest dog, would probably really enjoy getting to climb some hills. Pixie would probably need to be in a backpack, though. He's tiny.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of dogs are Panda and Pixie? What about Pepper and Precious?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Panda is some sort of Dalmatian mix. All I know beyond that is that he is very very long. Pixie is a yorkie-poo. (Part yorkie, part poodle.) Pepper and Precious are both mutts. They both came from rescues that have no idea what kind of dogs they are. Pepper small, dark and short haired, though. And Precious is brown and chunky. Probably a pug mix of some kind.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh how sweet! I would love to see pictures some time! It just seems to hard to have a dog in the city. They need room to run and play.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Absolutely. I'll send them over sometime. And yeah. My friend in downtown Chicago has several dogs, and she says she has access to some really nice parks that are usually full of other dogs to play with.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good idea! I never thought of that. Maybe I can hire someone to walk the dog while i'm at work. I'll have to look into what type of dog would be best.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah! Dog-walking can be a decent job if you are patient and in good shape. I do not recommend it though if you're small or out of shape, though. You could end up being dragged along by a St. Bernard, and that would not be fun. Except maybe to onlookers. It might be fun for them. For a city, though, a medium or small dog would definitely be preferred. A poodle might be a good choice. They're smart, easy to train, and don't shed!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There's got to be an app for that. I'll have to search for some info. Funny you mention someone being dragged along the street by a St. Bernard. Reminds me of that movie Beetoven from when I was a kid. It was so funny, i'll have to watch it again! I think a small or medium dog would be good. I'll have to look for breeds that would like to hike. San Francisco has some beautiful trails, i'm excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah. The whole "gig economy" thing has apps where you can hire just about anybody, especially in a big city. As for the movie, I don't think I saw that one. Maybe I'll put it on for the dogs sometime when I'm working! As for the hiking -- I definitely recommend a poodle. They're not huge, but not tiny or fragile either. They were originally used as hunting dogs! That's actually where the weird "poofy" haircuts come from. They were to keep their joints warm in cold water without slowing them down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! I never knew that about poodles! That does sound like a dog that would like to hike with me! I searched google and found a few dog walking apps! Now i'll start looking through local shelters and see if I can find someone that needs a home. Maybe I'll love them so much I'll get a tattoo like you!

s1.value: They live in Chicago.
2. Their new puppy is named Panda.
3. Speaker 1 is a dog walker and talks about taking her dogs to the park.

s2.value: They were originally trained as hunting dogs and are now used for dog walking. Speaker 1: They are good at the walking part, but I was not a big fan of the walking itself. I think the dogs often need to be walked at least 4 times per day. Most do not, but it's what I was used to.

2. They're small enough for city living and don't shed, but have great agility. What's great is that they have good recall. I can usually find them within 10 minutes, but the longer we're walking the more likely they are to lose track of us. In the worst cases, the dogs can become distressed and refuse to walk without supervision. If the owner is not quick enough to catch them, I often see them fall down while running at full speed.
3. They're very smart and have a very easy temperament. They are a great companion, and I think they are a great fit in some of the less urban areas like New York City.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite part about computer repair?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha. What's there to like about it at all? I am just glad that we have service centres where I can get my computer repaired, if needed. Do you still exercise / walk everyday?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I do! I love long walks, being outside and smelling the fresh air.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That do feels great! I cannot do without breathing in some fresh air before I call it a day. It's a must. Every.single.day!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I completely agree. Do you walk around your neighborhood mostly?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, mostly around my neighbourhood and sometimes, around the nearest mall. It's a beautiful place to walk around (and window shop at the same time). How about you? Where do you like to go for your daily walks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I prefer being outside. I don't really have a mall nearby but that's okay with me, I love the scenery and the peace and quiet. I think being in a mall can be overwhelming and wouldn't relax me as much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. That's still amazing that you have a peaceful and quiet place to go for your walks to. That's important for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, of course I'd love to be in an even more rural area but this is good enough for now!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess. Metros are honestly so over-rated. I like some quiet too. I hope to move to a rural area some day as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I didn't know that! Are you thinking someplace warmer maybe?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Definitely not a cold place. But something more moderate. I don't really like extreme weathers at all.

s1.value: Speaker 1 really enjoys computer repair.
2. Speaker 2 is often seen walking around the neighborhood around the mall.
3. Speaker 1 prefers to go outside for her daily walks.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I like to walk everyday.
2. Speaker 2: I love walks too.
3. Speaker 1: Which is your favorite part about computer repair?
Speaker 2: Haha. What's there to like about it at all? I am just glad that we have service centres where I can get my computer repaired, if needed. Do you still exercise / walk everyday?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's your favorite karaoke song to sing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love every song that Katy Perry make! It make me want to sing and dance, what is your favorite song?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats cool! They are all anthem songs that are fun to yell/sing! I love singing Beatles songs the most, my favorite it Let It Be.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah beatles are cool too! You should take exemple on them for your future songs!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I gonna try to go out more to actual Karaoke places. Is the spot you go to on Thursday pretty laid back and welcome to newcomers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it is, when i was a begginer, everyone wanted to teach me and people were so nice to me, you should come with us on a Thursday!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds really welcoming and like something I would like to try! I am really shy around strangers usually but when I start singing I just close my eyes and dig deep for courage!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is good, you just have to feel like nobody is judging you and that way you will not be shy anymore!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome, its a date, sort of! lol Hey, what part of Flordia do y'all vacation at?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We love going to Tampa Bay, I have a lot of family over there and it is so fun! Did you ever visited Florida?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, Tampa Bay sounds super fun because I love football! No, I have never been to Florida though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should definitely try it! It is very nice to see all those palm threes and beaches!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a singer, song writer, guitarist, actor, comedian, author.
2. Speaker 1 has published more than 20 books.
3. Speaker 1 co-wrote, producing, and starring in the film, "House" and directed/starred in the film, "Speaker"

s2.value: He is shy with strangers but he starts dancing and singing when he starts singing a Katy Perry song.
2. He likes the Beatles songs the most.
3. He goes to Tampa Bay for vacation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I watched a new scary movie the other day, and it was too much even for me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh goodness! I would have nightmares for weeks if I watched one of those. Dare I ask, what was it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I definitely had nightmares after this one. I woke up screaming. It was one of those where the child in the movie has what everybody believes is an imaginary friend but it's actually real and terrorizes everybody.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: OK, well I will officially have nightmares tonight haha.  I'll have to play my bass or something tonight to take my mind off of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well a good scare can do you good every now and then lol, it gets the blood pumping.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My kids always come over and try to watch that stuff. If I wanted to get my blood going, I would go for a good run, or something physical.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hear you, that sounds like that would do the trick to. How old are your kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My son is 22, and my daughter is 19.  They do all the scary movie, Halloween kind of stuff. They actually set up their own Haunted House last Halloween, I think they want to do every year.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow! I would love to come check it out next year if they do it again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You could not pay me enough to go through it! lol. I will tell you about it next year so you can go. Or maybe you could be a part of it, if you wanted to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be different! I've never been on the other side of the story where I could be the one scaring people. You've got my attention with that .

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it's all in good fun, especially since everyone wants to be scared.  I need to go watch a happy movie now or something, my mind has been just been racing with all this scary talk!

s1.value: I watched a new scary movie the other day, and it was too much even for me!
2. My son is 22, and my daughter is 1
9. They do all the scary movie, Halloween kind of stuff. They actually set up their own Haunted House last Halloween, I think they want to do every year.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a self-proclaimed horror fanatic.
2. She has a 5 year old son, and a 10 year old daughter.
3. Speaker 2 enjoys shopping and having a good time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just finished a new song on my guitar.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh cool, what kind of song? I wish I was better at guitar I am pretty bad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like Classic Rock.  It is difficult to make Classic Rock though.  The stones are my favorite and they are what I emulate.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The Rolling Stones are a great band. I love country music myself. Do you like country music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There are some country songs that use the steel slide guitar.  I love the sound of that.  Have you tried more than one type of guitar?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I don't have a guitar since I'm bad at playing them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not many people say I am good at it.  I do not let it stop me.  Sometimes loud is good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet you are way better than me. You already made a song and that's impressive.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks.  With practice you could be part of my country and stones band.  It will be unique.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like it would be a lot of fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think it would be.  I some times write songs about horses.  Do you think a rock and roll song about a horse would be a good idea?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be amazing! I work training horses so I'm sure I would like it.

s1.value: I just finished a new song on my guitar.
2. I like Classic Rock.
3. I play guitar and I am good at it.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has been playing guitar since 198
2. Speaker 2 is a practicing attorney in town.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went fishing on my boat and caught a cod fish.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Amazing ! I bet your wife is really excited to cook that cod ahahah

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She will be after I clean it.She doesn't like this part. How is your writing going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ahah I can relate . I too hate cleaning fish ! baawww

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah! What are you writing about Now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sorry . my writing is going great .. its a secret ! I can only tell you that the ending will shock you

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, man! You are really going to keep me in suspense? Common! I will take you fishing if you tell me

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ahaha I can't .. If I tell you it will lose all the fun . you can take me on a adventure on your boat and I can show you the cover ahah just the cover

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How about I give you a nice haircut, so you show me both : the cover and the last page??

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: deal ! you realise the last page is just for reference and greetings ahah

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Shoot! I mean the last page of  the actual writing, but you got me. So a haircut, a fishing trip... How about you do a drawing of what happens at the end?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A drawing of the end uhmmm that will be a challenge, but I can try . please my hair Is literally asking for help right now.

s1.value: Speaker 2 went fishing with a cod on his boat and brought home a beautiful cod fish for his wife
2. Speaker 2 loved to clean the fish. The end.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is the author of a highly popular book.
2. Speaker 1 is interested in the fishing boat story.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you take your dogs with you when you visit your home in the mountains?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do! They love it up there because they get to run free and have way more space to explore. Do you like to visit the mountains?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is awesome! Unfortunately I do very little traveling due to my fibromyalgia, but I have always admired the scenery. I would imagine it is very peaceful though. Have you traveled abroad or elsewhere?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aw I'm sorry to hear that your pain keeps you from traveling a lot. You can do virtual trips maybe? I have only been out of the US once. Have you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Virtual traveling is a great idea! I should definitely look into that. In my younger years I was able to travel to Spain with a group of peers. I'd love to go to India if I could since I've found they are noted for their beautiful bead work which has always been an inspiration.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Spain must have been so amazing. I've heard it has some really interesting architecture and art. What was your favorite part of that trip? India sounds very cool but I most want to see Peru.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Madrid was beautiful! I loved being able to enjoy the livelihood of the people, food, and culture. I'd highly recommend planning a trip in the near future if possible. I've heard great things about Peru as well. Are you planning any trips soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll have to check it out someday! Yeah I'd really love to see Machu Picchu and to try local Peruvian food. I don't have any plans besides my trips to the mountains sadly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's ok! I'm sure something will come up. I enjoy a few Peruvian dishes myself, but can imagine authentic Peruvian food is exquisite! I love food! What's your favorite dish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love food too! My favorite changes every few weeks based off how I'm feeling but right now it's Pad See Ew, a Thai dish. What's your favorite food?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm in love with Spanish dishes. My current favorite Pulpo a la gallega. It's basically a spicy boiled octopus soup served best with bread and wine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've never had that but it sounds really good! Outside of my normal wheelhouse but definitely interesting!

s1.value: Speaker 1: Do you take your dogs with you when you visit your home in the mountains?
2. Do you travel a lot as a result of fibromyalgia?
3. Do you like traveling abroad?

s2.value: Do you have children? What are their names?
2. How many dogs do you have?
3. What is your favorite vacation destination?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was able to get a group from school together and enjoy a great soccer game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds fun! How did the game go? Did you win?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It went really well until it started storming, but we were able to get about an hour in! When we had to stop my team was winning, so I'll call it a win!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome! Was your scholarship for school because of soccer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was, I was recruited out of high school. I focused my Instagram on my soccer skills during high school and was able to attract scouts that way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow, I have never thought about attracting scouts through Instagram. Was your college team pretty good?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, we were great! Won a few National Championships while I was there, which was a really fun experience. Soccer is such a great sport to both play and spectate. You should bring your dogs out to the park the next time we have a game!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great idea, but they might cause too much of a distraction, they can get too excited sometimes. What are some of your favorite healthy foods? I am trying to incorporate more in to my diet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no, we'd love the distraction of cute dogs! I'm on a sweet potato kick right now - I make sweet potato has a lot - sauteed sweet potatoes, black beans, mushrooms, onions, green peppers with cumin, chili pepper and the top with an over easy egg. I also really like to do smoothies for lunch or afternoon snacks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sweet potatoes are one of my favorites to eat. I also really like smoothies for lunch, but with it being so cold out I haven't been drinking them much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's true. I love the cold, so don't mind the extra cold. There are a lot of healthy soup options I make a lot - if you incorporate cabbage into them it's extra healthy and that would give you a warm, healthy option.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks! I really appreciate the recommendations, it is always helpful to hear from someone who likes to make and eat food that is healthy

s1.value: Speaker 1 worked in the media before they started coaching Soccer at the University of Miami.
2. Speaker 2: Speaker 1 was a high school soccer player.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a student and athlete.
2. His favorite food and drinks are ice cream and soda.
3. He likes to bake and share his recipes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your professional field?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am professional athlete, actually I am a tennis player to be more specific

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds fun. Who is the best player you have played against?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hmm it is hard to decide but I would probably say Roger Federer. It is nice being a tennis player but the thing is I can't eat too much fast food

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am sure that is true. I take it Federer won? do you get to eat a lot of pizza?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah Federer won but it was a good match. Not really, I like it but can't eat it too often. I would say I treat myself once a month

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: sounds hard. Is there anything else you sacrifice to be a professional?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hmm probably family time. I spend a lot of time training and travelling so I am not spending time with my family

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Can your family travel with you though? That could make it more fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well technically yes but they also have jobs or are in the school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Okay I wasn't sure. I know the top players make a lot of money, but I never know if all the players make enough to support long term.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It really depends how good you are. I think you have to be in top 100 to make a nice sum of money

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a professional tennis player.
2. Speaker 1 lives in Canada.
3. Speaker 1 was born in Canada.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a professional tennis player

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you do with your volunteer work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, this year I dedicated a lot of my time to helping people get registered to vote.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, really? That's interesting. It's great that your husband's work lets you participate in many side-activities that you enjoy, I wish I were in the same situation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks, I do feel lucky, but at the same time, working for a paycheck might be nice! My volunteering takes a lot of time!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I mean apart from being in charge of things I don't think there's any other benefit to it :P Sorry, you were talking about helping people get registered to vote. What did you do exactly there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, there are people in our area who were not registered to vote because they just didn't know how. So we set up a clinic in our town to teach them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing! I always wanted to do my part in the social and political life of my town at least, if not of our country. What do you think about me drawing a booklet for you guys? It can be about voting, illustrations often work better than just plain text.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be amazing! Especially because a lot of those we are helping are low-literacy people! A picture is worth a thousand words! Thank you for your offer!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No problem, will get into it right away then, I already have some ideas haha. What do you think is the age of your main target audience?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would say between 30 to 50 years old.  We have many who are new to the country, or who have been out of the workforce and are pretty poor. We might need a few versions for different cultures.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Got it. The last book I did illustrations for was actually aimed at the same audience. It has some decent images that I can use as references, so I will send you that book next week and would like to hear your thoughts on it, ok?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that would be so great. Thank you so much! I'm really looking forward to working with you. We will try to figure out a way to compensate you for your work!

s1.value: She was born on March 22, 1969 in Los Angeles, California.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is married with 3 children and she does lots of volunteer work in her spare time.
2. She is a low-income single mother.
3. The family has a small business.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Is there a film you're directing right now? What's your favorite genre to work with?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm directing a film right now called "Let's leave it to the team!" It is a comedy. Comedies are my favorite. I also do stand up comedy on the side. I'm not that funny though, ha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey we can't all be good at everything as long as you do what you love in my opinion

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah true! Do you love being a nurse? That is such a good profession because you are helping people constantly. I bet you are very proud!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really am, they are the first line for the patient and often have just as much importance in life saving as the doctor themselves.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes that's true, it takes a special person to be a nurse! What does your husband do, I forgot to ask you before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He is a firefighter! thanks for asking about him, I appreciate the thought.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's a great service job also! Where did you meet your husband, I met my last ex at a corn maze, lol!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: O I meet him at at work function, your story sounds much more exciting, tell me more?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It wasn't, believe me! We were in the corn maze and we bumped into each other. He was all mad and telling me to watch where I was going, and I was telling him the same. When we got out of the maze he apologized and asked me out. I don't know why I said yes! Kind of a corny story, no pun intended, ha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great. Should make it into  your next movie in my opinion.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ha! Good idea! By the way, you should come out to the National Park that's right by where I live. I heard it's great but haven't been there myself!

s1.value: Is there a film you're directing right now? What's your favorite genre to work with?
2. Do you love being a nurse? That is such a good profession because you are helping people constantly. I bet you are very proud!
3. What does your husband do, I forgot to ask you before. He is a firefighter!

s2.value: She has starred in several television series including: "Luther", "The Practice", "House", "American Assassin", "The Mindy Project", "The Last Resort", "Hannibal", "Nurse Jackie", "Justified", "Archer", "The Strain", "Weeds", "The Leftovers", and "Bones".
Speaker 1: She also has guest starred in "Black Sails" and "Person of Interest"
Speaker 2: Is your husband a firefighter as well? Tell me more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found a good new book that I started reading.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oyeaa, what is the name and does it look interesting already? I would love to hear about it considering i love staying at home i could indulge in it too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its called Times of My Life its by a writer who travelled the world to get inspired. Is it something you could read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes i would check for it. Thank you for sharing. What do you do for work? Would you consider taking more than one jobs so as to save money for maybe summer or just fun trips? I also love to travel as well as stay indoor, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work at a bookshop, Yeah we can plan a trip though it has to be somewhere cool like the alpines.. I may consider taking an extra job by the way. What do you normally do at home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: work online, i have a 5 year old daughter i look after, watch movies, read books. I just generally enjoy the quiet life. how are your friends and family doing? have you visited any one of recent?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are doing well actually I plan on seeing them during my next trip. Your schedule is pretty chill, I can therefore presume that this book would make for a good distraction at home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I look forward to getting the book, already reading the previews. Do you have pets? My daughter is asking for a puppy for her next Birthday. what is your best food? I love pasta

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah ill plan on getting it to you. Actually i love Italian food but pizza to be specific. What kind of puppy do you have in mind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: she is not sure what breed yet, all she knows is she just wants a tiny pet to play with. Guess shes bored just looking at me. Oh pizza are nice, i indulge once in a while with my daughter but they are too fattening so I'd rather not. Where do you live? How is the weather at yours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If its a tiny kind get her a Chihuahua. I live in New Mexico I like the warm. Why did you stop wearing makeup?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Chihuahua sounds nice. will check on them when i decide to get her one. Makeups generally cause my face to breakout. sensitive skin issues so i just prefer not stress the face. minimal or no makeup atall. Would love to visit New mexico.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I caught a couple rainbow trout in the river while fishing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's cool! Did you get to eat them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea, I cooked them up on the grill.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice. Fresh food is always the best.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you enjoy eating fish as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I really like fish, cooked or raw! I love going to all-you-can-eat sushi.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Me too but you have to be so careful with places like that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What would I need to be careful of?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know people have gotten food poisioning from it sitting out to long!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! I would hope that the places I've been to have always prepared them fresh before sending it out. I haven't gotten food poisoning (yet).

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Stay safe, worth the risk in my opinion.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha definitely. What's your favorite roll?

2. That's cool! Did you get to eat them?
3. Did you cook them up on the grill?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you gotten your tires fixed?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did, finally! The car drives much smoother now. Have you created any new fragrances for your soap lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good for you. Safety comes first! I am working on a new combination that I hope will work and sell. How does it sound to you the combination of peach and lemon thyme?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds wonderful! You should really consider starting your own business. You would do great at it! Would you be willing to share your potato soup recipe with me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You know what, I think I will, but in the future. Right now I am happy as I am. I do a job that doesn't stress me, I have my little garden where I relax. I am not ready yet to get all the responsibilities of a new business on me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is a lot of stress to undertake. I am in awe that you grow your own foods! I have considered growing strawberries next season. Perhaps you could give me some tips?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! First of all you should check if your soil is adapt for strawberries. Then I would say you need to check that you garden or whatever you want to grow your strawberries has a lot of light. They really need a lot of sun. And at this point I would check also the quality of the water that you are going to use.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I live in a well shaded location. I don't have much sunlight, but the soil here is wonderful! Is there any fruit that is ideal for growing in areas such as mine?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: At this point, considering what you said, I would suggest to abandon the idea of the strawberries and move on cherries, raspberries or blackberries. Would you like to cultivate them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I enjoy eating berries. I think I will purchase some books on growing raspberries and blackberries. Do you recommend any particluar books about fruit cultivation? Did you use books to help you get started?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really. What I know, I learned from my father. He's always been passionate about gardening.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a wonderful passion for a father to share with his son! I am grateful live in close proximity to my parents. Do you live far from your father?

s1.value: Works for a living in a lab.
2. Lives in a small studio apartment with his wife.
3. Has little yard and garden.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a speaker.
2. Speaker 1 enjoys sharing his talents through workshops, lectures, and seminars.
3. Speaker 2 is a father.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you given any further thought to your potential political campaign?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm still considering all my options.  It's very time consuming.   I want to be sure I'm heading in the right direction before I run again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats a good idea.  What do you think you need to do differently this time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I need to target more people from my party first off instead of kind of wavering back and forth.  I need to have a precise agenda that I follow and schedule more town hall meetings.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like a good plan.  What do you do with the computers you build?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I sell them to people in my neighborhood.  I list them on Craigslist.  They seem to go pretty fast.  New computers are so expensive now.  What kind of bugs does your son like best?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense, sounds like a good business.  My son loves all sorts of bugs, but his favorite is the praying mantis.  Have you ever caught one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've caught several.  They're very interesting little creatures.  Does he like lightning bugs, too?  I've always loved those.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes!  In the summers he likes to run around the yard and catch those as well.  What made you start catching bugs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I lived out in the country and there wasn't really much to do in the way of entertainment.  I just had a fascination with bugs.  Sounds strange, I guess.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No makes sense to me!  Any interest is worth exploring in my opinion.  What did you work on as a mechanic?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I mostly overhaul engines for an auto shop in town.  It keeps me busy.  What's your least favorite kind of mechanical task?

s1.value: His name is Paul.  He is a graduate of the University of Minnesota.  He is a father, a husband and a politician. He believes in the importance of supporting local businesses and has founded and funded many political campaigns.  He was involved in the creation of the state of Minnesota.
2. He served as Minnesota's Commissioner of Agriculture and Commerce.  He is an active member of the Republican Party.  He is a Republican.  His favorite bug is the praying mantis.
3. He is a former Minnesota Governor.

s2.value: He was born in 195
2. He lives in a town in the midwest.
3. He has 4 children.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe I could assist you some time when you play music on the street.  I would like to see your performance.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love that. An audience makes me feel good about performing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cool, Do you perform often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: All the time. What are some of your favorite country artists?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not that into country. More into pop and rap. Are you into country?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like a mix of genres. I love pop.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Who's your favorite pop artist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh...I'd have to say, for English-speaking artist, Taylor Swift. For K-pop, BTS, Blackpink, Mamamoo.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cool I'm into Taylor swift too.. who do you recommend for someone just getting into k pop?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I recommend BTS. I know they get a lot of hate from people who don't understand K-pop, but they really are more than just a boy band. Check out their songs, "No more dream," "N.O," "Sea," Oh gosh so many. You should be able to find English lyric videos.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds good. I will Definitely look into them

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Also, for girl groups, try Blackpink, Mamamoo, Twice. I think you'll like them.

2. Speaker 2 is a country artist.
