dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just finalized a house purchase with a big backyard and lots of space to grow plants.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is awesome! What sort of plants are you planning to grow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to plat lot of flowers . It looks good and also adds beauty.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great. Me too. I love planting roses and tulips. But I find it easier to grow roses as they are capable of withstanding harsher conditions. What is your favorite flower?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Daisies are my favorite. I love the colors. It just makes my day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is nice to know. I like daisies too. How are the daisies that your boyfriend bought you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is good. It becomes even more special since it was given by him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Absolutely. I love my boyfriend but he is yet to give me flowers, ha ha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He will one day. May be he must have thought what is the use of giving a flower to a flower. Lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh dear! I am already blushing here! Ya, he's a great guy and a gentleman. What other flowers do you like apart from daisies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like roses . They represent love.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome. Are you planning to grow some vegetables as well in your new home?

s1.value: I just finalized a house purchase with a big backyard and lots of space to grow plants.
2. I like to plat lot of flowers. It looks good and also adds beauty.

s2.value: Speaker 2 lives in a flat.
2. They are both planning to buy a house together.
3. They are planning to grow vegetables.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite hiking trail?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is hard to choose, but I love hiking in the woody area. I assume you also like to spend time in wood for camping?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I do prefer to go into the woods for camping, but also like beach camping. Have you gone camping too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Actually no, I have never tried it but I am open on trying it. Do you often go camping?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We go about every month with scouts. They teach the children many important life skills. Have you heard of scouting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I have. Whoa once a month, that is often. Do you usually go fishing while you are camping or are fishing trips separate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't like fish so much. It makes me sick so I avoid it at all costs.  Do you enjoy fishing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I don't it is hard doing it with one arm, but I enjoy eating fish. It tastes amazing

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you go with your brothers hiking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sometimes when I need a company. However, on some occasions I prefer to go by myself to clear my mind and relax. What about you? How are you doing in highschool?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love the band and performing.  I hope to pursue college if I keep my grades up. So far so good. Do you like to listen to music or is it hard with all that work you probably have on the farm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I listen to music a lot, especially while working on the farm. It gives me energy to do my job. Good luck with college application!

s1.value: Likes hiking, fishing, camping, and being able to eat fish as a side note. Has a favorite hiking trail. Speaker 2: No, has never tried it, and doesn't like camping. Speaker 1: I don't like fishing either.

s2.value: In high school I play the trumpet.
2. I am always into outdoors, hiking is one of my favorite activities.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you done any ski racing practice lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I've been practicing a lot lately and my family has been helping me with it. Have you looked at any houses yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, we have looked at a lot of different ones.  I want to live as close to my parents as possible so they can keep giving me money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How big of a house are you trying to get? I understand wanting to be close to your family. I think being family-oriented is a great trait to have. How are your classes going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I want to get a house that has at least 6 bedrooms.  My classes are going well.  Did you have to take a lot of classes to become a ski racer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! That's a lot of room to put all of your stuff in after shopping!! That's great about your classes. I didn't have to take a lot of classes, but I did have to take some in order to learn the basics of ski racing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you won any medals?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I've won a few medals. I'm hoping to win a few more and head off to the Olympics. How have you parents been? Are they excited to help you with your house?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My parents are so excited to help with the house.  They have been finding lots of options for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm so happy for you! What are you planning on majoring in for school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am planning to major in personal shopping.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like something you would be passionate about! Is it focused about business?

s1.value: She's been practicing a lot of ski racing and is looking for a house with at least 6 bedrooms.
2. Speaker 2 will be competing in the Olympic games soon.

s2.value: She has been learning how to ski for 10 years.
2. She won several medals for her ski racing.
3. She is planning on majoring in business.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long have you been working in sales? Is your job hiring?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Our company is not hiring now  Are you looking for a job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! I am quite good at selling so I was hoping you might know of something?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Let me ask my boss to see if there is going to be an opening in sales.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be great. I know you work hard at your job and take in seriously, so I appreciate that you would do that for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You said your boyfriend is unemployed too.  Did he quit or was he laid off?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He was laid off. The factory just doesn't have the hours right now. I don't think it is ever good to quit without having another job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are sensible in thinking that quitting without having another job is not a good idea.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: it is important to be sensible and these times. Right now many people are not even able to work like my BF.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: When I hear from my manager about next job openings, I will certainly let you know.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Really appreciate that it could make the world a difference for all of us in my family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So, how is your daughter doing?

s1.value: I am a mother who wants to take care of my daughter and help her through the times of stress.
2. I am the mother of 1 who is a boy. I would like for all my family members to be in good condition.
3. I have been unemployed for 5 months because of the financial crisis.

s2.value: She is very young but knows her world (she has a great imagination).
2. She has a boyfriend (also very young), who recently left his job.
3. She is very well-balanced.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have just started my own gaming company!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? That's awesome! What do you do with it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am hoping to work with my team to create a new game!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I wish you the best of success in it! I just started my last year of nursing school myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am so excited for you, what a great achievement! It looks like we are both entering new chapters in our lives.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I definitely believe so. You with your gaming company and me becoming a nurse, it's fantastic for both of us. What do your friends think of your company?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They're pretty excited as well, most of them can't wait to try out the game my company is planning to get started working on. It will probably be quite a while before its playable though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love to play it, me and my friends here in Queens are always looking for something fun to do!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe I can send you a copy and you all can test it out once it's ready.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That'd be great! Just because I'm gonna be a nurse, you have to find a way to unwind and relax after a long day of helping others. :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: True, it would be perfect for that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope it works out great for you!

s1.value: I just started my own gaming company and I am hoping to work with my team to create a new game.
2. I am a nurse.
3. I started nursing school last year.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a gamer and recently started his own gaming company. Speaker 2 is a nurse.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How's the studying going today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's crazy busy. I have to finish a new assignment almost every week and its been like this for the whole term so far

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Surely, after your education is all done though, you will reap the benefits of all your hard work. What are you majoring in at NYU?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm in physics. Learning how things work really interests me

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I liked physics in high school and did really well in it. I liked all the math involved because I like questions to which their are definite, concrete answers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree! Right now in my first year, the stuff I have been learning so far is a repeat from high school so it's been a bit easier

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool. I'm sure in your second, third, and fourth year your classwork will increase in difficulty and intensity. What general education and elective courses are you enrolled in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a course called Mechanics where we learn stuff like kinematics and monentum. I also have a some calculus courses right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mechanics sounds pretty fun. Are you learning to build a robot or anything like that? Calculus sounds like a real drag. I like math but not when it gets to that theoretical, impractical level.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nah, no robots right now, maybe I'll take that as an elective later. The stuff I'm learning right now basically involves problems dealing with gravity and velocities. It sounds like you could enjoy this course too since it's similar to high school

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I would enjoy that, too. If I ever go to college, I'd like to go into a field related to math or science, since it's one of my strong suits. Did your brothers go to NYU also?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ya, physics is pretty fun. In my opinion, it's much better than something like business, which is what both of my brothers are studying at NYU. Do you have any siblings?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a physics major at New York University.
2. Speaker 2 lives in Manhattan with their parents.
3. The family spends most weekends with their friends.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a physics major.
2. Speaker 2 is in New York University.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just had a dance practice, it went great. I met many new people

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: what type of dance was it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was square dancing. I've really been enjoying learning about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: what got you interested in doing square dancing particuarly?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think it was its cultural heritage and how long it's been around practiced by so many different people. It's kind of humbling to think of how long it's been passed down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: was there a lot of square dancing at parties/clubs/etc. in dallas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: lol well no it's not really a popular dance. It's more of a cultural old fashioned type of thing. But that doesn't make it any less fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I feel that, how big are the classes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There's usually about 30 people. They come from all different sorts of places so it really is a good mix.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: okay so that means you don't get a lot of one on one with the teacher then right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, it feels more individual with the other students. Some of them are very experienced though so it feels like a great lesson no matter what.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: that makes sense. i personally like one on ones because i like to be perfect when i'm learning something. haha

s1.value: Speaker 1 has been practicing square dancing for over ten years.
2. It was a very popular form of dance in the past.
3. Square dancing is now considered a modern dance.

s2.value: It's a square dancing class and it's been around for a very long time.
2. It's practiced by people of all sorts and has a different cultural heritage.

dialogue.author: 19932: I
dialogue.text: t to relax today which was nice on my day off.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome! It can be hard to find time to relax! Were you able to take any photographs on your day off?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I went for a walk in the park and was able to snap some great shots of the snow-covered trees.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wonderful! I love walks! You will have to show me the photos sometime. How much snow did you get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely!  We got about 3 inches yesterday, so it was the perfect amount to lightly cover the trees.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like it was beautiful! What else did you photograph?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There were some bright red cardinals, which looked great with the contrast of the white trees.  I also passed by a stream, so I got some nice photos of the water with some frozen patches of ice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: WOW! Sounds like a winter wonderland! My son loves birds. I bet the Cardinals were stunning. Were you out taking photos by yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yep, I really enjoy spending time alone in nature.  I can think about anything I want to and just listen to the sounds of the birds and the water.  How old is your son?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He is 7. He has quite the adventurous spirit. We enjoy going on walks together but I also enjoy my alone time. Nature is the perfect place to spend time alone.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I agree.  What types of nature do you prefer?  I love watching waterfalls if I could choose anything to watch in nature.

s1.value: I got to relax today which was nice on my day off.
2. I went for a walk in the park and was able to snap some great shots of the snow-covered trees.
3. I also passed by a stream, so I got some nice photos of the water with some frozen patches of ice.

s2.value: They are a retired couple with 4 children.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have lost 5 pounds since I started running

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That sound great! Congratulations! How many days per week do you run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I try to run at least  times a week. Hopefully I'll work my way up to 5.  And I might take up hiking soon too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are really going for it! I like that. I do a lot of hiking, but I don't like running too much. What surface do you run on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mostly the sidewalk, since that's what's around me.  But I probably should get into something a little more low-impact.  Where do you like to hike?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to hike in the mountains nearby. It's very hilly and the trails are kind of rugged, but I like the peace and quiet. Do you get any joint pains from running on the sidewalk?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not yet, but I've heard it can happen. Just want to prevent it is all!  But that's nice I wish I had some good terrain nearby it's most flat unless I drive 30+ minutes

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. Driving half hour just to hike can be a task unless you have company! Maybe your girlfriend could tag along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah i think she would, she's interested too.  Does your girlfriend hike with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, sometimes she does and it's almost way more fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good!  I will have to convince mine to come!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha! Well, she is already interested so half the battle is won. Is she excited about the weight loss?

s1.value: Speaker 1 hates running.
2. She runs regularly, sometimes multiple times per week.
3. She's lost a total of 5 pounds since she started running.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I am a 49-year-old woman who lives in San Francisco, California. I like to run, hike, and run some more.
2. Speaker 2: I am a 48-year-old woman living in Northern Vermont. I like to hike, run, and run some more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ni hao ma! Have you been able to play any baseball lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ni hao ma! I haven't been able to play any games so just go down to the nets each day and hit balls for a few hours. How is your arm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's still broken unfortunately. It takes some time for it to heal. Why can't you play baseball?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The team i was playing for has hit on hard times, a company has brought the ground and is planning on knocking it down to build a mall. I think i might have to move away and find a new team if we cant stop the developers from demolishing it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, that's just terrible. Maybe ya'll could try to fund raise? That might bring in some much needed funds?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats what were hoping, we only have a few weeks but were going to set up a charity car wash and hold a disco on the ground to raise funds. I still dont think it will be enough though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm sure it does take a large amount of cash to stop that kind of big guy. I wish you luck. I understand difficulties, believe me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you, i think if we all pull together anything is possible. Iv been trying speak to local radio to see if we can get some publicity. Can you think of any other fundraising ideas? I can only think of the carwash and a disco.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, since I am currently on the lookout for a new parner myself, you could try a single bachelor/bachelorette auction. That might be fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats a great idea, we could auction you off on stage at the disco!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would be happy to volunteer. I hope to have someone soon. I've been very lonely since my spouse passed away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im so pleased to hear you have moved on from the alien abduction idea. It must be such a sad and difficult time but its great you are accepting things and looking to move forwards now.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is deaf and has no hearing.
2. Speaker 1 has a broken arm after an alien abduction.
3. Has an alien name that the writer of this article doesn't know.

s2.value: The Speaker 1 has a broken arm.
2. The Speaker 2 is the one going to have to move away.
3. The Speaker 2 is a single bachelor/bachelorette.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to a clothing store and it made me think of you making and selling your own clothing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been thinking of making some dance costumes for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my goodness the is so sweet. Do you use patterns or make your own designs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I make my own designs.  What types of songs do you dance to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I Christian music.  Do you just envision in your head what you want to make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I envision it in my head and then draw it out.  I'm going to assume you don't want anything too revealing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are right. As you know less is more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you don't mind that the print is not floral.  I do not buy any floral fabrics.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea floral would be ugh

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How many days a week do you go to dance class?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I days counting weekends. I am getting alot of training.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do any of the routines involve piano music?

s1.value: She went to a clothing store and it made her think of you making and selling your own clothing.
2. She has been thinking of making some dance costumes for you.
3. She goes to dance class once a week.

s2.value: She lives in the Twin Cities.
2. She does not dance regularly but does take dance classes.
3. She is a professor of dance at a local college.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How has your song writing been going? Have you taken any more formal music lessons lately in piano or violin? Have you tried looking into taking cooking classes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm still continuing my lessons and they are going great! I think I'll try to improve my cooking with video tutorials when I get the time. How have you and your family been getting along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Saturday dinners with the family have been great! I always love trying out my new dessert recipes on hungry grandchildren. What kind of foods do you want to learn to cook in your tutorials?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite is Mexican and other Latin food. Do you know any good recipes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know a great flan recipe! I'll send it over to you. The secret is to add just a hint of lime. What's your favorite latin food?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite latin food is pupusas. Do you know how to make those?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do know how to make pupusas! In fact, my late husband and I traveled to Honduras for our honeymoon where I met a lovely Honduran woman who was kind enough to show me her recipe. Have you ever traveled to anywhere in Latin America?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's incredible! It must have been a great honeymoon. I admit I don't know if this counts as Latin America but I have been to Mexico City.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that's great! I haven't had the opportunity to go there yet. Did you try out any interesting local dishes there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's by far the largest city I've seen. Very busy place. I was a kid going with my whole family and I think I remember just getting tacos when I ate there. Have you traveled any other places?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds tasty! Fortunately, when my husband was alive we traveled all over the world for his work. My favorite place was Sao Paulo Brazil! They have a cheesy bread that's to die for!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad you guys were able to spend your time together experience so much travelling. There's too much good food in the world and not enough time to try it all! I'd love to try the cheesy bread.

s1.value: Speaker 1: How has your song writing been going? Have you taken any more formal music lessons lately in piano or violin? Have you tried looking into taking cooking classes?

Do you know any good recipes?
Do you know any Spanish?

3. She's a mother of two.

dialogue.author: 16178: I
dialogue.text: t in the park and people watched.  It was fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool. What interesting things did you see or notice? I enjoy people watching sometimes too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to imagine what people are like. I like watching people from all walks of life. I don't really like talking to people though. I usually get impatient when talking, but imagining is fun. I need to sit for a long time because of my back condition, so it gives me lots of time to sit and watch

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree. Imagining what peoples' lives might be like is interesting. Do you ever listen to any music while people watching?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, each day before I go out, I pick out one of my Johnny Cash cassette tapes, and clip my walkman to my belt, and that is my soundtrack for the day. I like when it seems like someone's personality or situation lines up with the lyrics of the song playing

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool! I also like Johnny Cash. Wow, you don't hear of many people using walkmans anymore. I wonder how the story would change if you were listening to a different song or genre, but watching the same person? What is your favorite Johnny Cash song?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Glad you like him too, he is the absolute best! Yeah, I don't like CDs, they don't have the same warmth as cassettes. Trouble is, my cassettes are getting worn out. Yeah, funny you mention that. I see the same people running by sometimes, but a new song is playing each time, so they get a unique soundtrack for that particular day

s1.value: I was born in 195
2. I moved around a lot as a child.
3. At one time I was a professional concert musician.

s2.value: Speaker 2 enjoys watching people from all walks of life and talking about them. In his off time, Speaker 2 likes to listen to Johnny Cash, John Prine, Bob Dylan and other famous musical artists. His favorite Johnny Cash song is Johnny B. Goode.

2. Speaker 2 has chronic back pain which prevents him from sitting for long periods. He does not like watching people. He usually gets impatient when talking and becomes impatient when he is not thinking or listening to music. He also gets impatient when others talk or have loud voices
3. Speaker 2 and his wife run a home for children with special needs. He gives out a monthly monetary award to honor those children (who might otherwise be overlooked)

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hi Luciano. I would really like to see pictures of your garden and learn how you created it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hello Homer! I will send you some! It is beautiful this time of year. Have you been scuba diving lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't unfortunately. It's been too cold where I'm from and I hate the cold! I hope to go when it warms up some.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love to go with you! We could travel to the Bahamas and spend time outdoors. I have been building a house and need a break.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like a lot of fun,  could definitely give you some tips on how to scuba dive! Building a house sounds stressful. What's been the hardest part so far?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: All of the different knowledge you need! Drawing blueprints, electrician work, plumbing, framing, drywall, roofing, et cetera. If we went on a trip outdoors, where would you want to go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would like to go somewhere warm and tropical. Maybe the Bahamas like you mentioned before, or somewhere like Hawaii. Where is somewhere that you would like to go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Scuba diving is perfect there! I would like to go to China and explore all the beautiful mountains and forests there. You could learn some gardening tips there and I will learn design tips. Maybe I can build you a garden!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be amazing! I would love to see your handiwork. Do you think there would be good hiking opportunities in the Chinese mountains? I like to get outdoors and take in the sights when I can.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The hiking is some of the world's best and most beautiful! And the Chinese are historically great gardeners so we could both learn a lot!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds great. I will probably plan a Chinese vacation in the coming months! Do you have a favorite TV show? I want to find a new show to watch but I can't stop watching CSI!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: CSI is amazing! I love crime shows! Game of Thrones is my favorite, though. I like it almost as much as being outside and gardening. What other shows do you enjoy, Homer?

s1.value: Speaker 1: Hi Luciano. I would really like to see pictures of your garden and learn how you created it.
2. Speaker 2: Hello Homer! I will send you some! It is beautiful this time of year. Have you been scuba diving lately?
3. Speaker 1: I haven't unfortunately. It's been too cold where I'm from and I hate the cold!

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a famous artist and musician. He has composed more than 150 albums and has taught art lessons, as well as singing lessons. He has also been teaching music lessons for over 45 years.

Speaker 1: The first time I saw Speaker 2 was at a show. My husband and I were in Las Vegas and we saw him performing and it was one of the best nights of our lives! He is such a talented person. Do you have any other skills?
Speaker 2: I am really good at playing guitar! I had a small guitar shop in Miami where I learned to play, and taught hundreds of students.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have decided to take a leave from work this month, and have begun my triathlon training. My daughter is coming to visit from college for the holidays.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great, how long do you have before the triathlon starts? And that's great news about your daughter I know how much you miss her when she's not around!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Being off work for this month during the holidays with her will be such a special time for us.  I have 3 months until the triathlon starts and have been training on and off this past year.  Time to really ramp it up!  You should join me on a run one day, or even just a walk!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not sure about that, I'm not a very outdoorsy kind of person. I would much rather stay inside playing Halo 3 all day! You should play that with me after your triathlon, after all you will need some rest!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to.  I haven't played Halo 3 before but I'm sure you could teach me pretty quickly, being the expert and all.  What other video games do you like to play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah you will get the hang of it quickly I'm sure! My other games I play, are usually GTA V, and of the call of duty's there great fun, and sometimes a bit of Minecraft! Do you play any video games yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like it keeps you very busy!  At this time of the year I'm so busy snowboarding that I don't make time for video games.  How is the job search going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not very good, I get to distracted playing video games all day, that I forget to look! Any advice how to stop procrastinating and get on with your day, you seem to live a very busy active life!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Exercise really helps keep my energy and focus up.  Between running, triatholons, snowboarding, I AM very busy but I always make time to for personal development.  My advice is to get out of bed first thing and go for a walk.  It can be just in your neighborhood by yourself.  Great way to clear your mind and focus on what you need to do for the day.  You've got this!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay thanks for the help, I will try and see if I can manage it, it might be hard because I do get very anxious in public, but I will let you know how it goes!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know you do but hopefully first thing in the morning it will just be you.  I just remembered!  My daughter has a friend that works for a video gaming company close to your house.  The work is also remote.  How perfect would that be for you!?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that would be amazing. Probably my dream job, thank you soo much for letting me know about it, I will definitely give that a look!

s1.value: The father of the daughter is working.
2. The daughter is coming from college for the holidays.
3. 3 months until the triathlon.

s2.value: She is a work from home mom.
2. Likes video games like Call of Duty, GTA, and Minecraft.
3. Has never been a snowboarder, but is willing to try it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite place is kansas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The city where I grew up, Topeka. All my friends and family live here, so I can't picture anywhere else feeling like home. Have you managed to turn things around lately in terms of school and finances?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I caught up on some school work this weekend so that is good, but haven't made much progress on the debt. I need a miracle, or to win the lotto! Money makes the world go around I guess. Speaking of, how is the job search going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That it certainly does, maybe you'll catch a decent break soon, hopefully. It's good that you were able to make up some ground in terms of school, keep it up. Not so well in terms of the job search for me - there is a limited amount of farms in the area, and none seem to be in need of extra help at the moment.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's tough. If you could do anything you wanted for a living, what would it be?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love to be a professional surfer, but that's based more on what I love doing than it is on how good I am at doing it. I'm a decent surfer, but not on the level where I can make a living off of it. How about you - what's your dream job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh but what a nice idea! I wonder if there are any creative ways to get sponsers? Or move out to the west coast and work in a coffee shop or something while you work on your craft? Honestly? I'd love to explore all the stories of paranormal activity in the Bermuda Triangle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a great idea, now you have me thinking - I never looked at it that way. Being a paranormal investigator sounds amazing, there is certainly a lot of light that can be shed on the events that have occurred within the Bermuda Triangle over the years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Where would you go to surf? California? Yes, I'd love to investigate it! I'm just not sure how I could get paid for that. Back to money, once again haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: California seems to be the ideal destination, but anywhere there are waves, really. Surfing at different destinations around the world would be a lot of fun. Who knows, maybe Bermuda will become a stop - although I don't want to become another story of disappearance, haha. Maybe you can start by creating a web series that investigates different things that have happened there? I can't imagine the startup is too much for that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh great idea!!! Thank you! Sounds like we both have the urge to travel and be near the water! Have you traveled much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been to a few different states, but nothing too interesting. Who knows, maybe if this farmhand thing goes the way its going, we could travel and jumpstart our dreams.

s1.value: He attended a Christian school and is currently a farmhand.
2. His favorite place is Topeka.
3. His dream job is to be a professional surfer.

s2.value: She was born in Topeka.
2. She grew up in the city.
3. She graduated from high school. Relevant facts about Speaker 1: Speaker 1: She was born in Kansas.
3. She graduated from high school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What area do you live in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I live in the South East of England, in a large town called Brighton. Its right by the sea, lots going on so a great place to live. Where do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh nice I always wanted to visit the UK. I live in Tampa Bay, Florida in a nice 3 bedroom house near the beach so I guess we have that in common lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah! The beaches seem very different, stony and only really hot in the summer months here. You certainly wouldn't want to go for a swim there today!.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I believe it. I bet the views are nice though. How's the overall area for tourists?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its a very touristy area, not quite as much as Florida, which iimagine is inundated most of the time. But its a popular place for people to visit if they are visiting London as its so close. Also very popular in the summer months with people wanting day trips, also people visit for stag and hen dos, and to go to the nightclubs which are quite famous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds fantastic. It makes me want to visit even more than before. It seems like there are a lot of great spots to hit up then. I'd love to try out the night life and hit up some clubs. We have plenty of that here but everybody seems so uncultured and they just want to drink until they blackout.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Some places are like that inevitably. The best time to come would probably for the Fringe festival which is each year. So much see and do for the month its on, stuif like arts, movies, comedy, music. Its alll a lot more civilised than the club nights.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome, I prefer the shows and the more artsy stuff anyway. How about the food, is it as good as their festivities?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, i dont know how it would compare to somewhere like Tampa, but there are lots of good resteraunts, street food etc all over the place, even more so during the festival. Its got a slightly (but not quite as full on) artys rep like Portland, so also has lots of nice vegan and veggie options.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I'm a huge foodie so that's excellent to hear. I like local stuff and various cuisines so I'm sure to like what they have to offer. I'm trying to eat healthier so that's good that they have veggie dishes to try.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im a bit of a carnivore, i enjoy the classic stuff like burgers, steaks etc... its nice to have genuinely interesting and appetizing vegetable options, makes for a healthy change.

s1.value: Lives in Tampa Bay, Florida, in a nice 3 bedroom house near the beach
2. Has traveled in many countries & visited over 80 countries

s2.value: He lives in Brighton, England, with his wife, and is the boss of a coffee shop. He enjoys going to the cinema to watch horror films.
2. He is a fan of the TV series Doctor Who.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finished a new chapter of the novel that I am writing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool, how is it coming along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Pretty good! I really feel like it's starting to take shape now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats great. What genre is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a crime novel, based on a true crime mystery that was never solved.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that sounds really cool. Have you gotten a job yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! No, not yet - I've been focusing on trying to get my writing out there. I should probably look for a job in the meantime though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah that seems like a good plan. Do you like dry humor comedy movies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I do! I know you love them as well - what is your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The Hangover series is one of my favorites. Have you ever watched one of those?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I did see the first movie! I didn't get a chance to see the rest of them though - do you recommend them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah they are really funny. I was laughing throughout the movie.

s1.value: She is a speaker at the local community college.
2. Speaker 1 speaks on topics such as mental health, parenting and self improvement.
3. She is an author of a crime novel and a parenting book.

s2.value: She is into the horror genre of movies.
2. She has a lot of dark thoughts and a lot of dark humor.

dialogue.author: 18771: I
dialogue.text: thinking about volunteering at a nursing home in my spare time and I was wondering if you have any recommendations.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure!  Pretty much all nursing homes need volunteers. Mostly, they need people to visit and spend time with the elderly who are there.  A lot of them don't get visitors and they get lonely.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great, thanks for the advice. What else do you do in your spare time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Every weekend I go to the lake with my husband and kids.  How do you spend your weekends?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to do yoga and play hockey. Are you into any sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Besides basketball and water ski, sometimes I go hiking with my family when the weather isn't warm enough for the lake.  How did you get into yoga?  I tried it one time and it was so hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've always liked challenging sports, so yoga seemed like a great way to exercise, stretch, and challenge myself. I can't imagine water skiing is easy either.

s1.value: She volunteers at nursing homes, plays hockey, and goes to the lake every weekend with her family.

s2.value: speaker 2's favourite hobby is snow skiing.
2. speaker 2 grew up in an urban area, where she never played sports.
3. Speaker 2's hobbies are golf, skiing, swimming, and gardening.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is the training going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah not bad. At the moment, we've got a blizzard here so I'm stuck indoors. But I'm giving my treadmill a good workout! How's work going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! The weathers pretty bad here as well. Works going fine, thank you for asking. Since you are stuck indoors, have you had a chance to practice your pottery?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not as much as I would like. Because of the wether I cant get any suplies. I'm doing an onlin corse but i cant keep up with the class. i think i have to start agin.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that sucks. I wish I had a hobby like that. For now I just do crossword puzzles. I've done so many of them that my spelling has improved.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: thats grate! Maybe I shuld do it too. do you think it could help my seplling? mine is totally bad!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I can tell. You should definitely try it out, it gets really fun after awhile. I've practiced a lot since I'm indoors most of the time. Do you still spend a lot of time outside?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No becos of the wether. I cant go out at all now. Im thinking I might take atrip somewhere warmer and keep training ther. maybe spain or turkey? any suggestins?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that makes sense. Spain seems nice. I'm not sure but I think there's a couple of mountains over there. You could probably find a way to practice in Spain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yah thats what i think too. hows ur work going? Busy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah pretty busy. The bar I work at is really popular and a lot of customers come in. It gets really stressful at times.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: i rember that you smoke a lot. are you planning to quite? its very unhealthly

s1.value: The speaker smokes pot every day.
2. The speaker is addicted to drugs
3. The speaker takes cocaine on occasion

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a smoker.
2. Speaker 2 is on a mission to quit smoking.
3. Speaker 2 has bad breathing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got a call from an old friend who wants to have drinks tonight.  Would you and your partner care to join?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, I am a bit busy tonight. Where are you going for drinks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah that's a shame, we would have a great time! What have you got planned for tonight? And we are heading to the rainbow bar and grill tonight in West Hollywood!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I got booked as a contract artist for some newspaper cartoons. I've been procrastinating on getting them done and they are due tomorrow. Is your friend anyone I know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah that sounds good, hopefully the pay is better than last time HAHA. And no this is an old friend from back in college, I'm sure you guys would have got along brilliantly, maybe next time!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm bummed to miss out. Definitely next time. Have you heard any good new music recently? I've sort of been struggling with finding some new stuff to get into.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You know me, I'm much more of a classic guy. Listening to the old classics on vinyl, i haven't got much time for all this new modern music, not my taste! Your partner must know a few, he's very trendy up to date guy! How is he doing by the way, long time since I've seen him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He is ok - he's been busy too. He's been frustrated with how quiet we have to be about things. I wish my family wasn't so closed minded.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I understand must be soo horrible, have you considered maybe telling your mother yet, maybe she might surprise you!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am thinking of having one of my siblings broach the topic with them and see how they react. My hope is that I am wrong in my assumptions about them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well it goes without saying, but I wish you all the best. Whatever you decide just know I will always support your choices!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks - I really appreciate that. How has the dating scene been going for you?

s1.value: She is a married lady and has a husband and family to attend to.
2. She likes to listen to old music and drink
3. She is a lesbian and is interested in women's rights.

s2.value: He is a contract artist for some newspaper cartoons.
2. He is a gay male.
3. He has been in relationships with women.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you picked out a name for your daughter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not! Do you have any suggestions?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've always liked the name Grace

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a beautiful name. I also like Charlotte and Alice. So many choices, it's hard to decide. How're your dogs doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They can be a handful at times but they keep me busy throughout the day.  I love taking them for walks, it's a good chance to get some sun and fresh air.  Alice in Wonderland and Charlotte's Pig were fun stories.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's a great connection. I loved Alice in Wonderland also. I can't wait to go on walks with Alice too! I'm so nervous about becoming a parent, but so excited also.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure your kids will love growing up in the country.  They'll get to connect with animals and nature.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love it here. She will have such a great appreciation for nature. I hope you can come out and visit sometime!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'd love to see your horses, I've always been a little afraid of them but I can't deny that they're so majestic.  I'm sure yours are quite friendly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They sure are! I'd love to introduce you to them too! And I bet your dogs would love running around out here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dogs love going to the park, they'd be in dog heaven having such a large area to run around in and getting to visit all your animals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It'll be a great time! And if my husband is back from deployment, you'll get to meet him too. I hope you can find the time.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a veterinarian.
3. Speaker 1 is a dog lover.
3. Speaker 1 has daughters.

s2.value: She named her first dog "Buck".
2. She loves to read, make music and go on walks.
3. She has a daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finally finished a piece of writing for work and am quite proud of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's great! What did you write about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a short story about transitioning from university into the working world.  It's largely based on my own personal experiences.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds really interesting. I'd love to read it. Do you work for a publisher full time or are you paid by the piece?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work mostly freelance.  I'm lucky though because I have some friends who work at various publications and they try to get me work when they can.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great gig. I am studying finance but I enjoy writing too. Maybe if I stopped partying so much I could accomplish more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha!  Yes, it's a balancing act with all you have on your plate.  How did your classes and your job at the restaurant go this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Work was good except I had a terrible customer who didn't want onions on her pizza even though that's what she ordered, and she ended up throwing it at me!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow!  I didn't realize pizza restaurants could be so dangerous.  And how about your classes?  Are you keeping up with those?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it was terrible and funny at the same time. Classes are good but I am struggling with math. Need to get a tutor. Are you good at math?

s1.value: I have an interest in writing.
2. I work full time as a freelance writer.

s2.value: She had a very hard week at work when she was on a very emotional high due to a boss threatening her job.
2. She is a finance student.
3. She is a self-taught artist.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you like your car?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love it! It is nothing fancy but it is so good to have that freedom now and it certainly makes getting to work and school easier.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I remember my first car. The feeling of freedom. It's just like having your own personal space. You work so hard in school. You deserve it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah totally. That's my present to myself for graduating. When I graduate university I'll hopefully be able to afford something better. What was your first car?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was a Honda Civic, pretty basic, but I thought it was the hottest thing at the time. Lol. I hope I can afford a new car as well. Sometimes it's kind of hard with just my job at Burger King.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, you will definitely need something reliable when you are a teacher. What would be your dream car?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dream car is a Land Rover. It has tons of room for my krav maga friends. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be good. If money was no issue I would totally go for something classic - a Charger maybe. Have you found a Krav Maga class yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, a small group of only about six. It's fun learning techniques from other people. You should try it sometimes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is it hard to learn? I imagine you need to have really good balance and be very fit in general?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's not too difficult. But it's a great workout so you have to have a little stamina. It's very rewarding though. What kinds of things do you like to do in your spare time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm just making the most of my free time before I start University to be honest. I'm sure business school will take up all my time so it's nice to just relax before that starts.

s1.value: They are the only ones who have to go to work in the morning and take care of the kids at night.
2. They are the only ones who have a lot of free time to do what they want.

s2.value: Speaker 2 was born in England.
2. He currently lives in the United Kingdom.
3. He is 35 years old.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of sitcoms are you watching nowadays?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I am just watching lots of reruns from older sitcoms from years back! Fun times. Do you like watching TV?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes but would prefer to walk on nature trails than to sit watch TV.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice! I wish I got out more to do walks like that! I'm stuck inside a lot writing for my job. How is your yoga going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is going well. Thanks for asking. Where do you get pad thai when you want to eat it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great! I get it from a local place, it's fantastic! Reasonably priced too. What are you other favorite foods, apart from salads?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like chinese food. However, I would always choose salads over any other food. Like how much do you get pad thai?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice! I get pad thai a lot to be honest! Also cookies, I love them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is surprising! Why would you say you get it for a reasonable price before? I really want to try it once at least.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The local thai place I order from is pretty cheap so it lets me get it often! You could always buy the ingredients and try it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Really! Preparing it myself will be suicidal! I can't do that, I suck in cooking. Thanks for the information.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet you could do it! I suck too, thats why I order haha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: ['What kind of sitcoms are you watching nowadays?', 'Hiking in the winter is challenging at the moment.']

dialogue.text: ['What kind of sitcoms are you watching nowadays?', 'Hiking in the winter is challenging at the moment.']

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you watched any good movies lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have! A really cool film about a guy who races cars around big cities. One of the cities was somewhere you'd been - somewhere in Europe?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hm, I don't travel in Europe much so I've really only been to Italy and France. Was it Rome or Paris do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah! Maybe Rome - it looked warm. Remind me, where else have you travelled?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My mom's from Singapore and Dad's from Hong Kong so mostly Asian countries. I try to visit family every other year at least.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! I've heard Singapore is one of the most expensive places to live. Where is your favourite country you've visited?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah the property costs are out of this world! I think it's a tie between Thailand and South Korea. They're really different but both amazing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've heard a lot about South Korea. Sounds intriguing! We should hang out some time - you tried any good beers lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely! There's a brewery a few miles from my house that just came out with a great new dark ale. We should grab a drink.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is dark ale your favourite? It'd definitely be good to catch a break from my studies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet genetics is a pretty tough subject. I actually prefer pale ales but it's good to try different things sometimes, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can be, but it's kinda fun, learning what people are made of. There's genes for gambling too! I know you go to the casino, so you may have a gene that tells you that you're more prone to gamble. Maybe that's why you like trying different things? I like a good lager - do you like the craft ales? They have awesome can designs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to the beach yesterday. I just wished I could surf a little.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love surfing... How long are you surfing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to the beach all after noon, it was a beautiful day. I even saw a shark!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What state do you live in, if I may ask?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I live in Florida, so the beaches here are rad. Can't wait to go back this weekend with my brother.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I live in Florida so that I can surf move.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should come vist! You could sleep on my couch and we could go surfing all day. I might even bring you to the restaurant I love near the beach afterwards.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks for the offer. That will wonderful. I am already having gooosebump thinking about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sweet, I'd love to see what kind of moves you got. Maybe you could show me a thing or two on a surf board.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What would be good time of the year to visit Florida?

s1.value: Speaker 1 went to the beach yesterday, she wished she could surf.
2. She lives in Florida, and is going to visit her brother this weekend.

s2.value: He is from Florida,
2. He surfs all the time,
3. He is a big fan of surf culture.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What shows would you recommend I watch on Netflix?  I need something new.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I liked the Queens Gambit. Im still no good at chess haha it goes on too long and I get bored.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmm, it sounds like an interesting show. Does Dave watch tv with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Usually he falls asleep on the sofa next to me. How about yours, do they like TV?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cats do like YouTube for cats but otherwise ignore what is on TV. What kind of work did you do at your last job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was doing deliveries but my car kinda broke so I could't really do that anymore. Hows your business going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Business is pretty good. Do you like anything from Hulu?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What's that? I've never heard of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hulu is a service kind of like Netflix. Do you use any streaming services beyond Netflix?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I only have Netflix. I guess I watch random YouTube videos too. Im a bit like your cats! haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I guess that makes sense LOL. I put in a lot of work hours and really don't have a whole lot of time for watching tv. Do you have any hobbies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Um i like tv haha is that a hobby? Actually, I do enjoy playing with Dave and going for walks. Its nice to be out in the fresh air. How about you?

s1.value: Speaker 1: What shows do you recommend I watch on Netflix? I need something new.
2. I liked the Queens Gambit. Im still no good at chess haha it goes on too long and I get bored.

s2.value: He does not like to watch TV and prefers to play chess.
2. He dislikes having to do deliveries.
3. He has two cats.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is the hot fashion trend for girls in Texas this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wrangler jeans becomes more trending now a days.You should also try it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I should see if I can incorporate that into some of my designs.  I have an interview with the design school next week.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool. All the best buddy. I know you do well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you!  How are your girls doing?  How old are they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing fine. Elder is 10 years old, second one is 7 and the last cutie is 5 years old. Hey, you should help me to design them their outfits.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Those sound like such fun ages!!  I would love to do that!  You'll have to let me know their sizes and some styles they are interested in and I'll start drawing some ideas up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will let you now about the size, you can prefer whatever style you want.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok sounds great that will be so much fun!  Are your girls in any school activities or anything?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are taking their online classes. So you can meet them whenever you want.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome!  I'd love to do a video chat with all of you sometime and get to know them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You would. I am expecting. They also will be enthusiastic if I told about you to them. I hope you guys get along.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a fashion designer based in Texas. He designs clothing for girls.
2. They have daughters of different ages and sizes.
3. Speaker 1 has an interview next week with a design school.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a famous fashion designer from Nigeria.
2. He has designed many dresses for famous actresses,fashion models and celebrities.
3. He is also an entrepreneur.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just had an interesting conversation with my 5 eldest son about his plans for what college major he wants to pick.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome! What major did he discuss with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He wants to major in Psychology. How old is you're son? When is he going off to college?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well that's cool, at least he has an idea of what he wants to do. My little dude is only 10, so there's a long time before we have to start thinking college.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It goes by so fast! Have you drawn any new comic recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, time really does fly. Nah, I haven't been drawing lately beucase I've been working too much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Having two jobs must be rough. How is your work-life balance?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is totally nuts, day time bagging rich people groceries, and night time making sure they behave out at the bars. Anyway, I try to do a yoga class on the weekend to stay centered. My kid goes back and forth between my ex's house and mine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What grocery store do you work at? Is it a big chain store or a local one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Actually it's a little one here in Los Angeles, locally owned, which is why I get to take off time if I have an emergency with my kiddo.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is great that they let you do that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, it makes all the difference between being a present parent and one that's always absent. I try to show up for my kid. How the heck do you do it with 12 kids? I forget where you work?

s1.value: She has 4 kids, and has been a stay-at-home mom for a long time.
2. At age 30 she became a stay-at-home mom, and is now a part-time mom.
3. She gets more tips than her fair share.

2. No, he hasn't drawn a new comic recently.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What video games have you played today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I played Rust, have you heard of it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I also play Rust sometimes, what do use to play your game?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I use my laptop with a mouse, what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I normally use my phone, I do not have a laptop

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that sucks, I always have to turn off the volume while playing. My parents ALWAYS complain about it. Kind of ruins the whole experience though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: you can try use earphones, that way you don't have to disturb them. what else do you do for fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I could, but right now I don't have the money for a high quality pair. I don't do a lot but yesterday I baked a really good cake all by myself!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that is cool. I also like to cook. I normally bake cupcakes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, cupcakes are really good. My mom makes them for me a lot. What other foods do you cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to make pies and roast chicken.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wanna learn how to cook but it seems kind of hard, I'm also terrified of starting a fire.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got back from an hour long bike ride. It was fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you taken a shower yet? You probably smell gross!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I have not taken a shower yet. I just got in and am cooling down, and then I will shower. But I do not smell gross.  Why are you thinking about me showering?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I sweat like a pig and I always smell gross after I get done with a ride. I forgot that you always smell like candy and roses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is correct! It is all roses and candy over here. Are you working tonight? I was thinking of going to your restaurant. I am craving Italian food, but I need to try to find something somewhat healthy to eat there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you implying that pizza and pasta aren't healthy? Do you forget how good that I look?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel they are not the healthiest food options, but they are so good. Yes, it has been too long. My husband is out of town for a conference, so I figured I would there and get go some food, maybe a few glasses of wine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds fun. You can ride your bike over and we'll put in the back room so it's safe.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you. That is helpful. I am looking forward to it. So, you are working? What time do you work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll be there from around five until closing. You can come over whenever you want. You can sit at the bar and critique my waitering skills.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a good plan. I have plenty of critique and suggestions for you. Maybe you can get off a few minutes early and have a drink with me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't need for work to be over to start drinking. I consider drinking to be a fundamental part of the job.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has a great sense of humor.
2. Speaker 1 lives in New York City.
3. Speaker 1 has a great sense of smell.

s2.value: He has a wife and two children.
2. He is currently dating a woman named Kim
3. He has been dating her for the past year.Speaker 1: He does not drink wine or have relationships with women. He says yes to the most outrageous suggestions.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm going to be flying again soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats great! What kind of plane will you be flying?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will be flying a C37. I'm very proud to be doing this as I am the third generation in my family to be in the army. I want to make them proud.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I think they'll be very proud of you. I really miss my army days. Do you enjoy being in the army.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do enjoy being in the army. As you know, I never did ROTC or college so it is a way for me to expand friendships and serve. I know you enjoy telling stories about your time in the army. So, why don't we meet up to talk more about it sometime? How about we go for a drink at a sports bar? I know you like watching sports.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh heck yeah buddy. That sounds like an awesome plan. We can trade stories and show off our battle scars. haha. I look forward to meeting up with you buddy. Drinks on me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds great. I know you like driving your car so how about you pick me up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For sure. I'd love to show off my ride. Im free on Friday. How about I pick you up around 6pm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds good. I will just be getting done with building a new computer around 5pm. If you want to come earlier to relax at my place that would work too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah for sure. I'd love to see your new computer. In that case I'll be there around 5.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Alright. Sounds like a plan. I will be able to show you my dads old mustang army outfit as well. I'm excited for this.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me too buddy. We'll talk soon. Have a great evening.

I love it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you getting nervous for the wedding?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, a little nervous for the wedding. Also very excited though!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The honeymoon at the Niagra Falls should he fun.  Is there anything else you plan to see while you are there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, were want to check out the falls and also go to the casino thats nearby as well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The casino should be extremely fun.  Be careful, though.  You don't want to start your relationship out with financial problems.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah i know. We plan on only spending the amount of money that could afford to lose. So how has it been going at the hospital?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is busy, as usual.  To be honest, I am getting burnt out.  I need a vacation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you plan on taking a vacation anytime soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will in a few months.  I am thinking about going to a state park.  I just feel that I need to get out into nature.  The hospital is just so clinical.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a lot of fun and a much needed break from work! What do you plan on doing at the park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I plan on hiking on the trails.  It should be good excercise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds really nice! I like taking walks on the beach with my dog for my exercise.

s1.value: She is getting married and has been spending a lot of time at the hospital.
2. She is very excited for wedding.
3. She is getting bored in there.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is getting married, the wedding is planned for Saturday.
2. Speaker 1 is getting nervous for the wedding
3. Speaker 2 is also excited for his wedding

dialogue.author: 23857: We
dialogue.text: ust starting serving tea at my place of work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome! What kind of tea do you serve though? I hope you have komodo tea.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! We do have komodo tea. You should definitely come by and try it some time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I definitely will! Does that place also have karaoke nights? Maybe we can get some tea and play songs from the Chili Peppers!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We don't currently have karaoke night but we have been exploring the possibility of having things like that. I will definitely bring it up to the manager. I think that's a great idea!! Would you be interested in designing the poster if we decided to do it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I love to make art while I'm singing. I could even put roses in the background since that is your favorite flower.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank but the poster would be for the coffee shop, not for me personally. Anyways, I've been meaning to ask if you've ever been able to meet the Chili Peppers??

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I could meet them one day. Maybe we should start our own band! Your heavy guitar and my singing could bring a lot of visitors to the coffee shop. Just pitch the idea to your manager!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, that would be amazing! Maybe we could start our own place instead and then no managers to deal with!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish we could practice at your place, but I know your cat hates it when we play loud music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes my cat hates loud noises, it's really becoming a problem when I practice guitar. I now go out to the garage to practice. What about your dog - does he have a problem with loud noises too?

dialogue.text: Do you live with your brothers currently?

dialogue.text: No, not since I left for college years ago.
