dialogue.text: Are you at the lab today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we're trying to come up with a new name for the Indians.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am so curious to see what they change it too. As long as the players don't change, I am fine with any name.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Understood, maybe they'll be like Washington and call themselves "Cleveland Baseball Team".

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is boring! I hope they come up with something more creative. Baseball was weird this year with cardboard cut outs as fans.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I thought that was lame. They should be able to allow in person attendance by April.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Fingers crossed! Have you seen any good romance shows lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am watching Bridgerton now on Netflix. It's good so far.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have heard it's great. I will try it tonight!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good, you'll probably end up watching two or three episodes in a row.

s1.value: She is a graduate of Oberlin.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is working on a new name for the Indians.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I could make you a veggie sub sometime if you came to the grocery store I work at.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be great! I will have to stop by. How is your dog doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Jesse is doing great. We have a vet appointment today, but I don't anticipate any problems.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is it just for a routine check up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it is routine. I just want to make sure that everything is okay. What about your dogs? How are they doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing well. They keep me very busy, but I enjoy taking them out. Do you take your dog to any dog parks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, our family property is about 25 acres so we have plenty of room to roam around.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that is a lot of property. Does your dog ever get lost?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, he has been with us since he was a puppy so he's pretty used to the place by now. We had to be very careful when he was smaller.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are there any wild animals on your property?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes mostly non threatening animals such as birds and deer. But we do occasionally see bears.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's really cool. How do you keep the bears out of your garbage?

s1.value: I could make you a veggie sub sometime if you came to the grocery store I work at.

s2.value: Speaker 2 owns a garden center.
2. He is always looking for ways to make customers happy.
3. He wants to get a pet dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you ever thought of trying to learn to make pizza yourself from scratch? It means you could have it whenever you want!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually do make pizza from scratch from time to time. I love it but the process is a bit tedious. Do you make your own?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do! Last week I made pepperoni although it's still not quite the same as my favorite pizza place in town.  I would be happy to share my recipe and any tips I learn along the way, the recipe I found is quite easy.  How is life on the ranch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool, I'd definitely give the recipe as shot. My oven just doesn't get hot enough bake the crust the way my favorite pizza place does and getting delivery out here at the ranch isn't possible since we're so far away. But it's great living out here otherwise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great - I can't wait to get out to the ranch, see your horses, and maybe enjoy a nice glass of sweet tea!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me either, I think you'll have fun. You can also show me how you make pizza.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'd be happy to, do you like pepperoni too?  How is your cheerleading going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love pepperoni, in fact, I don't think it's a pizza without, lol. Just tomato cheezy bread. I've got a part time job helping train the new cheerleaders at my old HS, so I've been looking forward to getting started with it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree, of course since its my favorite!! That is so exciting for you.  I'm sure it'll be nice to get away from the ranch for a while and do what you love.  You're the best person to teach them too since you've been cheerleading and riding horses since you were so  young.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks for the encouragement. Are you looking forward to the new batch of students with the upcoming school year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very much so!  I love teaching first graders.  They are so eager to learn and I get to be one of the first teachers they have.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet, and I don't know if it's strictly anectdotal, but I remember my kindergarten and first grade teachers more than any of my middle school ones.

s1.value: They were one of the top rated teachers in their school district.
2. They are a life long resident of the district.
3. They have worked at the same school for over 40 yrs.

s2.value: Was in high school and college cheerleading and horseback riding.
2. Likes pepperoni.
3. Living on a ranch where it is too hot to bake much.

dialogue.author: 13964: I
dialogue.text: ied a new tea that I think you would like.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of really? That's very interesting and thoughful of you Zach! What is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a Boba tea that has tangerine flavoring.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is it a cold tea or a hot tea? Hey so I was curious about how long that you have been riding your motorcycle for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a cold tea. Do you prefer hot or cold? I've been riding for about 8 years now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome, I'll definitely have to try it out, I'm kind of picky when it comes to trying new things lol. You ever had any close calls on that bike?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A few but those are the risks you take as a motorcycle rider. I wear a helmet at all times of course but it's just like riding a car, you have to be a defensive driver.

s1.value: I'm an artist and I love tea.
2. My favorite type of tea is black tea.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of sports do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Football, it's everywhere in Florida.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, Do you enjoy basketball too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Love it. I play it all the time with my son.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is good to teach them young to do sport instead of watching tv all day!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I try to avoid too much couch potato behavior. Though sometimes you really have to watch the big game. That also gives me a chance to bake.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it is fun something as long as you are not in front of it all day! With that said, i also enjoy watching the big games sometime

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, and you can also watch Drake music videos on the TV as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, i sometime listen to him on my couch or when cooking!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, he had a concert in Jacksonville when I was there, too bad I missed it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was there! I should have visited you but i forgot where you lived!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I tend to move around a lot. I had to move away from Jacksonville because of my job, loved it there.

2. Speaker 2 is from New York
3. They both love sports and listen to Drake music together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am about to run a marathon that only comes around every few years! Do you want to come with? It will be fun!! Maybe it'll make you enjoy drawing a little more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not much of a running person. Do you enjoy running?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do. It's my favorite pastime in fact. It helps me relax my mind. And gives me the much needed me-time. So, have you been drawing anything of late?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been drawing a lot of winter scenes. Is it snowy where you are?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! And not really. We rarely get any snowfalls here. I do love snowfalls though. It adds so much beauty to the nature. I would love to see your drawings.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks, I like to share them. How is your commute going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's so exhausting for sure. But I love my job so, that's something that keeps me motivated to drive. How are your mom and your siblings doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing pretty well. What is your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good to know that. I am an interior designer. So I have to visit a lot of client's places and offices for work. I enjoy the work though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds like fun. Do you select artwork for your clients?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually do. I was just wondering if you are interested in sharing some of your work with me, may be, I could help you sell some of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great idea. What is your typical client like?

dialogue.author: 18753: Wi
dialogue.text: all of these huge films coming out, I've been really busy at work!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet you have. I want to go with my husband and son to see Tom and Jerry when it comes out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That looks like it would a great movie to see with your family.  How's the pageant coming along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is going good. I still have to go do a dress fitting and schedule my hair appointment, but everything in in the works. I am excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What pageant are you in?  Mrs. America? I've never been in a pageant before. I couldn't do it because I get stage freight.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ha, ha, I wish it were! No, it is just a local pageant for a charity event. I used to have an issue with public speaking and I took a class in college that helped me get over my fear.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so nice that you are helping a charity.  I also volunteer at the local animal shelter whenever I have a day off from work.  I love animals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I try to fit in charity events in my spare time as well. The animal shelter is definitely a worthy cause.

dialogue.author: 15097: I
dialogue.text: de a lot of progress on my new book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congrats what is the book about? I love to read and can read it to my grandchildren when you're done.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is a children's book about a book about a dog that lives at a firehouse! I am getting pretty close to finishing it, and I am super excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's sounds like the perfect book they will love. I think it would be great if you release an audio version too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a great idea! I think I just might do that. How is your grandson doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's great. He's in the fourth grade and just started playing hockey for the first time. I love watching him play.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's awesome! Are you going to take him camping at any point in the near future?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah when the weather gets a bit warmer we have a spot at a local mountain that we love going to. How's the hunting been going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It has been going pretty well. I haven't been in a few weeks because it's been gloomy and raining a lot lately.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Right I can imagine hunting isn't great in those conditions. I just love the outdoors I can't wait for the summer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am going to the casino this weekend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess your friends have finally convinced you to join them! Casinos are a lot of fun but be prepared to lose all your money!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: recently i had been busy with my business so i dont have the time to hangout with my friends thats why i said yes to go to casinos with them.but iam little bit scared

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You can always bet low if you want. There are a lot of people that will want to play a game of blackjack for a few dollars. Not everyone is betting 100 dollars each time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes,i know.so tell about your concert experience

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was back in the late 80's. How many people can say they have seen Queen live! I've only been to one concert in my life and I'm glad it was Queen. They are legends. Have you been to any concerts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: omg you are very lucky.i really want to see queen one day.i never been to any concert

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I heard the other members of Queen have played without Freddie Mercury. Perhaps you can still see them

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish ,maybe next time.so you dont have any travel plans ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't have any travel plans right now. I haven't been on vacation for 8 months and I am starting to feel like it's time to plan a new trip. Do you have any recommendations?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: maybe you can visit thailand or hongkong

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I never thought about visiting Asia. Have you been there before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are your studies going? Have you been to the beach lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: School is okay it's definitely keeping me busy you're lucky you don't have to go I'm jealous. Went to the coast with my lil nephew this weekend we had a good time but it wasn't great weather we got to go storm watching though, have you ever done that? It's nuts!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I go to the local beach and watch the storms come in from off the lake at times, it's pretty cool long as you can get out of there in time!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah it's intense, almost scarry! The ocean kind of worries me I would not ever want to be out there in the storm I would die! Have you decided where you're going for your travels this summer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: WEll I'm hoping to go out west and see California, never been there and I figured it'd be a great place to relax. YOu've ever been there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I have, several times. I've frequented the west coast all over for my whole life pretty much but I've only done the East once or twice. It's pretty amazing the differences in the beaches even though they're both essentially the same thing, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine! I want to go get a cabin on the ocean and just forget the world for a week. Would be nice to have company but my boyfriend usually is working, so I'll just go without him lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah his loss hah! Where does he work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He owns his own insurance company, that keeps him busy for 60 hours a week haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah I bet wow that sounds like a ton of paperwork. Bless his heart! Well you'll have your pets with you at least to keep you company in his absence won't you? Sometimes their companionship is better than anyone anyways lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, they keep me company when I'm at home alone. They like to watch while I do my yoga!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How cute! I need to start a yoga program I've been so lazy lately! Do you do hot yoga?

s1.value: Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 had a similar question. Relevant facts about Speaker 2:

s2.value: Speaker 2 was at the beach on Saturday with her nephew. The weather was bad. They had to go storm watching. The last time she was in a storm was the week before when she went to the coast with her boyfriend. She has been to California before but only once and she has never been to the west coast. She has always wanted to go and visit the west coast.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I saw that you're from Pittsburgh. I've always wanted to visit the place! Andy Warhol was from there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are welcome to visit me here anytime, just let me know a few days in advance. Pittsburgh is a really cool town. It has a unique look and feel with it's many bridges, rivers, and rolling hills. I love living here. I have also visited your home town of Nashville. I love going to Nashville, so much to see and do there. I love all the music related sites and activities and we have a full schedule every time we go there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will certainly come and visit you some time, that is very kind of you. I'd love to be shown around by a local. Did you travel to Nashville as trip for part of your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did go to a music convention in Nashville once, but most of times have been just for fun with my wife. We like to get a feel for the local scene and hang out at the little joints. It is amazing the famous people that walk in those places and put on an impromptu concert. I have never been to Tennessee State though, how is that going for you?.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Does your wife enjoy the music scene as much as you do? I really enjoy it, I'm majoring in experimental physics which of course keeps me pretty busy

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes she also enjoys the music and vibe of Nashville. Have you been looking for a new job? I know you aren't satisfied with your job and said you might be on the lookout for something new.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've had to put the job hunt on the backburned a little, my school work is taking up a lot of my time. But you're right I do need to find something new. Have you got any advice for the sort of job I could do alongside my education?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really don't know much about experimental physics, so I'm afraid I won't be much help to you in that area. I hope you find something you like to do. And, when you come to Pittsburgh I'm going to take you out to all the great restaurants around here. I need to eat some delicious meals and put some fat on my skinny bones. It seems I'm so busy that sometimes I forget to eat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I look forward to exploring Pittsburgh with you. I'm more than certain I'll be able to encourage you to eat some more food

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great, we will do that after your school term is out, just give me a call as to a good date for you. The next time I come to Nashville I would also like to visit you there and we can hang out on Music Row.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes please do let me know when you're next in Nashville. If I'm not too busy I will show you around all my favourite spots

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Will do, we'll talk about it when you visit. Please bring a friend if you'd like because my wife will be joining us also.

s1.value: Speaker 2: You are welcome to visit me here anytime, just let me know a few days in advance. Pittsburgh is a really cool town. It has a unique look and feel with it's many bridges, rivers, and rolling hills. I love living here. I have also visited your home town of Nashville

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Tell me more about beans and rocks. Why do you collect them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm a big fan of round things and things that can fit in my pockets. There are so many beautiful rocks that you can find while wandering the countryside.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's neat. Do you have a favorite rock?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's not necessarily a rock, but I am a fan of sea glass. It's cool how the surf rounds it down so much. Do you get to get out in nature very often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet it's beautiful. I do. I love to paint landscapes, so I love being outside. Maybe I could paint where you collect rocks. Where is your favorite spot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There is a beach by my house that is beautiful and has a wide variety of shells and rocks. I bet it would be a wonderful place to paint.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I'd love to paint there. Maybe after class one day soon we can meet up and go to the beach. You can show me the best spots

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love that. How are your classes going, by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Going ok, I guess. I'm ready for a break. I feel like all I ever do is study and go to school and sleep. I am loving my photorealism class, though. Are you working or going to school now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm working. I am thinking of going to school next year, but I haven't applied anywhere yet. I will probably go to the local community college until I figure out what I want to study.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Those are great places to start. You can work on the required classes before settling on a major.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That was my thought. Save a bit of money and get my general studies out of the way. When do you graduate?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I paint and love rocks. I collect them for fun and because I am an early adopter of technology.
2. Speaker 1: I'm a student at an art school.
3. Speaker 1: I'm graduating next month

s2.value: Speaker 1: I'm a full-time college student.
2. Speaker 2: I'm a full-time college student.
3. Education majors are the best.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My soccer team won our game last weekend!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's rad! what was the final score?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: 10 to 8. Have you ever played soccer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah a few times, I'd love to join a club and get involved but I haven't got around to it yet. What's your favourite Disney movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love most Disney movies, but I think my favorite one is probably Beauty and the Beast. Which one is your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a great movie, I love The Fox and the Hound, classic! Are you still in a relationship?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love that movie too! I don't think I ever said I was in a relationship. I'm not, and I live with my parents. I think you said that you aren't in a relationship, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I thought you was with someone, my bad. yeah I'm single, relationships are too much work, so have you done much reading lately or are you too busy with the soccer right now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The soccer is keeping me busy, but I always manage to find time to read. What is your favorite genre? Mine is mystery and suspense.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's cool, I enjoy reading a good crime novel myself, do your parents watch you play soccer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, they come to my games whenever they can. They both work, so they can't always make it. You said that you like to watch football and hockey. Have you ever played either of them, or do you prefer to just watch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I hear you! that's good they come to watch when they can though. I play hockey for my local club but I'm only in the reserve team, I don't think I have the right build for football if I'm honest. Haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been looking at possible places to move to in Pennsylvania.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hi I thought you lived in Alabama, are you thinking to move back to Pennsylvania?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really. I do like going back to visit since thats where im from. But im not retired yet, most of my kids live around here now and I think I like my home too much. Are you happy in Wisconsin?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I'm pretty happy here, My daughter always says she wants to live in an area with more sun though, Shes such a handful lol , I dont know how you managed to raise 12 kids, you really are a superwoman

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha there's a reason I have to dye my hair!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha I wanna try going brunette I've been a blonde all my life, Did you get yours dyed at a salon or did you do it yourself ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I just do it myself haha. At my age I dont think im worth the salon treatment.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Omg dont say that, theres no age limit to being fabulous, Im going to take you out to a salon , and get your hair and nails done.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I dont think ive ever had my nails done haha. They'll see that I bite them :/ Must be the stress of 12 children now that I think about it haha. Its worth it though, youll enjoy watching your daughter grow up

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I cant wait, lol I feel like 5+ years old is that sweet age where u can enjoy their company

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha i had 4 under the age of 5 at one point. IT WAS HELL!!! (sometimes) (They can be fun even at that age occasionally)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha yeah , I wanna have more kids but i want to wait til shes a bit older, id go mad if I had more than one at this age

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got a great lead on a new job and the search is going well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! What kind of job is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a job at Game Stop. I hope I get it, I'm in desperate need of a job. I'm running low on funds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you get it too. Have you had that kind of job before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've had a retail job before, but not one at GameStop. I wonder if they'll let me play game while I'm in the store. That'd be great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't know. I've never been inside a GameStop before. Are you applying for any other jobs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I applied to work at a mom and pop movie store, similar to Blockbuster before they closed down. That one pays a bit better.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! I didn't know any of those were still in business anymore. That would be a cool place to work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I was surprised when I found out they were still in business. When I went in it was pretty busy, I was surprised. I guess a lot of the locals go there to support them. I have an interview with them on Monday next week. Do you got any advice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wear the closest clothes you have to business casual. Something neat and clean. Be confident when you answer questions, but also listen attentively. Make your interviewer feel like you are engaged with them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Okay, I'll keep that in mind. I've been practicing answering interview questions in the mirror. I hope I get the job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good luck! I hope you find other jobs to apply to as well. It's a numbers game. The more you apply the more likely you are to get one.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I'm looking for a new job at GameStop.
2. They are hiring people for a video game store.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is unemployed and would like to work at GameStop.
2. His current retail job is at a retail store.
3. Speaker 2 has an interview Monday next week.

dialogue.author: 4861: I t
dialogue.text: nk you would like to live in this area. You should visit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm single and looking for new areas to live to meet people. Does your husband play a lot of sports with neighbors?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, he plays with his friends. I think it's a good idea to go to new places to meet up people. What sports do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I play hockey! But i really like all sports.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hockey is a great sports. Who do you play with?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I play with a lot of people. I don't have tons of free time because I work a lot, i want to earn a lot of money. Is there anything that you like to do for fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really, I get busy with my boys. What do you do for living?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I work in business. That's so nice, how old are your boys?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You will earn a lot if you do well in business. My boys are 2 and 4. They are very active. Did you check out any new places?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do! I always go to new plaecs where i live. I try to find new places to practice yoga all the time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, yoga is good for physical and mental well-being. I wish I had time for it. How long have you been doing yoga?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been doing it for ten years. It's so good for your physical and mental heatlh!

s1.value: She is a professional speaker.
3. She is a single mother.

2. He is a fan of hockey and plays ice hockey.
3. He enjoys going to the gym and going to new places.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Guess what I would like to do on Mars and the moon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Knowing you I bet you would like to play Atari haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: HaHa! Almost. I would love to teach a class, remotely of course, from Mars. How cool would that be?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be awesome! What would you like to teach them about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Space, obviously! I could perform experiments and show them what happens when you don't have gravity to deal with. They would have to be in high school or higher so that the concepts wouldn't overwhelm them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There is gravity on Mars! You should know this stuff, your a scientist! Maybe teaching wouldn't be your strong point hahaha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, there's gravity on Mars, but it's not the same as on Earth. I would have students do the same experiments as me, then we could see how the results differ. I might be able to inspire a couple of kids to go into the space program. Speaking of teaching, how are your classes going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah now I get you! We'll if you ever get a second ticket to Mars I'll be your plus one!  They are going quite well so far, I've even started doing some placement work

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My plus one ... you got it. I'm glad the classes are going well. What grade(s) is/are your placement work in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been placed in pre-schooling which to be honest is exactly what I wanted. I think it's the most important time to get children interested in education even those that don't have developmental disorders

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Pre-school! Wow!  It takes a special person to take on that role. I don't think I could do it. I'm glad you're passionate about it.  Yes, I agree about reaching kids at a young age. It's important to get them off on the right foot, education-wise. I would imagine that it is difficult to diagnose education issues at such a young age. Is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We are learning how difficult diagnosis is in my classes but luckily we don't have to deal with that in placement as anyone in the school has been previously diagnosed. This can be quite demanding though as it means that many of the children in the school have quite severe disorders as milder disorders tend to appear later

s1.value: Speaker 1: I'd like to teach a class from Mars and the moon.
2. Knowing your a scientist you would probably like to play Atari haha
3. Speaker 2: That would be awesome! What would you like to teach them about Mars?

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a scientist and Speaker 2 is an astronaut. Speaker 1 is interested in teaching. Speaker 2 teaches at NASA's Johnson Space Center. They both have tickets to Mars.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If you ever become a casino manager maybe you could hire me as one of the cooks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure. Happy to consider it. Do you have any experience in a commercial kitchen?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sure. Mainly hotels and restaurants. No casinos though. That ok?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, sure. I want to hire a celebrity chef, so I'm sure they can train you. What food do you most like cooking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A celebrity chef! Wow! Like who?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't know yet. I have so many favorites from watching the Food Network. Who would you hire if you could hire any chef?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like Gordon Ramsay. He's funny. A real boss.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, for sure. He's super mean to his employees, though. Are you sure you'd want to work for him? lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe I'm a glutton for punishment, but I need a job!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey, I get it. What kind of food is your specialty? What do you like cooking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Everything and anything. But my speciality is Italian. The only food i dont eat is pet food!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: lol same. I love Italian food. I wish I knew more recipes for it.

s1.value: Speaker 1: If you ever become a casino manager maybe you could hire me as one of the cooks.
2. Sure. Happy to consider it. Do you have any experience in a commercial kitchen?
3. Do you like Gordon Ramsay? Who would you hire if you could hire any chef?

3. She doesn't eat pet food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Any luck in the job search?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not yet! I'm trying to improve my highlighting technique so I can get a better salon job.  Got any openings in your industry?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Our industry could always use new copywriters. How's your writing skills?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are mediocre, I think my dream job would involve being a personal shopper for the wealthy. Do you like to go shopping?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Shopping my passion. I love shopping and actually am addicted to watching the show home shopping, haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! Sounds like we have a lot in common! I think I'm going to shop for shampoo tomorrow.  What are your plans for tomorrow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not much. We should go shopping together and grab lunch!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would love a giant cheese burger from McDonalds! Sounds like a date!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I forgot you love junk food, but it sounds good to me too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, can't help myself. My ex boyfriend hates that about me that I love eating at junk food places.  Date anyone interesting lately

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nah not really. I've been pretty cynical after my last relationship and don't really think love exists, haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! I can sort of relate to that, given how my last relationship ended. But I want to believe in love!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of superhero power would you want to have if you could have one? Mine would be teleportation!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Jeez, that's real hard to choose. I guess I'd have to go with flying. Or going invisible. Maybe invisible flying!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that is a cool combination, being invisible is a great power though

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be the coolest! What kind of things is your robot gonna be able to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: the robots will be used in the security system, catching bad guys, fighting terrorists and stuff

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome! Do you think he'll ever, like, fight zombies or anything? I really like zombies -- I don't mean I like them, cause they're scary, but I like being scared by them! You know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: you are a very brave boy! if ever a zombie apocalypse happens, the robots can be used to fight them too

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Radical! I wish they had robots on The Walking Dead so they could beat up the zombies and stuff. Because the robots wouldn't care if the zombies tried to eat them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: exactly! that where we create robots, so that they can work in risky and dangerous situations

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, like they could fight the clown from IT, too! I don't think he'd even be able to hurt them! Oh, you won't tell my parents I watch WALKING DEAD, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: nope, that will be our little secret

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks! Yeah, cuz I'd get in a lot of trouble. They don't even like some of the comix I read, and those aren't bad or anything!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got a raise at my factory job!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That is great to hear. I'm excited to make more money in the future so I'm always excited to hear when someone else is able to make more money. Once you have made a bit more money from your raise, do you think you will go back to Europe on a vacation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would really like to! But for now, I'm trying to build up my savings so I have something to fall back on in an emergency.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is reasonable. As you know, I would like to travel more in the future. So, if you do decide to travel more, let me know. By that time, I might be out of school and be making more money thus being able to come along.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh great - I'd love to have a travel companion! Which country would you like to go to? I'd like to visit Spain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Spain would be nice but I would be happy to visit any place in Europe. If we went to Europe I would have to ask my brother to take care of my pets while I'm away. My pet skunk wouldn't be able to take care of himself so I will need my brother to help for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You could say the skunk is a comfort animal and bring him with us! But I guess no one would be too happy if he stunk up the plane!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ha! Yes, I don't think the other guests would be happy with that. I got him when I lived outside of Portland and at the time he was wild. So, I don't think he would cooperate on a plane since there would be so many other people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! What other pets do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have lots of pets! I have a dog, cat, parrot, raccoon, and many pet fish. I really enjoy having pets because I use them as subjects for when I am practicing graphic design. I hope that  my practice will help me land the job I want in graphic design.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I hope your career plans work out! Using them as subjects sounds like an amazing way to work on your art. Do you use a lot of color in your work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course I use a lot of color! Using color is important to making great graphic designs and, of course, with using my pets as subjects I want to make sure I get all of their colors to show. Especially my fish!

s1.value: Speaker 1 lives in Oregon.
2. Speaker 1 got a raise at his factory job!
3. So far, Speaker 1 has traveled to 12 countries.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Speaker 2, you recently received a raise at your factory job. What is your new income?
2. What is your current income?
3. Is your current income sufficient to pay your bills? If not, how often do you borrow money to cover your expenses?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have booked a flight to China. It is time to see more of the world.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Amazing. Which city are you going to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm flying to Beijing, it was the city in China I wanted to see the most.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Beijing looks beautiful. I would love to go. Are you going to check out the Great Wall?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it was one of the natural sights I wanted to see in China. That and try all the different types of cuisines.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great - I bet they have some amazing cuisine there. Noodles and dumplings! Do you know how to speak Chinese?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it is one of the languages I learned to speak. The other two being Japanese and English of course.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That will be so helpful when travelling. Will you be staying at a hotel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I managed to book a cheap one not too far from the airport. It's near some interesting restaurants and stores.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Amazing. I think their transport system is great too so not too hard to get around, I'd imagine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea, many of the public transports around the world are pretty useful to use. The one in Japan is a godsend if you don't own a car.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, the major cities have amazing public transports. I love their stations with connection to the underground tunnels and shops.

dialogue.author: 15075: Ho
dialogue.text: does your back massage feel like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't gone recently, I think that's why the pain came back.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What doctor say about your back pain. Why you have it frequently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I play video games alot, and I usually don't sit in a good position.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: oh! that is the great cause of back pain. You should take care of it. Are you a professional gamer? I play video game when I feel low, but it does not help me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not a professional, more recreational. So what do you to help with your depression? I work out, and that helps me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't know. I think eating helps me and making me fat day by day

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should probably try eating healthier, or only at certain times.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have craving for junk food, if it's not at home I run to the store or fast food restaurants to grab it. My kids are eating unhealthy now which make me more depressed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Try making homemade meals.  That way you and your kids can socialize and won't go to fast foods.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel tired all the time. doesn't feel like cooking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have decided to find a surgeon

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: you should check out the article we just published on local surgeons

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you, I really need to inform myself as much as possible, surgery in itself is pretty scary, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can be scary but it also isn't your only option, have you talked to your girlfriend about your wishes to undergo surgery?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have talked to my bestfriend about it, and she thinks I should go ahead and get the surgery done, that way I dont have to deal with this issue in the future.  I kinda want to get over it, I dont know. How did you feel when you had your own open heart surgery? how was recovery

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The recovery sucked but it was a major surgery but it definitely is easier if you actually follow the doctors orders and do what you are suppose to do and avoid the things you have to avoid. Are you worried about scarring?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, thats one of my worries. I also worried about having complications during the surgery. my kiddos need me, I worry about my ability of taking care of them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well it is definitely important you have a support system in place for after the procedure to help with recovery but you also have to realize that not getting the surgery could be as risky.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I completely agree with you, how did you choose your surgeon? did you do your own research? or went with who your primary provider suggested?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I always do my own research, and he was the best.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will have to do the same, read the article you sent me, and choose a surgeon while ensuring I take into account recommendations, did you stay in state or did you fly out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I felt it was best to stay close to home. travel after such an intense surgery is never a good idea.

s1.value: I like to be prepared for anything, I love to do research, and this is something I do with everything I do.
2. I am a very strong-willed person and I like to know everything about what I'm getting myself into.
3. I am a strong believer in positive thinking.

s2.value: An aspiring singer who wants to go country.
2. A musician who wants to become a better guitarist.
3. A musician who wants to become a better lyricist

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good news, I did well on that article I was writing!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great. I think you said it was Wired magazing, right? What was it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah it is! It's about decentralized internet and how it may take over and start shaping our online lives. I had fun writing it! Do you ever read Wired?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Scary stuff. I sometimes read wired, but I'm not really a tech person myself. I remember some article last year about how quantum computers will make all banking security systems out of date. Ouch!! Do you believe that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I do believe that. The reason things can be encrypted so well currently is that there isn't a machine capable of breaking encryption. Quantum computing would be so much more powerful that encryption could easily be broken and becomes virtually useless until new harder encrpytion is implemented. What kind of magazines do you like to read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a real worry. Luckily I don't ahve any money to worry about lol!! Since the divorce, I've been so focussed on work that I don't get time to read much. I still have my subscription to Vanity Fair, but it mostly goes to waste. Do you ever write for them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's good to work and get your mind off things sometimes. I have never writen for Vanity Fair but I would love to do a piece. I usually write for smaller publications. Wired was an exception. How is work going by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So busy at work! Whenever the winter comes around people forget that ice is slippery - so many car accidents!! Some of the things you see are really heartbreaking. It's quite different to what your character gets up to on TV.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet!! Is it hard being a nurse? I can't imagine doing it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well most of the time not much happens. Just small things like setting broken fingers, putting ice packs on bruises, and lots of paperwork. But Friday and Saturday nights or when the weather is bad - then things get crazy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet it does! The hospital is lucky to have you as a nurse. What's the most common injury you see?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably concussions. It's amazing how people don't look where they're going. It's amazing the number of people who fall down stairs because they're on their phones. Technology is definitely making humans stupider - because we're all getting brain damaged lol!!

s1.value: The story was supposed to be written for Wired magazine.
2. It was supposed to be a 5,000 word article.
3. It was set in a hospital, not a real hospital.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a TV Actor.
2. Speaker 2 is an internet enthusiast and was born in California.
3. Speaker 2 has been married three times.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I learned to play a new song on my guitar.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome! Was it another song by Oasis? I love the guitar solo in "Champagne Supernova"!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it's Wonderwall actually! I love Oasis! Did you see that SpaceX launch the other day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: "Wonderwall" is such a lovely, beautiful, timeless song. I love singing along to it. No, I didn't see the SpaceX launch. Please tell me about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh it crashed terribly. No-one was hurt, but my goodness the explosion was huge.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My god, that's terrible. Was it an unmanned rocket ship? I've been excited about the prospect of commercial space travel, like what Virgin Airlines and Sir Richard Branson are trying to do, but I'm concerned about safety.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Me too. Thankfully it was unmanned, but the anniversary of the Challenger explosion brings it all back into view how dangerous it can be.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, the Challenger explosion was a disaster that no one will forget. Let's talk about something more positive, shall we? Have you learned any new songs on your harp or listened to any good classical music lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know you're not crazy about the harp so I won't harp on (ha!) but yes, I've been practicing a lot lately. How is the guitar going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see what you did there. Clever pun! I'm still a beginner, so I'm getting based plucking and chords down. I learned a few Neil Young songs on the acoustic guitar. I can play "Heart of Gold" and "Old Man" from the "Harvest" album fairly well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love Heart of Gold. What a beautiful song! I must learn it myself some time. Thankyou for the inspiration.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is a very cool song, and you're welcome. Can you play any Neil Young songs on guitar?

s1.value: I learned to play a new song on my guitar. Speaker 2: That's awesome! Was it another song by Oasis? I love the guitar solo in "Champagne Supernova"!
2. Yes, it's Wonderwall actually! I love Oasis! Did you see that SpaceX launch the other day? I saw the launch on TV.
3. I'm a big fan of Neil Young. How did you like the SpaceX launch?

s2.value: Speaker 1: I learned how to play a new song on the guitar this month. Speaker 2: That's awesome! Was it an acoustic solo by Neil Young? Was it with the band Oasis? It's Wonderwall, I love the solo! Is he your favorite Neil Young?

dialogue.text: t and saw a great movie yesterday-- maybe you've seen it! Have you been recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not been my shifts at work have been long. How was the movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was good. It was nice to get out of the house. So, do you enjoy your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's good getting out is refreshing especially nowadays. Yes I do enjoy my waitressing job, I like talking to all sorts of different people all of the time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet talking to your customers helps the day go by faster.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it defintelt does, when I am there on time and work a full shift, lol. I seem to always be late no matter what I do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Lol. I'm that way, too. No matter how early I get ready for something, I always get distracted and lose track of time. Then I end up late.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, its like the extra time somehow gives me permission to do a bunch of extra things.

s1.value: Is a waitress.

3. Is a blonde.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you all moved into your new house yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, and I could not be happier! Everything has been going great so far! There is still a lot to unpack but we have made a lot of progress! What about you? How is work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good! So are you happy with the size and location? Work is good - I'm making progress on my book which is exciting!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! I am totally happy! My new house is the perfect location for me to finish writing my BBQ book. Maybe you can proofread it before I send it out! I am so happy to hear you're making great progress as well! Writing is not easy, contrary to popular belief.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to help you out. It helps that I am a big fan of BBQ too! Yes writing can be tough, but I find that it helps to take mental breaks down and then. I like to break my day up by watching TV, for example. Maybe you could watch Duck Dynasty in between writing - it will help!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great idea! Do you watch Rick and Morty when you need a break?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha you remembered! Yes I do - I love that show. Do you like any other shows aside from DD?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! My siblings and I love to watch cooking shows. We tend to have our own competitions for fun as well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh nice! Tell me more! How does the competition work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well we love to use certain ingredients in making a dish. Pickles are usually included in this ingredient list, because we love those. So we pick a few ingredients and we have to come up with one dish that includes all of the ingredients.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'd love to be there and watch one of those competitions, they sound fun. Although I would not be able to participate or judge them - I hate pickles!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We will have to come up with some different ingredients to include you! And when you come over, we can share ideas for our writing! I look forward to it!

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have been working on my book.

s2.value: Speaker 1: are thrilled to hear that their new place is ready to move into.
2. Speaker 2: is thrilled with the size and location of their new house.
3. Speaker 2: is happy with their writing career.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been able to enjoy the outdoors lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have! It's been a little cold for my liking though. How is it in Brooklyn?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Busy busy here in Brooklyn, I thought you liked the cold weather being a fall fanatic! Maybe it's too cold for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah i do prefer cooler weather.. not the cold! It has snowed! I imagine it is busy there. Have you made any interesting paintings lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to paint the city scape more than anything, really. The concrete jungle amazes me. Are you a fan of paintings?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My artistic abilities are slim to none.. but I love art so yes! Do you have any of Central Park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I dabbled with that view point but it just doesn't captivate me enough to stick out the full piece. I'm sure you'd love the park in the fall, such vibrant colours!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. and I think I would! I've seen plenty photographs..

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They honestly don't do it justice, you need to be there and really take it all in, you should visit soon and join me walking the park.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I would absolutely love too! Let's aim for fall time frame, of course!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Obviously, you're going to be so taken aback by it, honestly! Make sure you bring a coat!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I will! I love fall scenery.. not so much weather. If that makes any sense! How has accounting been?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a Brooklyn native.
2. Speaker 1 is a portrait painter, and an avid nature lover and lover.
3. Speaker 1 has made some interesting paintings recently.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There was this show about India on the Travel Channel.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? What'd they show on it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They had a lot of stuff on there about Indian food and culture. It was really enjoyable!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: India can definitely be a beautiful place. Ever think about travelling there yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would absolutely love to travel there. Maybe someday I'll be able to afford to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe if one of your show cats win a competition you can take the both of you on a trip.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: haha That would be awesome! Thanks for the idea.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was wondering about your cats. What breed of cat do you ... breed?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mostly Birman Cat Breed, but I love all cats and enjoy spending time with any breed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've got a few cats myself, don't think they'll win any competitions but I love them all the same.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha! What types of things do your cats like to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Typical cat activities I imagine. Mostly sleeping and eating but they're pretty affectionate and vocal when they're actually awake.

s1.value: Has an obsession with all things Indian, and loves to travel to India.
2. Has a cat called Star Trek Cat.
3. His favorite food is chicken curry.

s2.value: Speaker 2 owns several cats.
2. Speaker 2 uses a Birman Cat Breed cat to make his television show.
3. The show he hosts is called The Best of the Best Cat Show.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I watch a old baseball game today, it brought back some great memories.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I work from home writing computer software

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I too work from home, doing Customer Service.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats awesome! Who was playing in the baseball game? Did you see that game live when you first watched it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I do not watch baseball anymore. So, I wouldn't know.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: When was the last time you went hunting? I was able to go in the fall.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't done hungting for a while.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, thats ok, I dont do it for sport i do it for food. When i was young i got to go see a tigers playoff game with my father.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry I was quick to judge. I used to watch the Atlanta Braves and Houston Astros back in the day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, its ok. Most people do it for sport. Oh how fun! Later tonight i get to watch the new episode of the walking dead. Im so excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I used to the walking dead, but it started to go down hill for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, i understand. I just feel invested in it so, i have to see how it ends.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I work from home doing customer service.
2. Speaker 2: I too work from home, doing customer support for a computer software company.
3. Speaker 1: I watch a old baseball game today, it brought back some great memories.

s2.value: He works from home as a computer software writer.
2. He likes to watch old baseball games.
3. He does customer service for a living.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hello again! Have you visited the farm since we talked last?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: well yes i have since that is my current main source of income!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I see, that's not bad . So what kind of produce do you have in your farm ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: so we have a little bit, but we're mostly an animal farm. we have some tomatos and corn

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: okay, that's interesting . I have always wished to get my produce directly from the farm atleast you can be sure of how fresh what you are buying is. Unlike buying from the stores without knowing how long ago the things you are buying were harvested

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: when you have time, stop on by. i'd be more than willing to sell some to you and give you a tour of the land

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: oh that's very kind of you, I will be there once I get the direction, in fact you have made my day

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love giving tours to people and showing them how things were done before grocery stores really started becoming a thing!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good, I bet you meet people from all works of life everyday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: we honestly don't have much vistors because most people don't go to farms that process animals for food. people get disconnected and forget the meat they buy in the stores comes from animals first and gets creeped out by it

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's not me, I love to check where the things I eat come from . In fact if its possible I will like to buy directly from farm owners, freshness is a guarantee and you can't beat that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree, things have gotten harder for us farm handlers but it's important to carry the long tradition!

s1.value: they are a dog trainer and have a farm on the outskirts of the city.
2. they have a farm and a dog training school on the outskirts of the city.
3. they are dog trainers and have a farm on the outskirts of the city.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a farmer in a city with a lot of farms. He is making a good living off of it and can support his family on that money alone.
2. He does have a lot of fruits and vegetables on his farm.
3. He doesn't have animals, he has chickens

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There's going to be another audition soon that I'd like to try.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I say go for it! I know you have been trying, I think this will be the one. Is it for a play ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes for a local production of mary poppins

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice, I have heard great reviews about that play. If you get it, you will be a star and it will open up a lot of opportunities. So have you watched any flintstones lately ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! Fingers crossed. Yes, I watch it every weekend with my kids. It's become our weekend family time. What is your favorite old cartoon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been watching a lot of Dexter's laboratory and Johnny bravo. Although I have also watched the Simpsons. Even though I am not a big fan of some jokes, it has some great content.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I haven't seen much of that. Are they kid friendly?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is not to tell you the truth . There are some scenes that will be a little disturbing and inappropriate for them. For your children I would recommend SpongeBob. Have they seen it before ? There are a lot of knock-knock jokes in there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: As much as I love those knock knock jokes ... I am not a fan of sponge bob! I probably dislike it just as much as you you dislike south park!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Then that means you despise it lol. South park to me is the worst. So I have been wanting to sing. Do you want to meet up in the future so you can teach me ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I would love to! Have you ever taken any singing lessons?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not, so I hope that you are patient with me. I promise I will be a good student. In return I will buy you tickets to a concert of your choice. What kind of music are you into.

s1.value: It is for a local production of mary poppins.
2. It is for a play. It is a kids favorite film.
3. It is a kid friendly show.

s2.value: They are into musicals and cartoons.
2. They are both children.
3. The musicals they watch are flintstones, Dexter's laboratory and Johnny bravo.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Guess what. I ran into a neighbor who drives a Lamborghini. He said it took him five years to pay it off

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He must be rich then. Did you get a change to ride it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, but i will one day for sure. What do you think about that. Do you wanna ride?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course, it would be a dream come true! I don't know when I will able to buy that kind of car for myself

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You will. You have to give me a ride after you bought it pk. Lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure. I will take you to wherever you want to go. Are you still staying at your parent's house?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I live with my parents. So don't forget your promise okay. I am going to be the first ride.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I won't forget it. Do you have a place in mind where you like to go on a luxurious car?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, just a road trip is enough. It will be fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree.  I will make it a long and fun one. How's your professional life going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is good. A little busy these days.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good to hear that. Do you like being a pianist as of now?

s1.value: It took her 5 years to pay off her Lamborghini. She is a piano teacher.
2. She works from home.
3. She goes to parties with her piano students.

s2.value: He is a musician.
2. He is the current presenter of TV show called Kaun Banega Crorepati.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My friends got us a ticket to watch football game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun.  Which game are you going to?  I'm hoping I'll be able to make it to a Broncos game this season.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We're going to go to the UGA - Florida game in Jacksonville next year!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you have a great time!  Have you ever been to a game before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I've never been to one in person before. I've heard this one is really exciting. The seats are split 50/50 between teams fans. UGA on one side, UF on the other.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure you'll love it!  That should be super exciting.  I hope it is a great game, you'll have to keep in touch and let me know how you like it after you go!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll definitely do that. I really can't wait. So did you play football growing up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes me and my siblings played all the time and then I played in high school.  I would've loved to play in college, but that just didn't work out for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I understand that...that would have been awesome to have done. What position did you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was a running back.  Have you ever played?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Never real football, I played a little recreational flag football for intramurals before I got into dentistry.  It was fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Flag football is tons of fun too!  How's dentist school going for you?

s1.value: She is an Orthodontist by profession.
2. She has 4 grown children and 5 grandchildren.
3. She is in the process of becoming a certified dental hypnotherapist.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I graduated from high school in 199
3. I was offered a number of dentistry positions, but I decided to work for the US Postal Service (USPS) instead. My passion for helping people led me to become a postal clerk.
2. Speaker 2: I graduated in 1994 and went to UGA. My love of all things sports lead to becoming a football coach.
3. My students know I am the only one that is able to give them any academic guidance.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey my car just got fixed, so I am just chilling at home watching tv right now

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What was wrong with the car? What are you watching?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was making weird sounds before and it turns out the suspension was really worn down, but it's all good now. Right now I'm watching Kim's Convenience. Have you heard of it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Never heard of it whats it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's about a family who runs a convenience store and the interactions they have. I highly recommend it

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool, I usually like comedies, is it more toward the funny side or drama?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's definitely on the comedy side. It's a great laugh

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome, I'll check it out.  I've been watching The Office on Netflix, it's pretty good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah, that's a comedy too right? I heard about it but never watched it myself

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's a comedy mostly.  It's about a kind of nerdy guy and the terrible treatment he gets from a mean coworker.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds interesting, I'll put it in my to-watch list. Is it still airing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it ended in 2013 or thereabout.  I watch it with my dog and parakeet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was watching a game show in my condo earlier today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Which one were you watching?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was watching Jeopardy, I cannot believe that game show is still running, I dont think it has ever been off the air in my lifetime, are you familiar with the show?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, it's one of my favorites. I'm still sad about Alex Trebek though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Same, very sad, but the show is still running, it is still most homes go to shows. what other game shows or movies have you watched lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to watch The Price is Right a lot too. I hear Bob Barker's still around too despite not being the host anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have not watch The price is right in a long time, I really need to watch again. I recently watched Hunger games, not much of your standard 'game show' but definitively a movie where, if you dont win the game you are dead, have you watched?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I saw the first one but didn't watch the sequels. A battle royale to the death isn't the kind of game show I'd want to be on.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I could not agree with you more, I do wonder from time to time, if I had the guts, valor, and the intelligence to make the right decisions to win such gruesome games, also reminds me a bit of 'game of thrones'. Have you seen  the show?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haven't got around to watching that one. As for Hunger Games I'd probably be one of those who get lucky enough to escape the other contestants only to run into one of those forcefields or die to one of those hazardous events.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: LOL! can you imagine the disappointment? enduring so much just to die. Makes me also question, how long would I survive a Zombie apocalypse? Have you watched The walking dead?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've watched the show and read the comic. Everyone wants to be the hero but most people would probably just end up being walker bait.

s1.value: I am a fan of Jeopardy and a big fan of Alex Trebek.
2. I am single and have never had a significant other.
3. I am an ex-boyfriend of a woman who has since married and is now a mother to my son.
4. I am an ex-boyfriend of a woman who has since married and is now a mother to my son.

s2.value: He plays a poker dealer on a game show.
