dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your fish, any donations of late?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think my fish might be sick. He doesn't seem to be swimming around very much. I haven't donated recently, I've been too worried about my fish. How are your kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Kids are great.  They go to the school I teach at.  Care to share a poem? I am an English teacher.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think I'd be too nervous to share a poem to an English teacher. My grammar is not very good. I'm more of a spoken word poet. What grade do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: 6th Grade.  And I love spoken word poets.  I think it's great.  And as long as there is meaning and depth, the grammar isn't as important.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree. One of the best parts of poetry is bending the grammar to make it interesting. Breaking the rules is what makes good poetry in my opinion. I'm glad an English teacher understands.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: English has it rules, but emotion is more important and meaningful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Exactly! Do you teach poetry in your class?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do, but only the classics.  Fost, Keats, and sometimes I sneak in some good music lyrics, though old school admin thinks it shouldn't be.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see. Sometimes it's hard to be constrained by administration.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sometimes the administration should get thier heads out of the sand!  So what is a gub club?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a group of friends that like to get together and shoot different types of guns at targets. Have you ever gone shooting?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an English teacher,
2. She's teaching 6th grade,
3. She likes to read poetry in class.

s2.value: Is an English Teacher.
2. Teachs 6th Grade.
3. Grew up in the military.
4. Is into spoken word poets.
Yes, I have. We go to the range and shoot at paper targets.

They range has three types of targets. One target is a football, one target is a baseball, and one is a basketball hoop. I go to the range and we shoot at paper targets. Then we practice with air rifles. I don't care if you're a kid or an old fart. It's fun. If you have any questions, just ask. I'm always available to help.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to the Olympics and won Gold. I just got an advance of $3.5mn!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Holy cow! I never knew the olympics could be so lucrative, what sport do you compete in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm a long jumper. Track and field is my thing. You should try it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did a bit of track and field in high school. Congrats on the gold, btw. Was the money from sponsors or the people who run the olympics?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure exactly where it all comes from, don't have time to sort it out! Thats what coaches and agents are for. What events did you compeat in for high school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was a pole vaulter. I'm not too familiar with the olympics, I remember when I was young it was all about amatuer's, but I suppose that changed around the time they started allowing pro basket ball players.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Alot had changed. 3.5mn sound like more than it is. It has to last a long time! Now retail and comercial deals, thats where the money is.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I suppose it's all relative and depends on your cost of living. What do you plan on doing with the money?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just living. Maybe after a year or so I'll feel more free to spend. At some point in the near future I'll have to find a way to make money off the feild. If you had it what would you do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Shoot, if I had that kind of money I could afford to smoke 2 packs a day. JK! I'd probably put it in some low risk investment, like CD's and bonds

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Come on, you smoke that much already! You can be more creative than that! I wish I could smoke. As in shape as I am, it would be nice to relax and have a smoke.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It would probably have an impact on your performance, no doubt. I'd likely end up doing philanthropy type stuff, where I live is pretty cheap.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got called by some hot ladies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What did they say?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are interested in having a night out together, what activity do you suggest?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Usually when people go out they go to the bar or maybe if there's a party in the area you can take them there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's a good idea because I would have preferred going to watch a basketball game. Which football team do you support?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: To be honest I haven't watched football. I do watch Basketball. I do like the Toronto raptors. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I watch basketball and support Toronto raptors as well. I think it will be a good idea if you would join us for a night out with the girls or what plans do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not busy at all. Give me a date and a time and I'll be there. It sounds like you guys will find something fun to do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool let me confirm with the ladies then give you a call.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll be awaiting your call then!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sure thing just stay online a little longer

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Will do. So any other plans you have for that night?

s1.value: He is a professional speaker and has spoken and given talks all over the world.

s2.value: Speaker 2 just got called by hot ladies and would like to know what activities to do.

dialogue.author: 19877: I
dialogue.text: ve recently enrolled in school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great news. Which school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enrolled at Georgetown University. They have a campus close us so it makes it convenient for me to attend classes and still be able to pick up my son on time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Convenience is key when trying to juggle school and parent life. When I attended college I would travel over an hour each way to attend classes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow. That's a long commute. I definitely couldn't do that. Not just now, but I don't think I would have been willing to commute that far even before having a family. Why did you go to school so far away?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Back then, online classes were few and far between and my degree was mostly in person. I also lived in the country where the closest college was an hour away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That must have been tough. Where did you live?

s1.value: I enrolled at Georgetown University. They have a campus close us so it makes it convenient for me to attend classes and still be able to pick up my son on time.

s2.value: I recently enrolled in school but I did not go far from home.
2. I lived in the country and the closest college was an hour away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you played any soccer matches lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yes. our season just started so we've been playing again. I've enjoyed getting back into it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been winning lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: we won our first two matches. didn't get lucky for this last one. You and your husband should come to a game some time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be so much fun. I'd love to watch you stop some goals from being scored.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm pretty good at it if I do say so myself. we have a game coming up next Saturday. If you want to come I can get you some tickets.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would really appreciate that. I know my husband will get a kick out of actually getting to go to a game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay. I'll get that set up for you guys! How's business been for you lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been going pretty good. It definitely keeps me busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: what exactly does a marketing consultant do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work with businesses to help them with advertising the things that they sell.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds fun! which businesses do you work with? or are you not allowed to disclose that?

s1.value: is a marketing consultant
2. works with businesses to help them with advertising the things that they sell.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I am a speaker who is a marketing consultant.
2. Speaker 2: My job title is "Marketing Consultant".

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My mother is going dancing tonight, would you want to join us?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of dancing will you do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Salsa!  It should be a lot of fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've never tried salsa before.  Do you think you guys could give me a quick lesson?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Absolutely.  Can you teach me polka?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a fair deal: polka lessons for salsa lessons.  I'm in!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! In the meantime I will read up on Polka so I can get a leg up on it.  Is there any interesting books on Polka that you can recommend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll have to take a look at my bookshelf and see what books I have on Polka.  I really need to organize my bookshelves better.  There are books everywhere!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a professional dancer.
2. She dances with her mother at the local dance studio every night.
3. Her mother taught her how to dance.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is single and lives in Boston.
2. Speaker 2 works as a computer security expert.
3. The first time Speaker 1 heard of salsa is from a salsa lesson on Polka.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am attending the flying exam tomorrow. I am so nervous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good luck on it! I'm sure you'll do really well. Make sure to take some time to yourself and relax afterwards okay? Will you be treating yourself to a fish meal after the exam?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think a fish meal would be wonderful!  How do you calm yourself down when you are in a really tall tree?  I need some tips on how to relax.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha I promise you it's tricky sometimes. Not being afraid of heights definitely helps. I know it's not for everyone but listening to classic rock relaxes me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Our venue does a lot of classic rock concerts.  I agree, that is usually very relaxing.  I will try listening to some before going in to the exam tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been to a few of the classic rock concerts at your work. Some of my fondest memories are in that venue. If I wasn't a lumberjack I would happily do what you do for work. So yeah, I would definitely give it a shot. And remember that if the exam doesn't go well you can always sit it again!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: While I was eating my cereal this morning I thought about just not going to the exam but I've worked so hard to get here.  I'll definitely try again if this one doesn't go well.  I think it's just the nerves making me panic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's understandably, especially when it's something as scary as flying. I almost had cereal this morning and it made me think of you! I ended up going for pancakes instead. Can't beat them, so so delicious.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I remember the first lesson I had.  I almost threw up before getting in the plane.  I hope I don't get sick tomorrow haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I get sick everytime I fly, and that's as a passenger not even as the pilot! Just take deep breaths, and calm yourself before you start. I'll be thinking of you tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really appreciate that!  Every lesson has gone well so I think I'm going to pass the test.  It's just very important to me.  Hopefully the deep breaths and calm music will get me through this so I can quit my job and become a full time pilot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be the dream for you, and I'm sure you'll get there. Fingers and toes crossed!

s1.value: A pilot is someone who flies aircraft and is in charge of safety and flight.
The person behind the controls makes sure that all the passengers get safely to their destination, safe from harm.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you bought any new red items recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! I found another great pair of red heels.  They go great with my other stuff.  Have you read any new books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow!  Isn't it notoriously hard to match reds with each other?  Will you wear red heels with a red skirt, or just one red item per day?  I am reading Michelle Obama's book right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like the red as an accent; gives things a "pop".  I've been interested in that book.  How do you like it so far?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a great book.  I think they're the most amazing family.  I think Barack Obama might be the only man good enough for Michelle, and vice-versa.  Thank goodness they found each other, huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah for real. I think she would be pretty hard for any man to keep up with.  They seem pretty great together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's hard not to expect a lot from their two kids, but I know that's not fair...  I love the way Michelle dressed, too, but I don't know as much about fashion as you do.  Do you always dress in girly clothes - dresses and things?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I spend a lot of time hanging around the house in leggings.  But I do love an occasion to dress up and feel beautiful.  What kind of things do you like to wear?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wear things that make me invisible - ha!  I like grays and browns.  I like big soft sweaters, sweats, leggings - that kind of thing.  I hardly ever go out to anything you'd dress up for.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, well I love it!  I always say do what you like.  There's no wrong thing to wear if it makes you comfortable.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I have a boring job, but I like to be outside when I'm not working or reading - so I used to ruin too many nice clothes.  I'm quite clumsy!  I get the sense that you're not like that. Do you play other sports, besides golf?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not many other sports, but I do love the outdoors and being outside too.  Do you go on many hikes?

s1.value: They're the only family that seems to make it.
2. They live in the greatest house in the world and it's always sunny.
3. They have a great job.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Do you enjoy long walks? I've always preferred to run.
Speaker 2: Yes!  I like to walk around my neighborhood, but it's not far enough from the house to have more than one long walk.  Do you go on a lot of walks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you watch that show the voice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes.. My brothers & sisters watch it with me sometimes. We love all the different songs on there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: was there any song in particular that you really like over the others?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's hard to choose just one.. you know? I love all genres from rap to country to polka! How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like watching it to see what the judges say about the performances. did you watch the last show with your grand parents?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Occasionally, but it's difficult for them to stay up that late sometimes. I bet you miss your grandparents. Has it been awhile since you got to see them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its been a bit since I saw them, but I'm planning on visiting them over christmas break so I'm excited.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm so excited for you! Maybe you should take them to a museum?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yeah that might be a good way to pass the time. I think there is a history museum in their area that I haven't been too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: And maybe take them to a restaurant afterwards? Haha. I think I'm just hungry. I could go for a steak or something.. as long as it isn't salad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: oh thats right, you are like me, you don't like salads either. dinner is a good idea, do you have any museum recommendations if the history museum doesn't work out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should see if there are any music museums in your area. We have a really cool one here that shows you history of music and has all sorts of cool props.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I like the voice! I watch it often with my brothers and sisters. I love all the different songs on there.
2. Speaker 2: My brothers & sisters watch it with me sometimes. We love all the different songs on there.

s2.value: He plays the piano.
2. He learned to play the piano at age
3. He sings in a family band.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to hockey practice again today and I won the game for my team.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice! Do you think you'll be a starter this season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think so. The tall fast guy is out for a couple weeks with mono, so it's allowed me to play a little more. I mean, I guess it's a bad situation for him though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oof, mono sucks, but that's good for you. I had a lot of fun on my hockey team in high school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I didn't know that you played?! I'm at least hoping I'll be good enough to play for a college team, and then get a scholarship for vet school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I played all through middle and high school. I did two years in college but had to quit since it was taking up too much time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it can be very time consuming, especially all the practices.  I've had a lot less time for soccer too, which I really miss.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I still miss hockey but I don't regret giving it up when I did. I guess I wasn't serious enough about to commit. These days watching the NHL is good enough for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I might go to a camp in Vancover next summer, but I'm not sure if my parents will let me. I'm kind of worried about the commitment too. My parents would rather I focus on Vet School than hockey.  But I really want a scholarship because I don't want any student loans.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: If you can balance your time I think hockey is a great thing to have on your resume to help you stand out for scholarships. I know how competitive they can be these days.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, and I'm trying to keep my grades up too. Calculus has killed me this year! My least favorite subject by far.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad I'm not a student anymore! Calculus concepts are actually pretty simple once you figure them out. It's the algebra parts that are hard.

s1.value: Played hockey in college and played professional hockey but not in the NHL.

s2.value: He plays on a team that's been to the national championship.
2. He used to play in college, but quit due to low standards.
3. He has played college hockey.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My friend is thinking about being a politician. Any advices?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Definitely start small. Try to build up a big leading and party and make sure they completely understand what changes they want to make and how the best way to go about it is. Maybe they can do some research online?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for the advice! I will pass that along! Where have you been to in Mexico? I am thinking about traveling there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been to Mexico City, it is such a beautiful place! Where have you travelled to before? I really love travelling myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I travel to Russia very regularly. I highly recommend Moscow for the food, architecture and cars. You should go to check out their cars!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe I will one day!I have only really been to America and Mexico so Russia is completely different on the scale. What do you do in Russia?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love to eat, walk around, explore, and talk to locals! They have some grand concerts with excellent rock and roll music that I love so much!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? Who is your favourite song artist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They have some really great locals there. They are very talented and would be loved all over the world if they made it mainstream.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! Didn't know that. Maybe I should go to Russia some time! What other hobbies do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love skiing! They have great slopes if you enjoy skiing. I think you would most enjoy Russia for their cars!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I definitely would! I would love to work on a russian car too, I was a mechanic before I ran for office.

s1.value: Speaker 1: My friend is thinking about being a politician. Any advices?

2. Definitely start small. Try to build up a big leading and party and make sure they completely understand what changes they want to make and how the best way to go about it is. Maybe they can do some research online?
3. Where have you been to in Mexico? I am thinking about traveling there.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a young, single, attractive and fun person who is looking for adventure and change in her life.
2. Speaker 2 lives in a small town in the south of Mexico.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just found out that Guns and Roses are having a concert in Texas! You should go!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh really? What would you recommend I wear?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have any band tees? Otherwise I advise to wear something comfortable, maybe bring a light jacket since it's an outdoor concert.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do have one t-shirt from a previous gig, but it'll get hidden by my jacket! I need to stay warm, though. Have you been to any gigs recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Only ones that I've played in! I've been traveling a lot with my band so I've seen some other great bands along the way!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I can imagine, what's your favourite part about playing in a band? The travelling?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, definitely getting to travel and meet new people, although the music is great, too. How's your job going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's going really well, but let me tell you; some of the people I teach hand in work that looks like it's been drawn by children. Can you believe that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no! Well, my artwork would probably be no better, but that's why I didn't study art!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just like my music ability would be lacking, it's also subjective isn't it. Maybe I shouldn't be so hard, they are looking to be taught after all.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I suppose so, as long as they are trying to apply what you teach them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully, but I really plan on moving up in the world of teaching! Hopefully I'll become my department head for the start of next academic year.

s1.value: They are a singer, songwriter, and guitarist.
2. They were a popular rock band in the 1980s.
3. They are currently touring in Texas.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a musician.
2. Speaker 1 is a teacher.
3. Speaker 2 will be teaching a group of students in the future.

dialogue.author: 13173: Ha
dialogue.text: you ever seen the sequel to Godfather? It is really good too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not seen it. I am always afraid that sequels are not as good as the first. Did you think it was as good as the first?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If anything, I thought it was better than the first. One of the rare sequels that does that in my opinion. I'd recommend it, especially if you liked the first one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll have to watch it some time. Any other good movie recommendations?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Jurassic Park is probably my favorite movie, have you seen that? I tend to read more than I watch movies though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I have seen Jurassic Park and loved every single one. Well, maybe not Jurassic World as much as the rest. I also am more of a reader. It seems that a lot of the best movies are based on good books.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Agreed. I like a lot of the TV that is being made from books as well. The expanse is one of my favorite book series that they've made into a TV show.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've heard really good things about that series but haven't seen it yet. I didn't know it was based on a book. How have they gotten so many seasons out of one book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's based on a series of books. Each season covers about one book, more or less. I'd definitely recommend them if you like sci-fi.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has read more books than movies.
2. Speaker 2 is a reader
1. speaker 2 is the author of the second book in the Jurassic Park trilogy

s2.value: Speaker 2 likes good books.
2. Speaker 2 likes to read.
3. Speaker 2 has never seen the sequel to Godfather.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm have another trip planned soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good for you! Where are you gonna go this time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm going to go Barcelona, I hear they have a plethora of grocery stores!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun! I hope you enjoy your trip. You are so lucky to get all the free tickets through your dad! Wow! Maybe my dad should branch out his grocery store out there!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I get them free technically, but I have to do a load of odd jobs for my dad before he allows me to travel. Your dad should definitely expand out there, labour is plentiful and cheap.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah yes, my father made me work in his store all the time. Whenever i wanted anything, he would make me work in his shop. At the time i really did not like it, however, now i see the benefit in all of that. I try to make the kids in my school that i teach, learn these kind of learning and earning tactics.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's great teaching the youth that, is that your favourite part of the job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, i think so. I was lucky enough to have my mom stay at home while i was growing up. I learned a lot from her and she taught me a lot of life skills. I like to be able to be kind of a "stay-at-home mother" for my kids in my classrooms. Not everyone has a mom or a dad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No that's a great view on life, it's so kind that you offer that kind of support! I mean I lost my mum pretty young so would have been great having you teaching me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you. I appreciate it. I know, i am so sorry. I wish you didn't have to go through that. I am happy that you and your father can be so close though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, we're doing great. it was a struggle at first but we support each other.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am glad you two have one another. I can't imagine what that must be like.

s1.value: A lot of my free tickets are due to my family's generosity.

s2.value: Speaker 2 loves to travel. He can't wait to go to Barcelona soon. He loves his work but can't travel with his dad on the jobs. He has to "do odd jobs" for his dad. dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have booked tickets to go shopping in Paris

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Where are you staying in Paris?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: At Hotel De Sers. It's only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower so I'm really happy about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's amazing. Is it your first time in Paris?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yep! I can't wait to buy authentic Chanel clothing. Have you traveled before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been to Canada and Italy before, yes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh nice. I'm thinking if this trip goes well I'll travel the rest of Europe and get more designer clothes from every country.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a really cool idea. The shops in Italy are fantastic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I was thinking so. Which parts of Italy did you see?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I saw Rome and Milan

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to see Rome first. I also think the beaches would be the best in all of Europe.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They also have great brunch shops surprisingly. I'm sure you'd love them.

s1.value: A speaker who is traveling to Paris.
2. A store in Paris.
3. She is going shopping to buy Chanel clothing.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a model/actress and also a teacher.
2. Speaker 2 is from California.

dialogue.author: 22673: Di
dialogue.text: you finish shopping on line for Christmas gifts?  How is your daughters back?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lina feeling better now, she went with me to buy all the Christmas gifs that we need how about you ready for halloween?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad she's feeling better after her bad patch, I hope it lasts longer this time before the pain returns. I need to get my decorations down from the attic, I'll probably do that at the weekend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh thank you, you know that Lina needs absolutely surgery so until we get an appointment I m trying to make her happy. which kinda of decoration have you boight ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You always do your best for her. I have a new decoration that comes on automatically when someone walks past, I love those ones!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh great that something new for me , as i m bit old fashion decorator for  Halloween. anyway how do you feel after breast reduction ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel great, it's really changed my life and I feel like the scars have faded really well too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: that great , I m happy for and you inspired me to forget the idea of adding silicon suron my breast ?gery

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Natural is best, be happy with what god gave you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you enjoying Salt Lake City?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love it here. I think I might move here soon. Have you been here?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't been there yet but I hope after my assignment I can fly out there. What would you recommend I do there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would suggest to go to the parks around town. They are beautiful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow I actually try to avoid parks. I am allergic to grass and pollen. Do you have any allergies

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, luckily I am not allergic to anything. What do you do if you are allergic to grass and pollen.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have to keep antihistamines on me at all times. The air force is very supportive though so I rarely have to land in grassy areas

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What do you do in the Air Force?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm a stand in pilot. So I typically only fly when one of the more senior pilots can't. What did your parents do in the military?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My parents are both Master of Arms in the navy, basically a military cop.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow I would love to meet them. Are they still alive?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, they are both alive.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a military pilot and a former naval pilot as well.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Are you enjoying Salt Lake City? Speaker 2: Yes, I love it here. I think I might move here soon. Have you been here? Speaker 1: I haven't been there yet but I hope after my assignment I can fly out there. What would you recommend I do there? Speaker 2: I would suggest to go to the parks around town. They are beautiful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know you get along with your family, so I called up my father to talk with him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How did it go?  Do you think the conversation brought you closer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope we're at least on the path to that now. The whole thing was kind of awkward and I didn't know what to say... What do you talk to your father about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Generally, we talk about sports and gossip about the rest of the family.  If you do not feel comfortable on the phone, maybe ask him to go on a hike with you.  That might help to break the ice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great idea! He's actually visiting my city for a job interview later this month, so I'll see if he wants to join me on a hike. Does your family ever go hiking together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, we do.  We usually go out hiking during the day.  In the evening, we usually have a bonfire.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh a bonfire sounds nice. Maybe If he gets good news from the interview I could throw a little congratulations party out by my backyard bonfire. I know you like to go to parties. Do you have any advice for what I should get to prepare?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. If you are going to have a bonfire, the typical things are in order.  At a minimum hotdogs and marshmallows are in order.  You could also get some alcohol if you like to drink.  That should really help to loosen up the conversation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice! Roasted marshmallows and beer are the perfect incentive to get him to ace the job interview. Speaking of jobs, how's your job going lately? Is your boss still being a jerk?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My boss is always a jerk.  I think I am going to look for a new job soon. Maybe we can look for a job together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great idea! I think having a job-search partner would really help me finally get a job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great.  Hopefully, we can find something out there that we actually like to do for a living.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has a dad and a mother.

s2.value: He is a father with two sons.
2. He is married with one daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been working with my kids on their Japanese.  It is a tough language to learn.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds fun! Are you teaching them through a book or an app?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found an online program. That way we can hear the pronunciation and there are lots of fun activities for the kids too. Do you speak any other languages?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I only speak English, but sometimes I watch anime and they speak Japanese in it. So I know a few Japanese words haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that would be a fun thing for the kids to watch once they're japanese gets a little better. How's your brother doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's doing good. Last time I visited him he just got interested in riding horses, so that was interesting. We also went to some horse races and bet... You can guess how well that went.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: When was the last time you visited?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Last summer. I'll think I'll visit him again this summer too. Did you wanna tag along with me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing! But I was thinking of going to mexico this summer and was going to ask if you were going to be there? Would your timeshare be available?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can go to Mexico in the latter half of summer with you if you want. Yeah, my timeshare if still available. Did you want to bring your kids too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect. We were thinking of going towards the end of summer. Yes it'll be the entire family. Maybe we can go to europe with you and then you can come to mexico with us! The kids would love that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect! Let's have lunch next weekend and start planning it! I'm super excited now, what about you?

s1.value: He speaks Japanese with his kids.
2. His sister speaks German
3. His brother is doing good.
4. His sister lives in Japan.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I have been working with my kids on their Japanese.
2. Speaker 2: I only speak English, but sometimes I watch anime and they speak Japanese in it.
3. Speaker 1: I can speak to Spanish, so I want to give their Japanese lessons a go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have to see a physiotherapist to assess whether I'll be able to walk again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that must be nerve racking. Does the doctor have a good reputation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am better now. Yes, my doctor is very caring and with all her support I am here. Why you not like your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My job is quite boring because I have to do the same thing over and over again. It's quite monotonous. I prefer work that is more fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can understand! Do you have any other job in your mind which you want to do like related to craft or something?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes if I could I would be a painter but I don't think I would make enough money to support my children

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: you can start painting with your current job. when your business will do well, you can quit your job. you will get a fair idea how much you can earn by your painting. you might become millionaire. .

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's a good idea! Do you enjoy painting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes i love to do, but i am not a great artist like you. I like to do paint by number. I make me calm when I am in pain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I love that too. I'm glad it's able to help you relax. And you can paint pictures of your pets too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great idea. I would love to do that. How's your kids doing? do they love painting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yep! They love painting a little too much. My youngest painted a picture on the walls!

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have to see a physiotherapist to assess whether I'll be able to walk again. Does the doctor have a good reputation? I am better now. Yes, my doctor is very caring and with all her support I am here. Why you not like your job? My job is quite boring because I have to do the same thing over and over again. It's quite monotonous. I prefer work that is more fun

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a physiotherapist.
2. Speaker 2 is not a good painter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you watched any games by the Phoenix Coyotes recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im afraid not a live game.Watched a recap though.Not the same experience

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, definitely much more fun to be there in person!  I haven't been in a long time either.  How is yoga going lately?  It's something I've always been kind of interested in but never really tried

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Best thing you could ever think of doing.And the relaxation that comes after is worth all the hussle

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll have to look into it more seriously for sure!  Would you recommend going to a class with a trainer like you or starting with video tutorials?  Or something else?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A trainer is usually the best,because you get to be in the same space with them.And they see you in that moment

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's very true.  I'm sure it would be much better to have the personalized instruction.  Does your husband do it with you?  Maybe it would be a good activity for me to meet someone lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He more of a gymn, and power lifting type of person.But im sure they are also great people on the hockey field.You still play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Fair enough, I'm sure he's in really good shape then.  I do!  Not as much as I used but I still love it.  I have a local rink I can go to play but it's hard finding other people into it to start a game.  I get out ice skating at least a couple times a month though

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I guess we can almost rule that out.Ha! Still working two jobs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yes...  I don't mind working two jobs, but I'd rather do something different than cashier at both of them just to break up the monotony a little bit, you know?  How long have you been teaching yoga?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: This will be my sixth year,and im not slowing down anytime soon. Plan to do into  my sixties

s1.value: She is a Realtor.
2. Loves gardening.
3. A huge fan of the Arizona Coyotes.

s2.value: Have you ever seen a live Phoenix Coyotes game?
No

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Which comedy show's would recommend i watch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hmm, have you seen Silicon Valley or Trailer Park Boys?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I've watched only one episode of Silicon Valley before, but don't remember very much about it. What are they about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Silicon Valley is about a tech start-up company, and Trailer Park Boys is literally just boys in a trailer park lol. They're both really funny, kind of the same style of comedy as The Office.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I love The Office, it is by far my most favorite TV show. I guess I might give those two shows a try. What is your opinion of Parks and Recreation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like Parks and Recreation too! I just didn't connect with the characters as much as other shows I guess. But I've seen the first two seasons.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel the same way with you about Parks and Recreation, for some reason it just doesn't hit as well as The Office. Do you have a favorite character on The Office?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a tough decision. I really liked Gabe in the later seasons. Or maybe I just like the actor because I thought he was great in Silicon Valley as well. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I thought Dwight and Jim (or the scenarios they end up being in) are so funny. My favorite character is Pam. I think she grows the most over the span of the show! Didn't know the actor of Gabe was also in Silicon Valley, all the more reason to give it a watch.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's true about Pam. I like that a lot of characters on The Office grow over the whole series but Pam is the most obvious. Yes, he's even better in Silicon Valley so you should definitely try it out!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just curious, how many seasons or episodes are there to Silicon Valley? I do need to find a new TV show to binge watch now...

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it's 6 or 7 seasons. It took me about three weeks to finish but I watch fast LOL.

s1.value: They have been married for almost 22 years and have two kids.
2. They just celebrated their 20th anniversary.
3. They live in San Francisco.

dialogue.author: 22260: Do
dialogue.text: ou ever listen to podcasts while you're commuting to and from work? I have some recommendations for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I listen to podcasts sometimes, mostly when I'm running to keep me motivated. Do they motivate you on your runs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They're great to listen to when you're running, it really helps you lose track of time. What kind of podcasts do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like food podcasts, especially because I'm trying to get better at cooking. Maybe they could help you work on your baking skills, I'm sure your kids would appreciate that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't know if anything can help me get better at cooking, but I'm willing to try! Do you listen to recipe podcasts or just podcasts about different food and cuisines?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They're mostly just people talking about foods they enjoy and how they eat at home, but there's always tips and advice. I assume your partner does most of the cooking, then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She does. It can be really hard on her because my kids are very picky eaters. If one likes something, the other one usually doesn't. Do you have any kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds difficult! I don't have kids, maybe one day! I worry about finding that balance between work and family time, how do you manage that?

dialogue.author: 22560: I
dialogue.text: d a funny interaction with a client at my job as a party planner.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? What did you discuss with the client?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He told me he wanted to have a party for his child's birthday. I asked him if he liked Batman and he said yes. Guess how old the kid is?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm guessing the kid is probably past the age of having a Batman themed birthday party lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Exactly lol he was turning 36! Isn't that wild?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha WOW! 36 years old and his parent is planning a birthday party for him still? Batman could teach him something about not having to rely on his parents!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha good one! Have you had any fun stories from party planning lately?

s1.value: She works as a party planner.
2. She lives in Chicago, Illinois.
3. She had a funny interaction with a client at her job as a party planner.

s2.value: He once had a client tell him that Batman was on his daughter's birthday party invite. The dad was so excited, he bought a Batman themed t-shirt for his daughter. Batman does not have a parent.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How has the job at Nike been these days?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh man, it's been busy as heck, trying to tie up loose ends here while planning my move to London.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you already found a place to live in London?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! My former boss lives there and is letting me rent their second story for awhile before I find a place of my own. You'll have to tell me where to eat in London!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that is so nice of them! Nando's is always a hit with my family and I. I definitely recommend it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nando's... I think I've heard of it. It has really good chili-chicken, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes that is the place. They also have really excellent bakeries there so you can fulfill your sweet tooth.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay, so we're gonna go there for sure. Ack! Enough about my move to London, what say you we fix up my three brothers with your three sisters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, well two of my sisters are married and the other one is only 17 so I don't think that will really work out haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! Okay, well, it was worth a try. Hey, have you found any cool new threads on the Nike site?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately I have not gotten a chance to look. Do you know of any new collaborations coming out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think I saw something about Rick Owens and some cool new Chuck 70's! Have you seen those?

s1.value: Is a Nike employee.
2. Is trying to finish packing up his belongings and move to London.
3. Has been to Nandos for the chili-chicken with his family.

s2.value: Speaker 2 was a key member of the Nike basketball team during his high school and college years.
2. Speaker 2 is a frequent guest on ESPN shows and often shows off his impressive fashion sense.
3. One of the first stories that was read at the end of the presentation of the award was 'Speaker 2 is the true face of Nike'.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How have you been? Have you met any friends or traveled?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yeah I have taken a out of state trip to visit some family how about yourself

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No not at all I'm currently in college and I don't have very much time and or money to travel I mostly just blog math and watch cartoons. What do you like to do besides traveling?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been playing some tetris in my spare time it is a fun puzzle game

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool I like puzzles! I know that something that we have in common. What else did you do when you were on your trip to visit your family besides play Tetris?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I play some sports outdoors with my dad and brother

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's pretty cool what kind of sports do you like to play with them? I wish my parents played sports with me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: a bit of volley ball and some basketball

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: nice! do you like death metal music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: no I do not listen to music offten do you have a good band

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Give me a good band recommendation? I can give you one but also I play in a band.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: sure what death metal band do you recommend I listen to?

yes I do what kind of music do you like

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a terrible day at work at my engineering company.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am so sorry about that, what happened?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know you like Bill Nye, but the man drives me crazy. He is just full of himself and everything has to be done his own way which really triggers my OCD bad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am sorry he affects you that way. but you can agree he is handsome

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will give him that, probably the only thing going for him! Anyway, enough about my day. Tell me, how did your day go today and how is your Facebook side hustle going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: my day was great. I made a big client so I am very happy

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Congratulations! Keep it up! Was it a one time sell, or will you be supplying the new client?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its a huge order. I will be supplying for a long time

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing, I'm chuffed for you. How is your husband and the kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: they are doing alright. my husband is away on a mission, so its me and the kids

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good. Have you got any plans? Why don't you take them down to Mexico? You're always telling me stories of that time you went down to Mexico when you were a kiddie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will do that during the school break. they love to go there during the summer break

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is New York City?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cold!! Colder even than Portland, I think.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely! I don't know how you do it. but I guess i would give up Portland for the art and culture in NYC

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe you just need a little bit more time to settle-don't give up yet. Have you been able to connect with any other artists since you moved?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes and no. It's like any new place and it takes time to meet people. I just met this artist who makes these huge concrete pots. so impressive

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is one of the best parts about artistry-the diversity within it. What is your medium, for your art? I'm guessing the concrete pot person is not working in their home, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I make small scale wood carvings of animals in a "folk" style. You could say my work is outsider or untrained

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is so crazy! A young woman I'm giving voice lessons to wants to only sing about animals and nature, but jazz style. It is such a niche interest. Maybe you can shoot me some pictures of your work? I'd like to get her something for after her performance at the end of the month.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: done. you should give me copy of her singing. I've got a gallery show in a month and maybe could use her singing as audio in the room

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh. We can have a whole east coast/west coast thing going. I think she would love that-I'll ask her. And you've already scored a show. You are BRINGING art and culture to Portland!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: well don't get ahead of me. It is small. I am just a small fish in a very large artist pond.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know how that feels. Those who can't do, teach (in my case).

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you gotten any progress on your presentation? I hope that your back pain is doing alright. My mom has back pain as well so I asked what medication she takes, maybe it could work for you too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is nice of you. I am going to try physical therapy soon. What kind of chef are you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am a sous chef at the moment but hoping to become a head chef one day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome. That is a stressful job. What kind of restaurant do you work at? Is it a Cajun restaurant?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah it is a Cajun restaurant. Yeah it can be very stressful when we are busy it's not for everyone.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Does your parrot help you unwind at the end of the day? I have seen some really funny parrots before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah he does it's nice to come home and hear his voice he does say some funny stuff. How do you like to unwind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to spend time with my kids. They are also really funny. What can your parrot say?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I don't have any kids yet don't think I'm ready for that yet. He makes funny noises and repeats everything you say and looks the other way and whistles when you look at him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is entirely understandable. Your parrot sounds adorable. Are both your parents Cajun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah he is and yes both my parents are they were the ones who taught me to cook.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's so nice to carry on family traditions like that. I bet they are proud of you. I try to teach my kids about their heritage as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a tough class today that's stressing me out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! I'm really sorry to hear that, classes can be really stressful sometimes. Which class was it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They really can be stressful! It was maths, i just can't wrap my head around it. did you go to work at the dealership today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, not today, I have a few days off. Maths was very my strong suit, so I can understand the frustration! Have you tried talking to the professor? They might have some tips that could help you out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My professor is always too busy after class to set aside any time to see me. I am just really lost trying to figure out how i'm going to catch up

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I would recommend emailing them. They usually have hours every week set aside to talk to students. Have you thought about using a tutor? I did once, it helped quite a bit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would get a tutor, but i think my parents would be really disappointed if they found out! enough about my problems anyway! what have you done with your time off?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not much, certainly not any math, haha! Well, they might be more disappointed if you fail right? Maybe they don't have to know? Try looking in the student newspaper, or a bulletin board. I bet there are a lot of great tutors out there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: luck for you! stop making me jealous.. I will try looking for more help, just with all the stress it's causing me i just can't focus! was your tutor expensive at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The great thing about a tutor, a good tutor at least, is that they can instruct on both the subject and good study habits, and that can include better ways to focus. The one I used wasn't too expensive, it was cheaper than having to re-take the class, that's for sure!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! the way you describe it is already making it sound great. I think you're right i'll try find one. I've never considered it could be my study habits that's making it so stressful, If a tutor can help me stay level headed about it, my grades will definitely thank me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sometimes it's all about shifting your perspective. It's easy to focus on the end goal, but you have to take a lot of little steps to get there. I promise that maths can get easier! Take a deep breath and remember you can get through this, I believe in you.

s1.value: Is Speaker 1 a salesman?
2. Did they had to go to work today? No
3. What class did they have today? Maths

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a teacher.
2. Their job is to teach and give advice to students on how to excel in academic fields.
3. Speaker 1 is a student.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got into a fight with my manager at McDonald's.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! What happened to cause you to get into a fight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got into some Missunderstanding with the other workers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Besides work, how is your band going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is going so well becuase we are able to practice more often. that inspires my band to keep going. how things are going with you at work ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! I also am really into rock music so that's awesome that you're in a rock band. Work is going well for me. It is staying busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is great to hear, beside muscic; What else you like to do in your free time.?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like sports, mainly basketball, even though I do not play. That's cool that you made all state with it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's awesome, You should be playing basketball because you are tall enough for that sport. Do you like to play any other sport?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I hear that a lot! I enjoy playing golf as well. Do you golf?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't play golf however i do enjoy watching it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can be exciting. We should definitely meet up and play sometime.

s1.value: I got into a fight with my manager at McDonald's.
2. I am in a rock band.
3. I play basketball and golf.

2. In his lifetime, Speaker 2 has been employed in a variety of fields.
3. He is married and has three children.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: When it comes to computer programming, do you study it on your own, or are you in college? My alma mater is Notre Dame, I hated college.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am still studying. It is very difficult, but I am learning a lot. Why didn't you like school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad you are learning a lot. Honestly, I just wasn't very social in college, so it was hard for me to make friends.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense. I am not super social either, but I've been so busy with school that I wouldn't have much time to hang out anyways. Did you not enjoy law school either?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I didn't enjoy law school, but more because of the workload. In order to pay for law school I had a full time job at a local factory and then had to do classes and homework in the few hours that I wasn't working. It just burned me out. It's a lot better now though, so was ultimately worth it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It does seem like a lot of work. What kind of law do you practice now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm a defense lawyer and do a lot of pro bono work, which is really fulfilling. I actually just worked on a case that involved dogs that I think you would've liked!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is awesome. It's such important work and so desperately needed. Animal welfare is something that I feel strongly about. You must be a dog fan too if you have three of them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am! At first we just got them because the kids wanted them, but I am so attached to them now! Dogs just have such a unique way of loving and connecting. I can't imagine our lives without them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's the same here. When I rescued my dog, I never knew I would grow attached to him. I spend so much time with him since I'm away from home right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I love that you rescued your dog. I think that is so important! Ours are rescues as well. What kind of dog do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He is a whole bunch of everything. :) They said he is a boxer mix, but I think he has a whole lot more than that in him. What about yours?

s1.value: When it comes to computer programming, do you study it on your own, or are you in college? My alma mater is Notre Dame, I hated college.

2. I am still studying. It is very difficult, but I am learning a lot. Why didn't you like school? I'm glad you are learning a lot. Honestly, I just wasn't very social in college, so it was hard for me to make friends.
3. I have 3 dogs.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a retired high school teacher.
2. Speaker 2 is a retired high school teacher.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's the weather like in Chicago now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not been outside yet today!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Even though I like the heat, sometimes I jealous of you in Chicago. I just wish I could see some snow. All we get in Florida are hurricanes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hurricanes are very scary, but the snow can be incredibly inconvenient. Last week I had to spent an hour shoveling out my car just to go to the store. What kind of things do you have to do to prepare for a hurricane?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The grass is always greener I suppose, haha!  Get lots of food and water, and prepare for the power to be out. Last year though we bought a generator, just so my husband can play his Xbox whenever the power goes out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Videogames can be a great way to keep sane during terrible weather. They kept me wonderful company last week when we were snowed in. I tend to get really sucked into games and can kind of ignore the world around me when I play. Does that happen with your husband too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, he completely gets sucked in. My kids are old enough now so they can play some games with him. I don't mind though, it makes the house a little quiet so I can do some amazon shopping on my phone.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am glad that it's not a problem that he gets sucked in. Thankfully, I only have to worry about my pets needing attention when I play games. I worry that I might ignore something important if other people lived here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It sounds like you have a full house in your condo with all those pets. Are they ever able to go outiside, being in a big city like Chicago?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The dogs absolutely have to go outside. Thankfully we have some small parks. I try to keep the cats indoors, though. More and more studies are showing that the idea of an 'outdoor cat' is, bad for the cat and bad for the environment.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Our neighbor has some cats that always stalk our birdfeeder, kinda makes me wish they lived inside. At least they take care of the voles though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah. Cats can be absolute menaces to the local bird population even in the snow. I don't actually know what a vole is, though! I don't think we have those around here in the city.

s1.value: Speaks mostly about weather in Chicago.
2. Lives in a condo.
3. Grew up playing video games.

s2.value: Speaker 2: I don't have time to talk right now. I have to go out somewhere today. What's the weather like in Chicago now?

Speaker 1: It's already noon. It's a little hot in our room as you can see from the window, but we don't have much air conditioning. The weather here is fine. The humidity is low. No snow yet. But I do wish I was living in a place like this so I could see some snow.
Speaker 2: Yeah, it sounds like there's not much snow at all in Chicago. That must be a real bummer. I always enjoy seeing snow. How about you? Have you ever seen snow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've decided to quit my accounting job and be a full time musician. I'm thinking about moving back to Oregon, maybe we can meet up!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For sure! If you are near Coos bay, let me know and we can make it happen. Are you not enjoying life in pennsylvania?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do but the rent there is high.  I am doing accounting at the moment but I need a new place to stay!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe you could move to central oregon? I know you love it there!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm thinking of moving to Corvallis.  I've lived there before!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh awesome! Do you know if there are many opportunities for a musician there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a friend who is a musician there!  He wants to create a band!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe you could join his band if you moved back there!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will think about it!  We may need a pianist so I'll ask him if you want to join!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course! I would love to join. I'd have to see how much time I have off from the hospital

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How's the workload as a nurse?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: it is hard work but it is interesting! I love working here, I've almost earnt enough to buy a house

s1.value: Speaker 1 quit his accounting job and is thinking of doing a full time musician's job and moving back to Oregon.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a successful music teacher from Pennyvainia

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What was it like living in the Carribean?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was great! I loved the beaches and hot weather. I wish I could move back there when I am older.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How old were you when you moved to the Caribbean?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: 5. My parents moved us here for work. I don't really remember much since I was young. Do you wish to move somewhere?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to live near the Rocky Mountains. I haven't ever seen them and they are beautiful in pictures.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah mountains are really pretty I love hiking up them. I'd imagine it would be great for people who love the outdoors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love hiking! I enjoy being outdoors. I would love to hike up Pike's Peak some day. I also enjoy the beaches here, though. Do you go to the beach often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah during the summer I go about every weekend haha. I love sun tanning and being lazy on the beach.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can't tan. I just burn, so I have to use sunscreen with spf 50. I like playing in the water, like surfing, paddleboarding, and kayaking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah that's too bad. Yeah doing activities at the beach is really fun. I also enjoy surfing I just started learning last summer.

s1.value: She was born in Hawaii, now lives in Santa Cruz, CA.
2. Speaker 1 is an actress.
3. She is a big fan of the Rocky Mountains.

s2.value: She is a native Floridian
2. She moved to the Caribbean when she was
5. Speakers 1 and 2 have almost the same birthday and are both young mothers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Any luck with the job search?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I recently opened up a restaurant called "the wall" it has been going well! Are you still working in that restaurant?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Im no longer working in the restaurant, i graduated my program and moved from the school.   Been out running today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats good, congrats! Hopefully you fulfill your dreams! I have been out running, its such a great stress relief.  Have you been dancing lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not lately, havent had any time since the move.  I've been trying to get settled into my new aparment and ive been job hunting. What types of jobs are you considering for your second one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats awesome, and no, not yet still looking for my second job. Considering working for another restaurant as a cook.  Would you be interested in running a few trails sometime next time we meet up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah sure I have some really nice trails by my place we could tackle!  I might take a look at restaurants for some income until i find a more permanent job in my field.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like a plan to me! We just need to be on the look out for snakes, I'm scared of them!  have you ever encountered a bear on a hike before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've visited Canada and have seen many black bears, i'm more scared of snakes than bears!  We can watch for snakes on the trails, i've seen a few over the years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! Those bears are massive aren't they?  yes i'm always scared of getting bit by a snake.  Have you played hockey in canada before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have tried hockey in Canada, they are crazy for it there!  The bears arent huge, some get up to 500lbs but they are few and far between.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah absolutely! Well i sure think bears are huge to begin with!

s1.value: Born and raised in the United States.
2. Grew up in a middle class family.
3. Attended MIT.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is working from home with the new restaurant, they graduated their program and are moving on to bigger and better things. They are trying to figure out how to run the restaurant on their own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually decided to try reading a book per your suggestion at a coffee shop while i paint!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome! What did you read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I read a book called The Death and Life of Great American Cities by Jane Jacobs. It was such a great book. Have you read that before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh interesting, no I've never heard of it. What's it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Urban Planning. It's really interesting and a good read. Read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice. I've been reading a lot of Agatha Christy these days. Do you like mysteries?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I love them. They get me thinking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Same! I like to keep my mind occupied. Does your fiance enjoy reading?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He does not. I tried but he enjoys his games more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah, I could say the same thing about my husband. I love to talk about books, and I wish he was more interested!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh well! It's good to be different and have different interests to keep things interesting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree. How long have you been engaged?

s1.value: She met her fiance at the age of 1
2. She's been married to him for 43 years.
3. She enjoys painting.
