dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What year are you in school? What is your favorite subject?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am a senior in high school, finally! I would say that English is my favorite, and best, subject.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The English language is a great thing to study.  I bet it helps when it is time to write for school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, writing comes pretty naturally to me, probably why I enjoy English the most. Are you in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am not in school.  For a few years I raced remote control cars professionally. I found it difficult to get a job with my degree in English studies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no, that doesn't sound very promising for my future plans. I didn't know that people races remote cars professionally. That must have been really fun and exciting. Why did you stop?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The big money in remote control racing is in drones now.  I have no talent for flying a drone.  I have had success writing about drones.  Some times you have to roll with the tide.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that's a whole set of skills I don't have, either. Does your nephew know how to fly drones?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I thought he would like it.  He would not try. I think you might enjoy it, but there is a difference between enjoy and doing it for money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's true. And I bet it would be expensive to get all the best equipment to do it professionally.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The cost is less than a used car. Have you ever tried writing an article and submitting it to the school paper?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm actually a member of the yearbook committee, so I write polls for the school paper a lot to get an idea of the things students want in the yearbook. Submitting an article is a good idea, thanks.

s1.value: Speaker 1: Is in school, doesn't have a degree.
2. Is a senior in high school
3. Loves English the most.

s2.value: Reaching senior in high school, finally! English is my favorite subject.
1. Last, but not least, Remote Control Racer for a few years.
Relevant facts: Reaching senior in high school, finally! English is my favorite subject.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you done any yoga lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I tend to try and get a session in daily, but that doesn't always work out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It seems like some of those poses take a lot of practice. Some of them even look like they'd hurt.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It can take a lot of practice, but there are lots of things for beginners too! Do you think you'd enjoy it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe. I already have to do lots of stretches before soccer games. I wonder if yoga could help me play better.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe! There are free videos online you could check out or plenty of places around town if you'd like that type of environment.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I might be too young to go to one of those classes, but I'm on the Internet all the time so maybe they've got some beginner videos for kids my age.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I would think there would be some online. I wonder if there are any kid yoga classes out there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If there are I haven't seen any. Neither of my parents are much into fitness and probably wouldn't feel comfortable if I was doing an activity surrounded by adult strangers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. Just make sure you find reputable instructors online so you don't end up hurting yourself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll try and find a video with a good number of views and a lot of likes. Last thing I want to do is get hurt and not be able to play soccer anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that wouldn't be good! How is soccer going for you this year?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I play soccer and play it all the time.
2. Speaker 2: If you ever get the chance try it. It's so much fun!
3. Speaker 1: It's been a while since I've tried practicing the pose. Maybe it's too painful.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I do soccer every week to stay in shape. I try to get a daily session in yoga or some spinning classes.
2. Speaker 2: Yeah, I do yoga every week too. I enjoy it.
3. Speaker 1: It's not the best season for soccer. I am trying to push myself to play better this year.

dialogue.author: 18324: I'
dialogue.text: achieved a new personal best in my bench press.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's great!  Especially given your past achievements.  Let me guess..you've already set your new goal is that right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Would you like to tell me what your new goal is?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Getting my students up to par would be great.  Education is key don't you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree, students education should be number 1!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well we are on the same page at least.  I am often finding new ways to keep them engaged.  Perhaps you can share some of your secrets that can help them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Setting a basic schedule with some structure is number 1 in my book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great advice to anyone that would like to be successful in any aspect I would say.  Thank you.  Speaking of schedules... What do you have going today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am going to take a few pictures for mTurk and do a couple of surveys to try and make some extra cash.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not sure what you mean but good luck with that!  I am going to have to catch up on grading work for the little ones wish that you could help.  If so would you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you sold any cupcakes lately? What kinds of cupcakes do you make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I make alot of different kinds of cupcakes, but enjoy making red velvet the most. whats your favorite cupcake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like blueberry cupcakes. But I prefer to get them from outside as I am a terible cook. What else have you been cooking lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been cooking some curry food as of latley, trying to broaden my cooking skills. Do you have any cooking classes in school, that might get you to like cooking? it can be fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We do have cooking classes but I prefer to attend sports. So whenever I get time, I skip cooking and engage in sports. Do you get many people who are fond of bakery products in a diner?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We get a a decent amount of people, especially if they want a desert to take home after eating a meal. Whats your favorite sport?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love to play a couple of them. I am part of the school's badminton team but I love playing soccer too. Do you like any sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love to play softball now, I was mostly into competitive dance growing up though. Is your badminton team any good?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing. Our school's team is really good, infact we recently won the zonal inter-school championship.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: did you get to celebrate after with some sausage pizza?!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha. We definitely did. Our coach took us out for a great meal to a 5 star place close-by. The group had an amazing time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aw thats so nice of your coach! My roomate really likes sausage pizza too. is your hair natural blonde or do you dye it?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I am a terrible cook. Im a tennis player and a badminton player too.
2. My favorite cupcake is red velvet
3. My hair is natural blonde.

s2.value: She is a red velvet baker.
2. She likes to cook curry food.
3. She has an amazing group of friends.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My job was so boring today, I left early to go for a hike. Do you want to come with me sometime?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I would love to!  I will do anything to hang around people.  How difficult are your hikes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They're super easy, although last time I went I saw a bear!!! We need to find a new trail

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Uhm, yeah... I am not into getting gnawed on by a bear.  How far do you walk??  keep in mind I am all new to this

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: ok fine you're right. you haven't started smoking again have you? That won't help when you run from a bear!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It has been tempting, but no.  The cost actually prevents me from smoking... I can't believe the price these days.  Do you think we could walk to a destination, like a cafe or local hangout?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine! Everything is so expensive these days. And sure! Now that I think of it, there's a live band playing at this cafe like 40 minutes away if we walk, 15 if we drive. Should we just scratch the hiking idea?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No... I think it would make the walk so much more enjoyable... something to actually look forward to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok great. So we'll walk to the cafe. Hopefully they're playing some good music! What's your fav genre?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love classic rock.  But anything with some wings and a good beer is fine with me.  I am super excited now!  Maybe I can get a bunch of friends to meet us there??

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes the more the merrier!!!! Honestly anything to help me escape from that prison called my job. I need to quit so badly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes you do....you gotta find something you enjoy man... money is money... might as well make it and have fun at the same time

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How's work going? Did you arrest anyone lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, came close with some 23.01s and 24.01s -- which is drunk and disorderly. But they managed to calm themselves down and get a ride home. So that was good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are very nice. Did you get any birds on your last hunting trip?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No luck last time, no. To be honest, though, we didn't really try all that hard. A couple too many beers beforehand, so my accuracy was a little off. Have you given any more thought to going hunting yourself? The first time is pretty mjemorable!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been thinking about hunting since talked to you last time. I would love to give it a try, but am worried my inexperience may drag the whole team down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Don't worry about that. We are a super mellow bunch of guys and we don't take it very seriously, except for the safety part. No one is going to expect you to be Mr. Big Game Poacher or anything. None of us are. So if that's what you're mostly concerned about, you shouldn't be. It's cool, I promise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for you encourage. When will you go hunting again? If my schedule allows, I will love to go with you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's hard to say. Sometimes it can be a very last minute decision. Probably sometime in April, but not sure when. After tax day, I think.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: April should be good for me. Regardless when, what should I prepare for the first trip?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We can give you everything you'll need. We've got the vests, the outerwear, ammo, and all that. Just bring whatever food and coffee you think you're gonna want. I'm excited that you want to come along.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are really so kind. I can at least prepare some food for the team. are there any food allergies in the group?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't think so. Just keep it simple. No truffles or lady fingers please! But I would like to taste that broccoli dish you told me about.

dialogue.author: 17020: My
dialogue.text: equest for a promotion has went through! I'm so excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yay! I am happy for you. I knew they would give it to you. You really deserve it. Do you have a new title? Do you get more pay?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I'll get a pay rise but im still an Officer so no change. I will have more responsibilities though so hopefully it'll make work a bit more interesting. How's the museum going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am sure your work is always interesting. The museum is good. I love being around art all day. We have some really cool exhibits coming up. You should come some time while I am working.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I will. When are you available?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I work Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri, and Sat from 2pm - 8pm. So, any of those times are good. I will get you in for free. Did you start your new painting yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work mon-fri but I'm free on Saturday. Maybe you could show me some art work you have that isn't on display. A behind the scenes tour! Ive not got round to starting a new painting yet. Im still looking for inspiration--maybe you can give me some :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should come this Saturday. We have an awesome Pointillism exhibit going on. I really think you will like it. Maybe that will give you inspiration. I am usually pretty busy while I am at work, but I will find time to break away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah Ill do that. Maybe around 3pm. I've never tried Pointillism actually so maybe that will give me some inspiration. I hope so!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That will be perfect. Text me when you get there so that I can come to the lobby and get you in and walk around with you for a little while.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah it sounds fun. Do you think it'll be busy or quite relaxed?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Saturday afternoons are usually pretty busy, and this exhibit is kind of a big deal, so I think a lot of people will be there. But, it is still always a peaceful and mesmerizing place to be.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a museum officer at the Dallas Art Museum.
2. Speaker 1 is a Pointillist painter.
3. Speaker 1 is new to Pointillism.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is an Officer with the Ministry of Culture.
2. He works at the museum and enjoys being there.
3. He can see the art displays in real time and will be more helpful to you if he can see them in person.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just now completed watching cartoons and went to kitchen to prepare something.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah were you watching anything good? Hope you're making something tasty and healthy

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was thinking of goulash, but it sounds like something a canable would eat. I think I'll just order a pepperoni pizza

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I've never tried goulash aha. A pizza sounds good, I might have to join you. I usually cook when my mother is working but would much rather a pizza

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a statement I'd like to make: knock knock!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah I love jokes lol- who's there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: In answer to your inquiry: Voodoo!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: In response to your answer: voodoo who??

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Voodoo you think you are, asking all these questions?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aha, very funny, lol. That was a good joke, usually my go to is the doctor who knock knock

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just went to my doctor yesterday! Usually I'm fit as a fiddle, but the doc said I had a terminal disease and had only 5 days to live. I demanded a second opinion. He say, "OK, you're ugly, too!"

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My dad died when we couldn't remember his blood type. As he died, he kept insisting for us to "be positive," but it's hard without him!

2. Speaker 1 lives alone.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cats just did something that was so cute.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome! What did your cat do that was so cute?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: When I came home from work I found that they were sleeping heads to heads forming a star. I will send you a picture later. How are you anyway?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That is so cute. I am well, thank you for asking. How old are your cats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mikki is 7 years, Ash is 4, Muse and Tok are 3 and Max is just 1 year old. Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I have a husky. His name is Pit and he is 5. Sometimes he plays with my neighbor's cats. He is so gentle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow nice. I would like to have a husky but then I watch videos about them and then I was little bit scared as if not to give them enough space for activities they can destroy everything inside house. Do you live in a countryside as you mentioned before you like gardening?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am in the suburbs, but for sure on adequate space. A husky needs enough space just like you said, but they are fun to have. I have quite an extensive garden for my vegetables and some roses. Do you love roses?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I adore roses, those are my best favorite flowers of all. Good to hear your husky have enough place to play. Which veggies are you growing this season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will do some cantaloupes, sweet corn and peppers. I like doing it the organic way; for the healthy benefits. What do you think of organic food practices?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: To be fair I've never saw how non organic food is grown, I was helping my mum at hers garden to grow some tomatoes and runner beans and we have used only some natural vitamins for soil but I don't know if you can call it organic or not.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is pretty much organic. I am glad you know the drill in matters gardening. Are you planning on owning a garden yourself?

s1.value: I live in a small town in the south west of Ireland,.
2. My cat, Mikki and my neighbor's cat, Pit play in my garden.
3. I have a dog and cat.

s2.value: She also has a cat named Mikki.

3. Her Husky is named Pit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love your dog, what breed is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is a mixed breed from the shelter. What's your dog's name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: His name is Louie. Sox sounds like a great dog. Does he still act like a puppy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, very energetic. Was your dog born in February too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't know when he was born, but I pretend it was in February. We celebrate his "birthday" every year on February 2nd. Do you celebrate Sox's birthday?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes she was born in February on the 14th!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, a Valentine's puppy! Do you take Sox to class with you, or do you have to leave him at home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She comes with me everywhere, very loyal. What about your Shi Tzu. Those dogs are so small you could put it in your bag.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, yeah, except he won't hold still for long enough. We go for lots of walks, though. I hope Sox doesn't bark in the middle of your classes!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No Sox is outside, no dogs allowed in building.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, I see. How were your classes this week? Any tests coming up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I have a few tests. I need to study.

dialogue.text: I had to do so very weird jobs this week

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is the weirdest job you have had to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Horror film director job is very weirdest.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That seems pretty cool to me, but I'm a weird person. What kind of music do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like rock musics.  Because,  that is very good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You said you had 4 kids, all boy or girls or ? I want to have kids one day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: All of boy kids.  They are very cute.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow that sounds like a handful! My mom has 2 girls and 1 boy and she is my inspiration :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very good.  good family Your are became a good mom.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope so. I need to do some homework and I'm not looking forward to it! lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ha Ha.   I guess it.  funny.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I applied for a job at an old record store, trying to overcome my shyness. They have a huge collection of Beatles records.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great. Fingers crossed you get the job! When do you think you will find out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I should get reply sometime next week. It would help me a lot if I get it. How has your job been? Anything interesting you want to share with me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The ER is always so busy. I had a day of yesterday and went paddle boarding. It was great to have a day to myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds interesting. Do you always go by yourself or sometimes with siblings or friends?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Unfortunately my sister's live far away so I don't see them that often. Normally I just go by myself. It's relaxing and good to get some me time especially after a busy week in the ER.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine that. I also prefer to spend time on my own because my siblings can be very rude to me sometimes

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's not very nice. Hopefully you get the job at the record store and perhaps make some new friends!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is also what I hope for. Even if I don't, I can at least listen to Beatles records

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is very true. SO what is your favourite Beatles song or album?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really like Hey Jude, I think this one is my favourite. Are you seeing someone or are you single?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good choice. I'm single. To be honest I don't have much time to go out and meet anyone . I don't paddle board half as much as I would like to at the moment with being so busy - I can only imagine a relationship would need a lot of time invested into it.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I applied for a job at an old record store, trying to overcome my shyness. They have a huge collection of Beatles records.
2. It would go a long way to improve my confidence. The job is in a ER.
3. The ER is always so busy. That is something I need in my life.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has a job at a record store and is looking forward to a reply from the company soon.
2. She is the only single person in her family.
3. She doesn't paddle board as much as she would like to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know what kind  of cake I would like for my wedding.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice! What kind of cake is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I want to have a Swiss Cake Roll Cake with actual Swiss Cake Rolls in the center. I'll call it Cake-ception!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ooh I like the name lol. What made you decide on a Swiss Cake Roll as your main ingredient?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are my favorite treat as a child.  I think my parents will like seeing them in the wedding cake.  Do you think it's a good idea?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it's a great idea. Your combining your favorite treat with an important event in your life - your wedding. By the way, what do you mean by "your parents like seeing them in the wedding cake?"

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that was confusing of me to say.  I think my parents will like seeing tiny swiss cake rolls inside the giant swiss cake roll cake, to remind them of my childhood too.  What was the wedding cake you made like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that makes sense. I agree, I think your parents will enjoy that. I made a 3-layer chocolate mint cake. My brother loved York peppermint patties when he was younger, so I used that as an inspiration. The bottom and top layers are chocolate and the middle layer is mint.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds delicious!! I hope he appreciated it!  If you had to make a cake for yourself based on a childhood treat, what would you make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He said it looked and tasted great, so I was glad I picked the right cake. Ooh that's a great question. I've always loved Cadbury's milk chocolate bars, so I would have to incorporate that. I may make a marble cake and combine the bars with some vanilla components. It will probably only be a 2 layer cake because I prefer simplicity.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What a wonderful idea for a cake!  And it is simple!  I'm currently reading a romance novel.  What was the last book or genre you read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The last book I read was "Born a Crime" by Trevor Noah. It's an auto-biography about the life of a comedian from South Africa. I would highly recommend it. What romance novel are you currently reading?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an African-American.
3. She is from the Houston area of Louisiana.

s2.value: He is a self-proclaimed "happiest guy on Earth."
2. He is a photographer.
3. He is a married man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you had lots of patients lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yes, unfortunately accident are more common during winter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's sad. Roads are not that safe during winters for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Also, a lot of people do not drive safely either. What are you up to these days?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not much, just hibernating, taking a break from work. What about you? Any plans for the New Years?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Same, thankfully I have my cat to keep me company! I have a night shift during New Years, sad isn't it? Do you have any pet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice! I have a cat as well. And night shift on the New Years, that surely is going to be a tough one. I hope you get some time to relax and have fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks! What are your plans?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't really have any plans. New Year's eve is going to be so cold. I'll just stay in and watch Netflix and order some pasta and pizza, may be.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: it has been a hot minute since I was the last time I watched Netflix. Nursing can be draining and for sure it keeps you busy. What programmes have you watched recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How has work been at Goodwill?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love it there, since leaving Nursing, I find it a great way to spend my time. I love helping others, I find it so rewarding. How are you finding it, I know you haven't been there long!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love it as well! It's a nice pace for me, and I can find some nice things to refurbish for myself and family as well@

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great, I just hope its not affecting your performance at school, I know it can be tough doing both!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a good balance for now, but next semester I might take more classes and have to cut my hours!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well as long as you can manage both, that's great! How's your little dog doing, getting better behaved yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He's good! Training is going well. how are your cats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Up to no good as always, but I love them anyway. One of the cheeky little things, gave me a dead bird yesterday it was horrible!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no! What a gift to receive. Luckily my dog is too scared to do something like that

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha must be nice. Have you been up to much else this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to the beach! I love it there

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds lovely. I'm not much of a beach person my self, I don't like the sand you find it everywhere when you get back home!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My beard has grown even bigger!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! I love a long beard. My dog's nails have grown longer too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense. Nails and beards do continue to grow. If you were wondering what I meant about liking pillaging, I felt like I should explain... I meant I like pillaging villages in Minecraft.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Minecraft is awesome! I like to get under the warm electric blanket, play Minecraft and listen to the Beatles. I love being warm.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Being warm is much better than being cold. I live in a terrible place for it, it's cold so much of the year here. And our internet connection isn't good so I usually just have to play single player Minecraft offline. What do you like to do in Minecraft?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like building farms and filling them up with sheep and pigs. I name my farmer Odin, because Odin is awesome. I refuse to give Odin a man bun. Those are NOT awesome. I am sick of seeing them everywhere.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Building a farm is fun, I usually do that too. Are you usually a vegetarian in Minecraft too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am a vegetarian in Minecraft too. I just like to surround myself with animals because I am painfully shy. I enjoy peanuts but can't eat them because I'm allergic. I'm glad I'm not allergic to vegetarian pizza. That's my favorite. What foods do you enjoy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah the Minecraft animals are really cute too so I understand. I have a really hard time killing them so I try not to. I get too attached to them. I even installed a mod so that I can turn rotten flesh into leather, so I don't have to kill cows for leather. Vegetarian pizza is one of my favorites too, because I am allergic to dairy. I made blueberry muffins today, those really good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Blueberry muffins sound amazing. I don't eat out often, but when I do I go to a coffee shop on the corner that has wonderful muffins. You have blown my mind with that mod! How incredible! That is quite impressive.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Actually I realized I meant vegan pizza not vegetarian. It's very hard to get specialty foods like that in Nunavut though. And very expensive. Do you think Spring is coming early this year? I didn't see if the groundhog saw his shadow yesterday or not. All I know is that I am over being cold haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it is very expensive. I agree completely. Yes! They groundhog saw his shadow. I know that's supposed to mean 6 more weeks of winter but I hope he's wrong. I am ready for some warmth too. My dog and I are ready to go hiking.

s1.value: Speaker 2: My dog's nails have grown longer too.
2. Speaker 1: My beard has grown even bigger!
3. Speaker 1: My dog plays Minecraft.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a dog lover and a vegan.
2. He likes to play Minecraft and listen to the Beatles.
3. He lives in a city with no nice food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey hows it going, any new cosplay ideas lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't really, I've been neglecting it recently which isn't like me. Have you managed to get any further with starting the band?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I finally found a bass player! Just need a good drummer and we're set. You should do a Game of Thrones character!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are so close in that case! What will you do in the band? I should, good idea!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, I want to mash up metal and traditional Irish music. Try to picture a heavy metal sea shanty. Does that sound awful or interesting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that's unusual, I like the sound of that. No definitely interesting! What a niche! So how long have you been a vegan for? I keep trying to adopt the lifestyle but I'm not committed enough yet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My parents were vegan, so it is really all I've ever known. I recommend taking baby steps, though. Maybe start by cutting out red meat first, then all meat, then cheese, etc. What motivated you to want to go vegan?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's the best way I think, it's hard to transition once you have lived with meat your whole life. Baby steps is a good idea. I'm mainly interested from the environmental perspective, but I also feel guilty about eating meat. Do you enjoy the meat alternatives that are available? Can you recommend any?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've tried them, and they're fine, but for me it is about showcasing vegetables, not trying to replace or substitute meat. What are your favorite vegetables?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay, sure. That makes sense. I love broccoli and avocado. What are your favourites?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love broccoli too, but am allergic to avocados! I also love carrots, bok choi, potatoes and asparagus.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Omg, I didn't realise people could be allergic to avocados, have you always been or did your allergy develop as an adult? I agree with asparagus. Love it.

s1.value: Speaker 1: My name is Jason, I'm 26 years old. I love music and playing an instrument, and music is my life. I'm an avid gamer and a huge fan of TV shows such as Game of Thrones, Game of Thrones: The World Below, Game of Thrones: The Long Night, and Game of Thrones. I also like to cook and I always enjoy experimenting with food. I'm originally from Ireland and now live in Southern California.

2. Speaker 2: I'm also an Irish person, so I know a lot about Irish music culture! I've been playing drums since I was very young, in school I was a student of drum and bass. In fact, I have a band called Black & Blue, a collaboration between myself and fellow Irish drummers. We practice every Monday and Thursday at our house.
We perform in various local venues, and we have played and recorded at venues in Dublin, Limerick, Cork, and Belfast.

s2.value: They are both artists.
2. They both enjoy cosplaying.
3. They both are vegan.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I practiced playing jazz with my band. Then I went to my dojo to practice karate.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a busy day! Do you have any upcoming gigs or karate tournaments I can go watch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes it was a busy day, Not really, we are just practicing to get better whenever the tournaments come up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love to hear you let it rip on that sax. I was thinking about joining a dojo, how long did it take for you to et a black belt?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should join any Dojo to get the base of Karate. How things are going with the home that you are remodeling? is it any interior design job there ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The remodel is a going bit over budget due to changes by the client, but I'll get a lot of extra left over supplies from it. Yeah, the kitchen had a full overhaul.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, it makes sense some clients are really picky about their own stuff. i hope everything would look amazing at the end.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah they went for a really modern look, all white with a cork top island with a granite counter top. Spared no expense, they are very wealthy and its their lake house.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is good to hear, maybe in the future they will invite you to their lake house so you can go and know a lake House.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I have been to there lake house its right upon the shore. But not a huge one like lake Michigan. I don't think I'll be going back after I finish this job!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well i think what you should do is taake both of your daugthers to a big good looking Lake. By the way how are the girls doing ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Girls are doing great, getting so old. They have so many activities!

s1.value: I practiced playing jazz with my band. Then I went to my dojo to practice karate.
Speaker 2: That's a busy day! Do you have any upcoming gigs or karate tournaments I can go watch?
No.

s2.value: Speaker 1 met Speaker 2 10 years ago playing jazz with his band.
2. Speaker 1 practiced karate and played saxophone.
3. Speaker 2 is very wealthy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm planning that trip to Spain soon. When are you available to travel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am always available. I love to travel. I was looking at doing a cruise since prices are low right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! How do you have time and money to travel so much. You're living the life! I truly hope that I can do that in the future. Right now I only get one vacation every two to three years. A cruise sounds like a lot of fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cruises are very affordable and you get to see a lot doing them. I went to japan a few years ago and had a blast. What team do you play for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I play on a co-ed team in my hometown, nothing professional. If I were a professional football player maybe I'd have the money to travel a lot! Haha! I'll look into cruises for my next vacation! What was your favorite part of Japan?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I loved the food. Ramen and sushi and Waygu beef. What are you planning on doing in Spain?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I plan on doing the Camino de Santiago. It's a pilgrimage that leads to Santiago de Compostela.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am familiar. You should also visit Toledo and go to see their steel making. It is world famous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will definitely put that on my to-do list. I want to try to visit as much as I can while I'm there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you gotten your passport yet or read any more mystery novels?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have my appointment for my passport coming up, so I should have it soon. I'm currently reading other genres - I'm trying to learn about the stock market so I've put a pause on my mystery novels right now while I read a bunch of books about Wall Street.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love reading investment books. Have you read rich dad poor dad? I'll recommend that and the only investment guide you'll ever need.

s1.value: i'm married and have 1 daughter.
2. i enjoy traveling the most.
3. I am planning that trip to Spain soon

s2.value: She's been married for 12 years and has two kids. She travels a lot and stays in very comfortable hotels. She enjoys watching Netflix while she flies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know you like Disney movies, and while they aren't my favorite, what other types of movies do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I also like watching action movies in my free time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like action movies too! I also like reading, do you like reading?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just got done one of my favorite books by Shakespear just the other day! Do you play any sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't plat sports, but I do watch them! My parents worked for ESPN so I was around sports a lot in my childhood, especially football. Do you do sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats awesome! I enjoy snowboarding and dancing. I've actually been dancing competively since I was a child.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you won many competitions?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually took second place in my competion last week!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow, congratulations! Did you win anything :p

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just got awared a medal was all. What have been doing this past week anything interesting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't been doing anything interesting, just watched Goodfellas again! Did you watch any disney movies this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I watched Black Beauty on Disney plus last night before bed. I had plenty of pop corn, did you eat any snacks while watching Goodfellas?

s1.value: I like Disney movies, and while they aren't my favorite, what other types of movies do you like?
2. I also like watching action movies in my free time.
3. I read books for fun.

s2.value: He is a lover of all things Disney.
2. He loves to read and dance.
3. He likes singing in the choir.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you get to go surfing yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't gone surfing yet. Have you been to the beach today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not today. I'm afraid it's too chilly for me. When it's warm, I go every morning.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No kidding, it is a little cold these days. Where do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I live in California. I guess if you're not from here, it might be warm enough to go to the beach. I see a lot of people there most days, even when it's too cold for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For sure. I don't mind the cold, if I get to see the ocean!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should come visit, I can see the ocean from my house! I know you like to travel, it would be fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be so fun! I'll look up tickets right now!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome! I can teach you to surf! Even if it's cold, I'll still do it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You're such a good friend, that's real sacrifice. Now that I'm coming out there, what's your favorite place to eat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There is a cool place called Bob's Tacos near my house. They have like 50 different kinds of tacos, something for everyone. The ones I've tried are delicious.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love tacos! We'll have one of each kind!

s1.value: Did you get to go surfing yet?
2. Have you been to the beach today?
Speaker 1: Not today. I'm afraid it's too chilly for me. When it's warm, I go every morning.
2. Where do you live?
California. I guess if you're not from here, it might be warm enough to go to the beach. I see a lot of people there most days, even when it's too cold for me.

s2.value: She is from California, and lives in San Diego.
2. She likes to surf.
3. Her favorite place to eat is San Diego, California.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hi just wanted to ask how is your grad school going.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is very stressful. I will be really glad when I finish up. I feel like I don't have any time to enjoy life right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been stressful for me too with my little one and work at the school. You should plan a beach trip to relax.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I have been thinking about that. I just have to wait until this semester is over so I can have a few down days. It must be tough juggling being a mom and a teacher. Does your little one go to daycare, or stay with family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Right now her dad helps a lot. The people from my dad's church are all really helpful too. Like family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aww, that's great to have a church family that can help out. My church really helps me de-stress when things are tough at school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Does cooking help you feel less stressed too? What's your favorite Italian dish to make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It does. One of the best ways to de-stress for me when cooking is actually making my own pasta. There is something about the repetitive nature of it that just zones me out. I really like making chicken fettuccini.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enjoy cooking for the same reason. I don't know any Italian recipes, though. I make Mexican food, mostly. Have you ever had tamales?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love tamales. I hate to admit it, but when I was working on my undergrad, I would buy tamales from a church group who used to sell them to all of us as we left the bar on the weekends. We were easy targets after a night of drinking. Back in my wilder days.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so funny. I have a really good recipe. It's time-consuming, but maybe you could get your nephews to help and make it a family thing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet they would love it, I have always wanted to learn how. I think my dog might be addicted to Mexican food, anytime I make Mexican he just sits and drools staring at me.

s1.value: She is a retired teacher and an adjunct professor at a community college.
2. She has a 3-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son.
3. She has lived in the same house for 21 years.

s2.value: She is a mom.
2. A teacher.
3. A graduate student.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got a part in a new play, pretty excited about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's exciting! What is the play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is Shakespeare play, Romeo and Juliet. Believe it or not I am playing Romeo. I still can't believe I got this part.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a big part! You get to be a romantic lead. Good luck memorizing all the lines. When is the performance?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I know, I am worried about being able to memorize all the lines. The premiere will be in 3 months, next week we will start practising so some time to learn it all step by step.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a good amount of time to get it all down. Good luck! I guess you'll be very busy with rehearsals for the next 3 months then.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes you are right, it's gonna be crazy few months but I am looking forward to it. And how about you, still working so much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I'm still doing my 50 hour weeks because I'm trying to get a big promotion. I got a great performance review from my boss last week so I feel pretty confident. Are you still working at the grocery store?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, still working there. Not a great pay but it's flexible and allows my to do acting. Hopefully if it all goes well I can leave that job soon and do only acting full time. Happy about you performance review. When are you expecting promotion?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It seems like a pretty good gig while you get your acting career going. And now you're on the way! The promotion is not a sure thing, but there's a management position opening up next month. Cross your fingers for me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I definitely will. It surely comes with a nice pay rise, doesn't it? Are you happy to take the responsibility of managing others?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm a little nervous but I think I have the skills to make my company more productive. Mostly, it's that sweet raise money I want though lol. It's an extra $10,000 a year.

s1.value: She's working at a grocery store.
2. She's not sure if she'll get a promotion or a raise.

s2.value: He was hired as clerk at a local grocery store.
2. Then one day he got the opportunity to be a manager which he took without any hesitation.
3. He worked at another grocery store to make sure he would get the raise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I recently took a trip with my dog!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome! Where did you go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My wife and I travelled to Iceland with Max for three weeks. We own a small cottage there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow. That must have been nice. Did Max have a great time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was nice, we try to go a couple times a year. He did, although he is getting older now and doesn't like long hikes as much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's really nice. My dog George is like that too. He gets a bit overwhelmed at the end of walks on the beach.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is sad to see them age. What kind of dog is George?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He is a Husky. What about Max?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Huskies are so adorable. I have always wanted one. Do they shed a lot? Max is an Australian Sheppard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not George. I bet Max is a cutie. I think George and Max will get along!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am sure! Next time you are in Chicago, let me know. We can take them to the dog park.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds great. Looking forward to it.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an internet video moderator and owner of a successful business online.
2. She goes to a lot of dog parks and dog shows. She is also active in her community.
3. She has a black lab named Max.

s2.value: Max and George travel to Iceland and Chicago.
2. Max has a long nose.
3. Max is a Husky

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just found out my job is sending me to denver next month, shall we meet up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure! Why is amazon sending you to Denver?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Im not really too sure yet, they just said that they need help getting their warehouse up to par with the rest of the warehouses around the country

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay, how much free time are you going to have? I can think of some stuff for us to do while you are here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: from what I hear i should only be working 40hrs per week for the 3 months i will be in time, pretty much all my town outside work will be freetime for the first month. after the first month my husband will be bringing our children over here for the summer holidays since their school ends at a different time than the states. i will definitely be missing them and it would be nice to have sometime to spend my time with

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For sure, I believe my cousins are coming in to town to visit at some point. They are also in to robotics. I am currently working on building a bot, they were going to bring some parts I need. Do you want to help me out with building my bot? If your free you can come to the contest I'm going to be entering the bot in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes that sounds great! I would absolutely love that, i will see what i can do about my work schedule to make sure that i can go to your competition. i would love the be able to support you

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats great to hear! Are you currently building a bot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: im not currently working on anything. ever since i found out i was going to denver I didnt want to start a project that I couldnt finish. ive been spending most of my times with my kids trying to prepare them for me being away from them for an entire month. in the past the longest i have every been gone from them was 1 weeks

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense, I'm sure your kids will be ok but it is good that you are preparing them for it. How old are they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: they are 5 and 7 im not sure how they will handle it honestly, my youngest will probably be just fine she is such a daddys girl but my son on the other hand will probably have a hard time with it

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear that, hopefully you can video chat in some way and that could help him cope. Are your children interested in robotics?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a robot builder, speaker 2 works in the robotics industry.
2. Speaker 2 is helping Speaker 1 build his very first robot. Speaker 2: Speakers 1 first robot is going to be competing in a contest for free.

s2.value: Speaker 2 was born in the UK, grew up in the UK, moved to Canada and currently lives in the US
2. They speak English, Swedish, German, Dutch, and Dutch
3. They play computer games, and watch TV
4. They are also involved in robotics.
5. They own a Lego store

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What are you writing a script about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm writing a movie script following the rise and fall of a Kpop band - it's something close to my heart and i'm really looking forward to getting to filming! Do you listen to Kpop, or just Rock music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mainly rock music but kpop isn't bad. Do you play any recent Blizzard games?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't played any recently, but I played a lot of World of Warcraft when I was younger! Did you do any work on WoW?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A bit on the expansions, not the very beginning though. If you play more recent games, I worked on those. It's so fun to play WoW still to this day though, with a bag of chips by your side haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: haha what flavour of chips do you like? Honestly, chilling playing WoW with a big bottle of Dr Pepper and a ton of chocolate can't be beaten! Sometimes i play when i'm working overnight in the hotel, but don't tell my boss!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love sour cream and onion. That's funny, how long have you worked at the hotel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They're ok, I love something with a bit of spice though! I've been at the hotel for 3 years now, it's a great job, but can be really creepy and lonely in the nights! How is your mom doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My mom is okay. You know we get along super well. The only thing I dislike is she makes me eat vegetables. I know it's healthy but I hate it. Do you get enough veggies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's probably for the best, you can't survive on rubbish! Glad she's doing ok, i miss your mom! I love veggies, I've been tempted to go Vegetarian, but I like Chicken too much!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't think I could ever go vegetarian haha. I really like fried chicken. I know I should eat less junk food but you know it's my favorite.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is fried chicken your favourite, or is it McDonalds?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I'm a writer who's writing a movie script. It's close to my heart.
2. Speaker 2: I'm a musician who writes music and plays rock music.
3. Speaker 1: My favorite food is Fried Chicken.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a Korean popstar. The members of the group are called "Jinjae."
2. The members of the group are called "Jinjae."
2. The members of the group are called Jinjae."

dialogue.author: 17643: My
dialogue.text: at Leroy Jenkins broke my 386.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Boy, Leroy must have been riled up.  A 386 computer right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes, my poor computer. Leroy was definitely being a wild child

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So, you could say that Leroy wants you to have a faster new computer.  Possible a new/used mouse to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: well thats a great way to look at it. maybe it was a blessing in disguise! too bad you dont have a pet to break your xbox as a sign for needing a new one haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I get a new one when my buddies and me want to play some new game. So that is regular.  A 386 is like a boat anchor. How did a cat manage to break that.?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He managed to get up on the shelf above my desk a knocked the fish tank down on top of the computer. I managed to save the 2 fish but my poor computer was done for

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can picture quiet a mess. I bet Leroy was nowhere to be found for a while.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: you would think! but no, he was meowing by his empty food bowl less than 5 minutes later like he did nothing wrong! having pets can be a pain in the butt sometimes

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do not know.  They provide many benefits.  Even when the sink a boat anchor with a fish tank they are still fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: ha thats one way to look at it. at least your electronics are safe!

s1.value: A cat managed to knock over a fish tank and break my computer.
2. I have a new computer.
3. I have a pet dog

s2.value: Leroy Jenkins broke my 38
2. Leroy is a cat.
3. My computer was broken by a cat.

dialogue.author: 19552: I
dialogue.text: inted a portrait of my cats this week. I painted one picture of all of them, not 23 individual ones!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow! I'd love to see it. Did you get them all to sit still for it, or did you paint it from a photo or something?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I painted it from a photo.  I took many pictures before I got a perfect one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's really cool. I wish I knew how to paint. How's your garden doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is doing great.  Gardening is very relaxing to me.  How is your mom now?  I am sorry about your father.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She's ok, I guess. She's still having a really hard time with things. She needs to stay busy. Maybe gardening would be a good hobby for her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You can suggest that she tries.  Do you live close to her?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. She's only about 15 minutes away. What kind of plants do you recommend she start with if she takes up gardening?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If she uses herbs to cook, she can start with basil or cilantro.

s1.value: She paints cat portraits.
2. She painted one this week.
3. She got 23 cat portraits instead of only one.

s2.value: She painted a portrait of her cats this week.
2. She has been married to her husband, Frank Foltz, for 42 years.

dialogue.author: 18628: Ha
dialogue.text: you read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey, I have been waiting for the new John Grisham novel to come out. Normally I just read political articles. How are your grandkids doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The grandkids are doing fine AND getting to where they think they know where the fun is. If I make it to Cancun, they'll be jealous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I bet they will be! I will be envious of a CAncun trip too! What kind of fish will you be fishing for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would like to try my hand at sport fishing, maybe go after a marlin or swordfish. I haven't done much research so I'm not sure they even have any of those down there. Mostly fishing is just an excuse to sit on the beach and watch the cuties go by.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I see! HA! I have not been fishing in a long time but I love to catch them and cook them the same day!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I catch and release mostly because I seldom catch anything that is big enough to keep. I might be more interested in cooking them, if I didn't have to clean them first. It's much easier to fish in the frozen foods aisle at the grocery store.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that is a good point! As I get older I might lean towards the grocery store plan too! How about reading, do you have any good recommendations lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got myself a Kindle recently, just so I can enlarge the fonts - old eyes, you know. I got a couple months of free books from amazon and I've just been browsing thru things that catch my eye. I've tried learning to code, learning to cook, and learning to lose weight and keep it off genres. But, nothing really special has caught my attention for long. It might be different if the books weren't free.

s1.value: They are from Texas.
2. They are a father and a son.
3. They have been married for 30 years.
