dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been nice spending time on the farm, had a lot of stuff to do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure it's a lot of fun and relaxing at the same time. Do you have any ducks in your farm too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ive got plenty of ducks in my farm both domestic and wild

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I would love to visit your farm one day. Is it okay if I bring my dogs with me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: absolutely. You are most welcome and I bet your dogs will have fun running around the farm

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have always been fascinated by farm life to be honest. It just seems so calm. How many dogs do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Farm life as compared to the city life is calm indeed. I would not trade it for the latter. How are your mutts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I bet. Well my mutts are doing fine but they are high maintenance. I love spending time with them but it seems like they need more of my time and attention.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well you know what they say. Mutts are very attention seeking. They take a chunk of a persons attention and time

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh well I wish I knew it before. How about your dogs? Hope they are not as attention seeking as mine!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dogs are danes. They are good hunters and quite fast. They don't require much attention, only too playful

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's great to hear! I still love my mutts very much. Do your dogs help you when you go duck hunting?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a duck hunter who lives on a farm.
2.Speaker 2 is a dog lover who is going to visit Speaker 1's farm.
3.Speaker 2 has a lot of pets.

s2.value: Has been spending time on the farm with ducks and dogs.
2. Has dogs and at least one duck
3. Does not always take care of his mutts

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I ate some Italian food!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds delicious. What exactly did you eat?!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nothing difficult to be sure. I had some spaghetti and meatballs with some garlic bread sticks! It was fantastic!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love spaghetti. It's nothing like my food from the homeland, but it is very good. Did you make the spaghetti yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, unfortunately I ordered take out from a nearby restaurant.  So, what kinds of foods are from your homeland?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We have a wonderful lamb dish that in American, roughly translates to "spicy lamb shank kabob". My mom made it a lot. Are there any any East Asian foods you miss?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Actually no! There's plenty of East Asian places to eat and grocery stores sell all the ingredients now so I don't miss anything. I am more into exploring other cultures like Italian.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that's a really good point! I'm glad there's a lot of delicious homeland food for you. I've been eating a lot of East Indian food lately. I'm a bit obsessed with curries.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Now that I haven't tried! How are curries?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, they are such comfort food, but good for both hot and cold weather. My favorite right now is Masman curry with some basil on top.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What does it taste like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like mine really spicy hot, so that's kind of the main flavor I taste. But I think it's made with coconut milk, so it has a bit of a sweet taste to it.

s1.value: I ate some Italian food.
2. The food I ate was Italian.
3. I'm more into exploring other cultures than eating my own food.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is Italian and has been going out on "take-out" meals since their first encounter.
2. They speak different languages, but are both proficient in English.
3. They share a love of Chinese food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found a weird blue item while I was coming home from work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! What a jackpot. You better buy more containers, since you're going to run out of space for your collection at this rate.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Smile! What will I use containers for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: To hold all your weird blue items. You've been finding a lot recently, but eventually you're going to run out of room. In fact, you might need to purchase a whole new apartment!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Smile! That is sarcastic. Anyways, how is Maine and your preparation for Winters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is good, I bought so many blankets here to keep me warm. You would love it here, the snow piles high enough to go sledding on the hills.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is cool. Had it been I am not occupied now, I would have loved to come and have vacation over there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's too bad. I know a restaurant here that makes amazing pizza, I'm sure that alone would be worth the visit! Is it your job that is holding you up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! I would love to have a bite of the pizza. Yes, it is my job and other personal issues.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see, I hope that everything goes well and that you can come here sometime soon before the snow melts. What's your favorite pizza place in Texas?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you. Verily, I would find a good time to be there in one winter in the future. I don't have specific restaurant for pizza.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see, I do indeed hope that you swing by. There must not be any good pizza places in Texas. What about Utah? Are there any good pizza places there?

s1.value: He is a speaker that lives in Houston, Texas.
2. He likes to write poems and short stories.
3. He finds his inspiration in odd objects.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a retiree from Maine.
2. Speaker 1 has a collection of weird blue items.
3. Speaker 1 likes to travel to Maine for the winter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My son's wedding was wonderful? They loved the cake!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet he did, Your cakes are delicious as I remember. Did you cry on wedding by any chance? Those moments are always so sweet when parents cry a little bit on weddings

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have to admit, I cried a little bit. Have you had your talent show yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It will be next month, Now I am rehesing about 5 hours a day as I am little bit shy to perform on big audience but I need to overcome it I guess

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a lot of rehearsing! I hope you do well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wrote a song for talent show if you want I can send you on messenger later on so maybe you can give me some feedback. How is your husband?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would be happy to give you some feedback. He's been a little bit stressed about work recently, but he'll be fine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will record a sample later on and will send you then. What is he doing exactly which made him feel stressed? Is he a minister or something like that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He's the president. He's been hard at work undo-ing everything from the last four years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow I assume you are joking hehe. I almost fell for it lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not joking! He really is! Why do you not believe me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My apologies Mrs First Lady. I am assuming you will have no time then to do bakery job then with all responsibility which comes with your husbands presidency?

s1.value: She's the first lady of America.
2. She is married to Barack Obama.
3. She has a son running for president.

s2.value: She has a son's wedding cake to do so she usually gets a lot of orders from cakes.
2. People love her cakes with special message.
3. She is the first lady of United States so her husband is the President, therefore she gets the responsibility to do the bakery in the White House.

dialogue.author: 20639: I
dialogue.text: playing a game of Mortal Kombat, want to join in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For sure, can you give me a few minutes to grab a snack. How long do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! What snacks are you going to grab? I've got ages before my next shift, I'm free to play all day

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably a burger and a milkshake, I'll reheat it in the microwave quickly. I won't have long before the kids want me again LOL

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I'm surprised you get any time at all to yourself these days!! Do you get the kids working on the farm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They help out quite a bit, that's where they are now, with my wife. I can hide and game until they find me. I'm just loading up now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm guessing you don't help out on the farm much anymore with your weight issue? Which character is your favourite to play as in Mortal Kombat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love a bit of Scorpion, what about you? I try and stick to driving the machinery now, let the youngsters do the harder work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Kitana is my favourite, she plays so smooth and has the best finishing moves i think! That sounds like a great plan - do you have tractors and combines?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, we have both, although the combine is more problematic, I'm quite good at fixing it now, always on YouTube watching help videos.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Is it a really old machine? they do tend to break down more, but also very simple and easy to fix :) Do you watch any other stuff on Youtube in your free time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I had time to watch more stuff. Once the kids have grown up. Yea, it's an older machine, but still manages, most of the time

s1.value: Speaker 1 has a weight issue.
2. Speaker 2 is a farmer
3. Speaker 1 only has one more shift before her next one.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I work out 3 times a week.
2. Speaker 2: I'm stuck at 150 lbs
3. Speaker 1: I have been in very good shape.
3. Speaker 2: I like to eat burgers, milkshakes, and play Mortal Kombat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The food network had an episode the other day about a new twist on pizza, did you watch it? It looked really delicious.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I saw that one.  It looked really good and I was actually gonna try to do it to.  I don't usually like to mess with a classic pizza very much, but doing one with korean bbq sounds really good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Now you're talkin my language!! I wanna try your famous cracker crusted mac and cheese on a pizza.. Oh man, mac and cheese pizza??

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have actually just teamed up with UberEats and Doordash and am going to be allowing people to order my dishes via my online portal, you could probably get it delivered to you!  Would love it if you could post it to your social media pages.  I know you have lots of followers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah as one of the top Superman influencers I have a pretty big following of redditors with extra cash to burn from this gamestop thing, I can't imagine what more they'd want than mac and cheese delivered to their door.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be awesome!  I will comp you a few orders for the posts.  Wow, can you believe the Reddit phenomenom driving up all of these stocks, it's pretty awesome.  Have you personally made any money on any stocks?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've actually invested and lost everything I own on GME. Besides taking orders for mac and cheese pizza I wouldn't trust a redditor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh noooo!  that really stinks.  I also got in a little late and lost a bit on AMC.  Better stick with cooking and the online food venture.  On another topic, do you think they will do Comic Con this year?  I went a few years ago and it was really neat.  I think it is in San Diego this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My honest guess is no, the online thing DC did last year worked pretty well, either way you better believe we're gettin a new trailer for The Batman and some spicy news on my boy Henry Cavil.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Henry Cavil is a total dude.  In my opinion, the best Superman ever.  But then again, I don't know as much as you about Superman, what do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll put it this way, give us Henry Cavil with a mustache and I'll legally change my name to Lois Lane.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm with you!  I'll take him as the character he plays in The Witcher on Netflix too!

s1.value: A Superman fan.
2. A top supermodel.
3. She is extremely good looking.

s2.value: She is a Superman influencer who is currently a business owner.
2. She has teams of paid subscribers that order her restaurant meals online.
3. She has some pretty big aspirations about her future in the business.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you know any good black coffee brands?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite is Star Bucks.  I try to buy it every week from the local Star Bucks store.  Are you going to buy some coffee?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm thinking of picking up a few brands of black coffee to test them out.  I'll definitely add Starbucks to the list now.  I need to pick up some grocery items anyways, I'm planning on cooking some steak and twice baked potatoes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds good.  I love twice baked potatoes.  I may make some for Saturday when my family comes over.  It is so hard to cook for only myself during the week.  Do you have any good recipes for one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I use my grandmother's recipe which uses a lot of heavy cream and 3 kinds of cheese.  I'll send you the recipe later if you want.  The good think about it is you can cook a lot of it at once and it tastes even better when you have them as leftovers.  Do you grow any vegetables in your garden?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks I would love to try it.  I grow tomatoes, onions and cucumbers.  Do you garden?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a small herb garden that I grow in the house so I can always have fresh herbs when I'm cooking.  I'd like to do some vegetable gardening but the weather here isn't conducive to that.  You can make a great salad with the vegetables you're growing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, that is what I do.  I make onion and cucumber vinegar salad with tomatoes. It is one of my favorites. And, I always have plenty of vegetalbe for my family and the neighbors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can't use a lot of vegetables when I'm cooking for my grandkids, they won't eat them unless they're covered in cheese.  It's nice that you see your family every week, are you the one that usually cooks for them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I am the cook.  My daughter helps me but I do most of it before they get here.  I don't know what I'd do if I didn't get to see them every week.  Veggies are so good covered with cheese, I like veggies with about anything.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There's nothing better in the world than spending the night with your family with the smell of great cooking in the air.  How long have you drank your coffee black?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For about 5 years.  I never used to like it, then I tried it at a friends house and now I love it.  Don't forget to email me your recipe for the potatoes.

s1.value: He works as a Speech Professional.
2. He is married with two kids.
3. He is a father to a beautiful daughter named Emma.

s2.value: She likes her black coffee and steamed milk with some cream.
2. She only drinks it at Starbucks.
3. She's only been married a year and she's already planning to get a divorce.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of my pigs had babies today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are the babies going to be raised as potential food or are they just pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: As potential food I think. I really like pigs meat and especially bacon

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: As you know, I love bacon, and I'm interested in the process from birth to the eventual food product. How did you become interested in farming?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wasn't that interested but I got into it because of my parents. They needed help with farming so I helped them and learnt from them

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I understand. I wish I lived on a farm, so I could explore my passion for biology further. If you ever need help, I would love to join you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Of course, that would be great! You can come visit me anytime and I will show you around

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome. I will have to find a time where I am not in class or studying, but I'm sure I will be available sometime. Thanks for the opportunity to experience farm life.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not a problem, you are always welcome. Are you close to graduating?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I am a senior this year, so at the end of May, I will graduate. This last semester is a full load, but at least, they are classes that are interesting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is what matters, as long as you find it interesting, you will enjoy it later. I wish you luck in your final semester

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you so much. I'll get in contact with you soon as to when I'll be able to come out to the farm. See you later.

s1.value: Loves bacon.
2. Has been interested in farming for a while.
3. Was born on a farm.

s2.value: A pig farmer.
2. Speaker is a senior in high school and just recently started university.
3. She is a vegetarian and is interested in agriculture.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You said you were young, are you still in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Freshman athlete at my local college.  So yeah, I'm still young but people tell me I'm mature for my age.  How's the job working out?  I don't know if I could handle screaming kids all day

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You're funny! Yeah the kids scream but I'm not actually one of the teachers. I work in the administrative office as one of the secretaries.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Admin work.  Ok, that sounds a little more appealing.  I was thinking about your situation with careers.  Have you thought about a double major?  You could tie them together and open up your own dental practice.  It's certainly would provide you job security for the future.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, a double major with a business degree as one of them will definitely be rewarding. I can apply the business knowledge to anything I choose!!! You're so right. What about you. What is your major?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Can I major in sports?!  I'm not sure yet.  I'm interested in so many things but I know I need something to pay the bills.  What are your business classes like?  Hard?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There is probably a degree in sports management, for sure! I had a friend who majored in that at FSU. My business classes are challenging but so eye-opening and you can apply that knowledge to almost everything in life! So, very useful, I think!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good idea.  I never even thought of sports management.  I'll call my counselor on Monday and see about changing my course load.  Thanks!  Did you try out that jogging trail I told you about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did! It was beautiful yet challenging. So uphill. But I felt great after finishing the 5 mile run. How often do you go on that trail?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd like to hit it everyday but my schedule won't let me.  I sprint/jog it 4 days and steady state 1 day.  Good for the endurance.  I'm actually heading out there this weekend if you want a running buddy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a lot, at least for an average person! At what time are you going? We should definitely meet up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: 10am sound ok to you?  Then we can grab some lunch afterwards to refuel.

s1.value: Has a BA from The Ohio State University and is pursuing a Master of Public Administration.
2. Has helped a high school student earn a scholarship and has also been the assistant to the athletic director at his high school.
3. Now, works in the administrative office of high school.

s2.value: She was Freshman Athlete at her local college.
2. She works in the administrative office.
3. She has a double major in business and sports management.

dialogue.author: 13035: Yo
dialogue.text: are a teacher? What subject do you teach? What grade-level do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I teach science to k-12 students. I love it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing. What's the best part about being a teacher?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's the interaction with young people. They are very curious and appreciative. Do you like science?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Science is an incredible subject. Do you do experiments with you students?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course. Without experiments science would be meaningless. Students gain the first hand knowledge about science from experiements.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It must be very fun for your students. Has there ever been an accident while performing an experiment?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not in my class. But there was terrible accident in one of Chemistry lab when a tube exploded but no one was seriously injured

s1.value: He is a teacher of science.
2. He teaches to k-12 level.
3. He loves it.

s2.value: That's amazing. What's the best part about being a teacher?
2. it's interaction with young people. They are very curious and appreciative. Do you like science?
3. does your students have accidents with equipment?

dialogue.author: 22294: Th
dialogue.text: rain stopped so i decided to go for a walk with my dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I didn't know you had a dog, or that it was raining. I was reading a book and having a nice evening with a warm cup of coffee by my window watching the snow fall. What kind of dog do you have? What do you like to read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a Husky; his name is Toby. He's a big boy but a gentle dog. Well, when Toby is not bothering me to take him our or get him food, I enjoy reading historical fiction. Anything about kings, queens, knights, wars, fights, political games, and so on. What book are you reading currently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am actually reading a newer book right now, about dragons. I am on the 4th book in a 7 book series and it is really interesting, but the author did not do a good edit. I also loved reading about King Authur and Merlin! I love huskys, they are so cute and fluffy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: OMG! We have similar tastes then. Medieval historical fiction and fantasy have ALOT in common. Have you ever read Lord of the Rings or Game of Thrones? I love Tolkien and George RR Martin!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not read either, but I am on the last two episodes of Game of Thrones now. I plan to read the books after I finish the series. I love Daenerys! But she is going a bit crazy. I love dragons though, so of course I like her. Most of the fantasy books I have read have been lesser known honestly. Have you ever heard of a series called Acorna?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, Daenerys is a great character, but she's always had a mad streak in her! And I actually read the books after watching the TV show. It didn't ruin it all for me. The book is so well-written is like hearing the story for the first time. And I haven't heard of that series. What is it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is about a world where most planets are inhabited by humans, some aliens exist, and a mining crew find a young girl with a horn and hooves. it is a unicorn girl. It ends up having time travel and stuff later on in the series. It is pretty intense. I'm glad the books don't ruin anything, sometimes you hate the show after reading the book. I had to stop reading Harry Potter because I loved the movies.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Woah, time travel and fantasy together sounds like a great combination. I know you like to write songs, have you ever considered writing a book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Actually I am working on both book and songs. I am working on a full fantasy series and another fantasy type idea that I have not started. I have been reading as much as I can about different styles of dragons and ways that people write about them to work on a dragon series as well, and have to study some of the history of Christianity for one of my books. My music is mostly the notes and I play the guitar and piano. The words are usuallly more like poems and I can't always find the right melody for them when I play.

s1.value: They are a Husky Terrier Mix, who lives in North Carolina.
2. They are the dog of Toby the Husky, who is a big dog but a gentle dog.
3. They love to play fetch but Toby is the better shot.

s2.value: He has a Husky.
2. He's a medieval type fantasy writer and a fan of dragons and horses and elves.
3. He is working on music and a song as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I broke my personal record at the track yesterday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey that's great! What was your finish time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It used to be 10.93 minutes but yesterday I finished at 10.26 minutes. Do you like running?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow. Congrats! That's really awesome. I have an old neck injury so I can't really do a lot of sports. I like to watch sports though. .

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you, I was jumping with joy lol. Oh I'm sorry, how did you hurt your neck?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I fell off a horse a few years ago and my body hasn't been the same since. Do you practice running every day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow I'm sorry to hear that. So you don't ride horses anymore? I run three times a week, sometimes five.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: NO I can't ride horses any more either. I'm just finally getting tapered off all the pain meds I was on. That takes some dedication to run that many times a week!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I see. I actually enjoy running a lot so it's more of a hobby. What hobbies do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to read a lot. have you read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I read "the fault in our stars" recently, I really liked it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I have seen that online but haven't read it yet. It looked really good.

s1.value: They are a competitive track runner.

s2.value: The last time Speaker 1 ran a 1
0.93 minute mile was in June 201
2. He runs three to five times a week.
3. He uses tape on his neck to help with the pain.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went for a hike to curb my urge to gamble.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How did that go for you? Did it work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Umm yeah, it worked a little. I love green things like you so seeing nature made me a bit happier.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, i understand. Green things brings me a lot of happiness. The nature and the fresh air are definitely very calming. I need to take hikes every weekend. I work at Mc Donalds and it's a lot of fast paced work, so the nature helps me center myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I remember when I used to work at McDonald, it was pretty hectic. Now I work as a telemarketer and I love it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that is great! I feel like i will never be able to get out of McDonalds. I kind of get stuck in places. It could be cool to do your job, but i hate taking phone calls. How do you handle needing to be on the phone with people always?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love the phone so that's why I love the job lol. I get to speak Spanish with customers, so Its pretty fun. You also know some spanish right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense, i just can't understand how people can enjoy talking to people on the phone. I prefer to send messages. Yes! I speak a little bit! I had a friend who tried to teach me. Are you fluent in Spanish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I am fluent. I guess when a person loves something it just makes sense to them

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, you are definitely right! Are you spanish yourself and that is why you are fluent? Or did you learn it through your telemarketing job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I learned it, that is why also got a job as being telemarketer. Knowing two languages can come pretty handy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is fantastic! I really like when i can speak a little Spanish at McDonalds! I hope i can learn it fluently through there too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's your favorite football team?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am a fan of the Buffalo Bills LOL

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: lol, that's some commitment. I can't say I'm a football fan really

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is your favorite spectator sport?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not a big sports fan in general. I do like watching twitch sometimes, but it's more for the interaction.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do you play video games?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do, but less and less. My biggest game is Destiny 2.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow!  I play Candy Crush!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great game to pass the time. Casual yet addicting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How long have you played violin?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Since highschool. I played in Orchestra. Do you play any instruments?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, unfortunately not.  The school budgets for music have been deeply cut.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just made a really cool Garden Gnome for my yard that I'd love to show you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love garden gnomes.  You'll have to send me a picture.  ...do you sell them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No I don't sell them, usually give them away to people who like them. I get enough pleasure just making them. I can make you one! What are your favorite colours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: ohh. that would be great!  I like them with bright colored clothing.  Yellows, oranges, and reds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh those colours are great! I will make you a very cheery gnome, with fashion sense of course. Hey, I just joined a dance class you may like. It's very casual. You should come with me next time I go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: When is it?  lol.  I could use a good workout.  I've been spending all my time sewing.  ...what color blouse would you like.  I'll make you one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There are two classes next week. Wednesday and Thursday at 6:00 pm. Let me know which one works for you. Oh a blouse :) I would love a light pink one. I so wish I could sew like you, but I am grateful at least one of us can sew.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thursday works best for me.  I have exactly the perfect shade of pink cloth.  You'll love it.  I'll bring the blouse with me on Thursday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I am so excited. You may have to wait a little longer for your gnome, the process usually takes me a week or two. How about I buy the coffee and donuts before dance class? :) Thursday is perfect.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Coffee and donuts sound great!  We'll need the extra calories for dancing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha that's what I keep telling myself, but I love those new Oreo donuts I get at the bakery down the street from me. They are soooooo good. Hope you like Oreo!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You can't beat an Oreo!  Oreo ice cream.  Deep fried Oreos.  Bring them all on.

s1.value: Makes fun garden gnomes and presents them to friends.
2. Has made hundreds of such gnomes.
3. Asks questions about his garden gnome customers.

s2.value: Is a freelance video producer in Denver.
2. Is a freelance video producer in Denver.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite Italian restaurant in the area?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love a place called 'Plario's. It's just a small place but always crowded because their food is so good. The large chains just mass produce food but everything in Plario's is cooked when you order.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds so good, I'd love to go if I could ever get myself to leave the house :(

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The day will come my friend. Perhaps you can join me sometime. They have a great chicken dish that's made for two. Melts in your mouth.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my god I love chicken that melts in your mouth! But there's just one thing, even though you said the dish is for two, could we each get one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I suppose so. That way we could each have a take home portion. Don't try to feed it to your cat though. From the taste I would say it's very fattening but who cares every once in awhile?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I heard that lol. We'll have to save room for dessert too! This is all getting me so excited. Such a special event. Would you come over early and help with my makeup?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will try but I apply mine with a paint brush.  Maybe that's why no body is rushing to propose!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Girl who needs men these days. We're gonna hit the town so hard you'll forget they even exist. I mean just talking about it and I've already almost forgot about my crippling depression!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you tried mediation? I started doing it several times a week and it soothes my anxieties a lot. Do you take meds for it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If by medication and meds you mean knocking out after chowing down a slice of chocolate cake, yes I have been for years!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love it! There's nothing better for a girl than chocolate cake with a scoop of ice cream on top! I have a great recipe for it, from my granny. It's moist and very heavy. .

s1.value: She's extremely shy but loves to spend time with her friends.
2. She loves to travel and see new things.
3. She is a true foodie who eats at all the best restaurants in the area.

s2.value: She loves Italy and the food there.
2. She loves her job and the people she works with.
3. She is very depressed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just lost my internship.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am so, so sorry to hear that, Kev. What happened?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I made a stupid mistake and they let me go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What mistake did you make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I failed to inform my superior about a mistake in one of my code which I later identified. I guess I should have communicated it as soon as I realised.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's okay, you didn't even know that you had made the mistake at the time of failing to inform? That isn't fair at all or on you. Everyone makes mistakes!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you for saying that. Sometimes you are your worst critic. I will just find another internship.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it's for the best. If it happened like this it is just a sign that there is better out there for you. I believe in you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks. How are you doing? how is your online business doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a little rocky, but hey that's part of being an entrepreneur right? Lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes but I am sure you will be successful. I envy you for being able to work for yourself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you! It's harder than I ever had anticipated and takes a lot more of my time, but I hope it'll have the payoff that makes it all worth it.

s1.value: I am from California.
2. I work full time as a high school Spanish teacher.
3. I worked as a high school Spanish teacher in the past.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a developer.
2. Speaker 2 lost her internship due to a coding mistake.
3. Speaker 2 is the owner/founder of Online Business Coach.
4. She works 4-6 hours each day to oversee the company.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you know a lot about designing video games?  That is really interesting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do. That's what I went to school for. It's a lot more math than you'd think. lol Are you going to watch that new Japanese movie tonight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to watch it but I am going on a trip so I won't have time. Have you gone on any trips recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nah. Still hoping to go to Tokyo someday soon. Where are you going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Going to see family in Flordia hopefully I'll have time to go to the beach while I'm there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice. That'll be fun. It'll be nice to get out of this cold weather for a while. Are you close with your family there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just distant cousins I haven't seen in a while but it'll be nice to catch up with them. Have you even been to Flordia?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I haven't. I'd love to, though. I wanna go to Disney! Have you ever been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I loved going to Disney, they all sorts of fun rides when I went. Whats your favorite type of ride?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love rollercoasters! The faster and scarier, the better. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Rollercoasters make me sick but I do enjoy bumper cars!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Those are fun. My mom and I used to ride them when I was younger. I hope you have fun on your trip.

s1.value: Do you know a lot about designing video games? That is really interesting.
2. I do. That's what I went to school for. It's a lot more math than you'd think. lol Are you going to watch that new Japanese movie tonight?
3. No. I am going to Florida.

s2.value: Speaker 2 majored in math in school.
2. Speaker 2 is a big fan of video games.
3. Speaker 1 has never been to the south.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was thinking about our conversation and I decided to get a little stricter with my diet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! If you don't mine me asking...How much weight did you gain?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: About 30 pounds. I really need to lose it. Do you have any diet recommendations?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. Cut down on sugar, white flour and sugary drinks such as sodas, drink more water and eat more fruits and vegetables.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good advice, thanks! I really love to drink Cola so I might struggle with that. Do you have a favorite fruit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. My favorite fruit is mangos and it's really good for weight loss. You should get back into ballet that'll help you keep the weight off too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like mangos too, I should eat more of them. I really should get back into ballet. I used to be really good at it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I know. You were the best! Would you like go out and get some Indian food? We don't have to give that up, we can just order the healthiest dish on the menu.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Aw thanks, that is so nice of you to say. I would love to get Indian food with you, are you free for dinner next week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. It'll be fun. You don't have to punish yourself to be healthy. Lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is so true. I look forward to getting a tasty butter chicken, that's my favorite! What is your favorite dish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. Butter chicken is definitely my favorite. We'll just eat it in moderation.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a professional speaker.
2. It is the best diet for weight loss.
3. Speaker 2 is the best person to discuss dieting with.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I recently lost 30 pounds. I need to lose more. What tips did Speaker 2 give you?
2. Did Speaker 2 ever tell you about his diet? What did it consist of?
3. What did Speaker 2 think of his diet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finished reading my book about the Great Wall in China.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did you like the Book? What did you learn about it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was pretty good. I learned a lot about how it was built and what went into it. What have you been up to lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been studying a lot. I'm currently in Nursing School.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is nursing school going? Have you you been doing anything fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's pretty difficult. Currently I am observing actual nurses when they are dealing with patients for all different types of things.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope you are learning a lot! I have been busy trying to learn a few new songs on piano.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What's one of the new ones you are trying to learn?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The song is called My Way by Frank Sinatra!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That's one of my all time favorite songs. I did it my way!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's my favorite song too! I also want to try and learn a Beatles song on the piano.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love the Beatles. My favorite song by them is Eight Days a Week

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a musician.
2. Speaker 1 is married to his wife. They have 3 children together.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a nurse.
2. The Great Wall of China is a popular tourist destination.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you like about golf and tennis?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think golf is relaxing to watch and it requires so much precision.  Tennis is really exciting to me!  Have you ever played either one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I used to play tennis a little bit but it's been a long time!  Golf I've never tried but it doesn't look too fun to me.  I really like snowboarding the best!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh, very cool.  I don't know much about that but it seems fun I guess.  i really just prefer reading and relaxing personally.  I'm not super active overall

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My favorite thing to do is to play blackjack, I always beat my friends!  So how long have you been studying Spanish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm very new to that.  I've only been studying it a year or so, so I'm not very proficient yet.  How long have you been teaching it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: This is my first year teaching it but I have been more or less fluent in it my whole life.  My mom is from Spain so I grew up speaking it in my home!  It's such a beautiful language to me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm really enjoying it so far and I agree with you!  And it's so useful too, I feel like everybody speaks Spanish!  That's really cool you grew up with it and started out bilingual, what an advantage!  I wish I was in your class?  Do you offer tutoring?  lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do that on the side, actually!  I've done that for several years but this is the first year I've had an official class, it's quite different!  What do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe we'll have to be in touch about that because I could definitely use the help!  I teach a science class!  That's why I'm able to sneak my students to the lake sometimes, we can talk about nature and ecosystems and things like that while we're there

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish I had had teachers doing cool things like that with me when I was in school, I would have enjoyed science a lot more if that was the case!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I try to be exciting so the kids have fun in my class!  Thank you for noticing that!

s1.value: Speaker 1: What do you like about playing tennis and snowboarding?
Speaker 2: I think snowboarding is relaxing to watch and it requires so much precision.  Tennis is really exciting to me!  Have you ever played either one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just went to a bakery here that you might be interested in visiting for a cake, next time you're in town.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of cake? I love pastries!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The most amazing red velvet cake you have ever encountered! It is definitely worth a trip up here to try it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm ready for a slice! So how's your brother doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He's doing okay. Back in school and struggling to make rent. But I'm trying to be emotional support for him. He just doesn't seem motivated. Thanks for asking. I know it's awkward for you since you guys used to date back in the day. But now that you are all married off, I guess it's not weird anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear he's not doing better. We stayed friends for a while, but I haven't heard from him in some time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, the 10 year reunion is coming up for you guys. Are you going to go? He's on Facebook but I don't think he goes on there much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe we can all get together and hit a local steak house! I'm hankering for a good martini and a big slice of prime rib, baked potato and creamed spinach!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, man, they that sounds like a plan. They have a new Brazilian steakhouse down the road from me called Fogo de Chao. Best steak you'll ever taste. Now I'm hungry. You should bring your wife, if you can get a babysitter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Grass fed, I bet. Yes, l can get a baby sitter. Let's do it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, when can you head up? how long a trip is it for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not long. Let me check with my better half. Nice talking to you!

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have been married to Speaker 2 for over 10 years. I love her dearly.
2. Speaker 2: She was my ex-girlfriend, which means I technically divorced her 10 years ago.
3. They are now both married and have children.

s2.value: Speaker 1 went to her brother's wedding. There was a new bakery there, and she ate a pastel-looking cake. dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I saw a news article about the royal family in England.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Interesting, what did it say? I want to go there so bad!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was talking about how the Queen has been in power for such a long time. I remember you mentioning you want to go there sometime.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah she has been around for forever. I'd love to go sometime. You bought a camper right? Are you planning on taking any trips?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I did. I love hitting the open road; that's why I became a truck driver.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Where's your favorite place you've been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Driving through Colorado is always pretty, because of the mountains!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet! Do you ever get to stop and hike or explore?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah sometimes, I really try to exercise at least 4 times a week. I enjoy it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good stuff. And you're a football fan right? Did you watch the Super bowl?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I did, I enjoy watching it on TV. Did you get a chance to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I did too. Who were you rooting for?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I saw a news article about the royal family in England.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I saw a news article about the royal family in England.
2. Speaker 2: Interesting, what did it say? I want to go there so bad!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you go for a hike this weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did go hiking this weekend. I've been going every weekend for awhile now. How is school going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: School is going great. Its just too much of homework since I am in 8th grade. What about you? Do you still go to college?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I finished up all of my classes. I finally got my degree in American Literature!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing. Congrats! You're so lucky to have finished college. What do you plan on working as?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I want to be a teacher. That is my dream job. Somewhere at a high school preferably.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great. My parents are both school teachers actually, but I don't know why I do find them quite boring. Maybe its their professional?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I could see how people would think being a teacher is boring but I find it very fulfilling. I'm part of an online teachers group and I've seen some very interesting people on there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's interesting. You're probably right. Its just everyone has a different nature I guess, but I am not even allowed to use internet. So, could teachers even be narrow minded you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think there are all sorts of teachers out there both good and bad. I hope you have good ones! You're still not allowed to use the internet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's correct! Yes, I am still not allowed to use the internet, and that is why I usually just tend to listen to music by Selena. Do you like her music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think I only know like one of her songs. I'm not the biggest fan to be honest but I think she did have talent.

s1.value: She wants to be a teacher.
2. She has been going to school for awhile.
3. Last weekend she went hiking.

s2.value: Speaker 2 was at a hiking trip last weekend.
2. She finished up her classes and got her degree in American Literature.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have started a Jane Austen book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you enjoying the book so far?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am greatly enjoying my new book. Do you have any plans to build any new furniture?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do! I am going to build a new table and chair set.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's awesome. How many people will it be able to sit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It will sit 6 people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Enough to have a small dinner party. Plan on cooking any ribs soon? I love smoked ribs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It will be an outdoor table I'm thinking about adding in a small fire pit to make it nice to use in the winter and more smores! I could build you a small table with a fire pit for your cabin cruiser!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that would be wonderful. I don't see land much so some normality would be nice. It would have to be a propane pit though. I think open fire would be a no no. haha. I miss doing land things like that, I miss playing tennis a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think I'd make some teriyaki favored ribs week this week. I could make one using propane! I wouldn't want you to have any problems! Tennis is really fun I played it a few times.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yum, teriyaki ribs sound delightful. I had a teriyaki pork loin a few weeks ago and it was to die for. I get really competitive at tennis, so if we ever play together, watch out. haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hear ya, nothing wrong with having fun, I jet ski every once and while and people out there can get that way trying to show off their skills.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We need to get together for a yoga class soon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds good to me just let me know when and where. Have you heard any new kpop jams lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! Yeah I have, did you see that the #1 Kpop band came out with a new album yesterday! Been listening to it on repeat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm going to have to check that out. Now I have some catching up to do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah you do! You can probably rock out to it while you're playing games! Any new ones that you're on recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nothing new but I have been playing a lot of Quake for probably too long as usual.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh nice! The new one or the old one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh the new one, Tournament Arena. It is a bit of an addiction. I need more yoga.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You'll have to show me how to play sometime. In the meantime, I think I can help you with the yoga! You should come by tomorrow morning!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds great. We will get our morning yoga on tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome! I'll turn on some kpop when you get here. See you then!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Can't wait. see you then.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you end up going to the craft show over the weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did get to go to one on Saturday. There were so many different kinds of jewelry and a lot of handmade quilts. I didn't get a chance to reserve a booth for me though to sell anything.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sorry about that. Is there another one coming up soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There is another one at the end of this month. I'm hoping my bracelets sell well! Do you or any of your children like jewelry?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I've been looking at your stuff and I love it! I'll definitely be in touch for my daughter's birthday. Do you want kids someday?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not planning on having and kids anytime soon. It will be years later for me once my boyfriend and I are married. Do you enjoy baking as much as I enjoy making jewelry?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Probably more! I love baking, just not the clean up

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can understand that! It's a lot more fun to make something than to clean up the mess we make! I really would like to try your lasagna sometime if possible. Is that your favorite dish to make or is it your favorite dish to eat too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'd love to make some for you! I do love it, but I can't pick favorites. How's Sunday sound?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sunday would be perfect! What time works best for you? Where do you want to bake at?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You guys can come over around 5 and I'll teach you how to make it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a wonderful idea! Let me know some things that your daughter likes and I can make some bracelets to bring along with me for her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've got to tell you about this book we're reading.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is the name of it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's called Twilight, have you ever heard of it? It's about vampires.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually have heard about it. I have seen the first movie of the series.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They made a movie about it???? I didn't know that. Was it any good (no spoilers though!)?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It actually was really good but I don't know how close it was to the book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's all very exciting so far. Lots of blood. Is that the type of movie that you'd normally watch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like the mystery genre, but I'm not crazy about vampires or blood.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cool! I end up watching kid's movies most of the time. Whatever keeps the little ones happy while I get things done.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love watching animated movies. Lion King is one of my all time favorites.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It makes me cry every time. Have you ever thought about making a movie of your own?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't because that would take a lot of time, money and expertise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you ever think about going back to Greece?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes i do. It is a beautiful place and i miss being there eating the food. How was your weekend? Guess you did a lot of cleaning.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yea, thanks for asking. I had a very busy weekend doing some cleaning, in fact I hope to complete it next week end. Did you get to learn how to cook some of the greek food

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes i have a few recipes but i was fond of eating and dinning out. Oh wow, your house must be really or the cleaning involves other things.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: oh I do too, wish I have time to cook my own food. Yes, I have been meaning to do a deep cleaning in my house and haven't had the time to, was very happy to get started last week. So how about you how did you spend your weekend

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that is nice. i'm sure you are doing a good job and will be done by this weekend. I spent my weekend at the beach and watching my favorite Tv series (The Blacklist). and also i dinned out. was a lazy weekend

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh lucky you, wish I can do that my self, anyway I have a vacation coming up maybe I can visit the beach, thanks for making me think in that direction

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hahaha you are welcome. what occupies your time? Do you have kids?/

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I do . Have 4 of them, they keep me very busy when I'm not working or have a project I'm working on. Don't what I would without them, they are my life. How about you ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awww that is sweet. Kids are a blessing. I have a daughter and she means the world to me and is also a handful, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's wonderful, as much as we complain about how busy they children keeps us, they are blessing indeed. I thank God everyday for mine. So you have anything planned this weekend, I know it's kinda of far to ask

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes they are. Off my head i am sure to be with my kiddo. But i also plan going to a resort even for a day. i love the beach side. and as usual weekends are for order in or takeout. what about you? ofcos asides cleaning and running around the kids

Speaker 1: Probably a whore

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How was your dive in the lake the other day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My dive was great, I got to spend time with my family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you see any cool fish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I saw really cool fish with many colors in the lake. It was really cold though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's very cool! Even though I live in California I'm afraid to go in the ocean, I'm scared of sharks

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am scared of sharks too! I never like walking my dog on the beach because I have a fear of them attacking me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes me too. I've heard many horror stories. What is your dogs name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My dogs name is Mike and he is a boxer mix. Do you have a dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dog is a mix from a shelter, I'm not sure exactly what breed shes mixed with, but she was supposed to only be 30 pounds max and she's already 60 pounds!!! She's a big girl.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet! My dog is a decent size because he likes to lay on my lap while I watch TV.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice. What TV shows are you into?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Mystery TV shows are my favorite, they really capture me and keep me watching. How about you?

dialogue.author: 21229: On
dialogue.text: ne advertising is already showing promising results.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great!  Have has your meditation been going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: it's on and off. kinda hard with so much going on you know.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense.  I am sure your job takes up a lot of time.  I have been interested in meditation, do you use an app as part of your meditation practice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a method that i follow specifically so i don't use any apps but i have heard some apps to be helpful. my friends tried a popular one and enjoyed it but still would rather do a public session in a classroom setting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice.  I will have to check out a public session.  This would probably be most useful for me to get started.  Do you use music as part of your meditation?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: sometimes. it's relaxing at times and other times it's a distraction. have you tried meditation before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I haven't tried it before.  It seems like it might be hard to stay engaged and I feel my mind would just wander.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: it happens more often than you realize how scatter-brained we are that we can't even sit still on focus on one task. lol...

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, that is true.  Even when I work it is hard for me to stay focused on my task.  So I know you said that sometimes you listen to music while meditating but what other kind of music do you like to listen to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: mostly classical, occasionally music from japanese animated films or movie soundtracks. rarely rock, except queen and journey. are those the rock music you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is maddie doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maddie is good. A terror sometimes, but she's older so it's to be expected. How are your dogs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How old is she again? My dogs are 6 and 7. It's a great age! Not too old to be concerned about and not too young to have to keep a constant watch on!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She's 10. I miss her being a puppy though. She always wanted to be cuddled, now all she wants to do is lay around and not be bothered. I've been thinking of getting another one, I love the puppy stages.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Puppy stages are great but they sure are frustrating! Cuddles are nice but I'd take the training of an older dog over a puppy anytime. What kind of puppy are you thinking of getting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love training puppies. They don't know anything so what you teach them is what they know. Older dogs have already experienced some training, you know the saying "you can't teach an old dog new tricks". I've been thinking of getting a German Short Haired Pointer or maybe another Australian Shepherd.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Training was frustrating for me! But I can understand why you'd like it. I did like that I got to train my dog how I wanted, it just took her a long time to learn. My other dog was older when I got her and training her was harder. Those are great breeds! Are they smart dogs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are both very smart dogs. I've never had a GSP, but I've had an Australian Shepherd and they are so smart. She would let herself out of the house whenever she wanted to go back inside. She was very protective and would secure the home all the time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that is very impressive! My dogs are poodles and they are both scary smart, but nothing as smart as that! I have thought about getting another dog for protection. Was your dog able to tell the difference between intruders and people who were benign?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very much so. She could also tell the difference between good people and bad people. People she knew that weren't very nice, she would nip them on their calves. She didn't trust them and there was a reason. I would just know to watch that person when they were around. Poodles are cool, my brother has a labradoodle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow!! I need a dog like that! Dogs truly are amazing. Poodles are very cool but not as protective as I would like. I still love my dogs, though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, dogs amaze me everyday. I've always been a dog person. They are my absolute favorite animal. Horses are my next favorite! Do you like horses?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cats were running around the house and dropped my favorite vase.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh no!!  Is it fixable or not?  I hate when my cats and dog do things like that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, no. It shattered into a million pieces. I made tacos to feel better about it, but it's not working. Maybe I need to try those asian tacos you're always raving about

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ugh, that's the worst, I'm sorry!  I hope it's replaceable somehow.  You should try them, they're so good!  Same idea as Mexican tacos but asian ingredients, they are yummy!!  Do you like cooking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do sometimes. I'll have to look up a recipe. How was your trip to mexico?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My recent one was so fun!  I went to Cabo again and it was so warm and beautiful, I already want to go back lol.  Have you ever been to Mexico since you like tacos so much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like such a great get-away. I have never been, but would love to. Not sure what I would do with the cats though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, you've got to go!  I like staying at all inclusive places so I don't have to worry about anything and it's all taken care of!  I can watch your cats while you go!  As long as they don't get jumpy around a friendly dog!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be amazing! I'll have to start planning. SO kind of you. They won't mind a dog at all. I've got to be near a beach. Whats your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You can totally count on me, never mind having more cats around!  There's a beach in Cabo called lovers beach, there's a big rock shaped like a heart and you have to take a boat into the ocean to get there, it's beautiful!  You have to take pictures to show me when you go!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely! I can't wait. I'll have to request some time off of work. I hope my boss doesn't have a problem with it. How's work been for you lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you're able to, I'm sure you deserve a vacation!  My work has been awesome, I love my job, teaching skiing is the best because I get to do what I love all day!   How's your job?  it must be hard to take time off as a secretary?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Tonight's episode of the voice was really good, did you see it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I didn't see the voice. What style of music did they do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There were lot's of different contestants and they did lots of different styles. You should take a look! What did you watch on TV tonight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually didn't watch tv last night. I had to help my son with his homework.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is really nice that you help with the homework! Do you find it easy or do you have to Google some things?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can help him with his English and Social Studies homework without a problem, but math is a different story.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know what you mean about the math! I really struggle with it too! How old is your son?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My son is 13. He's a good kid and does well in school, but still sometimes needs help and motivation to do his homework.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well all kids need motivation I guess! How do you motivate him? Do you offer a reward?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, positive reinforcement is the way to go. I usually take him to a movie or to a baseball game if he's done well for a couple of weeks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is really good that you can have that positive relationship with him! What does he want to do when he is older?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He wants to be a professional game streamer, but I've told him that he really needs a better plan. At this point, he's thinking about becoming a social worker.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you found any exciting restaurants today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I have been at home cooking mushroom ravioli, how about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, is it completely from scratch? I just got home from work and ordered some takeout.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I love to cook from scratch I love being in the kitchen.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish I could cook, but honestly, I'm fine paying others to do it for me. What else do you make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You could always learn it isn't hard and their are plenty of video's out their to teach you. I cook lots of different things I like to try to be as healthy as I can though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you ever tried cooking for Bella? Or do you just feed her scraps from your meals?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Some times I will cook her chicken and rice as it is good for her and she loves it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice of you. Do you have any pets? I'm not sure how you could work at an animal shelter and not end up with 101 pets.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Neither can I, yeah I have a dog do you have any?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, right, I meant other than Bella. No, it is just me. I'm not sure I could keep anything else alive. I once had a houseplant, and it died after 2 weeks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I bet your busy being a banker? No it is just me and Bella.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been practicing the piano quite a bit.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What songs have you been learning and are you talking lessons or solo practice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Learning some classical like Bach and Beethoven. I like the classical because they don't have words, my voice needs some work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Where did you learn to play Piano? I'm thinking of taking some lessons when I'm not working at the bookstore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My father made me take lessons growing up. I didn't like it when I was younger, but I guess I just grew into it. You should! Just practice, even if it's only for a few minutes a day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay, you've convinced me. I'm gonna sign up for lessons I'm my next day off. You're lucky to have you dad around when you grew up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to strike a nerve. Had you ever tried to contact or find him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's alright. I've just never felt the need to you know? If he wanted me in his life he would have stayed in my life when I was younger.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good attitude, you've done really well without him thus far, what more could he offer? And besides, you wouldn't have any of those tats if he was around!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha, that's true. Thanks for cheering me up. You're a great friend! On my next day off do you want to hang out and maybe play piano?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, that sounds great! I could teach you a little bit of it to start. You know, see how you like it? Was thinking of maybe getting a tattoo as well, and you could show me where you got yours

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure thing, I know of a great spot to get tattoos. The artist and great and welcoming

dialogue.author: 24824: Wh
dialogue.text: is the next poem you plan on writing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I was considering writing something in French. I usually write in English, but I thought I might enjoy the challenge. Do you think I could recruit your dad to read it to see if it makes sense when I've completed it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sure, he would love that. He has been really bored lately and would look forward to helping! He was in an accident and is on bed rest.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh Jane that's terrible! I had no idea. What happened to him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He was driving to the grocery store and a drunk driver hit him out of nowhere. It was in the morning so it was especially weird to be hit by a drunk driver at that time of day. Thank goodness he only has a broken foot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is good, it could have been much worse. Are you helping keep him calm and entertained by singing to him or anything?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I have been practicing singing and he cant get away from me, lol. I have the best audience because he cant go anywhere and is forced to listen. I have been making him nice meals too though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! What kind of food do you make for him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He would like to have french meals but I only know how to make Mexican, Italian and American food.

s1.value: Jane has been home all day with her father, who has been bed-ridden since the accident. Jane has been practicing her singing.

dialogue.text: Which 4 languages do you speak?

dialogue.text: Oh neat! I bet that was a fun experience. I have not, but I did see Michael Jordan at a theme park from a distance.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that was probably kind of fun. Which park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was at Six Flags over Texas on a family vacation when I was a kid. Do you like amusement parks?
