dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you taken any new pictures?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I managed to get out at the weekend and get loads of shots in the snow we had, I really want to upload them and start editing!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow you had snow!? We just had rain all weekend :) I managed to get some time to myself to have a bath and listen to the rain on the window! Did you have a nice chilled weekend? It's nice to catch up on sleep after a busy week!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Your weekend still sounds pretty nice! I find photographing quite relaxing so it felt like a chilled weekend, even though I was out early. Fresh snow is the best, harder to get crisp shots when it's been disturbed by other people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah it was lush thanks :) I did manage to get out for a few hours surfing as well - the rainy weather makes the waves bigger! What is your favourite subject to photograph?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hmm, tough question, but I would say currently it's portraits, I'm really getting into them and feel like my shots are getting better and better. I'm always looking for new subjects too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds really interesting - I'd love to pose for you if you ever need someone to photograph? Do you like taking pictures of animals as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, we could even do some in the rain, that's a skill i've yet to master, if you would be up for some trial and error.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oooh sounds amazing, I'm up for that! I've always wanted to get into photography, and it sounds like you'd be a good teacher :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do like taking photos of animals too, but they're not as good at taking direction. Goes with the saying don't work with animals or children LOL.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: haha yeah, weirdly i'm good with both animals and children, but not other people! That's why I like surfing, get to spend a bit of time by myself :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess we are all different. Animals and children are fine, as long as I don't expect them to listen to me, stick to small doses.

2. Speaker 1 is a retired lecturer from Ulster University.
3. Speaker 1 enjoys photography, surfing, and playing sport.

s2.value: Speaker 1 likes to get out a lot, and take lots of pictures.
2. Speaker 2 likes snow, and likes to take pictures.
3. Speaker 2 takes photos of animals and people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have finally finished unpacking from my move from a different state.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is fantastic. Are you looking forward to getting out and about and exploring? Are you feeling stressed or are you okay?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A little nervous to be honest.  I'm glad I got this job opportunity but I don't know  anyone here!  There's a local farmers market nearby that I'll hit this weekend.  Did you talk to your parents about your thoughts?  Did they understand?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not spoken to my parents yet. I am very nervous about it. Do you think they will understand? What is the job opportunity that you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The new sales manager for a small start up.  I know I can do the job.  Now I have to figure out how to navigate the city.  Thank goodness for GPS!  I think they would understand.  If you're nervous talking to them, I can come with you to offer support.  Have you thought about going to a councelor?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is great that you are starting to find your feet! You can do this, you are so right! That is a really kind offer, thank you. I have thought about going to a counselor but they can be quite expensive. Do you hve much experience with this type of thing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really.  For me it's just offering support and help to my friends when they need it.  Sometimes all a person needs a little reassurance and love.  If you want we can role play the conversation so you can practice what you want to say?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really like your stance on this. Okay that sounds great! Mom, dad I have something that I would like to tell you. Please can you sit down. I don't want you to be upset or judge me. I am having thoughts about becoming a different gender. How does that make you feel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: "We're a little confused.  When did you decide this?  Have you always felt this way?  Whatever you want though, we'll support you."

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have felt this way for a long time. Thank you so much for your support. That means so much to me and if you have any questions, please ask them and I will do my best to answer them. How was that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think that was perfect.  And remember, what ever the outcome, you know this is right for yourself and I'll be here for you.   You busy right now?  How about we meet up for some lunch?  You craving anything?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for all your help. I really needed this right now. I am actually quite hungry! Do you like Chinese food?!

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have finally finished unpacking from my move from a different state.
Speaker 2: That is fantastic. Are you looking forward to getting out and about and exploring? Are you feeling stressed or are you okay?

Did you talk to your parents about your thoughts? What was their response?
Did they understand?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I talked to my boss.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So have you put any more thought into dating your boss?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: His response to our talk led me to believe that there's not much future there. Now I'm stuck with a dilemma, do I change jobs now or see how things work out if I break it off?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hear ya.  I ask myself that question every day.  Running a deli is hard work.  I guess my best advice is to do what you think is right.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If only I knew! Too bad we can't see into the future. I suppose that running a deli is indeed a lot of hard work and long hours, am I right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You bring up a good point, for sure.  With raising daughters, which is a whole  challenge all its own...   I guess it's about just trying to set the best example I can for them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well it sounds like you're doing a great job. How old are your kids? Old enough to start thinking that Mom doesn't know anything?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think they started that when they were 5.  Anyway, Sally just turned nine, and Megan just turned 13.  Sally wants to follow her mom into the deli business.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: But Megan doesn't? She probably sees how much work is involved and decided to be a U tube star instead. She at that age.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Megan is at that age where I don't think she knows what she wants.  We've all been there.  When I was thirteen I wanted to be a pop  star.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes. I was a Heart fan and could see myself on stage with them. Oh, to be young again!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: This is so true, but honestly, I'm happy at the age I'm at.  Being a working professional woman these days...  It's tough, but rewarding too.

2. He has two daughters.
3. He dates his boss.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is the wedding planning coming along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really well! I have decided that a traditional wedding is not for me. Why do we have to adhere to this rigid structure of role and ceremonies? If im going to be shelling out all this money, I might as well do it the way I want

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes! If I was to ever get married I would want to go all out too. I want to do a destination wedding, where my family would have to fly there and meet us. How long did it take for your fiance to design your ring?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Months, he really wanted to make it personal. Maybe we are too focussed on doing things unconventionally, but its not a diamond ring. Its opalite, my favorite stone

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have never heard of that stone before. My boyfriend likes to give me ring pops and pretends to propose all the time. But we are still not married.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I think thats just the sweetest. I dont think a couple should feel pressured to rush into marriage, good things are worth waiting for

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree. I feel like if it is rushed it is fake. I do not mind waiting a few more years for that special day. How long were you two together before getting engaged?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: 5 years! We wanted time to travel around and really get to know each other. Now he's my best friend, and I feel like theres nothing I cant tell him

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish I could  be at the point where I told my partner anything. One day we will be and I am looking forward to that. Many good things will come to those that wait!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Exactly. Cheesy sayings might be overused, but they do make points

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know! I feel like I sound so cheesy sometimes, but they make so much sense and relate to many things in my life. How was it when your partner proposed? Were you surprised?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Suprised by the moment but not by the concept. We were seeing one of our favorite bands in concert, and he proposed during our favorite song. The band invited us up on stage, it was such a special moment!

Speaker 1: That is an interesting point. Are you ok with being on the road all of the time?
Speaker 2: Oh I would love to just be anywhere really. Theres nothing better than being able to travel and see the world. Where do you think we should have our wedding?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found a junk car in my dads garage.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you planning to fix it up?  If so, I can give you some tips.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I am not good at fixing cars. I was thinking if you want it? Are you currently working on any junk cars?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not working on any junk cars.  I would love to start a new one.  Have you taught your child any new dances lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My child just loves to dance with me. We are doing ballet these days. It is a bit tough for her but so far so good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds so fun.  I love to dance to my record collection.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Right! Nothing better than that. Dancing really helps lifting up my mood. What kind of records do you buy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really like vintage albums.  I try to get rare pieces that will grow in value.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great hobby I must say. Wish they had more stores selling vintage albums.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A lot have went out of business.  I travel around in my vintage car to find records.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds fun for sure. Have you been fixing any airplane lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do that every day at work.  You wouldn't believe how many problems airplanes have.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a friend that is wants to get into real estate. I will recommend you to him

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh really? Send him my way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Perfect. I'll let him know. How long have you been in real estate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been in the business for roughly twenty years which is almost as long as you've been alive LOL!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow. That's a really long time. You must be quite good at it. It seems to complicated to me honestly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's honestly not too bad, but it does get frustrating sometimes. I adopted a cat to help me feel a little less stressed since you said it worked for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It does. Cats are wonderful creatures for companionship and comfort. Most of my family loves dogs instead. What about your family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: If I had children, I know they would freak out ever time they saw an animal. However, all of my siblings are dog people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's something we have in common then. Though people tell me I'm a bit too young to be thinking about kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I believe you're never too young to think about the future, Speaking of the future, do you plan to stay in New York?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My young nephew just told me he watched Frozen, I bet your kids have watched it, is that a good movie? I will have to check it out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Frozen is a really great movie. That and Moana are both really great. What are you going to university  for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am a Psychology major. I would eventually like to be a therapist. Did you go to college?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a really great career to get into. I went to college and have my MBA.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I think so. Congrats on the MBA! What did you study?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a concentration in Health Care Management because I enjoy working in the health care field.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh very nice. You mentioned that you are a stay at home mom, do you miss working in the field or do the kids keep you busy enough to not think about it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really miss working in the field. My kids do keep me busy. They are in basketball and gymnastics.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh very nice. I used to do gymnastics when I was a kid. I am sure you have more than a full time job with the two kids. Would you ever want to go back to working in the field when your kids get older?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will for sure go back to work when they get older. Gymnastics is so fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats great for you. It is always good to have another avenue for your brain so that you can use that MBA I am sure you worked so hard to achieve.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did work hard. It took me 6 years to get.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went and bought some lilies yesterday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really, my boyfriend bought me some lilies one time, I liked them a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That was sweet of him. Every good woman deserves flowers from her man sometimes. The ones I bought were for decorating my house and giving it a little life.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well everyone deserves to take care of themselves and their homes too haha. You did very well I am sure they look pretty.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes. They look great sitting on my windowsill. I bought some roses, too, but I don't have a pretty woman to give them to, unfortunately.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aww that's fine I'm sure there will be one day. Roses are my favourite flowers btw.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah they are lovely and smell great. My dogs love the smell of fresh roses when I bring them home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh how are your dogs doing? What are their names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I have a lovely Alaskan Eskimo dog named King and a Pomeranian named Boo. I named the Pomeranian after Boo, the so-called "Cutest Dog in the World".

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aww that's cute. I've always wanted a dog, I think it's time I should get one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would definitely recommend it. Dogs certainly are man's best friend. What's stopping you from getting one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Since I work a lot, I thought I wouldn't be available much to a pet. If I get a dog I want to make sure I take care of it well.

dialogue.text: Where are you planning to go for the coming holiday season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully to the beach, I like it there. Where do you plan on going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A like the beach too but this time I am going to the mountains to see family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that seems like fun! What do you do on those trips?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually I cook lol! And take lots of pictures of different sites.  What will you do at the beach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully I will be able to get some nice camera shots of the nature and the sealife. I was planning on going with my friends to spend some time with them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun! You should be able to get some great shots at whatever beach you go to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I sure hope so. Beats working a shift at the pizza restaurant I work at!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I hear that! I like to cook don't get me wrong but I really like being at the beach a lot more!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is totally fair enough! Do you have any hobbies? I enjoy growing my own spices.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Actually I do! I have a garden where I grow vegetables.

dialogue.text: Oooo that sounds lovely! What types of veg do you grow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just went to visit my husband. I made sure to buy roses, he loved roses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's so sweet. How are you feeling?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel so sad. How is your husband doingÉ

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am so sorry to hear that. I can't imagine life without my husband. He is travelling for work right now. He has been in Seattle for the last week. I am afraid he might be cheating on me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Why do you say that? Do you have any proof?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He seems to be going to Seattle very often. Last time he came back he had scratches on his back. We haven't talked about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you consider hiring a private detective?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No that sounds too much. We have a good life together, I don't want to ruin anything by bringing it up. Did you ever have go through something similar?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. My husband was working as mechanic. He didn't have to travel. He was a sweet and clam man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is really sweet. Sometimes I wish I married a simpler man. Elliott is a nice man, but I wouldn't describe him as calm. He has fire inside him that I can't control.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If we have kids together, it might make him travel less. Did you try talking to him about having kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Perhaps. I am not sure he will be a good father. Or If I will be a good mother. He is distant and volatile. I am miserable.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey there! I've looked into adopting children since we last talked!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow, so you are ready to commit. Congrats! being a parent is the most fulfilling role you'll ever have. Have you spoken to the agency, yet? are you adopting outside of USA or inside?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did contact an agency. I'm going to get started on the paperwork. I will be doing it in the US, since I think its easier here than home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did they say anything about being only 20? Ive heard there is an, ideal age, adoption agencies look for? is that true? Great, many children here in the U.S that need a forever home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, I think it might be 25. I know its a long process though, so I'm getting all the stuff done that I can now. how is everything up north?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am wishing you the absolute best, have you told your family about adopting, how many are you seeking to adopt, again? Boy! its cold here, winter storms have been harsh here, I really want to move Hawaii, and not deal with iced roads and the SNOW!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They support me wanting to have kids. I think I'm going to start with one and see how it goes. That sucks about the cold weather. Did you get snow recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am so happy to hear, I always thought I only wanted one, and here I am with 3. They drive me nuts, but make life meaningful and purposeful. We got snow last night, we had to wait for the city to come out and remove the snow from our doors, it was awful, had snow alerts all night long. Are you adopting a boy or a girl

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really don't have a preference. I just want to give them a loving home. Having to wait to have the snow removed sounds awful. Do you have to shovel a lot of snow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was in the same boat, until I got my 2 girls back to back, after that I longed for a boy! and here he is, that little rascal. love him to death. It is, we could not open our doors, its a hassle to live in states where we have regular snow storms. Yes, I do lots of shoveling and removal of ice from cars too. do you deal with snow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We barely have seasons where I am. I'd love to see the snow some day, but I don't want to live somewhere snowy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Once you adopt you baby, trust me, youll have this need to explore the world and show your child the beauty the world has to offer. I did not feel like exploring the world until I became a parent.

s1.value: I have looked into adopting children since we last talked.
2. Oh wow, so you are ready to commit. Congrats! being a parent is the most fulfilling role you'll ever have. Have you spoken to the agency, yet? are you adopting outside of USA or inside?
3. Have you been to Hawaii?
No, but I'm moving there, soon.

s2.value: Speaker 1 wants to have biological children one day, but is open to adopting a child after marriage.
2. They have an adopted son who has been with them for 10 years.
3. They live in Honolulu, HI.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh sorry it took so long for me to respond, I am baking a cake and had to take it out of the oven.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of cake is it? I would buy a cake but I need to save my money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Just an ordinary cake for Sunday dinner with the folks.  I decided on yellow cake with chocolate frosting.  You know making cakes isn't hard to do.  I find it rather relaxing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know but I have no motivation. Nothing in my life seems to go right. That 3rd divorce was really hard. I don't want to split my money with my ex.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine.  After the first two divorces, it has got to be tough to go through again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How about you? Are you married? Marriage is hard I must say. They only want my money and not me. I hate it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not married.  Came close a couple of years ago.  I think my mother has given up on me and any grandchildren from me.  Luckily she has my sisters to pin her hopes on.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh what happened? If you don't mind me asking. I'm sure you will find someone so don't give up hope.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was a bit strange, we just kind of drifted apart.  Last I heard she is married with a child on the way.  I am not even jealous.  But yeah, I do keep thinking there has got to be someone out there for me.  I am sure there is for you too,

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey, this is kind of random but if you don't mind maybe we can get dinner sometimes? The restaurant I have in mind is near a theater too so we can watch a play there after dinner.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds great.  I haven't been to the theater in a while, so it would be a pleasure.  Is your dad going to be in it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nah, I would never go to a play with my father in it. I don't have a good relationship with my father. You seem close with your parents though?

s1.value: Speakers father is very ill and his last words are "I don't care how much money you got.  You can't bring this baby girl back to me. She will never be mine".
2. Speakers mother broke up with her last husband before and started a new family with Speaker
3. Speaker 1 is in her 60s for her age.
Why doesn't Speaker 2 get married? Why is Speaker 2 so disinterested in marriage?

s2.value: She has no desire to marry or have a family.
2. She has been divorced for 2 years.
3. She is looking for a boyfriend

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I also like to spend time with family and friends

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is that true or are you lying to me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I suppose you'll just have to trust me. Anything special you like doing with your family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We like to go camping and hiking. Our favorite place to go is Arches National Park in Utah. Do you have any places you like to travel to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I travel all the time, but to places you probably wouldn't know. Is hiking like a family tradition of yours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not a tradition so to speak. We moved out west about 15 years ago and just fell in love with the lifestyle. I grew up in Philly in a 2 room apartment with no siblings. We didn't get out in to nature a lot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to Philly last week. I decided to go by this theme park and got kicked off the go cart track. The kid running it was like "hey, no professionals." He's lucky I didn't slug him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably better that you didn't. You should probably draw the line at beating juveniles.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I suppose, have you heard the band Aqua is launching a new tour? I've got a friend who knows the singer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? They've lasted a long time for a one-hit wonder! I saw them once back in 99.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's great. I wrote a song for Dave Mathews band in 98, called Dancing Nancies, you ever heard it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have heard it but I'm pretty sure they wrote that themselves. Are you lying to me again?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I also like to spend time with family and friends

2. Is that true or are you lying to me? Speaker 1: I suppose you'll just have to trust me. Anything special you like doing with your family? Speaker 2: We like to go camping and hiking. dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you looking for a job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am. I've been looking for something where I can work in an office.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh okay. I know it is not an office position, but i heard my bosses talking about needing new construction workers on a new site we are getting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not opposed to that at all. But with being partially deaf, I'm a little worried about the construction noises and if I might not be able to hear hazardous things on the job site.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I definitely understand that. For the most part, we all have to wear these large construction ear protector muffs. They are like really big headphones, that protect our ears. However, I understand what you are saying about the not hearing hazardous things part. Have you thought about being a lifeguard, since you love to swim?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ya know, I hadn't even considered that. And there's a place near me with an indoor pool, that might be needing one. I'll give them a call. I have two small children to support, so I really need to find something.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect!! You should really look into that. Plus, i believe that if you work at a pool, you could get your children to swim there for free, or at least at a discount!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oooh, bonus! lol As for your new job site.  I was just thinking ... could you maybe get me some contact info for your boss? I['m not afraid of hard work, and even if I couldn't do the actual construction or loud noise part, you know there will be painting and things coming up once construction is complete. If I'm still needing something by that time, maybe I could do that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Honestly, yes that is a fantastic idea!! Plus, i don't know if you remember, but i work for seaworld. So maybe my boss could talk to one of the other bosses inside of the park and maybe you wouldn't even have to do a labor type of job after all. I didn't think of that until now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, that would be wonderful! I've visited SeaWorld a couple of times, and loved it. To have an opportunity to work there would be absolutely amazing! Thank you, so much!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No problem!! I will let my boss know and have him talk to the other managers. I will let you know as soon as I hear anything back.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be great! I know a lot of applications ask if you're bilingual, and knowing ASL is truly a bonus. Since I've been partially deaf since childhood, I learned sign language early on, and I also read lips very well. I really think that could be beneficial, because I know SeaWorld has very diverse visitors.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is half deaf.
2. They live in a seaside town.
3. They are both interested in working at a new construction site.

s2.value: She is partially deaf, and loves swim with the kids. Also she has read lips since childhood and is a native speaker of ASL.
2. Speaker 1 is a lifeguard.
3. Speaker 1 does not have children of her own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just sold a huge drawing and I think it has made a big advance in my career!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is so amazing! That's a huge breakthrough. What was it a drawing of?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was a landscape of the farm where I grew up. I really put a lot of myself into it. It was so nostalgic to draw and so rewarding to see it appreciated.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wish I could see it because it sounds special. Did you sell it for a lot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Only for $150. I know it doesn't seem like a lot, but the fact that someone wanted it and was willing to pay for it make me feel validated. I'm feeling really inspired and uplifted.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Selling your art is always a lot. I get it. My first painting I ever sold was for only $40. You should feel inspired!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks. I just want to get started on my next drawing now, but I'm having some artist block. Any ideas for some inspiration?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe try taking a walk around your neighborhood and look for anything that inspires you or sticks out to you. I like to go to the park at different hours to watch people for my drawings.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good idea. I'm not very good at drawing people, but maybe a landscape at the park will jump out at me. I'm thinking of taking a drive out to the mountains this weekend, so maybe I'll find something inspiring there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds perfect to me! Are your kids going with you to the mountains?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Of course! The love the woods. I figure I'll let them tire themselves out while playing while I take some photos of things I want to draw later.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you have a great trip!

s1.value: That's a huge breakthrough. What was it a drawing of?
1. It was a landscape of the farm where I grew up. I really put a lot of myself into it. It was so nostalgic to draw and so rewarding to see it appreciated.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I played basketball last night, and my team won!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! I'm happy for you, but can we talk about another subject?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks, and sure! How is college going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am still undecided in my major. Every time I try to decide I get so frustrated that all I can do is watch cartoons.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a tough decision. Maybe you could look into a major that has to do with animation or tv?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good suggestion. When I get frustrated, I should just go outside and look at the ocean instead of watching cartoons.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is a good idea! When I get frustrated, I hang out in my pool, where I can look out at the ocean!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You should have a pool party. It could be themed. Like 1950's themed. Do you like this idea?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am not a big fan of the old days, but it would be fun to have a themed pool party, I think! Maybe during the playoffs!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You just won a game, maybe it could be a themed pool party to celebrate your win!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have had those before, yes, that would be a fun idea! You could come and see my mansion, which would be quite a change from your small apartment, I imagine!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a date! Let's make a plan.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I played basketball last night, and my team won! Speaker 2: Wow! I'm happy for you, but can we talk about another subject? Speaker 1: Thanks, and sure! How is college going? Speaker 2: I am still undecided in my major. Every time I try to decide I get so frustrated that all I can do is watch cartoons.

s2.value: She lost her apartment because of her drug addiction.
2. She is working on a degree in animation.
3. She is still undecided about her major.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My kids just came to visit me two hours ago.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's great! Did they bring the grandson too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it was good to see him! He might come to bingo with me this week. Do you think you will attend bingo this week?g

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I think I will. It's always great when there are little ones around. Has he played bingo before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is great to hear! And yes, he liked to attend every now and then. It's nice to have the company.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How are your kids doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Doing well! They are thinking of traveling this summer. Speaking of kids, how are the ones you babysit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing great! We have lots of fun playing games and doing activities together. It's really nice to get paid for doing what you love.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Agreed! I do miss work sometimes, although I feel like a kid myself being at my nursing home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: In what ways is it like being a kid? Maybe I'd enjoy working at a nursing home then. I've been thinking about finding another part-time job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They provide lots of games and activities for us residents. I think you could enjoy it! I bet it would be a change of pace from chasing around young children, though. Maybe I can speak with an employee about opportunities at my residence!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think that'd be great! Thank you. Yeah, sometimes it can take a lot of energy to deal with the kids, so I think that'd be a good balance for me.

s1.value: Speaker 1 lives in a nursing home.

s2.value: She is the mother of two daughters.
2. Her husband of 44 years died 9 years ago.
2. She usually babysits her grandchildren for adults.
3. Her other kids just came home from school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just finished a long run. Time for a snack.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I love running! It's so good for both physical and mental health. I like to take my dog on runs with me. Where do you like to run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like running around the park that is near my neighborhood. It has a beautiful scenery

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds really nice. I like to run on trails in the woods. What kind of protein do you like to eat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I prefer legumes as they don't contain a lot of fat and they have adequate proteins and also some fish

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice. I have a good lentil "taco meat" recipe. It's basically a bunch of vegetables, mushrooms, and lentils simmered in veggie broth. Then you blend it up and put it in a tortilla. It makes a nice burrito.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: wow, that sounds delicious and healthy

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: If you want to look it up, google Ordinary Vegetarian super veggie lentil taco meat.  What's your favorite snack for after a run?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will definitely google it up. My favorite snack after a run is an apple and a sandwich. so what motivated you to be a doctor?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: As I went through school I realized that the easiest thing for me to learn was things about the body. I also knew from a young age, even when I didn't know what I wanted to be yet, that I wanted to help people. So it's really perfect for me since I am naturally good at understanding the information needed and I get to help people in the process. It's also a job that won't be automated away like many other in the near future.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You seem really passionate about your career. I've never thought much about becoming a doctor and i cannot see myself becoming one. i think think i can be a gym instructor because i love to run and exercising

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like it would be a great job for you. You could share your passion for exercise with others and help them.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I just finished a long run. Time for a snack.
2. Speaker 2: Oh I love running! It's so good for both physical and mental health. I like to take my dog on runs with me. Where do you like to run?
3. Speaker 1: I like running around the park that is near my neighborhood. It has a beautiful scenery.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a doctor.
2. She is also a gym instructor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I recently fell off of my horse and sprained my ankle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Omg. Are you ok? What happened? Is your horse ok? I know how close you are with your horses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My horse is fine, I think she laughed at me when it happened. So I was practicing barrels and when I made the turn I lost my balance and kind of got myself thrown off and landed awkwardly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no. Your ankle must be painful. I am brewing a new beer today. I wish I could give you some. That may help with the pain and discomfort.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet, I'd try anything at this point. What's worse, is we have a cheerleading competition this weekend and I'm not going to be able to compete with my team.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am sorry. I am sure you are diappointed, but you need to let yourself rest and heal. When do you think you will be able to be active and compete again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The doctor said to stay off it for atleast 3 weeks so hopefully it'll be healed by then. So tell me about your new home, any projects?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you feel better soon. I wish I could help. I am loving the new home, but it has been stressful. I feel like I have so much to do. I have been working on decorating it, which is fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet it is a lot, but once you have it set up exactly how you want it, it will be worth it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, right now I still have a lot of unpacked boxes and stuff everywhere. My boyfriend has been trying to help me sort out everything and deal with the chaos. He has been very helpful during my move.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good you have someone to help you and you don't have to handle it all alone. Why did you decide to move?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just felt I needed a change, something different. I really like to try new areas and experience and learn different parts of the country. I just needed some new fresh air. I hope you can come to Portland and visit me sometime.

s1.value: She is the owner of a horse, which she loves dearly. She is an extreme equestrian and likes to compete in barrel racing.
2. Her husband is the local director of the local college.

s2.value: She has a new home and decorating it.
2. She is working in her new job.
3. She likes to move to new areas.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found a new workout that produces great results!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh please tell me more! I might have to try it at the gym today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is all about finding a weight that you can do with very little effort and doing over a hundred reps. It gave me so much burn so much more than I ever have had.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow I've never heard of that technique. I typically do very heavy weights and very few reps.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did that for so long until I heard about this new method. I gave it a try for the past two weeks and have seen so much improvement.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Which muscles do you workout the most?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I mostly focus on legs but I am starting to focus all over.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yep I'm mostly a leg person too. You should try crossfit. It's great for full body exercise I heard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have tried but I just never could stick to it. I am looking for a new video game to play, what do you suggest?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just bought the new call od duty and it's awesome. I also enjoy NBA 2K! What kind of games are your favourite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I play  call of duty: war zone a lot. Do you enjoy the new game?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yep I love it. It's not as good as Halo but it is great for enjoying myself after work.

s1.value: Find a new workout that produces great results!
2. Do over a hundred reps.
3. Give the new workout a try for the past two weeks.

s2.value: Does Speaker 1 usually do very heavy weights and very few reps? No. Speaker 1 does the exercise known as "CrossFit"

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your saving for university going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: its going great! I got a job at my local grocery store after school and on the weekends and Ive been saving everything I have... Im thinking about dipping into that for a really nice prom dress though

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be a good idea! Maybe your parents can help you pay for the dress as well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I wouldnt want to burden them with that, I think it would be even more special if it came from my own hard earned money

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree! i think you will be able to save up enough for the prom dress and college!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope so I really dont want to take out any student loans

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea loans can get tricky when it comes to paying them back with interest added on. Better to not take them out but if you have to it is not the end of the world!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know its not the end of the world but i would hate to have to stress about it in the future

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea it can definitely be a stressful factor in the long run.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: how are the kids you babysit for doing

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are good! They have their moments but they are good for the most part! Thanks for asking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: thats great all kids have their moments, im glad they are doing well

s1.value: Its Speaker 1's birthday today!

s2.value: Speaker 2 saved up for the prom dress and college.
2. Speaker 2 is the mother of two children.
3. Speaker 2 works at a grocery store doing part time as a cashier.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do they have live metal bands that play there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are live bands on Friday and Saturday night.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun! Do you ever get to meet the bands that play at your work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sometimes, depends on how busy I am.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense. I would love to see live music at work, but that doesn't occur too often at the animal shelter. I do get to meet a lot of interesting animals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is the most interesting animal you have had at the animal shelter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I once met a 3-legged bearded dragon at the animal shelter while I was volunteering. He was very friendly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's pretty metal. I owned a chameleon once when I was in my early 20's. His name was psycho. I loved feeding him. watching the tongue snap the cricket was always fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Psycho sounds like a totally appropriate name for a chameleon. I bet feeding him was the best part for sure! I've fed a few lizards but never a chameleon. Do you have any pets now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I own a Pomeranian mix now, his name is Butters. He is really hyper, and irritable. He has the most personality of any pet I've ever owned.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love Pomeranians! I see a lot of those at the animal shelter. I hope to own a small dog when I complete medical school, but for now, I only own a few fish.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think fish are cool to watch, but I would miss the play time with them as pets if I owned fish. Although I thought owning a octopus would be really sweet, but they are expensive, hard to find and maintain. They are also notorious for being little escape artists.

s1.value: I am a vocalist in a metal band
2. I work at an animal shelter in Virginia.
3. I am a vegan animal advocate.

s2.value: He has a large collection of live instruments
2. He enjoys playing the guitar
3. He loves to play the piano

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My grandparents came to my choir concert.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great, I am sure they must be so proud of you. When I heard you singing the first time I couldn't believe how good you are.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! Maybe I can teach you next time, and you'll change your mind about singing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I think it's impossible to teach me how to sing. I am soo bad at it. If I went to X-Factor I would surely end up on TV, but for the wrong reason haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: LOL that is hilarious! Maybe you can go teach your dog how to do yoga and go to America's got talent

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha, that's actually a good idea. Maybe I will get rich this way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: When you get rich don't forget your old friend who's still living with his grandparents.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would never forget. For me friends are forever, whether I will poor or rich, it doesn't matter. How long are you planning to stay with your grandparents? Are you not thinking of something just for yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish I can. But I just lost my job recently so not much I can do about that. Maybe I should get some lottery and test my luck.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So sorry to hear about your job. I am sure you will find something else soon. Buying a lottery ticket doesn't hurt, someone has to win!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for cheering me up :) How's the teaching gig going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's going quite well to be honest. I have to say I am a bit surprised but I enjoy doing it.

s1.value: My grandparents came to my choir concert.
2. That's great, I am sure they must be so proud of you. When I heard you singing the first time I couldn't believe how good you are.
3. Speaker 2: Thanks! Maybe I can teach you next time, and you'll change your mind about singing.

s2.value: Speaker 1: My grandparents came to my choir concert.
2. Speaker 2: That's great, I am sure they must be so proud of you. When I heard you singing the first time I couldn't believe how good you are.
3. Speaker 1: Thanks! Maybe I can teach you next time, and you'll change your mind about singing.

dialogue.author: 15869: I
dialogue.text: st came back from pulling weeds from my garden and now I'm sitting down to enjoy a glass of wine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice, what kind of wine are you drinking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Masseto, it's a vintage from Itally. What kind of papers do you sell?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds nice. I sell newspapers and other magazines for work. It is not very exciting at times.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A lot more exciting than selling baby clothes, can't even get a good review from my customers. They mostly just burp and throw up at me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is funny, I'm sure their parents love you though! At least you can come home and relax in the garden. What are you growing this season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been trying to grow grape vines so that I can try making my own wine, it's kind of difficult in this temperate climate. I've also started growing beets since my wife like them, you know I can't stand them though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yes, growing grapes can be tough. My grandfather used to make his own wine in his garage. Although he didn't grow his own grapes. I have plenty of beets over at my place too if your wife needs some before yours start growing!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She's been craving them, I should come by and pick some up. Still watching Battlestar Gallactica?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, you are welcome to anytime. I am still watching it, I could watch it over and over again. Have you seen it before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've never gotten around to it, I'm still trying to get through Star Treck so my sci fi tolerance is near capacity. It's pretty similar to Star Treck right?

s1.value: The Speaker 1 was born in Italy.
2. The speaker 1 moved to Miami Beach in his youth.
3. The speaker 1 is married to Mary, with whom he has 2 children, 2 boys and a girl.

s2.value: Speakers 2 mother is a teacher and Speakers father is a pastor. His mother taught at Concordia College in St. Paul, MN.
2. Speakers mother is English and Speakers father is German.
3. Speaker 1 is a newspaper reporter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are things in Sweden?  Heard any good music?  Eaten any lutefisk?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sweden is beautiful!  I just got home from a nice hike and had some Marduk blasting in my ears.  Gets my blood pumping!  How has work at the store been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Never heard of Marduk! Work at the store has been pretty good. We have a new register system being installed which will make scanning easier for us so I'm excited for that. What's your favorite cupcake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are my favorite band.  They are a swedish black metal bad.  That sounds like it would really help out, will it be complicated to learn at all?  I really love little red velvet cupcakes, what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is super easy to learn, we already got the training last week. Now we're just waiting for installation. Red velvet cupcakes are delicious but I prefer chocolate or vanilla.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Anything else going on at work?  I hope they treat the employees right.  Chocolate and vanilla are classics, you can't go wrong with those!  Have you been hiking anywhere recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not much else going on at work. We have a new system for onlien ordering as well, b ut that has been going on for a few weeks. I have been hiking recently to Shenandoah. It's beautiful. I love the sunsets there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like life has been fairly good for you.  Where is Shenandoah?  I have never heard of it before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's in Virginia. It's a national state park. It is pretty popular here! Do you have state parks in Sweden?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have never been to Virginia, maybe the next time I travel to the US I will seek out the place you mentioned.  We have many national parks here.  Sarek is one of my favorites to go to!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice! Do you have any pets? My family loves hiking with our dog. He enjoys it very much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes!  I have a dog!  My dog loves coming with me too.  What kind of dog do you have?

s1.value: Is currently employed working in a retail store.
2. Has only recently been hired at the store following a training.
3. Does not like chocolate and vanilla cupcakes.

s2.value: Speakers 1 and 2 met at a conference.
2. Speaker 1 is a woman.
3. Speaker 2 is a man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've finally finished unpacking my new apartment.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is great!  How many rooms does it have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: 2 rooms. I've basically dedicated one of the bedrooms for my pets.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds nice.  What colors are you decorating with?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well my favourite colour is blue. So I think I will make the walls like a dark blue for the bedroom walls. What colours did you use?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My bedroom is blue!  My kitchen is the room I'm proudest of.  It is all in red, with an apples theme.  My husband thinks it is too bright, but I love it.  It is my favorite room, but I love to cook!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very nice. That's sounds super interesting. Well men and women definitely have different taste! I love cooking too... with the microwave.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like the microwave too.  I really like baking cakes.  I'm the one who makes them for all our families birthdays.  Once I made a Micky Mouse cake.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I loved Micky Mouse as a kid. I enjoy making red velvet cake, its so good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yummy, that sounds good right now.  Maybe I should bake a cake for dinner tonight.  What are you going to do for dinner?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be a good idea! I think I will make tacos, mexican is my favourite cuisine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that sounds good!  I like mexican too.  I love bean burritos.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has been married for 10 years.
2. She has 2 dogs named Tula and Peanut.
3. She is a huge animal lover.

s2.value: She is a petite, blonde with red hair, often topless, and a huge fan of the Jets.
2. She has been working in the sex industry since she was 17 years old.
3. She prefers men who are 6'4" or taller.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are you feeling today? What tattoo are you planning to get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm thinking about something conservation related. Like a depiction of Earth maybe and the words Love Our Planet. Or something like that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like that! I think that is a good idea. Do you have any other tattoos already?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, a Bible verse on my back. Laurel around my wrist. That's all. I don't want to go overboard, lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Those sound cool! I have been thinking about getting a tattoo myself. I do not have any yet. Do they hurt?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I don't want to scare you out of getting one, but yes -- they hurt like crazy. Some spots more than others, of course. The wrist actually hurt worse than my back -- more boney.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's what I thought! I wonder though if I would be able to sit through it or if I would be the person that passes out in the chair, lol. I would like to have a large piece done. Did any of yours take more than one session to complete?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, fortunately not. Both of mine are pretty simple though -- not too complex. What were thinking about getting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would like to get a sleeve done, but my arms are kind of small so I'm not sure how that would look. I was also thinking of a side piece, but I imagine that ribs would hurt pretty bad.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The ribs are supposed to be one of the worst spots -- might want to save that for later. Start someplace easier. What image are you gonna get, do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I go back and forth on what I want, but I think I have more ideas about things that I know I don't want, lol. Definitely something that makes people go "wow!"

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe the word "wow" then -- no, just kidding. How are your boys going to feel about their mom getting some ink done? Will they be cool with it?

s1.value: Is addicted to TV.
2. Has had a dozen tattoos
3. Loves children

s2.value: She has 3 boys.
2. She is having her first child.
3. She is in a Christian ministry.

dialogue.author: 9102: Do
dialogue.text: u and your brothers want to go to a football game?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I went with my brothers to the football game! How is your family doing nowadays?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Who won the game? How did it go? They are doing very well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My team won the game, so we were really happy about that. The game was fantastic lots of touchdowns! I'm glad they're doing well, are your parents still well too??

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Listen, my team is out, but I might be able to pull some strings if your guys make it to the Super Bowl. Just let me know! Yes they are fine, we're a little disappointed with the season obviously but healthy and happy otherwise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am glad they are still doing well. I hope your team makes it next season! Do you use special oil for your beard? How do you keep it so thick?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We'll try as hard as we can! Lots of people counting on us. I wish we were still playing now. And my beard? I should be asking you about yours!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah.. It happens to the best of our teams. Nothing much you can do other than hope for the best next time! Do you plan on changing hair colors any time soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hope and play hard! Can't wait to see the guys again. I don't think it's changing any time soon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah same here, I cannot wait till we see you back! We were planning on dying our hair for the next season! You should join us!

s1.value: He was a coach in the football team in his childhood.
2. He is now a private detective.
3. He lives in St. Louis and travels a lot with his team.

s2.value: He is older than Speaker 1 and is the youngest of the speakers.
2. He is from Miami, Florida.
3. He has a black beard that reaches his eyes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have finished my art project.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds really cool. What type of art is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enjoy creating pour art. my husband helped me on this latest piece and the colors we chose together look pretty good in my opinion. It's pretty hard to find time to ever work on it though with all of the kids

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How many kids do you have? I don't have any.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have 6 of them! It's a constant madhouse here so i really appreciate that my husband and I were able to set aside that time together. How is child free living?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, you mentioned the number to me before. I love child free living. I can spend all my money on myself! Just kidding, I have a big family so the money gets spent quickly anyway.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well if you ever decide on having your own kids I think I've got a few to spare haha. I was thinking of cooking some ziti tonight, I believe you said that was your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love baking ziti, it's my favorite. It feeds my big family easily.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you visit with your family often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A lot. So much that I have many chances to bake Ziti for them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's wonderful. I mentioned before that I love my friends and family so being able to visit and interact with them often is pretty important to me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I love to show my friends and family my game animations, they're always mesmerized.

s1.value: She is an artist who loves creating pour art.
2. She has 6 kids.
3. She has been married for 36 years.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I have finished my art project.
2. Speaker 2: That sounds really cool. What type of art is it?

3. Speaker 1: I enjoy creating pour art. my husband helped me on this latest piece and the colors we chose together look pretty good in my opinion. It's pretty hard to find time to ever work on it though with all of the kids

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had to hide my cats when my RA came and now I've seem to have lost one!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh no! You should try leaving an item of your clothing somewhere. Cats have a good sense of smell so your cat could find you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats a good idea!  So tell me about this chasing cheetahs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's all about conservation. There are fewer and fewer cheetahs in the wild so it's important to catalogue them so we can keep an eye on the numbers. My team and I chase them down in a truck, catch them with a big net and then put a geotag on its ear.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that sounds like exciting work.  is it dangerous?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a little dangerous. A couple of years ago, one of my colleagues got scratched by a cheetah and lost their eye.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't think i would be brave enough.  have you evver been hurt?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been lucky, just a few minor scratched from some of the cubs. They are pretty cute, just like a bigger housecat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love cats so I would love to play with the cubs.  I see you run track.  what is your favorite event?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been getting into running hurdles. Its just fun until you hit your knee on the hurdle! What sports do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love gymnastics.  I aam always amazed at what they can do.  Hurdles are really awesome.  I don't know how you do it

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Gymnastics must be surely difficult. I like to watch gymnastics when the Olympics is happening. Can you do any gymnastics?

s1.value: I had to hide my cats when my RA came and now I've see to have lost one!

s2.value: Speaker 1: I had to hide my cats when my RA came and now I've seem to have lost one!
2. Speaker 2: My team and I chase them down in a truck, catch them with a big net and then put a geotag on its ear.
3. Speaker 1: I had to hide my cats when my RA came and now I've seem to have lost one!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you done any sightseeing in Japan lately? Which city?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm there right now! I'm currently touring Osaka.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very nice! I would love to see Japan. Hows the food? I imagine the access to fresh sea food to be spectacular.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The sushi is incredible! They have American fare as well which might appeal to you. They also have great birdwatching.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The birdwatching would be exotic compaired to what I'm used to. And sushi sounds wonderfull too! I may like hotdogs, but thats not all I like.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is your favorite place to bird watch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: In the dunes on Lake Michigan. It's got a variaity you don't see many places. Does being in Aisa make you miss home?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really. I work remotely so I can be wherever I want. I like the adventure. If I'm home too long I get stir crazy. What is the best trip you've ever taken?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: San Diego was a good one. I've been into Canada a few times and I really liked that. But never off the continent. Someday I will go to Aisa. Is it easy to put in hours while traveling?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I just remote in and do my work. I spent 6 months in Italy last year. I love it. How do you like being a librarian?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its fun. More interesting than it sounds. Everyday I get the chance to learn new things and meet new people. Maybe not as many as yourself!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like a great place to be since you enjoy reading so much.

s1.value: Visited Osaka with his sister last month.
2. Lives in Seattle, WA.
3. Also enjoys a good sushi roll.

s2.value: She is currently touring Osaka.
2. She is from California.
3. Her favorite music is classical music, which she likes to listen to while working.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Went to the cheesecake factory and had the best cheesecake

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is pretty dope. I love getting high and going to each cheesecake. Mostly cause my kids are a disappointment. this is also why i drink scotch.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that's a lot of stuff lol! We should definitely get together and eat cheesecake sometime!  Do you have a favorite place to go eat it and talk about your disappointing kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cheesecake factory. They serve alcoholic beverages there and the cheesecake is pretty good. I like your idea we should definitely go do that. Are you busy next week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is the best! I usually have a pretty flexible schedule and I can always make room when cheesecake and gossip is involved.  Maybe I could get some good material for some of my stand up bits if you tell me some stuff about your kids we ca laugh about.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a plan I feel like someone should profit off my Missouri I mean I am rich and all that happiness and my wife is pretty hot but when your kids are just a disappointment what can you do? Get drunk and go home and plough your wife again I guess.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well if she's super hot that definitely sounds like some silver lining I guess.  I wouldn't complain about that aspect at least!  I am always looking for fresh material so it sounds like it might work out in my favor too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree. What do most of your bits centre on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually on things that have happened in my life.  A lot of comics use situations other people have had and I do that occasionally, but it's always a but more real and funny if they are your own experiences.  I talk about my parents a lot since they don't really approve of what I do anyway lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was going to ask about that; why do they not approve?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They just don't think it's a respectable enough way to make a living I think.  They always wanted me to be a doctor or something but they feel like I've failed at life.  I enjoy making people laugh and be happy, it's fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I mean; How do you make enough money and don't ask them for handouts right? If that's the case they have no reason to be ashamed of you

s1.value: Speakers name is John Poynter. John Poynter is the President of the St. Louis Metropolitan Council which is involved in many of the issues that affect St. Louis.  John was born and raised in St. Louis.  John was raised Catholic.  His family is very proud of him and what he has accomplished in life.  John is a Democrat in St. Louis and the owner of a coffee shop in St. Louis' West End.  Speaker 1: He owns a coffee shop.  That's awesome! I love coffee! I also believe in the public financing of campaigns. I feel like the only way to get involved is through supporting a politician who will work for you!

John is a great dad and great husband.  He is a fantastic father of 4, and he and his wife are doing very well as an older couple.  He is very active in his church and his community.  He is not only a great father, but a wonderful community member.
John Poynter III - a very close friend of mine.  (This paragraph has not been edited for formatting, grammar, or spelling)

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a comedian.
2. Speaker 2 went to the cheesecake factory and had the best cheesecake

dialogue.author: 20252: Ho
dialogue.text: is your wife doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks for asking Becky, she's actually doing a lot better since the last time we've talked with you. Seems like chemo is really helping here. My kids are still shocked by the whole thing, but I hope we will get through it. How was your day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's really great to hear, it's such a shame what has happened but you guys have so much strength it inspires me! My day was ok, I spent most of it doodling anime in my notebook! Did you listen to any Folk music today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, nice, I'd love to see them if I can! My younger daughter is into anime, I think she'd like your drawings too :) Yes, I'm listening to it almost every day. Helps to start the morning just right, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah of course, next time you come over I'll show you my whole notebook, there's loads!! How old are your children? I would love to meet your daughter and draw together :) I like it when my parents listen to Folk music, it helps me relax before bed! Who is your favourite artist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great, will try to remember that! The boys are 9 and 11, my daughter is 15. Hmmm let me think... Bob dylan and Leonard Cohen are the best for sure. What about your parents, who do they listen to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yes, I love Bob Dylan, he's my favourite :) My parents like him too so they quite often listen to him! I have soccer practice this evening, i'm really looking forward to it .. do you play or watch soccer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds cool, I hope you will have fun :) Nah, I know you're into soccer, but my passion is martial arts. Wanted to get into it since I've been a kid, watched a lot of karate movies haha. How did you get into soccer?

s1.value: They are originally from Wisconsin
2. They have 2 kids
3. They live in a small town
4. They are a soccer team

s2.value: Speaker 1 and Becky's husband were killed in a car accident.
2. Speaker 1 started doing a weekly show with his band.
3. The show was a success and he began touring with his band.

Speaker 1: My day starts with a nice run around the neighborhood, it helps me wake up and stay focused. I have been doing this since I was a kid too, it's very relaxing. I have been training for the past year but I'm not an expert yet :\ Do you play any sports? Who is your favorite sports star?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good Morning, how did you do with the grease solvent?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its looking promising, I'm currently experimenting with a new prototype that looks like it needs a bit more refining before it could be put out on the market.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats good!  How long have you been working on this project?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: For about six months or so, I was given the task by my company based on my past performance on similar projects.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They must have a lot of faith in you for this project then.  I hope what you come up with will be better than what is currently available, would be so nice to have an easier time cleaning up grease.  Anything new going on in your life other than that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been trying to work out more often, as I want to build some more muscle and generally tone my body.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's an activity I can always approve of.  I'm a bit of a health nut and love to exercise any chance I get.  Have you been getting the results you were hoping for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its been going alright so far. I have been trying to drink a protein shake after my workouts, and I have noted that I gained a bit of muscle in my biceps.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long did it take from when you started trying to regularly work out and started seeing results?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It looked like to be under a month before I started to see some results. I think it was around 2 weeks where I noted that I felt stronger, especially in my arms and my legs while doing the workouts.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: People tend to give up really early when they don't see results after their first few work outs, they need to realize that it takes dedication and sticking with it and once those results start showing up it really gives a good feeling and becomes another good motivator to continue.  It's great that you didn't give up and before you know it you'll have the body you were hoping for.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree, even if I do get the body I want, I think I am going to keep at it to maintain it and to stay healthy in general. I think it would be a good idea for me to also think about eating healthier, whether it is from a diet or counting the calories I eat.

s1.value: Speaker 1: Good Morning, how did you do with the grease solvent?
2. Speaker 2: Its looking promising, I'm currently experimenting with a new prototype that looks like it needs a bit more refining before it could be put out on the market.
