dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Guess what, I just got a membership with my local pool!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! So you'll be able to spend even more time swimming.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely! I am thinking about taking up teaching it too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be very rewarding. What ages do you want to teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmmm, I think it would be good to get young kids interested.  That way maybe I can help them to get a swimming scholarship or something.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it is great to get them used to the water at a young age. It diminishes the chance of an accidental drowning.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is very true.  Learning about the dangers of water at an early age is a good thing.  You know, with your pool you could teach a class. Have you considered it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have considered it but I don't know if I have the patience to teach other people's kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it does take patience to be around kids.  Hey, does your dog swim?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, he adores the water. Sometimes it is hard to get him to leave the pool.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hahaha! I would love to see that! I have a cat as you know and he hates the water!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not surprised lol. Cats that like the water are few and far between.

s1.value: Speaker 1 loves swimming in the pool and teaching swimming lessons.
2. Speaker 1's dog swims in the pool regularly.

s2.value: I just received a membership to a local pool.
2. I want to teach children at some point.
3. My dog swims and likes it.

dialogue.author: 21343: My
dialogue.text: abysitter is available this weekend, Where is your sister's band playing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My sisters band is playing at a bar called 'The Dive', I plan to attend. If your baby sitter is available, would you like to come?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun! What kind of music is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Her band is into rock music, they sound a bit like the Arctic Monkeys actually. The bar is a little sketchy though!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, like an indie rock vibe! Sounds good. I'll see if my husband can take us and pick us up to be safe! How's the tutoring going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Tutoring is going great, I have a lot of new clients and starting to get a hang of the online sessions. Did you see he Miss America episode last night? Scandalous!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Technology is so handy these days. And I just about caught the end! Pretty shocking twist! Reminds me of my youngers days but we behaved better for sure!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes my god I just stay home and knit every night, they are so buck wild on that show, I almost feel guilty while watching it. How many pageants did you win back in the day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you knitted anything pretty lately? I remember that jumper last year - it was so impressive! I won a few pageants but it was a lot of pressure from my parents.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I knitted a few hats and scarfs the other week while reading, I can give you a set for Owen.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be great, thank you so much! I can pay you for the wool and your time. Do you have any red wool?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just painted something I'm really proud of. I'll send you a picture.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great. What did you paint?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I painted a picture of cookies and ice cream. I was inspired by last night's dessert. Do you like dessert?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, especially cookies! Is it an oil painting or a watercolor?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oil painting. I love watercolor too, but wasn't in the mood for it. Tell me more about your photography!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do landscapes, mostly. I used to go hiking with my old boyfriend and he introduced me to photography.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds fun! Glad you got a nice hobby out of the relationship.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah. I still miss him sometimes - maybe I should have taken up portrait photography too, so I'd have more mementos of him!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Why did you break up? Any chance maybe you would get back together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He got the chance to go study art in Europe, and I couldn't go with him because of my job. Maybe he'll come back some day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You never know. The future may bring you back again!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope so. In the meantime still have good friends like you - that counts for a lot!

s1.value: Speaker is a model.
2. She works at a travel agency.
3. She is a wife and a mother with 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls.

s2.value: She is single, and lives on her own.
2. She graduated from college in 200
3. She makes an average of $40 hourly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a new vegetarian recipe for you to try.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great. How is your cat doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cat is doing so well. I'm sure she can't ask for a better friend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is nice to hear! I'm sure it must be hard sometimes given your fear of germs. I'd love to pet her sometime she seems lovely.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it can be exhausting sometimes but i'm learning everyday

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I absolutely love all cats, so I'm glad that you are able to manage.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you plan to have your own cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hopefully one day yes!! As long as it doesn't interfere with my guitar playing then I will.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That will be lovely, you can always play to her while she listens. You can as well write a song for her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I'd love to write a song for her. Maybe I can play for you sometime as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so thoughtful of you. I will really appreciate it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course! We could even try that new vegetarian recipe.

s1.value: My cat loves to play with my guitar.
2. I love cats and don't want to adopt a new cat.
3. I am currently working on a new vegetarian recipe.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been to any antique stores before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not been to an antique store, but I watch Antique Roadshow on PBS. And I have purchased from an estate sale before. I hope I got something good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a fun show to watch. I watch it all the time. Do your daughters watch it with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It really is great, and they do! They enjoy it too. Have you been to any new antique shops lately? Picked up any special items?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't been able to go lately. I've been too busy with work. I miss going though. Have you been mountain climbing lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we just did Mount Whitney, California. It was absolutely astounding. You can not image the view from the top.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing! Did your friends go with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I had my friends there too. We all love it. This canyon view of the sunrise is irreplaceable.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds beautiful. Are your daughters into mountain climbing as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we all do it together, they love to trek with me on the trails.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How old were they when they started?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My youngest was 8 and my oldest was 13.

2. Have you been to any mountain climbing lately?
3. Age of your daughters?

s2.value: He watches Antique Roadshow on PBS with his two daughters.
2. He has purchased from an estate sale before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite thing about living in San Francisco?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess I would have to say the people. We have the most interesting mix of everyone . I love the diversity . Do you see that a lot in New York?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah it is pretty diverse in New York as well. But i felt like it might be more fast paced in New York. Speaking of this, there's actually a snow storm here....

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love the snow. I was in Pennsylvania last winter and it was beautiful . but brutal . Are there things to do in the winter time there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah you can always go skiing if that's something you're interested in? Or it's snows, build a snowman. :) What do you do in SF during the winter time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its mainly just rain here in our winter months , so life doesn't really change with the seasons much. I did get to build a snowman in Pa, But I dont think I would be very good at skiing .

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually did a road trip a couple of years ago and drove from SF to LA through route 1. It was beautiful. SF is a pretty unique place, housing prices are so expensive but salaries are pretty high too for people working at the high tech firms. If you come over to PA we can meet up again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes. Its not far at all. Considering you have a gay friend , I assume that you are opened minded and respect different type of people , I think we would have lots of fun .

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes!! Are you gay if you don't me asking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am actually , But I just love meeting interesting people with interesting stories . Oddly enough I am not big on the gay scence , as in clubs and such. I like to go where there are many types of people..If that makes sense.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! Did your parents react fine when you came out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was lucky in that way . Most people supported me. Unforunantly thats not the case for everyone. Thats why I love diverse places like SF and New York. I def have to pay a visit there.

s1.value: I have a gay friend.
2. I live in San Francisco.
3. I have 3 kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have packed up all of my belongings and I'm ready for the flight!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know you're excited for you trip.  Are you taking your own ski equipment or are you just going to rent some there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm taking my own. I'm so particular about my stuff! How has work been? I need to find some books for the trip.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love my jobs.  I'm surrounded by books all day and talk novels non stop all day with our patrons.  What genres do you like to read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like a lot of history, nonfiction. I've always loved libraries. I would love to work in one someday. There are some amazing ones back home in Russia. Just huge!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet they're gorgeous.  Let's see.  I just read an interesting bio on Prince Charles that you might like.  I'll make a list of other possibilites and will email them to you.  Have you given any thought by trying snow boarding this time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I thought about it, I'll see how I feel when I get there. I would love to read that biography, thankyou! Eaten anything good lately? It's been a while since I had Italian.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a pan of my mom's lasagna in the oven right now.  It's always a hit with company.  Do you like to cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I try, I'm not great at it though. Could you send me the recipe for that lasagna? Nothing like mom used to make, huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Absolutely.  I'll add it with my book recommendations.  I'm sure you have a few traditional Russian dishes you can make.  Come to think of it, I don't know if I've ever had Russian food.  Is is spicy at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It can be a little, but nothing compared to Indian or Mexican food. We'll have to do a recipe trade, I would love to share some of my most favorite comfort foods with you!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's sound like a plan!  How do you feel about desserts?  I have a cannoli recipe you might like.

s1.value: She's from Russia.
2. She worked as a schoolteacher.
3. She's the author of the classic book, 'I Know Where I've Been and I Know Where I'm Going'.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Something funny that my pet did an hour ago.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Please tell me! I love hearing crazy pet stories.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: my poor hampster got on his wheel with ALOT of energy and he ended up going so fast that he flipped out of it and hit the wall of his cage and tried to play it off, went back to the wheel and slowly started walking on it

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hahaha. That is hilarious. Atleast it didn't hurt him and he got back on.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: he was not phased at all but he definitely slowed down

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He learned his lesson lol. Do you ever get to go back to Greece?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I try to visit my grandma and the rest of my family at least once a year. what about you? do you still have family in greece?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's cool you still visit often. My family all left at the same time so no one is there to visit but I would love to go back sometime. Maybe we can plan a trip together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that sounds awesome my grandmother owns a vaction house that she usually rents out but keeps clear when I want to visit, we could have alot of fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would very much enjoy that. Maybe next summer would be the perfect time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: that sounds great! there is a awesome pool at the home. do you still speak greek at all or are you a little rusty?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm still pretty fluent but I'm sure it's not as good as it was. A pool does sound awesome by the way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are things going at the animal shelter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Pretty good, there are some good days and some bad. This week has been good

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great!  How ofter to you volunteer there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I try to go at least 3 days a week. There arent many volunteers and the animals need all the love they can get in there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nursing school keeps me busy, but in my free time I might like to volunteer at the shelter.  Would it be a good stress relief?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh yes, when you volunteer, you dont have to do anything you dont want too. You can just walk the dogs if thats all you want to do. How much longer till you graduate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have another 8 months and then I am done!  I would love to walk the dogs, that sounds fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, its a great stress reliever. Cleaning pens isnt fun, but the dogs are so lovable walking is the best part

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I love dogs.  "Nursing" dogs may be easier than nursing humans!  How can I apply?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, they dont complan at all LOL. Its super easy, just call the shelter and ask. They will have an orientation which is like an hour then you can just show up whenever you want. Its super easy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great!  I will look into it.  Any travel plans?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, im going to try and go to Nashville and see what country singer concerts i can attend. How about you?

dialogue.text: oh i love yorkies and nice to meet you jill. I go to rhode island state

dialogue.text: Stay patient, you will get there.  What do you do at the Doctor's office?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You been getting enough rest lately? your job isn't too stressful right now is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was able to get in a good nap. Work is actually picking up with tax season knocking on our door. Do you dabble in tax side of accounting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been doing my own taxes for years. I rather do it myself than pay the accountant!  What do you do for a living?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am a financial advisor. I work closely with my clients accountants. I take care of the common sense side of things.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice! I do need a financial advisor myself.  I am an engineer

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet that keeps you busy! My brother is in his last year of engineering school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats great! final stretch. what is he studying

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know it's engineering, but not quite sure of the specifics. Have you been to Florida this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't been there in months. Anything crazy going on in Florida?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, thought you might have been on one of your weekly trips there. I know I personally like to travel

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been travelling to Atlanta a lot.  I will go to Florida again next month

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am looking for a new book to read. Do you like to read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are the kids? I hope they haven't caused you too much trouble. Are you still thinking about getting a cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My kids are fine, I just put them down for a nap. I am thinking very seriously about getting cat, what do you like about them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love snuggling up with my cat while I watch TV at night.  I guess you have all the snuggles you need from the kids!  : )

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You can never have too many snuggles, in my opinion. I love how independent cats are and how low maintenance. What are your favorite shows to watch on TV?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have actually found a show on Hulu called Alone where they drop 10 people off in the wilderness and see how long they can live off the land.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds really interesting, a real sink or swim type situation. Have you ever been camping in the wilderness before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been camping with the scouts, but I prefer a nice warm bed after a day of outdoor adventures.  Do you like to have outdoor adventures with the kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The kids feel the same way as you do, so we've never been camping but I love to take them hiking so they have an appreciation of nature.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love anything near the water, but every time we go to the beach, I remember why I don't like sand!  Do you like the beach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have never been someone who likes the beach, because I get sunburned easily. Anything on the water I am a fan of. Do you own a boat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't have a boat of my own.  I like the idea of going out every now and then but owning a boat is a big investment!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it is, they say the happiest days of a boat owner's life is the day they buy the boat and the day they sell in. I own a canoe and I like to take it on trips to the lake or nearby rivers.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I think owning a cat is a great idea, I'm hoping to adopt a cat soon. Maybe I should get one. I like being able to sleep and sleep a lot. I also think cats are great companions. How about you? Do you like your kids?

They love to cuddle up with me. I do not own cats. Speaker one: What do you do for a living? Speaker two: I am a computer software developer. Speaker one: What kind of cat do you have? Speaker two: I have three cats, I am used to them. They are very low maintenance. They love to cuddle up with me. I do not own cats.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been very busy at the coffee shop lately.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Where do you currently live?  It's always good to have a business that is busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I live in Dallas. My parents came over to the U.S. when I was 6 years old. Where do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is great.  Do you like Texas?  I live in Orlando Florida.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love it because I feel like I'm centrally located. I used to live in Florida and any time I needed to get to the west coast it took forever. Do you like the humidity?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I have learned to live with it.  Not my favorite, but I have family up North right now in 2' of snow, so I will take the hotter summers.  So have you adopted being a Cowboys fan?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No I'm more of a AC Milan fan. I never got in to American Football. I have other relatives that immigrated to Italy and I speak fluent Italian.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that is awesome.  Have you ever been to a Milan game in person?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Si! 4 years ago at San Siro! Former Milan legend Kaka played in your city for a bit at Orlando City. Have you been to a game or do you spend all your time at the comedy clubs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Most of my night life is in the clubs, but I did actually make it to a Orlando game, but can't say that I remember Kaka because I just don't understand soccer that much.  Have you ever been to Italy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah several times. They have great coffee. It's a little different than Colombian but it's really a treat.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree with you there!  How long have you worked in the coffee shop?

2. Speaker 2: I live in Dallas. My parents came over to the U.S. when I was 6 years old. Where do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My son is with his dad for the weekend, so I get a much needed break!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I could do with one of those! What are you going to do to let your hair down and relax?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A spa day! I'm planning to get a manicure and I've already booked a session at my favourite spa! As much as I love my son, he can be a little much sometimes. How are your two sons doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The youngest Dunc is doing brilliantly well, he's top of most of his classes and has just won a scholarship to quarterback at Ohio State.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great to hear! I'm not the biggest fan of sports however I know how amazing that is! How are things going with your husband?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, that brings me to the other son, he livesin our basement, he's 38 and he barely leaves him room. Hes disgusting. He's putting a real strain on mine and my husbands relationship. Weve been arguing a bit, but we dont even feel comfortable doing that because our son is around. We cant even argue in our own home!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Jesus, I'm assuming he's your stepson as you couldn't have had a kid at 2. That's a real shame, I can see who has the good genetics then!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, he is from my husbands first marriage, but his mother ran away with a zoo keeper when he was 5 so he sees me as his mother. Yeah thanks, i think he takes after his mother to be honest, he is very dishonest.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh. Don't worry too much about it as its clear to me that you're great at raising kids. It's hard for me to find time for myself and I'm having a little trouble with friends. Do you know any tips that may have helped you?\

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Since you have the time without your son so rarely, i would go out and really let your hair down. Id go to a nightclub, seee how many men i could get to buy me drinks, see if i could find myself someone that was doing well for themselves. That's how i met my husband.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've tried that however many don't want to settle with someone who has a kid. I want something long-term.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you tried craigslist? Iv not been single for so long im maybe a little out of touch, but a friend of mine put an ad in craigslist and she met loads of men. I dont think most men would mind that you have a child. Have you tried any dating apps?

s1.value: I'm a bit jealous of you. Because you have a son, it makes you the most interesting person in the world. And no, Im not going to write about my situation in the text, because it makes me too emotional.
Speaker 2: I dont have a son. Just a husband and two cats. He's putting a real strain on our relationship.
My friend put up an ad on craigslist and she met loads of men. I dont think most men would mind that you have a child. Have you tried any dating apps?

s2.value: Does he have a kid? Yes.
2. Does he live in their basement? Yes.
3. Has he met someone on there? Yes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are your piano lessons going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are going well, im in grade 5 of 9 now.  Im enjoying the lessons so much im considering teaching it others when im done.  My dog on the other hand hates when I play and barks continuously!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, dogs have notoriously bad taste in music, so don't worry about that!  Do you mean there are only nine piano lessons?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There are 9 grades of piano lessons, so im currently in grade 5. What type of mysic do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love lots of different kinds of music - classical, jazz, rock.  I don't like musical theater or opera, though.  How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm happy listening to all types of music as well..sometimes im in the mood for 90s hits, other times in happy with country.  When I listen to piano music Classical is my favorite and I could spend hours listening to concerts.  Have you been to any concerts lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, my cousin is an incredible violinist - she is the concert mistress of her orchestra!  I went and saw her perform for Bach's birthday recently.  It was amazing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow thats impressive, the dedication it must take to learn and be good at the violin must be crazy!  Are you watching the Raptors game tonight>

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She is also a music teacher for kids, and all three of her kids are unbelievably talented.  If you just listened to them play, you'd never think they were so young.  And yes, of course!  I'm excited for the game.  Will you be watching, too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I will be watching the game.  Have the snacks ready to go and the TV hooked up to the surround sound.  I hope they win and make the finals again this year!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, me too!  I assume the horse isn't interested, but will your dog or any of your cats watch the game with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: All the cats are sitting on the couch with me ready to cheer on the boys!

s1.value: Speaker 1: My dog, on the other hand hates when I play.
2. Speaker 2: Yes, their dog is also very jealous of their piano lessons.
3. Speaker 1: I love listening to all types of music and have a wide repertoire.
4. Speaker 2: I like classical music, I listen to a lot of jazz and rock too.

s2.value: She has an adorable golden retriever named Bella.
2. She enjoys classical, jazz and rock music.
3. She has a 10 year old black lab named Buster.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got a new lizard!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh god! I don't know how you do it. They freak me out. What is his/her name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a he. His name is Draco. He's the cutest lizard I've ever owned.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great name for a lizard! Do you have any other pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I've only ever had lizards. Draco is the only one I have at the moment, but I'm thinking of getting another one next week so that he has a friend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That will be cute! You have send a photo of the pair. Do you have name in mind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Definitely will send one over as soon as I get him or her. I haven't put much thought into it yet, but Snape is an early candidate, if it's a male anyway. What do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like it! You will soon have the whole Hogwarts gang!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Eventually, that's a good idea actually. Anyway, how's working at the library been for you lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its been very quiet. Like more than usual I mean. When I was young kids used to come to the library to hangout and use the computers. They don't do that anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that's a shame. There's so much to discover in a library, I think they're missing out. Kids these days, eh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Right! We tried jazzing it up a bit and have comic books days and moster movie nights planned. So hopefully that sparks some interest.

s1.value: They like to talk. They like to joke around and tell things that have happend to them. They like to laugh. Also they can be a bit of a bit of a bit of a pain. They have a sense of humor and their sense of humor is rather clever and sharp. They can tell jokes very well and can play silly games. They are good at making people laugh. They are intelligent. They like to read. They are not so good at using the computer. They are more of geeks than nerds. They like to play games like card games and dice games. They are good at making jokes. They like to take jokes. They like to take a little bit of fun. They take criticism very lightly.

2. They like to read. They like to write. You, a librarian, love reading and enjoy writing. They always try to find a new author to try to keep the interest of your customers. You have a sense of humor similar to Draco and enjoy reading and writing. You also like to play games like card games and dice games. What do you do for a living?

s2.value: Speaker 1: It's funny, but I was just going to tell you a while ago about Draco my lizard's name. I love it. He is a great pet.
2. Speaker 2: I love that it's a he. I have a lizard too. I have a pet lizards, I don't know if I would even go up for a second second if I found out.
How's the library been for you lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What interesting locations has your cruise ship visited recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The one I work with typically stays in the Caribbean. It's awesome.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice, I would like one day to go on cruise trip for a week or two but it is very expensive, Apart of working there do you have enough time to enjoy a trip or have a coffee while looking on sunrise?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We usually get some time off during the trips to enjoy the sights and ports that we stop at. With a master's degree, I'm sure you'll be able to afford a cruise soon enough.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: At the moment I am still saving for Mortgage with my wife while doing my degree But yes, one day I will definitely go on cruise trip. For how long are you expecting to continue to work there? Do you want to settle down one day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really haven't thought too much about it. I suppose one day it would be nice to be in one place but right now I'm just going with the flow, or the ocean lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: As far as you are enjoying it and you job give you a pleasure continue doing it. Maybe you can train as some kind of sports trainer on cruise ship you could even exercise more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey, there's a good thought. I'd not even considered that as an option. How about you, what will you do with the social sciences degree?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am currently working as a volunteer in police and to be fair I am kind of between to have a job there or to be a teacher in my Uni 2 years after graduation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet working with the police is an interesting experience. I'm sure you will figure it out when the time comes to choose though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you, By the way on 42 Avenue there is new Sushi bar, Have you been there yet or maybe would you like to go there with me when you return from next cruise?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No kidding, that's my favorite one. We will definitely have to hit that up when I get back to the mainland.

s1.value: Worked as a public speaker for almost 3 years until I received a Master's degree at the University of Miami, now teaching at the University of Miami.
3. Favorite ice cream flavor is root beer.
Speaker 1: Favorite ice cream flavor is root beer. Favorite ice cream flavor is root beer.

s2.value: Speaker 1 went to public school and graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts.
2. Speaker 1 works as a Speaker at a cruise ship.
3. Has a Master's Degree.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If you could get a pet, what kind would you want?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would definitely get a dog. They are the best type of pets! How old was your cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cat died when he was 12. But I don't have a new cat now. What kind of dog would you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think English Cocker Spaniels are the best breed. The are super smart, they have a lot of energy but not enough to be overwhelming and they love to cuddle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you like to do with your friends?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We normally play chess and read books. What is your favorite book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My favorite books are about Thomas the tank engine. I really like Thomas comes to breakfast

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That awesome!!! Do your friends like Thomas the tank engine too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes. They like to come to my house and play with the big train set that I have. I really like to share my trains

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not a big fan of trains. They are pretty clumsy machines but im glad you have some friends to share your trains with. I have tons and tons of friends

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet if we played together you would like my trains. I have built a really big set on my train table. What else do you do for fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: you think so? Maybe you are right! I do enjoy building things from scratch. Unfortunately, I am not as strong as I used to be. Do you play any sports?

s1.value: Speaker 1 lives alone in an apartment. She often reads and watches Thomas the tank engine with her friends to pass the time.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I work as a programmer in the banking sector in Turkey.
2. Speaker 1: I am a cat enthusiast and lover.
3. Speaker 2: I am a teacher at the college level.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've finished a really great book I was reading.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very Cool! What is the name of the book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I got it at Costco, it's called the "Girls of Atomic City"

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What a coincidence! I just purchased that same book from there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am usually  not a fan of novels set in world war II but it was a real page turner.  Have you started it yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't started it yet. I will be reading it tonight after I finish my workout

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think you will like it! You could read it in the bath tub!  Did you buy yours at Costco?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I sure did! I also found really nice dog toys there for my boxer. Do you get pet items from Costco also?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I always buy my dog food and cat litter there, but I didn't see the dog toys there.  Were they in a special section or by the other dog items?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They were in a special section, there was a big sale going on. They might not have had it in Maryland]

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: New York always has great deals.  I might look online and see if they have them.  I did buy a great pair of tennis shoes there last week.  If you need some new work out shoes you should check them out!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I might! Most of the time I will purchase clothes from Costco so I will have to give the shoes a try. Have you been cloud watching lately?

s1.value: I've finished a really great book I was reading. I am now listening to music and am having a good meal after putting in a full day at work.

s2.value: He is an older gentleman.
2. He is extremely good looking.
3. He is a speaker for the American Civil Liberties Union.

dialogue.author: 13149: Di
dialogue.text: you bring your cats to Canada with you to visit your sister?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No way! I don't like driving anywhere with my cats, so that long of a drive would be torture. I took them to a place that watches animals during vacations. Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Probably a good idea. I doubt they would have enjoyed the trip anymore than you would have. I have one dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, most cats aren't a fan of driving. They tend to freak out. I definitely enjoyed the trip without them. What is your dog's name and what type is he?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: His name is Sully and he's a beagle. He has a ton of energy so he keeps my busy trying to tire him out on long walks. He does enjoy car rides though, so probably would have loved driving to Canada. How long of a drive did that end up being?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is so funny how different cats are from dogs. Sometimes I wish I was a dog person, but somehow I ended up with four cats. It took me 25 hours to get there. It was soooooo long. I'm the type of person who doesn't like to make stops, so I did it all without taking a stop for sleep.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, I don't think I've ever stayed up that long in my life. How did you keep from falling asleep at the wheel?

s1.value: Did you bring your cats to Canada with you to visit your sister?
No

s2.value: Did you bring your cats to Canada with you to visit your sister?
No way! I don't like driving anywhere with my cats, so that long of a drive would be torture. I took them to a place that watches animals during vacations. Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: See any awesome dogs at work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure, we have a couple of them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I find my worst day can be made better by playing with a dog.  Do you think the same thing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course yes, dogs are the best friend any human can have.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They good company. However, when eating pizza that have very little to say.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very little to say, how? i don't get.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They give the puppy dog eyes and they watch, waiting for a bite of their own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually share with them when I can or most times when i eat in their presence.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: In what way are the dogs at your work awesome?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They have been trained to their best ability. Even though they can't talk, they can respond to your commands .

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Trained to help a disabled person with life, or trained to not bark at the mailman?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Trained for all purpose, they've got intuition too. They know when to do what.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has a nervous breakdown and is taking antidepressants.
2. Speaker 1 has a difficult time eating pizza.
3. Speaker 1 has been divorced and has no children.

s2.value: She has one Labrador Retriever. His name is Bob, for his sense of humor and his curiosity.
2. She has two cats and an African Grey.
3. She has been with many different people and dogs in her life. She's been to different states, countries, and met different types of dogs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finished knitting the sweater for my daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is great, what color/pattern is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's not far off sky blue. I could knit you something too if you'd like. How is college going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thank you, I would love that! College is very busy but it is going well. We have Spring Break in a couple of weeks so I am looking forward to some downtime.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will get some more wool - what colour would you like? Downtime sounds lovely - do you have any plans?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will take a green sweater. Thanks again! I do not have any plans, I am going home and will be with my family for the week. I will probably find some time to hang out with my high school friends while I am there. Did you give your daughter the sweater?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No problem! And that sounds lovely - family is important. What do you like to do with your friends? Do you play football together or something else? And I haven't given it to her yet - we're going shopping together later this week so I'm gifting it to her then.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, we will play flag football or play video games. We like to go to the movies too, but I am not sure what is out in theaters. What stores are you and your daughter planning to go to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah, on one of those new fangled consoles? I can't keep up anymore with technology. Oh lovely! What genre of films do you go for? Hopefully some nice shoe shops, we both need some practical shoes to go walking in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like action or comedy movies. I try to stay away from thrillers, they just get my imagination going. Do you and your daughter go walking together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good point! I saw a film about a clown when I was younger and I still to this day have nightmares. We do quite frequently, there's some lovely trails nearby - you should check them out!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love to go exploring new trails, my family use to go hiking all the time when I was younger. Do you have a favorite trail?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I finished knitting the sweater for my daughter.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a father, mother is deceased and father is Speaker
2. Speaker 2 is a single male living at home by himself, his favorite hobby is knitting and his favorite food is mashed potatoes.
3. Speaker 2 is a self-employed, he has his own business for knitting, selling goods.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think google really listens, YouTube started recommending me Tupac videos lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah! Big brother is in full force. It is quite scary. Technology scares me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It scares me sometimes too.  Sometimes when I even mention a book that I'm reading I'll see a bunch of ads for books from the same author, its crazy!  Anyways though, how is the family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah me too, I started getting vegan recipes showing up after you mentioned it. They are pretty good we are going out for italian later. Its my favourite.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did any of them at least look good to you?  Can't go wrong with Italian.  I make a pretty good vegan speghetti and "meatballs", it's not the same but still pretty good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah they looked good but its worrying when I didnt even ask for it, it's like it knows what im thinking... Italian is great, what is your favourite cuisine? I can't cook for my life.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's always listening and watching.  A real invasion of privacy.  This vegan creamy pasta with broccoli is one of my top favorites.  Cooking is a lot of fun, should try to learn!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I had to sell my Alexa it was freaking me out and randomly turning on. Hmmm, I will need to try it some time, maybe my girlfriend can make it. I will watch some Gordon Ramsay videos to teach me, I love him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe it was just a ghost trying to spook you, if you believe in that sort of thing!  My ex-girlfriend and I used to cook together, it was a great activity to do together and its what really helped me learn to cook.  That guy is a riot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you superstitious? Well I can give it a shot with my girlfriend then, a good bonding experience probably. Are you single now then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I am a little bit.  I haven't had any real encounters, only one that was unexplained.  It really is, unless you have a tiny kitchen then it can be more of a pain.  Yes, my girlfriend died two summers ago and I haven't been ready to get out there again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I swear I saw a ghost when I was a kid, maybe my imagination though. I'm sorry to hear that, I hope you get out there soon once you've grieved fully.

dialogue.author: 21401: I
dialogue.text: oked my flight for our spring break trip.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is it for Florida? I know you want to do the Iron Man Competition there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I will be coming to Florida. I think I am going to watch the competition this year and I might be ready to join next year. Will you be there? I would love to see you. Maybe you can give me some pointers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! I will be there, but you know I'm not the most athletic. I would love to come see the competition with you. Would you want to go to karaoke night on Thursday with me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would be glad to meet you at the competition. If you wear your lucky yellow shirt I can't miss you. I would love to go to karaoke with you, maybe you can sing and I will play my guitar.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you learned any new songs on guitar? I can practice singing them and prepare for karaoke. I will definitely wear my yellow shirt so you can easily spot me in the crowd at the competition. Kevin, I do miss you as it has been so long since we've seen each other!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it will be great to get together again. I have been practicing some songs, mostly rock and roll and country. I know a lot of people like to sing country songs at karaoke. What is your favorite type of music to sing? I can really play most any song if I hear it once. Cant wait to see you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I tried this new VR game yesterday. It was so cool!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How was it? is it really that amazing, being confined in bed because of my motorcycle accident, I wished I could experience how it feels to walk again? How did you feel playing the VR game? is it really that realistic?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am feel so sorry for you. Don't worry you will get better soon. The game was too good. We can paly it together if you want. What do you say?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I know, I feel sorry for myself too. Maybe one day I will be able to walk again. Yes I would love to play with you, did you really feel as though you were inside of the game? some people have said that it feels so realistic they have forgotten its just a game, do you think thats true?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it is. It is an amazing experience. I can't wait to play with you. You will definitely gonna forget about your pain once you started playing. It can also be a good distraction for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What type of game did you play? was it action? I dont think I am brave enough to play the scarier games, I am too much of a chicken, do you like scary games? Yes, I definitely need the distraction. I also want to become a professional gamer, Ive heard if you win the big competition you can become rich if you win, unsure how true that is?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are too excited , aren't you? . Don't worry its no that much scary , if you want we can change the genre.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I am! lol I bet you can feel my excitement. Good, I am not the biggest fan of scary anything, I watched a movie called, insidious, I have not been able to watch anything scary since then, have you watched it? Maybe we can play a war game?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Insidious is one of my favorite. I haven't slept after watching the movie. It was too scary but I like it especially the red room scene scared me to the core. Yes, we can play war game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No way! that movie scarred me for life! I can seriously hear the scary music used right now. I am not surprised, took me forever to sleep without thinking about it. I heard there are sequels as well. I thought about being brave enough to watch, but I dont think I can. what is your favorite movie? Awesome, I think I would like to play games about war, sort of like Game of Throne battle scenes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can understand your fear. I watched the sequels as well but it next chapters were more of a prequel. My all time favorite is Harry potter. I just love it. So how about this weekend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How were they? are they as terrifying as the first one? Chapters, interesting? I may watch the following chapter, in the MORNING, with all windows open, and all lights on, lol. I love Harry Potter as well, have you watched The hobbit? I just watched the movies recently, I am so impressed. Yes, I am totally down for this weekend.

s1.value: speaker 1: I tried a new VR game yesterday. It was cool!

s2.value: Speaker 1 is paralyzed from the waist down due to a motorbike accident.
2. Speakers 2 previous partners have been, a woman and a man.
3. Speaker 2 is a writer, speaker, and author.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What e-books have you read, recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just got into the Twilight Series actually. Enjoying it so far!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cool! What do you like most about the series?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really enjoy romance novels, so I figured I would enjoy that aspect haha. I haven't gotten too far into the first book yet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are good books. I read them a long time ago. The storytelling I thought was really good and of course the romance aspect. As a writer, I thought the author was ok. I've read better writing, but the stories are good. What do you plan to read next?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad to hear the storytelling is good. I'm not sure what to read next. Any suggestions? Do you write books or other things?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Stephen King has a lot of good books if you like Sci-Fi and thriller stuff. Justin Cronin's The Passage is also really good. I like to write short stories in my spare time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I lovd Sci-Fi! I'll look into The Passage. I've had my eye on that for awhile actually. That's awesome that you write short stories.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! Yeah it's really good. In all honesty though, I've never finished it because it is super long. I've attempted to finish it twice, and didn't get through it, but it wasn't because it wasn't good. What are your favorite Sci-Fi books you have read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha I understand. It can be difficult to get through longer books. I really enjoyed The Blazing World.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've never heard of that, but I'll have to check it out. Thanks for the recommendation! Do you enjoy other genres, too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, you might like it! I feel like I enjoy all types of books. I like to switch up genres often. How about you?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a novelist and writer.
2. Speaker 1 wrote The Twilight Series.
3. Speaker 1 is a fan of Stephen King.

s2.value: He works in public relations.
2. He is a writer.
3. He is also a professional soccer player.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wish my dad wouldn't have abandoned me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry that happened to you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can't stop thinking about him. I wonder where he is now. I think it's my fault however my brother says it's because my mother cheated on him. Aren't you worried about that happening to you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't think it was your fault. Is there anyway you can find him now? I'm a father and I never want to leave my daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I mean what if your wife finds out and she leaves. Your daughter might blame it on herself. I tried contacting him however my mother doesn't let me. I think she's intercepting messages from him.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I guess I never thought about that. Maybe I need to be more honest. I'm sorry your mother is doing that. Have you tried explaining to her why you're reaching out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No. It's not worth it. I think that I already have lost my dad so there's no good reason to risk losing my mom either. What university does your daughter go to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's true. Try to enjoy your time with your Mom. My daughter goes to Yale Medical School.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yale? My brother attends Yale Social Sciences. That's crazy! Is Yale near you guys? Do you visit often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What a small world! It's actually a bit far, we live in North Carolina and have only visited a few times since dropping her off.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Since we live very nearby, I can visit at anytime. He actually didn't love that Yale was so close, however he doesn't mind the free food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's really cool. Haha and I bet he brings home his dirty laundry too. When will you visit him again?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I wish my dad wouldn't have abandoned me.
Speaker 2: I'm so sorry that happened to you.

Speaker 2: I don't think it was your fault. Is there anyway you can find him now? I'm a father and I never want to leave my daughter.

Speaker 1: I mean what if your wife finds out and she leaves. Your daughter might blame it on herself. I tried contacting him however my mother doesn't let me. I think she's intercepting messages from him.

2. Speaker 2: I'm so sorry that happened to you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What sort of beer have you been making at home? Do you have a favorite type that you like to drink?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like a variety of beers including Heineken, Guiness and others. I've even come up with my own flavors though I don't have a favorite at the moment. How about yourself, are you a big beer drinker?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I definitely do. Though, I'm more of a whiskey person if I had to pick. Nothing like kicking back with a nice glass of scotch listening to some music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds very nice. I like whiskey but don't drink it as often. What kind of music do you listen to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Like I mentioned before. Pretty much anything. Really enjoying this album by a band called Moon Hooch though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can't say I'm too familiar with them. Have you ever seen them in concert?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I saw them last year. They were a lot of fun. I'm pretty sure they visited Portland too. They tour everywhere

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh really it's unfortunate that I missed them. Maybe I'll check them out next time they tour here.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not to steretopype, but if you love coffee, brewing your own beer, and you live in Portland, you'll probably like them. LOL. You seen any good concerts recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lol very true. We get a bad rap sometimes but we are eclectic in our style choices. I haven't been to a concert in a long time due to work but I have to go soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you do for work again? Or maybe you never mentioned it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Funny enough I work at a brewery lol. I can't get enough of those nice, cold beers.

s1.value: My favorite beer is a Heineken, Scotch, or a Budweiser.
2. I am a big beer drinker.
3. I'm in my 20's.
4.I am in Portland.

s2.value: It's rare for me to admit this on the Internet but I'm a big beer drinker

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your grandmother doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She's doing good, thanks for asking. She really appreciates having me help her out around the house. Have you been to any fun concerts lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I went to a Sting concert back in November. It was really good. It was right here in Pittsburg.  Too bad you couldn't have come with me, you would have liked it. But I know you have your grandmother to take care of, I don't know how you do it. And with your kids too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I've also wanted to see Sting. It definitely can be a bit of a hassle managing both the kids and my grandmother. Especially after the divorce.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know, that's what I was thinking, you've handled it all so well though. You have to be a pretty stong person to handle all that at once but you did it! Do you work a lot of hours at the insurance agency?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thankfully it's only a 9-5 job and I never have to work overtime. That makes it more manageable, since I know my schedule won't change. I also have a lot of friends nearby who have been helping me out whenever I need it. How's work at the library for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's good, it's great to have friends around! The library has been a pretty fun job for me, it's relaxing and I meet a lot of people everyday plus I get to take books home all the time for me and my family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That does sound like a great time. It's important to have a job that you enjoy. Have you read any good books lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I brought one home the other day that is on Italian food. It has a lot of recipe's in it that I'm going to try since you and I both know that is my favorite food!! I still want to come to visit you in New Mexico sometime and try that pizza you were talking about!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You will definitely have to come out at some point. It's quite a ways away from Pittsburg, but it's really pretty out here. The weather and scenery are just beautiful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It sounds great! I can't wait! Tell your grandmother I said hello and that I may be seeing her soon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure she would love to see you. She really enjoys having company and getting to interact with other people. How is your family doing?

s1.value: Their mother passed away when they were very young.
Speaker 1: Their grandma really needs the help around the house. They are also having a hard time with the divorce. They have two kids under their care.

s2.value: Speaker 2's grandmother is doing good.
2. Speaker 2 is also dealing with custody of his 3 children.
3. Speaker 2 has just divorced from his wife.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I took a few kids to the movies earlier and I saw this movie you'd probably love.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Can you tell me which movie you watched?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We watched the new Croods movie, so good! it was witty and had me cracking up the entire time. Have you seen the first movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Unfortunately I have not. But I will now as I got your input. Can you tell the storyline in short?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You will definitely would love it, what is your favorite Disney movie, again?  croods 2 follows the story line of one of the main characters, at the end he realizes what is important to him. Dont want to give much away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I recently watch Mulan and liked it very much. You are right to not have a spoiler alert. How long was the movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The live action? I also watched, the story line though somewhat different, was pretty exiting to watch. the movie was around standard time, and hour and half. I really want to watch the live action of The Little Mermaid.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of reviews does The Little Mermaid have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its still in the making, I am unsure of when its the release date, I wonder if they will take a similar approach to Mulan or stick to the original story line. what is your overall favorite movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ohh I see. Well, I like action movies. So far, my favorite movie is Ipman 4. Have you seen it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have seen every single Ipman!  movie number 4 was EPIC. I am guessing you are a fan of Mortal Kombat? Ip man vs Liu Knag?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I have not watched Mortal Kombat. I don't like the name itself. Which one is your favorite Ipman movie?

s1.value: Speaker 1: Raises his kids at home, and works full time, but is still an active voice in the community.
2. Speaker 1 grew up in a large family as well, so his love of kids is obvious.
3. Speaker 1 is passionate about the issues that make up the youth of our country, specifically, the inner city of New York City. Speaker 1's favorite movie?

2. Speaker 2 is also the main photographer for UK magazine MCM, in addition to his work as an actor.
Speaker 2 also a photographer for UK magazine MCM, in addition to his work as an actor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just heard a great new rage metal album and wanted to tell you about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What was the album and who is the artist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The album is called Soundchaser and it's by the German band Rage. Do you listen to any German artists?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do. I have listened to Rage since they were formed. I also like to listen to Running Wild. Have you ever heard of them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually haven't heard of them? How did you find out about them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They were popular back in the 90's. My cousin introduced them to me. My sons can't believe that I actually enjoy the music. I guess they forget that I had a life before they came along.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I totally understand! But surprisingly my daughters have started to enjoy rage metal. Do you ever wish you had daughters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really. I enjoy the different kind of drama that comes with sons than daughters especially now that mine are in their late teens. How old are your kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have 7 so it always take me awhile to remember their ages. If I remember correctly they are 17, 15, 14, 11, 6, 3, and 2.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow. Mine are 18 and 16. I am soon to be an empty nester and we have started making plans about what we want to enjoy before grandkids start appearing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Aww that's sweet! What is the first thing you want to do once you have the kids out of the house?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I have told them that we are going to redo their rooms and if they want to visit they get to sleep on the floor! Really we plan to take a couple of extended trips so we can see what we want without entertaining kids. Probably Australia first.

s1.value: He drives a blue 1990 Toyota Matrix.
2. He is in his 70's.
3. He enjoys music.

s2.value: The album they are listening to is Soundchaser.
2. The band is Rage.
3. The band was formed in 198

dialogue.author: 16248: Ho
dialogue.text: are you feeling now?  Find anything good while shopping?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Feeling good. Found a lot of new shoes and tops.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! I went shopping today as well. What kind of shoes did you buy? I love sneakers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bought 4 new pairs of Converse shoes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, good choice. I have a matching pair of black and white Converse with my son. Have you seen any good tv shows lately? The weather ha been so cold that I hate going outside recently. I would love to find a good show to watch.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love watching Bridgerton on netflix right now as well as The Queens Gambit

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have seen those pop up in my recommendations, maybe I will give them a try after the kids go to bed tonight. How often do you get a chance to watch tv? I feel like i don't get the chance to wind down very much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually get to watch TV every evening after work and on the weekends.

s1.value: I am 46 years old, married for 12 years. Have 3 children.
2. I like to travel, read, watch tv, and hang out with friends.
3. I work in HR and am currently an employee at a large tech corp.

s2.value: Speaker 1 just finished shopping in Speakers 1's and 2's respective stores.
2. Speaker 1 likes Converse.
3. The weather is cold.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you destress after work?  I can only imagine how trying your job is!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually just chat with my wife it really helps me to relax. Also, sometimes I watch comedies to forget about stressful situations at hospital

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What are some of your favorite comedies to watch? It takes a special kind of person to be able to perform the work that you do, it's inspirational. My job pays the bills, but doesn't give me the sense of fulfillment I'm looking for.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like american pie movies and anything starring jim carrey. Well it seems like your job has a lot of advantages. For example I think it is nice to be on a sea everyday

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love Jim Carrey! Does your wife enjoy watching comedies with you? I'm sure working at a college can be stressful for her too. You're right, it's very nice to be able to see the sea every day. Would you believe me if I told you I used to get seasick at the beginning? lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She joins me when she has some free time to spare, but yes, her job is also stressful. I would actually believe you haha because I experience the same thing. How long did it take to get over it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's nice that you're both able to still find time to spend together despite your busy schedules. Actually, it took me almost six months lol, but I took the job because I was craving a career change. Did you always know you wanted to be a surgeon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it has always been my dream job, even when I was a kid. Career change? What were you doing prior to that change?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing! I used to be a car salesman. I loved being able to interact with new people every day, but it wasn't the most exciting. I wanted something with a bigger sense of adventure, and eventually found the fish catching job!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I kind of see your point. Working as a salesman can be boring sometimes and fishing is definitely more exciting

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Exciting definitely, but also kind of dangerous. I think once the year is over I'll look for something a little more calm lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well good luck with that and if you need any suggestions, feel free to ask me! I would love to help you

s1.value: The job he's looking for is a surgical tech at a hospital. The job is tough and not rewarding. He's considering switching jobs when the year is over.
2. He is a car salesman in the beginning of his career but he loses it. He finds his purpose to travel the seas every year.
3. He is married to his best friend and together they are raising their twin girls.

s2.value: He is a great singer and dancer and he can dance the cha-cha with the best of them.
2. He is a certified paramedic.
3. He is a chef in the hospital.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How busy are restaurant in New York right now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Depends on the restaurant, but fancy New Yorkers always need their fancy food. The restaurants with high reputations continue to book up quickly

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How many people do you cook for on a consistent basis?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: People often book me for large parties and events as well as small ones. Everything from a family for dinner to a companies buisiness retreat

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you specialize in any specific type of cousine?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love asian fusion! I think its so fun to take inspiration from different cuisines and put a modern or unique spin on it

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds really good. What is your favorite part about living in New York?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There's just so much culture! Not only the food, but music and fashion and people. Everything and everyone you can think of, you can find it in New York

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be an adventure to live there. So much to see.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What about San Diego? The warm weather and beaches must be incredible

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is really nice here. I love the weather and the beach. Living by the beach is really nice.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can imagine, good waves for surfing? Or more of a lounging in the sun type of beach

s1.value: Lives in New York.
2. Uses an imac to run his business.
3. Always has a group of friends with him.

s2.value: How busy are restaurant in New York right now?
Speaker 2: Depends on the restaurant, but fancy New Yorkers always need their fancy food

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are your classes? Have you had any soccer matches?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Classes are going ok, although math makes my head hurt. Havent played soccer in a few weeks, its been too cold. What sports do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like soccer and baseball but I don't follow any sports that much. Math is hard for many people. What are your favorite classes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love history, and science the most. Have you hiked any where neat lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't hiked lately.  Some people don't like the basics that much. Are you taking any electives?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: no.. I would rather take that time to work out, or train.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense. I guess you have to work out a lot to be at the top of your game. Is your team good this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Its not soccer season right now, but I try to stay in shape, can't let my body go. It would be that much harder during training and games.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: True. I know it's not the same but it makes me think about all the time I have taken off from hiking and I need to get back out there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hiking is great. I've done some myself. I hiked some of the Appalachian trail a few years ago

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That must have been amazing! That is a long term goal of mine. Was it as hard as I think it is?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I only hiked from Georgia to into North Carolina, and got picked up in Tennesse. It was a two week trip. I couldn't devote the time to make hike the full thing.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I like soccer and baseball but I don't follow any sports that much. Math is hard for many people.
