dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Last night, I took my dogs hunting and you won't believe what I saw!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh boy, what did you see?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am pretty sure I saw a baby sasquatch!!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that's crazy!  What makes you think it was a sasquatch?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well... I saw his footprints... it looked just like a human's footprints... but my wife says its probably a raccoon... So be and Buster and Clem (my dogs)are going out again on the hunt again tonight... except tonight I am taking my polaroid camera

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats exciting!  What do you normally hunt when you go out at night?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Usually I am hunting alligators... they are easier to spot at night.  they are hanging out near the surface then.  Do you hunt?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that makes sense.  I've been deer hunting once or twice, but I don't do it regularly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah... I hunted deer a few times... ended up with more on the bumper of my truck than hangin' in the garage.  Their meat is so lean... gotta cook it with some lard to make it stick together.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I remember that, I didn't get any myself but my friends who i was hunting with did, and you're right it is a pretty tough meat.  I enjoyed it though.  I haven't hunted it, but I've also had some hunted elk before, which is very delicious, but still very lean.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I would love to have an elk rack in my collection.  Where did you hunt that at?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I didn't hunt it myself, I had it when i was visiting my friend's place, he had a bunch in his freezer.  I think he nabbed it in Colorado.

s1.value: Last night I was hunting polaroid pictures.
Speaker 2: I wish I had a Polaroid camera.

s2.value: He hunts at night.
2. He takes polaroid camera when going out at night.
3. He wants to take photos of a baby sasquatch.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I recently graduated from college!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congratulations! Bet you're celebrating with lots of time outdoors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I celebrated out side during the full moon.  Then I went and did some recycling.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lol, you know me and recycling! I just got back from a trip to my recycling center.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It takes effort to recycle.  Imagine, some people work out in a gym when they could just sort trash.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, now that you've graduated you get a job at the recycling center. That was one of my first jobs. Do you have a job lined up yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Currently I volunteer at a non profit group.  We give basketballs to kids.  I love the joy it gives kids to hoop it up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's so nice to do something you love and I remember you like basketball. That's fantastic!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: When it is cold out, what is your favorite outdoor activity?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Even if it's cold, I like to go on hikes. Do you hike?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, on every hike I find some trash.  Know what I do with that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Recycle it? lol! That's what I do. I always carry a recycling bag.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a college graduate.
2. Speaker 1 volunteers at a non profit group.
3. Speaker 1 hikes on their hikes.

s2.value: Speaker 1 recently graduated from college.
2. Speaker said they went hiking on a full moon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just finished up with classes for the day. I'm getting ready to practice with the band.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That should be fun, were your classes tough today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are so difficult these days. I can't get my head around quantum mechanics. I hope I won't fail the course

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's definitely too complicated for me! I'm sure you'll do just fine if you keep studying. Your cat could help you study!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My cat is more of a distraction that anything. She's so cute! Do you ever think about getting another cat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can't wait, once I move out of this apartment into one that allows pets I'll definitely be getting a cat. What's your cats name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Her name is Chandler. My mom was a big Friends fan when we got her and named her after the character.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good name, I love it when cats have human names like Frank or Barbara. Does your band have any gigs coming up or do you guys just jam?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We mostly play cover songs and play at weddings. I'm just trying to save enough money to move out after I finish college. That is, if I finish college, which is never gonna happen if Chandler keeps bothering me. Maybe I should put her in a box and then I would understand quantum mechanics.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Too bad Schroedinger already beat you to that one, could have been your thesis! You guys must be pretty good if you are getting paid to play at weddings. I'd love to hear some one day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We play some dive bars now and then. I think we have a gig coming up this weekend. You should come along, I can get you in for free. What do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can't complain about a free show. Will your girlfriend be there?

s1.value: I just finished up with classes for the day. I'm getting ready to practice with the band.
Speaker 2: That should be fun, were your classes tough today?
Speaker 1: They are so difficult these days. I can't get my head around quantum mechanics. I hope I won't fail the course

s2.value: Speaker 1: I am getting married. Speaker 2: Who is your future wife? Speaker 1: I don't know yet. Speaker 2: What is your future husband's name? Speaker 1: I don't know. I never looked at it that way before.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long have you lived in Ohio?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I lived here my  whole life.  I grew up on a farm.  How often do you travel?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One good vacation a year and a handful of weekend but hoping to travel much more when I retire

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would like to travel sometime but I have never been on plane.  I'm a little nervous about flying.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Why? It's super safe. You are more likely to get into an accident driving than flying

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess it's because I have no control. Plus you are up in the air so if something goes wrong it is even more devastating than a car accident.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should fly somewhere close so that you can just get the experience.  It's great waking up in on one side of the country and eating dinner on the other!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That does sound great.  I will try sometime.  So when do you think you will retire?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I set a date of April 30. That will let me hit the ground running with good summer weather.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good idea.  Do you plan to move when you retire?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not at first, but if I fall in love with a place I'll be ready to pack up and move.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My uncle is retired and lives in Hawaii.  I'd like to visit him once I work up the nerve to fly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hope you have smoke detectors installed in your store?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What type of store are you opening?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was you that want to open up a store! Do you have Alzheimer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: To much smoke inhalation - LOL!  Who do you babysit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I look after a child of a rich family. What is your favorite cigarette brand?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't smoke.  How old is the child?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She is 3 years old. Her parents are doctors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Why is your favorite color Yellow - what is your favorite Yellow item?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It make me happy. I like banana. What is your favorite color?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Blue.  I like the oceans and lakes.

dialogue.author: 20737: Ho
dialogue.text: s it going with the person you've been dating with two cats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We are doing quite okay. Thanks for asking. How are the cats doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad to hear that - you really deserve the best.  My cats are doing okay.  But one of them, Pepper, needs to go to the vet.  He has a strange wheezing cough that has been making me nervous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure he needs to get checked up. My little sister has a Persian cat, but I love huskies. I hope to get myself one soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice - pets are great.  I love dogs too, but I have the cats because they're a little less maintenance.  Huskies are beautiful dogs.  Do you have time to walk it every day? I've heard they need a lot of exercise.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I have plenty of time in the evening, after school. What is your favorite meal at taco bell?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really enjoy the doritos locos tacos, but I'll be honest - I'm kind of tired of Taco Bell.  We have it all of the time since my husband is the CEO and I'm just tired of it!  Do you ever go there? I know they have some vegan options.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I visit at least thrice a week. I enjoy the bean crunchwrapS, mostly on my way home after school. They are quite tasty.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow, you're a loyal customer!  Yes, it's nice they they offer vegan options.  How long have you been a vegan?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been vegan since 11th grade, and I must say I like it a lot. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that's a long time.  I'm not vegan, but I have considered being vegetarian since I don't like the way the animals are treated.  But I really love fish and burgers.  Are there any foods you really miss?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes sometime I miss cheesesteaks and chicken pie, but I get over it eventually. Maintaining a vegan lifestyle is quite demanding, especially with those yummy displays everywhere.

s1.value: Speaker 1 has been dating with a person since last year.
Speaker 1's cats are not being cared for properly by the cat sitter.
Speaker 2's girlfriend is leaving him after a month-long relationship.
Speaker 2's girlfriend is leaving him after a month-long relationship. He likes huskies and dogs, but his girlfriend is not a dog person.

s2.value: His favorite food is Taco Bell.
2. His favorite food is Doritos Locos Tacos.
3. He enjoys watching YouTube videos on veganism.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so cool you have a motorcycle! I have always wanted to ride on one! They are so cool. What kind of motorcycle is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a yamaha. Next time you visit, we'll take it out! How are classes going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You know college you can't be busy enough sometimes! I would love that, I use to go riding with my dad sometimes, but you're doing the driving lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea I totally get it! What type of motorcycle did your dad have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He had a Shadow, have you ever rode one? How are your classes going by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I've never been on one of those. Classes are going well. Bust as usual. What are you studying again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nursing, just a few more months of clinical and I will finally be done! I am glad your classes are going well, how much longer before you graduate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have one semester left of classes and then I hope to get an internship with a low office around here to get some more practical experience. Have you started applying for jobs yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No not yet, after we graduate we should plan a trip together out to cali!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love that! How did you like San Diego?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I loved it, a guy I was dating was stationed out there. Have you decided where in Cali you want to live yet? We could check some places out while we are there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't really decided. I'd love to move to LA but it really depends on the job market.

2. Speaker 1 has a yamaha
3. Speaker 1 studied nursing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I sold a lot of encyclopedias and got a bonus.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's amazing! Well done you! What are you going to spend it on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure yet, probably on a hiking trip. I'm dying to go to Yosemite

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great idea! What about it is appealing? I feel so lucky to be in a country now with some great national parks.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, America's national parks are sooo beautiful! I figure since I've been walking so much selling books, I'm in shape enough for one of the big ones. Yosemite is just really beautiful with huge, famous sites like El Capitan and Half Dome

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good thinking - walking while working isn't a bad deal! I'd love to see it too some day. Are you hoping to add to your rock collection? I bet there's some pretty geodes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You can't take anything from the parks to preserve it, but maybe outside of them. I'm sure you're familiar with pretty sites from Argentina too, what does hiking look like there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah, I didn't know that! There are some beautiful places - I'd ride my horse on a lot of the trails there. A lot of great viewpoints to explore. I recommend visiting!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would love to do that someday! Maybe you could show me around some! Not so sure about the horse riding though haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great! We can probably stay with my family so you don't have to worry about accommodation. We're big meat eaters though, so hope you're not vegetarian!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No worries about that, I'll eat anything! I would love to see Argentina and experience the culture, thanks for the offer!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No problem. Do you speak any Spanish for when we travel?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I sold a lot of encyclopedias and got a bonus.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I sold a lot of encyclopedias and got a bonus.
2. Speaker 2: That's amazing! Well done you! What are you going to spend it on?
3. Speaker 1: I'm not sure yet, probably on a hiking trip. I'm dying to go to Yosemite

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My ex contacted me yesterday. He wants to go to lunch together!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Were you surprised?  Do you still like him?  Obviously, he still likes you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh, I was so surprised!  I really miss him a lot and I know my friends think it's a terrible idea, but gosh I still love him.  Do you have a boyfriend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I don't. I am now trying to work on my anxiety.  I am not interested in a romantic relationship at this time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well that makes sense to work on yourself first.  I should probably do that more often, but I just can't stand being single.  I'm always dating around.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: When you said an ex, is he an ex husband or boyfriend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ex-boyfriend.  I'm not ready for a husband.  I can't be tied down for too long.  I just get bored really quickly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I see.  You are funny.  So, are you going to have lunch with your ex?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea, we'll get lunch and I really can't wait.  I have to find the perfect outfit.  I want him back so badly.  I just can't stop thinking about him!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did you say "yes" then?  I am so happy for you.  Where are you going to meet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yep.  We're going to Hooters. That's his favorite restaurant.  Don't give me a lecture.  They really just have the best wings, I promise!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, okay.  Perhaps you can tell me how it goes later.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is talking to a friend about meeting a boyfriend or wife. Speaker 2 is not interested. Speaker 2 is now trying to work on her anxiety. She is not interested in a romantic relationship at this time.

s2.value: She was in a relationship with someone before. She was in a relationship with my ex husband. She was in a relationship with some other guy before. Speaker 1: Yes, that is true. What do you think about that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Feeling any better since I saw you last? I hope you got to rest.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I took a little nap so that helped. How is your brother doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure, I haven't visited him in a while since he robbed the bank.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Could he be the reason your parents are always arguing? Maybe you could write him and get things off your chest.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No. I think he robbed the bank because we have a broken family. My family has always been mentally abusive to us.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe talking to a therapist would help. Or just having alone time to meditate or be in nature or something like that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah thanks for the suggestions. I'm actually thinking about robbing a bank too. That might help with my stress. Do you want to join me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: LOL! I think robbing a bank would put me in the nuthouse with even more stress! I could use the money though, that's for sure!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think you should join me. We can get some BB guns and buy some masks. It will be very easy. You'll distract them with your guns and I'll take the money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: But look at your brother. He got caught and he did this a lot. I would feel much too guilty!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey think about it it wouldn't be too bad. Then we can join my brother in prison if we get caught and we can get some hotpot.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would certainly have time to write a follow-up book if I was in prison! I guess all you get is time, in that case.

s1.value: They're mentally abusive
2. They've robbed a bank
3. They have a brother in prison.

s2.value: He robbed a bank to get money because his family has always neglected him.
2. He is now in prison.
3. I suggest taking a nap or doing something relaxing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How have the language studies been going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have been studying for years now, so I am doing pretty well. It was not always the case though, I used to struggle especially with English. What kind of things do you do to work out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I lift weights at the gym. Gotta keep those muscles big!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds like upi are very dedicated to those work outs. What country do you come from and how long have you been in this country?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm from Norway. Here we have to lift lots of heavy lumber in the woods, so it helps to have big muscles. I have been here since I was born.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Norway, I was there a few times. What an interesting place. My family still lives in Algeria. I love to travel though and I love to learn new things and go to new places. Do you spend a lot of time working out each day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, it's part of my routine. Do people exercise a lot in Algeria? I imagine it can be difficult surviving in the desert.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes it is very hot. There are some dedicated people who do exercise. I have never been into exercising much, I keep in shape by hiking and other outdoor activities. Do you have weights at home or do you always go to a gym?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a daily routine. I go to the gym when I can but if I'm in a rush there are always some logs I can use as weights. Did you know that exercising makes your brain bigger?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, no I never knew that. Exercise is good for a lot of things. I have a big brain already. Do you play any instruments? I play piano, I find it relaxing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I have made lutes and woodwind instruments out of some of the trees that I have chopped down. The whole process is very relaxing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is wonderful. Do you sell the instruments you make or are they mostly ones you kept for your own use? Do you spend a lot of time chopping down trees?

s1.value: How have the language studies been going?
2. How long into the country have you been?
2. And what do you do to work out?
3. Do you play any instruments?

s2.value: She is from Norway.
2. She started to lift weights at the gym.
3. She plays piano.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been working on any neat sculptures?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not lately. My dog died recently so I haven't had the motivation to do anything.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is so sad! Maybe it is time to take that trip to Italy and take your mind off things?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ahh I guess so. I've always wanted to go there, I guess this is the perfect time. How was your trip there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was so scenic! We ventured out and saw the Vatican which was spectacular. I highly recommend it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds magical, you know I might really make up my mind and just go. I've been putting it off for a long time now. Where else would you recommend I visit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Milan and Florence are spectacular at all times of the year which makes it the perfect place to visit.  There is so much art there you are bound to be inspired again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I already know I'm gonna fall in love with the art lol. That's why I wanted to go in the first place. Well the art, and I want to visit museums too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: In the meantime you can look at all the awesome videos online of those cities and plan which route will work best for your needs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's true I'll get on it right now before I change my mind. I just wish my doggy could've went with me. Do you have a dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not any more.  It also died.  That's actually the whole reason I went on that long trip.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh wow well we have that in common. From what I gathered I guess the trip did you good. I'm hoping it will be a stress reliever for me as well.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a sculptor
2. Speaker 1 has not really worked on sculptures lately.
3. His dog recently died.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a dog owner.
2. Speaker 2 has been working on sculptures recently.
3. Speaker 1 is having problems with their dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I moved out of my attic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thats great, where are you living now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finally got a small apartment. How are your mother and daughter doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good for you. Are you getting new furniture? They are good, thank you for asking. My daughter just got a new skateboard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am getting some new furniture but just the basics. My brother is donating some of his old stuff too. Skateboarding seems like a lot of fun. Your daughter will really enjoy it. Is she taking any lessons or just teaching herself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She is just picking it up herself. She is a total tomboy, always coming home with scraped knees and muddy clothes haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my brother was like that growing up. He was always coming home dirty and scraped up. He even had several minor injuries that landed him in the ER. Has your daughter ever gotten hurt?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The ER? Oh wow as a mom that gives me a heartache. No thank god she hasn't. She jammed her finger playing basketball but nothing that would put her in the ER.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Girls being tomboys isn't common in Saudi Arabia is it? How does your mom deal with your daughter being that way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well she grew up in Canada so I think she's more Canadian in her values. She loves Peggy with all her heart. Peggy's the first grandchild after all.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's nice. I wasn't aware that she actually grew up in Canada. Does she still have any family back there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, we don't have roots there any more. I have never even been there! How about you? Were your born and raised in the US?

s1.value: She moved out of her attic.
2. She finally got a small apartment.
3. She is getting new furniture but just the basics.

s2.value: I moved out of my attic.
2. I finally got a small apartment.
3. My daughter just got a new skateboard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Other day I tried to play frisbee with my dude which was fun.Then I just want to tell you thank you for suggesting interesting game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have always wanted to learn to play frisbee. I can never catch the thing though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha yeah it can be tricky. Do you ever play frisbee with your dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I guess I could. He'd probably be better at catching and I can just throw. Right now it's cold out so I can't do much of that. Plenty of time to practice I guess.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah that's true, it is cold here too. That's cool your dog would catch a frisbee. My dogs are too small for that and not interested. They would rather snuggle on the sofa. You know there is also frisbee golf where you throw towards a goal and don't have to catch it. Have you ever tried that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, I had no idea that was even a thing! I'm going to have to try that. Frisbee golf? Who would've thought that would be an option. My dog likes to snuggle too but since we are inside a lot more he loves the excitement of going out too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's a lot of fun, you should try it. Yes, it is nice to go out and get fresh air when you've been in the house all day. My dogs do get excited to go for their daily "walkie." What kind of dog do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a golden retriever. Thinking of getting a second dog once I figure out whether my dog would get along with another dog living here. He's friendly but you never know. Plus, baby steps. Frisbee first. Adding another dog, second.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I totally agree. It takes a lot of time and energy to train dogs, so you want to make sure to take one thing at a time. I grew up with a golden retriever, but now I have three chihuahua rescue mixes. Golden retrievers are really some of the friendliest dogs I've met, though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's amazing that you have three rescues. That's a difficult undertaking sometimes considering the dogs can come from all different backgrounds. My dog is like family and yeah he is warm and super friendly. Was it difficult for you at first to get your dogs acclimated to being at home with you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We adopted one at a time and worked with each on their behavior before getting another. At first, yes, some of them were scared due to their background, but if you are patient and gentle, they eventually warm up and settle into their new home. Our dogs are like family, too. Have you worked on training or learning tricks with your dog?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Seems like you planned that out pretty well taking them in one at a time. Patience of a saint. I haven't worked on training or learning tricks with my dog. I guess teaching him not to get into the garbage and things like that could be considered training but nothing formal.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had some drama at work yesterday, that I resolved amicably.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What happened?  How did you resolve it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Someone posted the wrong update for a client, promptly tried to blame someone else! But turns out the other person was actually off work that morning, so couldn't have been them. Once he realised he was in the wrong he calmed down and we got it sorted.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Will there be any disciplinary action for the worker that incorrectly placed blame?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not this time, just a verbal from me. It's crazy how much drama we have for a small company. How's work been this week for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It has been rather good.  I have turned in good sales numbers so far this month.  A month end bonus looks viable.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's fantastic, well done! Have you got anything in mind that you would like to spend the money on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No.  Money has been rather tight lately.  I would probably be better off saving for a rainy day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah, probably a good idea. I'm spending so much money on organic produce at the moment, I'm thinking I will need to cut back.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, it is always nice to have a cushion.  Organic produce is probably a worthwhile investment, though.  It is good to invest in your health.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I suppose, there seems to be quite the business for it in Florida recently too. I should see if there's some other shops to try, even online might be more competitively priced.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good idea.  Try to reduce costs without losing the ability to purchase the organic produce.

2. They have had some drama this week.
3. They are planning a business trip to Florida.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is a businessman.
2. Speaker 1 has a small company.
3. Speaker 2 is a salesman,

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you like to cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love to cook!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome, do you ever cook for the kids at your work? I bet that would be a dream come true for both yourself and them!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I cook for my friends mostly. I like to throw dinner parties and murder mysteries. I cook 6 to 10 courses and I usually pair them with wine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like a lot of fun! I happen to be a bit of a chef myself...I enjoy making just about anything. Maybe we should throw a themed dinner party together? I think that would be a lot of fun!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yes, maybe something like what the ate on the  Titanic, or even what the first president ate for dinner. I like to cook French food: rack of lamb, fois gras, duck leg confit. I also love to cook German food; Spatzel, and bratwurst.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Those are some excellent themes and some even better sounding food options! I am really interested. If you are interested in a "murder mystery", perhaps I can write a little story to go along with it. When do you think we can get together and do this thing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am free most weekends. you should definitely write the story. How many people should we invite? Will we know who the killer is? Do we get killed after we cook? Do we hire a patsy so we can help solve the murder. So much planning!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my goodness I have so much to think through! We should do it NEXT weekend! I love a good deadline. That should give me plenty of time to write and get some rehearsed. We totally get killed after cooking. And then come back as zombie chefs? Endless possibilities! It's like Halloween in January!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The possibilities are endless. So, do is Monday. How about we do it in a fortnight. That way it will gives plenty of time, but not too long that we have to linger and lose stamina.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is an excellent idea. I suppose we should get together and go to the grocery store to get all of the ingredients we will need. There is a new place downtown that has a lot of exotic meats, want to meet me there tomorrow after work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! Do you know if it has organic fruits and veggies? Also, how about cheese? I am going to back two loaves of bread. One with Kalamata Olives, garlic, and basil, and one sourdough.. I get out of work at 4:30pm. Let's say we meet at 5:30 for some Espresso and a quick initial meeting. We can plan as we shop, and we may not need to get everything tomorrow. But, it is getting late, and I need to sleep.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is very interested in a murder mystery party at her work.
2. Speaker 2 does not currently have children.
3. Speaker 1 is a chef.

s2.value: speaker 2 is a chef.
2. speaker 2 loves cooking.
3. Speaker 2 is the wife of the owner of the business.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just saw a bunch of celebrity on Instagram wearing bell-bottom pants from the 70s! Does your mom's fashion brand create those too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, my mom actually loved those when they came out, and she's been dying to make a line of them! Do you like bell-bottoms?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not really. They feel very 70s to me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's tragic. I think they're great! Have you ever tried making your own clothes?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have not. Sounds complicated.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's not that hard once you get into it! What kind of crafts do you like to do with your sisters then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really like to do origami.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Origami is so cool! I tried it once but I had the worst time keeping the folds straight. What are you favorite origami shapes to make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like making cranes and planes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh cool! How long have you been doing origami? Do your sisters like cranes and planes too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been doing it for years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's awesome. Any tips for a newbie folder on getting your folds and edges crisp?

dialogue.author: 18496: So
dialogue.text: was watching a surgery video which I think you might be interested in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh really? What was it about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found it on youtube. It was a lung transplant being performed on an older man.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's cool. How did you find it? Were you looking for model sword videos and that video came up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I fell down a rabbit-hole, I was watching sword reviews, then scalpels, then the surgery video. Has that ever happened to you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh for sure. I can't tell you how many times I've just watched video after video on YouTube. You can find some really interesting information that way. Did you find any interesting sword reviews?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There were a few, my wife and I watch them together, she sent me the first one and that began my binge-watch. Are you married?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am! I got married recently. How long have you and your wife been together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Our first anniversary is next month! We're both newly-weds. Where did you honeymoon? We went to Greece.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We actually just went to a cabin in the Smoky Mountains. We were on a budget, but it turned out really well. We enjoyed it a lot. How was Greece? I've always wanted to go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Greece was beautiful, I recommend saving for a visit. The food was fantastic. I bet you found some delicious pistachio ice cream in the Smokies, though.

s1.value: Speaker 1 discovered online that he has cancer. He is undergoing a lung transplant from a male donor.
2. He made a sword review video for his wife as a way to cope with the cancer.
3. His wife is a nurse.

s2.value: He owns a barbershop.
2. He has an extensive collection of swords.
3. He was born in 197

dialogue.author: 18983: I
dialogue.text: st saw a spider behind my bed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ahh!! So scary. What are you going to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I called my boyfriend. I will not go anywhere near my room until he gets here. Have you ever seen a spider in your house?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, thank goodness. I would lose my mind. You should go to Starbucks and grab a Chai tea while you wait for him

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow! You give the best suggestions! That's exactly what I'm going to do before that spider decides to give itself a house tour! Would you ever get a pet? A non poisonous one of course

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would! I really want a cat. I've been reading books about them. Do you have a pet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a cat. I am keeping her far away from that spider. She loves to pounce and I don't know whether the spider is poisonous. If you need any tips on cats, I may be able to help :)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks! I am surprised you don't have a pet snake!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a pet snake before but it passed away. I think it may have been all my fault but I don't want to talk about it. It will be a while before I can bring myself to get another

s1.value: Was an actor before he became a teacher.
Speaker 3: Has been a teacher for 27 years.

s2.value: He never went to the store to buy a drink on the way home after his meeting. He drove home alone.
2. He is a very quiet person unless he is around a group of people. His pet name is "Hornet".
3. He is very fond of the color red.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got back home from a night out at the casino.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds awesome! I've been to a few casinos when I travelled in Macau. How much did you win/lose?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I broke even, so not a bad evening knowing my luck. That sounds soo awesome I would love to go to Macau what's it like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's so fun it was kind of like Las Vegas. I speak Chinese so I guess it was easy to get around. I took my mother and children there last year.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing! Perhaps me and my wife will go visit some time soon. You speak Chinese! Wow that's incredible do you speak any other languages?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just Mandarin, and a little bit of Cantonese. My mother was born in Bejing and came to America by herself when I was really young.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow that sounds really tough. She must be an amazing women. I wish I could speak another language, maybe I should start learning, any tips on the best way to start?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just speak a little every day and you will learn it before you know it. She is an amazing woman, that's why I took her on that trip! Which invloved some caving, which is also what gave me my fear of spiders!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for the advice ill make sure to try that. I've also been caving in Italy in the Blue Grotto on my European trip with my wife. It was so beautiful. Have you ever been to Europe?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I've never been there! But it always looks so nice. Watch out for all the creepy crawlies while you're down in those caves!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't mind the bugs and insects, my wife on the other hand she is just like you and hates spiders!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yikes, I hate them all LOL.  Where would a good place to visit in Europe for someone who has never been there before?

s1.value: I spoke Mandarin as a child and a little bit of Cantonese. Speaker 2: I spoke English very well so our travels were short, but I love casinos and travel.Speaker 1: I speak Mandarin as a child and a little bit of Cantonese.

s2.value: Has never been there before.
2. Lives in America.
3. speaks Mandarin

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How old are your children?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: 17, 15, 13, 11, 11 (twins), 7 and 5. How old are your daughters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that must be tough, I thought having a 4 daughters was hard work, I couldn't imagine having 7 children! The twins are turning 4 next week, while my oldest is now 7 and the youngest only 8 months!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really young kids. When did you leave the state troopers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: 3 years ago now, been a stay at home Dad this whole time, i just couldn't do such a dangerous job after I had my children I just kept thinking what would happen if something bad was to happen to me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I agree. Do you still live in Michigan or did you leave those winters behind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No we are still here, we can't leave with my wife's work being located here! Have you read any interesting books today? I just don't understand how you can have the time, with all your children around!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's tough but I mostly read biographies and history non fiction. I actually read a book recently about guitar hero Les Paul. Right up your alley!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That does sound very interesting he is my hero after all, maybe I will give it a read. Would you recommend it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: IT was very good. Do you have any Les Paul guitars.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have one yes, my prize possession haha, Definitely one I keep out of reach from the kids!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What is your favorite style to play, Blues, rock, jazz?

s1.value: How old are your children?
2. Where do you live?
3. What is your spouse's occupation?
4. How old are your daughters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have your dogs seen any ghosts recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They seen one yesterday and it scared them really bad as well as me. I like burn sage to try and keep them away.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, I would be terrified.  Have you ever considered having a psychic medium try to connect with the ghosts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I never have. I think I will probably try to find someone to come in my home. I always think that they will stir up more trouble if I have them in the house though. I tried to talk to the ghost once but then had to leave my house because more came out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have heard the same about possibly stiffing up more spirits.  I would strongly think about it though.  My aunt had a situation in her home about 5 years ago and used a psychic medium who was able to help communicate with the spirit and eventually the spirit was able to make peace and left the home.  I can get you the contact info if you are interested.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would so nice if you get the information for me. Your Aunt never had anymore issues at all after that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, never had any more issues.  She also has a couple of dogs who were always super sensitive and seemed to be more aware of the spirits.  They have not noticed anything either.  I suspect that not all spirits are harmful though.  My grandmother is ill and will probably not make it.  I would love it if she visited once she goes to the other side.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is so sad. Do you know what is wrong with your grandma?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She has cancer.  Has had it for year, but it is stage 4 now.  She worked at the asbestos plant when she was young.  She has had a very good life and has seen a lot.  She will be missed, but for now, we are cherishing our time with her.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am so sorry to hear that. Do they think the asbestos caused the cancer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: For sure.  She has always weezed when she breathes and my grandfather and uncle who also worked at the factor have previously passed away from the same issue.  It is really sad that they didn't do more to protect the workers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is really sad that they did not do more to protect the workers. Did you grandpa and uncle get cancer as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My restaurant is getting really busy now. How is your restaurant doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is packed right now, I have my manager in charge tonight because I'm supposed to be off but I might go in to help so she doesn't get overwhelmed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It sounds like you need to fire her and hire a new manager if she cannot run things on her own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, she's great but I just promoted her last week. She's the reason it's packed, she came up with a wonderful marketing campaign since business hasn't been great lately. Does your family help you run your restaurant?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its great she has your support, I hope she does well. It also sounds like she has a great boss! No, I think its best to separate family life and work life. Less stress.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes since. My son wants to work for me but I don't think it's a great idea because he thinks I'll not care if he doesn't do what he's supposed to.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, be careful he doesn't treat it like a playground. We should do a swap, your son can come and work in mine, and my daughter can work in yours.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think that would be a great idea! Is she the one who just had the baby?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, god knows how I'm a grandparent at this age, but it seems this was the life that was chosen for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is exciting for you though. I've heard of 32 year olds being grandparents, that would be crazy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: School wasn't very good at teaching sex education. My daughter and I went to the same school, so nothing much have changed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad my son has't had any kids yet. but my parents are wanting to be great grandparents soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2

dialogue.text: You're studing psychology right? Are you planning on working after grduation or go on to grad school?

dialogue.text: Working  then pay for grad school after.So you  like art of open fields? Sounds interesting

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: And believe it hard enough to see it through you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah but that's the thing. I'm usually so tired after work that I hardly feel like doing any of that. I'm on my feet all day, deal with obnoxious people, it's just so draining.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yeah that must be a tough balance. Hope you get to make time for fin frenzy  though

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah that's another thing lol. I used to love that so much and couldn't wait for Sharknado week. It's corny but a lot of fun. Are you still into Dragon Ball Z?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I im! Its one of those thing that I really look forward to dust off and just put then neat on my display

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you going to the big Dragon Ball Z convention later this year?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im hoping that Ill have time to attend.Got afew friends who will be attending so ill try to make time for that. You should come with

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really like to start traveling after retiredness; go around the world, see other places

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's really great relaxation after retirement. I love traveling and want to go all around the world.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What would be the first place you would travel to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have travel many places. Next I am planning to go to New Zealand. What is your favorite place?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really enjoyed Barcelona.  It was a mix of old and new.  Have you done any fishing lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love to go to Barcelona too. That is in my bucket list. Were you able to catch any fish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, I'm not a very good at fishing.   I just enjoy being on the water.  The waves are relaxing.  It was fun taking my nephew out there.  He didn't catch anything either.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: the good thing was you both enjoyed.  Do you have your own graphic art company?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I really enjoy making graphic art and I wanted to be my own boss.  It is challenging but a lot of fun.  What's it like to be retired at 30?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: i worked really hard till age 30. now I have enough to enjoy my life and I do bit investments here and there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good for you!  Any suggestions for investments?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: stock could be a good investment, but lot of risk involed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will definitely look it up,thanks. How`s your dad and the taxi business

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I wanted to tell you I ended up going up the tower with my sisters and overcome some of my fear of heights.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow thats great! I bet it helped having your sisters there to support you. How tall was the tower again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was huge. I think it was around 100 stories. Having me sisters there definitely was helpful. How are your kids doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh they are a a handful! You know kids. My youngest got himself into my painting supplies. There was paint everywhere! It was a mess. Do you have kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, yeah that does sound pretty messy. I don't have any kids yet, but I definitely want them someday. Growing up with 4 sisters, I really want to raise kids of my own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet! 5 kids is a big family. I bet you have happy memories of your home life growing up. Do you get along with all your sisters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Surprisingly we all get along really well and are still pretty close. You wouldn't have thought that based on how much we fought growing up, but we definitely got more mature as we got older and our relationship improved.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think everyone fights with their siblings growing up. I know my kids sure love to fight with their siblings! It doesn't mean they don't like each other, though. I wish I was close with my siblings. Maybe I should ask them to take me up a tower to bond with them. Do you have a favorite sister?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: True. Me and my oldest sister are definitely the closest since she is only 2 years older than me. Plus we also still live in the same town, so it's much easier to stay in touch. How many siblings do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! It's nice to have silbing close by. I only have 2. 1 sister and 1 brother. We are all close in age though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Me and my sisters are all reasonably close in age. Only 10 years difference between my oldest and youngest sister. Being close in age definitely makes it easier to get along.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It definitely does! Me and my siblings didn't get along during our early teenage years, but since then we have been really close.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a very shy person, yet has a huge personality!
2. Speaker 1's family lives in the same town as hers.
3. Speaker 1 enjoys spending time with her sisters.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has two sisters.
2. Speaker 2 has 3 older brothers.
3. Speaker 2 has 3 identical twin sisters.
4. Speaker 2 has been an artist since she was very young.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you finish reading the previous book?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I did, it was wonderful! I have started a new book now. Have you gone fishing lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: no I haven't been able to go fishing. work has been pretty hectic

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a shame. Is it tough working as a fireman? I guess that does not leave a lot of time for your family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's fun sometimes but other times it's quite emotionally draining. Just yesterday we had to stop a house fire.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! I can see how that would be draining. I have been doing a lot of reading, it helps me disconnect from the world around me. How has your family been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They have been doing fine! I just taught my kids to blow bubbles with bubble gum. I can't believe they're 7 and 6 now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Time definitely flies, that sounds amazing though! It must be great raising kids like that. Have you heard any good new music? I don't have a chance to listen to music very often but I am always open to something new.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I would definietly reccommend you listen to Drake! He has a sound for any mood. Have you heard of him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have but I have not listened to him too much, I will check him out. What is your favorite song by Drake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My favorite Drake song is definitely Hotline Bling. It has a cool dance. Do you dance at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love to dance, so I will definitely have to check that song out. What makes you like Drake so much?

dialogue.author: 25626: So
dialogue.text: hat kind of food do you like to cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to cook Italian and Mexican food, what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love macaroni and cheese. My mom makes it from scratch but she said she'd teach me how to make it! What kind of Mexican food do you cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ooh, Mac and cheese is great. My grandparents make the same kind. I usually will cook steak tacos or make tamales with my roommate. Have you done anything with your friends today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yummy! I love steak tacos, too! Me and my friend, Tommy, went skateboarding today. It was really fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! Did your parents let you go for a long time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, we went after school for a couple of hours but I had to come back to do a school project. I making a volcano!!!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ooh, with baking soda and vinegar? I've read about that but never made one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes. It's gonna be so cool! My dad is helping me. He thinks I might win a science award from my school!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be awesome! The only awards that I'll be winning are from Drake song identification contests. How are the pets doing?

s1.value: They both have cats and I want to get a hamster. I like the one that is furry.
2. I am allergic to cats, but I live with a dog.

2. They have a cat, named Poppi;
3. They also have a bird, named Bob.

dialogue.author: 15027: I
dialogue.text: cided to go apply for a job at the library. Wish me luck!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: All m best wishes are there with you! You will make it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks a lot! I really want this job, so hopefully my enthusiasm shines through.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: you will be a great librarian! Why you don't like dancing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! This is an assistant position. Hoping to get my foot in the door. Oh, dancing? I don't know. Self conscious I guess!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good position. You should start dancing alone at home . It is really relaxing. I love to read history books at my free time. It make me feel relaxed.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, maybe I'll try it out. I love history books as well. I love reading in general.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Why did you move from New Orleans to Louisiana?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: New Orleans is in Louisiana. I just changed cities to closer to Arkansas. I am near Texas too, the three meet at the top. What are you doing to help you lose weight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm trying to eat right and exercise every day. How do you like your new city?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is not as full and lively as New Orleans was, but it has more country and more horses, so that is nice. I do enjoy the fact that I don't have to be nervous about running over pedestrians every time I turn my head here. Where in Texas are you from?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm from west Texas. Football and oil country haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, ok, Louisiana is on the East side! Guess it is a bit different there. What do you like about where you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like the heat and the plains. What about you? What do you like about where you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I already said that I enjoy the fact that there is a lot more country and horses, and less pedestrians. But I guess I also like that there is a lot of local hospitality, that I can make it to 3 different states in less than an hour and that my friends live here

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah, yes I know you said that. I was just curious of what else there was that you liked. Do they have any good fruit stands in your new city?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yes we do. We have a great farmers market, and some healthy food trucks that carry fruit cups, and they offer the caramel sauce! Oh, and they have a really good edible arrangements store right next to my apartments so I can get nice looking fruit just by walking down the street!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds delicious! I need to eat more fruit. Do you suggest I try it with the caramel sauce?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would say that you should limit the amount of caramel sauce if you are watching your weight, but yeah, try it! Just don't over do it. Also, you can order yourself a beautiful bouquet of fruit from edible arrangements and it will make you want to have fruit all the time!

s1.value: Speaker 1 will be starting a new diet to help him lose weight.
2. He has lived in Texas, West Texas, Arkansas, and Louisiana. He currently lives in Louisiana.

s2.value: I am an Arkansas native with a job at a local university.
2. I have lived in 3 cities in the past two years and finally settled in the city of my dreams, St. Louis.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of car do you own? It sounds like a lot of fun and you can repair and sell cars for some good side money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a dodge. It's an old one. I haven't really thought about starting a side car business, but it does sound interesting. If only I had time for it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How many kids do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have 2 kids, a daughter who's 4 and a son, 2. How's the week been for you? Have you been helping out your dad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Your kids are at their cutest ages. They must keep you busy.  It's just a normal week. I helped my dad yesterday at the store. Today he does not need me. I am going to walk the dog in the park. What kind of car do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They sure are, but it's a lot or work having two kids who are this young. Good that you are walking the dog today. And I have a Dodge 2015 model.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you like the car? Do you plan to sell it to make some money?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's pretty good. I don't think I'll be selling it anytime soon. I do need it. Plus I don't think I can buy a new one just yet. What's your dog like? What breed is he? And what do you call him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a big black and white husky. His name is Mic. He is very strong. How about your two dogs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds wonderful. I have two pugs, both from the same mother. I call them Keanu and Reeves.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Your kids must love the dogs. Do the dogs like your kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They just adore each other so much! They are like 4 siblings, actually! Keanu is my son's best bud and Reeves is more attached to my daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have tickets to a concert tomorrow, would you like to go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool. What kind of concert? Classical music concert? I will be free tomorrow afternoon. It is in the afternoon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Lets just say its a mix of classic and rock... you'll love it! It's right around 3 if you can make it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh sure. I like rock music very much. As you know my favorite band is Led Zeppelin. 3 pm sounds great for me. Say what have you been up to lately? Went fishing the past month?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You can't go wrong with Zeppelin, my dad grew up with them and passed it down, even if the classical is more my jive. you've gotta diversify! I'm glad 3 works I'll grab you at 2:30, okay? No fishing unfortunately, lots of work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea for sure. Thanks for picking me up. You are lucky you got a job and have a busy life. I am having a difficult finding work you know. And my diabetes doesn't help either.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Of course, always happy to help, and go for a drive! I don't feel so lucky sometimes, but other times I'm out on the road or the water and you just kind of forget all else. That's where the luck is. Are there no fields that will accommodate you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are a good friend. And meh I don't know. I am trying everything. You know my mom is at Apple making a decent salary and she couldn't help me either. I guess I am just gonna try harder

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Helping is right, friendship and recognition aside... though I do enjoy some recognition! Ha ha! Maybe it's just a matter of looking further outside the area at this point.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea I guess you are right. By the way how was the Christmas party with your folks? Is your family doing okay?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'll help with that to! All went well, they loved the gifts! How about yours?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love getting together with my extended families. It was a big party and some of my relatives flew over to visit. We had a great time and I can say I always enjoy Christmas

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found out whether or not my trauma patients from today, are stable and pulling through after the surgeries.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds so serious. It must be challenging to deal with all the emotions that go along with trauma.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is, but I enjoy the challenge. What do you enjoy doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like to keep busy with hobbies.  My latest is trying to learn to paint.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow that's amazing. I wish I could paint well. My mother loves the arts and is a very artistic person. I didn't get that gene unfortunately.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am first starting by watching painting shows on tv and following along.  I bought some paint and an easel and am slowly getting somewhere.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great. I like watching Bob Ross paint, even though I don't try to paint along with him. I find his show relaxing after a long day at work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He is relaxing.  What type of art does your mother do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She is a concert pianist. She enjoys collecting art and has several recreated Rembrandt paintings. She has an eye for art. She is also an amazing home decorator. Her house looks like something out of a magazine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow that is so neat!  I wish I could someday paint even 1/100 like Rembrandt.  I would love to visit her home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sure! Next time you're in Chicago, give me a call. I can arrange a visit. Bring your art supplies! It will be fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great. Thank you!  I'd love to hear your mom play piano as well.  I have taken some lessons and enjoy the music.

s1.value: I am a speaker.
2. I work hard at being the best physician I can be.
3. My patients are all in good health.

s2.value: She enjoys playing jazz piano.
2. She collects Rembrandt paintings.
3. Speaker 1 found out recently that Speaker 2's trauma patients are doing well.

dialogue.author: 11557: Ha
dialogue.text: you been doing well? I hope you're dealing with your problem in a healthy way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hello! Yes, I've been going to meetings. How have you been doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great that you're taking care of these issues in a healthy way. Have you been seeing improvements?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, having support really helps. I hope to get that behind me and start living life again.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can understand that. I've always found getting support from others is the best way to be able to start on a new journey.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I highly recommend it. I'm working my way up to driving lessons. I feel safer about driving now that I'm sober. Lol, you'll have to give me car recommendations some day!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'd be happy to. Make sure to stay sober though so you'll keep the car in good shape.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How is the Passat? I know it's been snowing a lot and I've been thinking about you having to drive in that. Sounds scary.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well you do get used to driving in the snow. Ifworks for me. But four wheel drive is the best for snow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm very intimidated by four wheel drive. That's why I'm holding off on getting my driver's license until summer. One: I want to be 100% healthy. Two: the weather should be easier to drive in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Driving on clear roads is the way to start. But you will likely have to get used to poorer weather anyway

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I just have to be confident enough to challenge myself. I'll have to figure out a car that helps me do that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately I was running on the treadmill last night and twisted my ankle so I may have to cancel.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, no I hope you are okay. I was really looking forward to getting out on the lake!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know!  It's been a long time since I've had a chance to fish.  The dr said if I stay off of it the next few days and ice it, I maybe able to make.  So sofa city it is.  How's school going?  Have you gotten your math test back?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is going well. I got the test back and did much better than I expected!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I knew you'd pass!  Congrats!  Did you finally decide on a major yet?  I still think a business major is a solid backup.  It will help you with anything you want to do going forward.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My friend thinks so too. I was thinking about at least having that as a minor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think it would be a good choice.  I tried stuffing my burger with cheese last night like you said and it was delicious.  Where did you learn how to cook?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just picked it up here and there. How was the burger compared to your usual? I know you love them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very messy but much juicier than how I normally prepare them.  I hope you have so fish recipes you can share.  What type of fish do you have in the lake anyway?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think it is mainly bass fish.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice.  I'll eat any fish that I can catch.  Fresh fish is so much better than farm raised.  So have you decided if you're going to propose to your girlfriend on Valentine's Day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No. We are just friends.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is from Oklahoma.
2. Speaker 1 likes to play football.
3. Speaker 1 has a big smiley face painted on his forehead.

s2.value: Speaker 1 was in the hospital for two days with an injury. Speaker 2 is a professional athlete. Speaker 1 was an assistant coach for the basketball team. Speaker 2 is a professional athlete and speaker.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: So I'm thinking I need to find my own interest in literature again. I've never read Pride and Prejudice. What is it that makes it your favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: i think its just a really great love story and the way that it highlights the difference in marrying for love vs wealth and status

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds pretty neat. I think I'm ready to get into a new love story.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: thats a great idea, i hope it doesnt negatively effect how you handle your break up with Charlie but maybe it can help you highlight the signs of a healthly relationship and give you some closure

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I appreciate that. It's been a really tough month. How's your little sister doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: shes doing great, she tried out for her schools soccer team because she knows how much I love it and thinks that it would be a great way for the two of us to bond. she made the team and im so excited to help her practice and go to her games

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's really great. I'm so happy you two can share that experience. You can teach her all your moves!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I plan on it, have you ever thought about getting back into basketball? sports are such a great outlet for your emotions

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, but that's a good point. It might be a good way to get out some of the aggression.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: i think it would be good for you to find something to focus your energy on, or maybe you could get a dog? my golden has been such a great source of happiness in my life

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just don't know if I'm in a place where I can take care of something else right now. I'd be afraid I'd neglect it. Thank you for all your great advice though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I dont think you would neglect it, it think you would be surprised by the instant bond and having an animal that loves you so unconditionally

2. Speaker 2: i think its just a really great love story and the way that it highlights the difference in marrying for love vs wealth and status
