dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Debra, how are your archery clases going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey, my archery classes are going well. My teacher said I'm progressing a lot faster than he expected. Although, I hurt my forearm a bit with the bow string.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no! Is that a common injury in archery? In Tennis, we call "tennis elbow"

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's common if you don't relax your arm. I was a bit stiff at first and the bow string slapped against my forearm after I released it. Just a bit of learning pains haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It sounds painful! I'm sure you'll get better at relaxing before you release. I tried archery as a kid and enjoyed. I do remember those bows being heavy! You must have strong arms!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hehe, yeah that's what my instructor said too! The swelling has gone down a lot, so it should be healed up soon. I'm thinking of getting a forearm brace so it doesn't hurt if it hits against my forearm. What color do you think I should get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should look into physical therapy too! When I had tennis elbow, I went for a few sessions and the doctor was able to give me a plan to heal. I was amazed at how quickly I was back on the tennis courts. I never had a brace though. I'm not sure. What colors are you thinking of?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm trying to decide if I should get a bright neon type of color or a duller color like brown or black. What do you think?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The neon is definitely fun, but can bring attention to the brace. I guess it depends on if you want it to blend in or stand out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I definitely want to stand out so I can show off my archery skills haha. Everyone will be checking out my brace then be amazed by my archery :D

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha well then it sounds like you have made your decision! I like the neon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Neon it is! I'll send you pictures once I get it. Do you wanna go to the archery range with my next weekend? I can show you how much I've learned

s1.value: Debra, how are your archery classes going? Speaker 2: Hey, my archery classes are going well. My teacher said I'm progressing a lot faster than he expected. Although, I hurt my forearm a bit with the bow string.
Speaker 1: Oh no! Is that a common injury in archery? In Tennis, we call "tennis elbow"

s2.value: Speaker 2 says her classes are going well.
2. She hurt her arm when she did not relax it.
3. She will be getting a forearm brace.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I met a new person while I was out hiking today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh really, that's great! Are you going to see them again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I dont know but they were kind of like you. Talked about video games  a lot. Do you have a favorite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They sound very interesting then lol. Call of Duty games are my favorite. Do you play any?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sometimes when i'm not out either hiking or out at the bar. I like COD, but i play less stressful games more like rocket race.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like that game also. I just enjoy playing with my friends, I don't play any too competitively.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Some of the kids in my class that's all the talk about is tournaments. Oh i forgot to ask how is your pet iguana?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Jax is doing great. Probably one of the easiest pets to own and take care of

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Reptiles are awesome! My ex had 2 snakes and i miss those the most haha. Where do you keep it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a very large terranium that gives him plenty of space when I don't have him outside of it.  But I keep him in my living room so everybody can see him when they are over.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She used to keep the snakes right next to our bed but we usually had the out and about. They were always a hit at a party. DO you have yours out a lot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do quite a bit...Believe it or not, he loves to watch me play video games. He sits right next to my chair and watches the tv.

s1.value: I met a new person while I was out hiking today.
2. Their pet iguana is named Jax.
3. The pet iguana is Jax.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your dog? Does she like the park?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No.  She doesn't get along with other dogs too well.  But I have a huge yard that she can run around it, so it's all good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good. My sister is an English teacher to people who speak other languages. I hope you will be able to become a teacher.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Those jobs are cool because there are so many people around the world that want to learn to speak English.  When you get married will you consider getting a pet then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, and it can be done virtually for the most part. Yes, my fiance and I have talked about getting a dog soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My dog is a pit bull fox hound mix.  Sweetest dog ever!  What kind of dog are you considering?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think we will get a Corgi. They are great dogs, I had one when I was a kid.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's cool.  The queen of England likes Corgis.  I loved The Crown.  Did you watch it?  I'm not a history buff but it was really interesting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been meaning to watch that. I haven't yet. And yes that is one of the reasons I love Corgis. Maybe when I get a dog, I can bring him over to meet yours.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be cool.  Maybe with your vet office experience, you can help my dog learn to get along!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yeah, that's what I was thinking. I'm sure we can figure out a way to make your dog more social.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She is super chill.  When people come over, she is excited for about 2 minutes then back to her nap!  But not so chill around other dogs...

s1.value: I think we'll get a Corgi
2. My sister is an English teacher
3. She likes The Crown

s2.value: She loves her dog and would like it to be socially acceptable to own one, which would make the world a better place (SPEAKER 1)
2. She is an English teacher and would like to teach people to speak English, which could benefit her own family and country (SPEAKER 2)

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are you and Luis doing?  Have you been playing with your band recently?  I hope school is going well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We are doing awesome, thank you for asking.  Yes my band and I have been playing some outside gigs like in the park. School is going just ok for now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's all good to hear. How much longer do you have in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just until May.  Tell me about your dogs.  I love them but I am allergic.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Keep going! You're so close. They're good. I love having them, always nice to have something that's trilled to see you no matter what. Have you ever thought about a dog that won't shed?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will thank you for the encouragement.  I have thought about some different breeds of dogs that I may not be allergic to.  Maybe someday, right now not sure I want the responsibility either.  Too much going on.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah you do sound busy for sure. What are you going to school for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Business Management.  How about you, school? Job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I went to school for accounting. I work as an accountant at my local county government. It pays that bills.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is there another type of job you would like to do instead?  I have no clue yet how I want to use my degree.  I will be looking very soon to try to get something lined up before graduation.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Honestly I'm a bit jealous of your band. I played a bit in high school and always wanted to do that, but it's was much harder than school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awe, what do you play?  It is fun but I know that I will have to spend less time until I get an established career that like you said will actually pay the bills.  Maybe after I get my life situated we could get together and jam.

s1.value: Luis and I love dogs and I'm allergic.
1. Speaker 1 played in a band for a little over a year.
1. Speaker 1 is in school for Business Management.
1. Speaker 1 also plays guitar.
1. Speaker 1 has been playing guitar for over 10 years.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a guy who plays drums and plays with his band outside.
2. He has a girlfriend and they have a small dog.
3. They have a budget of $200 for the year and they don't have as many expenses as speaker 1 does.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should try making more friends.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was thinking of trying to add yoga to my workout routine - what is your favorite type to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like the yoga that helps me clear my mind and stay flexible. It helps me with my swimming and staying stress free.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I could definitely benefit from that - work has bee so stressful this past week, I need to unwind.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel you there. It has helped me tremendously for dealing with work. I guess that's how I can keep doing it 5 days a week.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How do you have the time and energy with working 5 days a week? When I get home from my call center job, I am exhausted. Of course it does not help that I deal with crazy people all day long. You would not believe the customer I had today. She tried to tell me that an alien spaceship had landed and "abducted" her package off of her front porch!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so ridiculous! That's the kind of thing I'd need to get a clean slate mind for, haha. I feel like I'm forced to use yoga at this point. It's basically my form of meditation. Swimming also helps me put my mind off of stressors like that. Do you think you'll stay working at the call center?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have to, I need the health benefits. It does offer perks like memberships to fitness centers, so I could try joining one, maybe take a fitness class like yoga. That is why I was wondering what type you do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe you should look into iyengar yoga as a start. You could also find some new friends there that could help improve your quality of life and take some weight off your shoulders.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good idea. So, what do you do for work? Do you get to set your own schedule or is more a 9-5 job?

s1.value: She works for a call center.
2. She goes to regular yoga class.
3. She has a swimming pool.

s2.value: She is a call center agent.
2. She works from 9am to 5pm Monday through Thursday, then leaves for a call center on Friday.
3. She works from 9am to 6pm Friday evening.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How was your chinese meal?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was pretty good even still tasted fresh even after I warmed it up in the microwave

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I am going to bring some chinese to the next boy scouts meeting.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure they'll enjoy it so tell me who's your favorite celebrity to impersonate

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like to impersonate Morgan Freeman. Although, his voice is very deep so it can be hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: His voice is very distinguished I've noticed he does a lot of narrating in some movies instead of actually playing a role

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's your favorite snack to take to the movies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It would definitely have to be candy bars Snickers he's my favorite of all and it's easy to sneak into the movies

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's my sons favorite too! I would say my favorite is sour patch kids. I always take some in my car on my way to a plumbing job.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How much do you charge to do the plumbing on an average house it's just been built

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Around $50 per hour, but it also depends on what kind of work is being done.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: nice I bet that's a decent paycheck especially when you add it up for a weeks worth of work or even better a month

s1.value: Speaker 1 has a daughter that's in the Boy Scouts and can't wait to take her next time they have a meeting.
2. Speaker 1's favorite snack is chinese food, especially chinese food that has been microwaved in the microwave.

s2.value: Speaker 1: It's almost time for your chinese food you should be hungry.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been working in my garden. How are your grandkids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They're growing up so fast! What garden progress did you make? Flowers or crops?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The weather hasn't been cooperating with me over here. It has kept me inside but I have been building a new compost system in the garadge.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Weather where I am has been messy too. I'm down in Texas, and we've had rolling blackouts and water issues for days. We got an alert this morning that the entire city is on a boil water notice!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I live outside of Fort Worth until recently. Looks terrible, what you folks are going through now. Weather is a strange beast.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Weather is for sure strange, and this is just so unexpected. I wasn't prepared for anything like this, just praying that my grandkids stay safe

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: So how do the orchids feel about all this cold weather? Grandkids in a warm spot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Orchids are certainly not cold weather plants, I took them and my grandkids to my friends house. She's on the same electrical grid as the hospitals so her power never goes out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Super cool that you have that option. You need to take care of that friend! Good thing you have your health. Are the hospitals avercrowded at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think right now they're not over capacity, but I'm not quite sure. Texans are very cautious about this sort of thing so very few people are out on the roads

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you getting out and getting excercise or is all your energy spent keeping warm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Way too cold for exercise, other than indoor walks. For now we are very focused on just keeping everything together. But enough about me. What's something fun you've done in the past few days?

s1.value: Works in his garden.
2. Lives in Texas.
3. Grandkids are growing up fast

s2.value: She is the mother of 3 children from her previous marriage and mother to two of her grandkids.
2. She has been married to her husband, Bruce for 34 years and is the homemaker in the home.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: we're going to see a movie with my friends, any suggestions?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I heard that Wonder Woman 1984 was a really good movie, especially if you are into Gal Gadot!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think I have seen a trailer for that and it looked good. I think my friends are more into horror movies though. Any good horror movies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hmm, I'm not into horror movies, so I am unsure about some recommendations. A quick search on Rotten Tomatoes could be a good start! Do you have any recommendations for any romantic-comedy movies for me and a date?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good idea. I don't really know of any newer rom-com's in theaters but I know of a few that are considered rom-com's that I've seen and liked, for example 13 Going on 30.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've heard that was good, and understandable, perhaps it will be a surprise for the both of us! In terms of movies in general, what is your favorite movie of all time and why?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My favorite movie is Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare. I love horror movies and I just love everything the characters go through and learning a bit more about Kruger. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Freddy Kruger is a total beast, but you might not like my answer.. My favorite movie of all time is definitely the Texas Chainsaw mssacre. It's extremely terrifying just thinking of something like that happening, considering the fact that the chilling movie is based on a true story

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like those movies as well and for the same reason. I like to be scared. I know that sounds odd but I just love horror movies. Have you seen any of the Puppet Master movies? Those are scary.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Puppet Master, I heard it was a very gory series! And no, definitely not odd, I'd think it's strange to be dislike horror movies! I think I will go check out the Puppet Master movies, thanks for the suggestion! What makes the Puppet Master movies scary, in your opinion?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Some of the Puppets just freak me out. Like the one with the big hands, he's so small! Why does he need such large hands? And the guy with the screw on his head, I was terrified to look under my bed for a bit thinking he was going to get me like in the movie lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds just like the fear I had of Chucky, not sure why I thought he was so terrifying, now that I'm a grown man it's funny to hear some of the things that Chucky says, albeit his horrifying face. Puppets freak me out, and this movie sounds like it won't let me get any sleep! Definitely am pumped to be able to watch it!

s1.value: Speaker 1: We're going to see a movie with my friends, any suggestions?
2. Speaker 2: Yes, I heard that Wonder Woman 1984 was a really good movie, especially if you are into Gal Gadot!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My paintings were accepted for a gallery showing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congrats. How many were accepted?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks! I am showing 10 paintings. If you visit New York soon, you can see my work in person!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sounds good, I would love to paint, especially something blue.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You should give it a try! I'm sure there are classes you could take in Oklahoma City, or you could just just buy a canvas and some paint from the craft store.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good advice, how did you start painting watercolors?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I took an art class in high school and fell in love with it! I was lucky to have a great teacher. Have you tried anything artistic before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I just play tennis.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, maybe you could try painting a tennis ball. Have you played at all this week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did play this week. My dog was watching.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, what kind of dog do you have? Mine would just chase the ball around and get in the way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's a service dog because I am deaf.

s1.value: Have you ever been to New York to see my paintings?
2. Would you like to paint a tennis ball yourself?
3. What kind of dog is your service dog?

s2.value: They won 2 gold medals at the World Championships in 200
2. They are currently ranked 2nd in the world.
3. They recently won the ATP Cup.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you take a lot of photos when you go hiking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea I like taking pictures, I like to think I'm good at it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! I'm sure there are some great trails in Maine to photograph as well! Do you prefer nature photography then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I like nature photography the most, sometimes I like up close shots of flowers and plants and sometimes farther shots of different animals

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds very peaceful, I'm sure they're beautiful photos! What is your favorite thing you've ever photographed?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hard to pick a single one they're all very nice, but I like up close shots with my macro lens.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's fair, I'm sure it's hard to pick after seeing so many things too! Have you only photographed in Maine or travelled elsewhere too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I get to travel to different places for my work, and the time I have off in the summer is when I prefer to hike.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's nice that you get to travel to work, I only get to travel to the worlds in the stories I write haha. It's not as exciting!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's unfortunate, do you travel much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, not very often. Seattle and Washington in general has a lot to offer though, there are beaches, forests, and cities so it's been nice to live here. But of course, I always wanted to travel more! Do you like traveling often for work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do enjoy when I travel for work, sometimes it's across many different states for my current company.

s1.value: I'm a nature photographer and I love hiking.
2. I also like photography and macro lenses.
3. I have macro lenses to take shots inside my home.

s2.value: Speaker 1 asked Speaker 2 which he likes more nature photography or up close and personal shots of plants and animals. Speaker 2 likes both and thinks he is a pretty good photographer

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My oldest kid told me he wants to be a lawyer like his dad when he grows up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is quite ambitious. What does your other child want to be when they grow up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He want to be a waitress just like me!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Where do you waitress at?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work in a Small restaurant near Kansas City.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have never been to Kansas City. Do you like it there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love it, I live here since I moved with my husband ten years ago.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do they have a good community theater program? I am very active with our community theater in Seattle.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, they have a good community theater program, you should move here and try it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will be looking at many different hospitals around the US for my residency.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, We got a least three big hospital here!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I will look into each of them! I was also looking at hospitals in California and Florida. I enjoy warm weather.

s1.value: His other child wants to be a waitress at small restaurant near Kansas City.
2. Speaker 1 has always wanted to be a lawyer.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is of Asian descent.
1. Speaker 2 is in the U.S.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I talked to my parents about getting lasik. They made an appointment for us to go in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's good.  Doesn't your vision have to be perfect to become a pilot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Its kinda complicated but you have to have pretty good eyesight. I just don't like wearing glasses anyway they're annoying.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay.  When is your appointment?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's on Saturday. Do you wear glasses at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I don't.  Knock on wood!  Have you ever had contact lenses?  I heard they are better.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Dont you have to touch your eye to put them in and take them out? I'm not sure I'd like that

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes you do.  I guess lasik would be better, no more glasses, contact lenses and hassle.  How effective is the process?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They'll explain all that at the appointment but I'm pretty sure that its safe and effective. There's obviously a risk but it's only small and I think it'll be worth it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It sounds scary and expensive.  But I guess it would be worth it in the end.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Luckily I wont be paying haha. I think since my dad's a pilot he knows how important it is to me so I'm lucky that he's willing to pay. What do your parents do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lucky you!  My parents coach men's and women's basketball.  They are both over 6ft2 so I guess it is an appropriate career.  Not as cool as an airline pilot, though!

s1.value: He was born in Chicago.

s2.value: Can you see past 100 yards? or can you read a map from 100 yards?
2. Does anyone else find eye contact with someone else to be difficult?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How has work been in New York?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I typically operate in the Harlem projects, so always eventful and busy. How are you liking your movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I finished watching "Moulin Rouge" finally, and it definitely lived up to the reviews and my own expectations. I'd love to see it live on Broadway.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've heard only good things about that movie, maybe I'll check it out. That would be quite a memorable experience to see it on Broadway. When are you headed out to New York next?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm thinking I'll go to NYC this summer, once the weather is warmer. It's chilly here in California, but not below freezing like it is on the East Coast. What's the weather like in New York today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Extremely cold, and it has been very windy recently so that doesn't help. You Californians are probably still in shorts and t-shirts, haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: LOL. No I needed to wear long pants and a long-sleeved shirt today. Have you been busy saving lots of people at your paramedic job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I do what I can in every response, so for the most part, yes. Lost a few last week in a gang shootout.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet it is rewarding work where you go home feeling good about yourself mostly, no? Well, except for instances like that gang shooting, I suppose. I've been watching this cool show called "9-1-1" on TV. Have you seen that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh for sure. But it's also draining, especially when things like that happened. I haven't seen that show, no. My life is 911. I prefer to kick back by fishing, even in the winter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Check it out. It's a really great show with 4 seasons so far. What are some good fishing spots in New York?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Next time I'm looking for a show I'll give it a chance, thanks. It depends where you go in New York. Crotona Park is good if you're in the Bronx, Clove Lakes if you're in Staten Island, or Central Park Lake if you're in Manhattan to name a few. Have you ever thought of becoming a theater actor?

s1.value: Does Speaker 1 have any acting roles?
Yes, I've had several roles, including a role in the 2007 movie "The Help,"
and a stage play called "The Great Gatsby" in New York.
My brother is a stage actor, and I have been asked to join him for some shows.

s2.value: He has a degree in film from New York University, and has appeared in numerous television, film, and commercial productions.
2. He also has a graduate degree in English from the City University of New York (CUNY) and a master's in emergency and trauma management from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
3. He is the chairman of the Emergency Medicine Society of New York and New Jersey.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are the kids? Did you work this morning?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Two of the kids are great thanks, but one has a stomach bug so is in bed. I worked the night shift. How was your job today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Same as usual. Loud and dangerous. I swear, I leave that place with a headache every single day. Still, your job is probably tougher than mine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nursing is tough sure, but very rewarding. Have you been to the jazz clubs in New Orleans?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have never made it to New Orleans, actually. I think it might be kind of an overwhelming city for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Why do you think it would be overwhelming?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't know, crowds? I mean, maybe that's only during Mardi Gras.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I went during thanksgiving break last time and it wasn't too busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, nice. Did the whole family go, the kids and the hubby?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No it was a romantic getaway for me and my husband. My parents looked after the kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Aw, that's nice. I'm glad you had a good time there. Maybe I should take a trip there someday. I certainly would like to check out the jazz clubs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The clubs are awesome. And so is the southern food! Whereabouts do you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you see the new Dancing with the Stars episode last week? It was thrilling!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes i did, it was amazing, Kirstie Alley looked amazing, the costumes were so decadent. It really is a great show!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you dream of going on Dancing with the Stars?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! I would absolutely love to. Iv been thinking of recording a demo. Maybe myself doing various dances. Im not sure. What would you do if you wanted to get on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would try to do dances from some of the musicals I have been in.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would need a partner to dance with, maybe we could combine and do a demo video together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a great idea!  What type of costumes should we wear?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I was thinking we could do a range of dances all in the one video, so multiple costumes depending on the song i guess. But id like to keep it quite classic, cocktail dresses, suits, kind of like the show.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We could do dances from older musicals like Fiddler on the Roof and Grease.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Great, we could do those, maybe a tango, something like  'Whatever Lola Wants', a salsa. We should definitely wear 50s stuff for Grease!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: This sounds fantastic.  How would you do your hair and make-up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Id quite like a beehive for hair, i could get my friend Anna who does hair for TV to help me. Makeup, id have different styles for each costume. Some heavy, some light i guess. Would you get a 50's quiff for the Grease dance?

dialogue.text: What book are you currently reading?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: the shining. hey what did you think of canada

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I didn't see much of Canada, but I loved Niagara Falls.  Waterfalls are my favorite.  What do you enjoy about living in Canada?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: waterfalls are great and Niagara falls is the best on both sides of the border. yeah canada is the next best thing to living in france for a native french speaker.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very true.  Is your husband also from France?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: yes but he can work anywhere as an author so came with me when i travelled for work. seems like you have a passion fro writing as well

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I really enjoy writing poetry. What type of writing does your husband do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: he writes finance books. not really poetry at all. lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, no definitely not, but those books are very helpful.  I need to learn more about finance myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: my husband says save more than you spend. don't tell him i told you

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha thank you for the advice!  I'll keep the secret.  So what type of art do you make on the computer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: actually i make gun art. what I coincidence that you are a leader of a gun club!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey Kourtney, I listened to some gary numan the other day and I enjoyed it. Do you have any songs to recommend me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey Megan, I am so happy to discover another potential Numan fan. Personally, I love the songs Cars and Intruders.  What songs were you able to listen to the other day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually listened to Cars, I was getting total 80's nostalgia vibes.  Maybe we can get some pizzas with extra cheese and you can play your favorite Gary Numan songs, and I'll play you some R&B?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe we can work something out in the near future! What type of R & B do you enjoy listening to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like 90's R&B, since it reminds me of high school. My favorite artists are TLC and Lauryn Hill.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have also loved chasing waterfalls, both figuratively and literally. Do you jam to R & B while sitting by the lake? Are there many lakes where you live?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's my favorite song! I don't have a waterfall near my house, so yes the lake has to do.  Just one big one at the edge of the property.  It's usually very peaceful this time of year.  Maybe next time you're over, we could snorkle in it. The water is pretty calm.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh,it must be nice to live so close to an accessible lake! I adore being near water, especially when there are great snorkeling sites to scope out! Are the scarfs you make by the lake for personal use or do you sell them externally?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's mostly for friends and family. I mostly make them to relax and destress. I feel like if I made them to sell, it would turn into a job, and then I would stop enjoying it as much.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ah, that makes a lot of sense. Have you ever made a scarf with a mango design? Asking for a friend...

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmmm, no I haven't made one with that on it before, but I guess I need to expand my scarf horizons. On an unrelated note, your birthday is coming up pretty soon, isn't it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Indeed it is.  I am in need of more warm clothing that incorporates mango and snorkeling design elements if anyone is wondering what to get me.  Maybe we can go out for some pizza for my birthday?

dialogue.author: 9124: I d
dialogue.text: w something earlier that I'm proud of.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What exactly did you draw?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I drew a realistic painting of my favorite food, spaghetti!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds neat. Do you plan to sell your artwork?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I always wanted to, but between being a married man and my workout schedule, I don't have enough time to make it into a part time career. Do you know anything about art?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's too bad, I would have been interested in buying it from you, since as I said before, I teach art. I could have used it in one of my classes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah that's right, I apologize it slipped my mind. Maybe I should consider taking some of your classes, do you want to get a coffee sometime and discuss it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I'd love to discuss art with someone who actually makes it! We should definitely do that sometime, if you're able to find time in your busy schedule!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure I can make the time and my wife will understand. I just hope I don't mistake you for your twin haha. Speaking of, how is your twin?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's doing good! Thanks for asking. I'll show you a picture of him when we get there so you'll be able to tell us apart if you ever run into him in the future, haha!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Very amusing my friend, maybe a painted portrait of him would be even better ha! I was thinking, since we both like physical activities, you could try one of my workouts and I could try yoga sometime

s1.value: He is a painter of spaghetti.
2. He is married.
3. Speaker 1 is also a yoga instructor.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a sculptor.
2. He works out a lot.
3. Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 share the same name.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What is your favorite subject in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite subject is computer science. What was your favorite subject?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love economics. My family had encouraged this interest. Do you practice tennis often?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Very cool. I practice every day. How often do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have not played since highschool but I have played in the wii. Do you play video games?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I like to play wii and gamecube. What other games do you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Mario and Zelda are my two favorites. I have many different mario games, they are pretty hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Those 2 are classics and are always fun to play. I find Zelda difficult at times as it requires logic to figure out what to next in adventure mode.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes that is right sounds like you know your stuff. I have finally got to the last few gold medals needed in mario kart.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That is impressive. I am currently trying to win gold in the special cup in 150cc, then I will have beaten the entire game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ill admit i have had a little bit of help from my family. My fiance is much better than me and has saved me in a few cases where i would have gotten silver if he had not won the last one for me. So do you have any famous sauce recipes to share? Seeing as you love spaghettis and meatballs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do not have a famous recipe per say but I do add my own blend of Italian style spices to give it good flavor. Do you cook often?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a computer science major and loves economics and Mario.
2. Speaker 2 grew up poor and is now a millionaire.
3. Speaker 1's favorite food is spaghetti and meatballs.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a computer science major in school.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Where do you like to take your dogs when you go out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We just go to the local park mostly. I tried to take them on some longer trails at least once a month. Have a good catches lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of dog do you have?  I caught a huge bass the other day.  that was awesome

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: A german shepherd. He loves going for runs with me. That's awesome!! Cooked any of it yet? I'd love a recipe for bass.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I didn't cook that one b/c I am going to mount it.  What do you like to bake?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow! That's pretty cool. I love making french pastries the most!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that sounds amazing.  I love anything chocolate.  Have anny good chocolate recipes

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course! I made an amazing chocolate croissant yesterday. So flakey. Have you gotten time to play your guitar lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are making me hungry.  I actually have a gig coming that I am really excited about

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice! Where are you playing? Country music or something else?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is a local restaurant and I will be playing a set there.  Yes country music.  do you like country?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm so excited for you! Wish I could come see you play. Country isn't my number one but I do like some of it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I grabbed a cup of coffee on my way home from the beach. What kind of coffee do you drink?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like dark roast. What kind did you get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I ran by Starbucks and got a Cafe Vanilla Frappucino. I love them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I really like iced coffees, but the whipped cream at Starbucks isn't my favorite. Have you tried cold brew?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've had it occasionally. I generally like all types. I especially like getting a cup in the morning a turning on the radio station to just chill and get ready for work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What's your favorite song right now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's not new but I can always stop and listen to "The Thunder Rolls".

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, gosh, I don't even know the song. Who's it by?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Garth Brooks. He's a legend

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, man, it seems like he's a good guy, too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I watch "The Masked Singer" and would have sworn he was on it this last season but it was Clint Black

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've only seen clips of the show so far.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you played any basketball recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, we're a ways into the season now! You haven't been able to watch any ball?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enjoy watching here and there when I have time. How is your team doing this season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We're middle of the pack, looking to make some moves upward as things progress. Try and catch us sometime.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will definitely try to catch a game sometime. Do you listen to a lot of music before your games?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, gotta stay pumped up and that's the best way for sure!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree, I like to listen to a lot of music throughout my day. Do you have any other favorite songs that help get you pumped up beside Keep ya Head up by 2pac?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Honestly a guilty pleasure for pump up is Get Ready 4 This. It just works for some reason! If you ever play, something upbeat like that is good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I agree, it is energizing. Have you been back to North Carolina University since you left?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I do guest speeches a few times a year, gotta give back to my roots. When you get on your feet, try giving back, it feels great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am not sure how well I would do with public speaking. For you, it must helping playing in front of huge crowds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, you sort of tune it out after getting used to it. You don't know if you don't practice though, so try!

dialogue.author: 15831: Th
dialogue.text: color of my walls are blue, I changed them yesterday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What color did you change them to? I'm so sorry your dog died. It's so hard to loose a pet!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I meant that I changed the color of my walls to blue. They were white before. Thanks for your condolences about my dog. Do you have a pet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't have a pet currently but I had a cat when I was younger. Blue sounds good! It would really bring more color into the room. My home could really do with redecorating. I haven't changed it since I moved in years ago.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You could change the color of your walls too. What color are they now, and what new color would you pick?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My walls are a pale grey which is pretty unambitious! I'd like to go for something much more exciting. Maybe a bright patterned wallpaper or red. Do you dye you hair yourself or get it done professionally?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do it myself, I like having blue hair because it matches my eyes. What color is your hair?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My hair is brown which is my natural color. I don't know what color I would suit. I love the idea of being a blonde but i'm not sure if it would look good on me. I'm so indecisive !

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you pet sit any cool dogs lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Dogs? No. I have pet sit an extremely well spoken parrot, though. Her name was Darcy, she was very eloquent. How are your pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that's pretty cool, I've never cared for a parrot before.  What's the strangest thing you've heard Darcy saw?  My cats and dogs are doing pretty well by the way, they don't really like the snow we've gotten though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I heard her accuse the fern of plotting against the household, that was pretty strange. Haha, I am very much like your pets, I don't really like the snow either!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is very strange!  I'd be careful what you say around that bird, you never know what it will accuse you of next...  And I don't like the snow either, but my sons sure have been loving it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me and the bird have an understanding. How are you boys, getting sick of all that metal music you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, well it's funny that you ask because they actually asked me to take them to a country music concert last weekend.  But of course I told them no, it's metal or nothing in this household.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Too right and all, can't have that type of music rotting their brains, I keep my hair purple specifically for metal concerts.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Nice! Have you been to any concerts recently? We should totally go to one together! Maybe that'll get the boys back into the right state of mind.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I haven't at the minute, everyone's on holiday in my town it seems so I'm constantly working looking after their pets and the odd plant, but I'd love to go with you to one, what band were you thinking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmmm, that's a great question.  I'll have to look up who is touring this year and we can go from there.  I will get back to you on that after doing some research tonight!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Try to get a gig that has a decent band for the opener, I hate when you have to listen to a band you don't like waiting for the headliner.

dialogue.author: 15999: I
dialogue.text: bmitted and application with Best Buy. You should have your brother put in a good word for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ill try. Hes kind of a pain. You know how brothers can be.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's a shame you don't get along with your brother.  My brother and I are tight.  I don't know what I'd do if he wasn't around.  I applied there too. Maybe we can be co-workers?  Have you applied anywhere else?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, it is ashame we arent close, but hes much older than me. Yea, ive also applied as a dishwasher at Bob Evans.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet you'll get some free food to take home if you get the job there.  A nice little perk.  How do your iguanas like the new heat lamp you bought for them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea, free food is the best kind. I think he likes it. He moves around alot more now. What made you decide to get two cats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad it's working out.  I like that they're fairly independent.  They aren't always trying to grab my attention like dogs would.  Plus they're very chill.  What made you pick iguanas?  The thought of them makes me nervous.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: they are so cool to look at. pretty lazy animal and they dont aquire much attention. Its the perfect pet for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I get the lazy thing.  We have small lizards that run around outside and hide in the shrubs.  My cats are always trying to chase them.  And they scare the heck out of me when I do yard work.  My brother on the other hand, would love an iguana.  Would you mind talking to him about the care and requirement of iguanas?  He likes to have all the facts before jumping into something.

s1.value: Speaker 2 was interested in selling speakers at Big Lots before his car broke down. He applied to Best Buy. Speaker 1 is an experienced salesman.
2. Speaker 1 is looking for a job.

s2.value: Speaker 1 told Speaker 2 he will probably get the job at Bob Evans. Because of this it was obvious that Speaker 1 wanted to invite Speaker 2 on the trip with him.
2. Speaker 2 had a pet iguana and used to get lost in the bush. He decided to go with a friend and get an iguana.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you listen to One Direction while relaxing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I sure did! But I also listened to Prince!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love prince! I'm assuming you are a big fan of music, whats your favorite genre?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I'm a child of the '80s, so a lot of my favorites are from that time period, 80's pop and rock. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm more a fan of Alternative Rock. My first concert was the Gorillaz, have you been to any concerts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I actually haven't been to a concert in many years. I think the last one was in the 1990's! I saw the Indigo Girls.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've actually never heard of them I might have to check them out. Other than listening to music what do you do for fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, my mom is a painter. For fun I like to photograph her work and try to get publicity for her. What do you like to do?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds nice! I enjoy horseback riding I actually have 4 horses of my own.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, wow! Do they live on your property or do you board them somewhere?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We used to board one but a couple years back my grandfather built a barn outback so we have them there. Have you ever ridden a horse?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have, only a few times and it was very controlled, in a ring. They are magnificent animals though! Did you start riding as a child?

dialogue.text: I read something interesting in the bible.

dialogue.text: What was so interesting that you read?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There is a part in the Old Testament that sounds like it is describing a dinosaur like creature. It's either a bad description or maybe an extinct creature. Are there any interesting creatures in Halo 3 that you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like the prophets in Halo 3 how about you have you played it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have played the first game that was on XBOX a long time ago. I remember the little aliens. Do you you ride your moped to work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I ride my moped around everywhere I love it and it's easy to beat the traffic with.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that is a good point. I bet it saves on gas money too. What kind of retail store do you manage?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah it does a lot cheaper than running a car and i'm not stuck in traffic wasting fuel. I work in a video game store.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that is awesome. One of the symphonies I have enjoyed lately is a collection of compositions from video games.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah what games are they from? I may know them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My favorite is Baba Yetu from Civilations IV, composed by Christopher Tin. The music from Halo is good too. Do you play anything else besides Halo 3?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah Halo's is good i'm not fimiliar with the Civilations one though. Yes I love the grand theft auto series as well.

s1.value: The speaker's favorite game is the Halo
2. The speaker played the original game on the XBOX.
3. The speaker plays for a video game retailer.

s2.value: Speaker 2: I read something interesting in the bible.

2. Speaker 1: There is a part in the Old Testament that sounds like it is describing a dinosaur like creature. It's either a bad description or maybe an extinct creature. Are there any interesting creatures in Halo 3 that you like?
3. Speaker 2: I like the prophets in Halo 3 how about you have you played it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went for a run and now I feel great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's nice. I wish I could go on a run. But Of course I have to watch my siblings

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, you should. How are they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are fine. Just bored. Well, the truth is I would really like to go running. I am too heavy for this

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You know what? I want to hire a babysitter for you siblings even just for one day, so you can join me running. We can even try rock climbing. I haven't tried that yet.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You are soo Nice. But I think I would only slow you down. We could though do rock climbing. You would see it is such fun. And then we could do make up. What do you say?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Rock climbing would be great. I know you're good at it. Yeah we can do make-up tutorial vlog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Awesome. What else would you want to do if this was a perfect day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would like to go to a pound and adopt a dog. You know that I don't have a pet, right? I want one now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What a great idea! I would love to do the same, but you know I would have another responsibility being the oldest of us, six siblings

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. Maybe I should just go there and pay a visit. I miss Todd, too. How is he? Is he still noisy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! Todd loves to participate in our conversations! What name would you give your pet?
