dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of my dogs gave birth to puppies this weekend.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh that is great! which dog gave birth? and how many puppies did she have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was Sparky. She had five puppies. They're so cute! Do you want one of them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh how lovely! and thanks for offering but i have to decline. i have my hands full enough with the 8 rabbits i have lol, i would love to see pictures though when you have time

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That makes sense. I bet dogs and rabbits don't get along. You're welcome to come see them anytime. How's the violin playing going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: it has been pretty good actually. the restaurant i have been playing in front of this past weekend offered for me to play a small concert this weekend for a fundraiser they are hosting. so im pretty excited about that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's amazing! Congratulations! I'll definitely come see you play. We can go get dessert afterwards. Chocolate sundaes, right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh you remembered my chocolate obsession lol, yes, its definitely a date, and thanks for offering to come out and see me play,  could definitely use the support!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's what friends are for! I'll bring Lily. I think she'd love it. What kind of music will you play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: i cant wait to see Lily! and for my line up, i havent quite decided what to play. the restaurant manager said the event will be more upbeat and  cheerful so i will probably play some upbeat classical pieces or maybe even a few jazz pieces

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that'll be fun. Classical is good, but you want patrons to be awake and ready to tip!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh i definitely will keep the audience interested. That is how i got the gig after all, perking the manager's interest lol

s1.value: Speakers name is Angela.
2. Speaker 1, has a dog, and has played viola.
3. Speaker 1, has just had puppies.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a dog.
2. Speaker 1 has been playing the violin for 19 years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went out and bought a video game.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Which one did you buy? There's so many good ones out right now

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bought this cooking game so I could play with my mom. She did not want anything too crazy to play. Have you invested in any recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I've been really into Red Dead Redemption 2, the story mode is incredible and the graphics are really nice. Its all set in the Wild West

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I feel like the graphics really do make it or break it for games. I was showing my mom some games to choose from and all the good ones scared her away. Do you ever play video games with your boyfriend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's the one that got me into them! He's a classic gamer boy, light up keyboard, custom PC, and everything

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds so cool. I have a neighbor who just invested hundreds of dollars into their gaming room and everything lights up, even the console. I feel like my mobile device is all I need for many of my games.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I respect people who have those big light up setups, but its too much money I totally agree. If you have a basic computer, you should be good to go

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Way too much money. They had to save up their summer's income and treated themselves. I also agree. A computer has always been popular. Growing up that is all I had to play any kind of game. What about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My brother got an Xbox in high school so I played a lot on that, but also had the classic wii when I was young. Super marios bros for the win

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I remember the Wii, I had so much fun on that. Did you ever do the dancing and sports games on the Wii?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! Just Dance shaped my childhood music taste, got me into Nicki Minaj and gwen stefani

s1.value: Speaker 1: I went out and bought a video game.
Game: Cooking Game

s2.value: Has multiple systems.
2. Grew up with video games.
3. Has a family.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just got another modelling job that I'm super excited about!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Congratulations. When do you start?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Next week! How is your job going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is going great actually.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that is great to hear! What do you like about it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I like talking to the customers.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet you get to meet a lot of interesting people. Who was the most interesting customer you have had?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I served a very grumpy Japanese customer the other day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What was he grumpy about? Was he mean to you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He seemed to be having a bad day. Not mean, just grumpy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm glad he wasn't mean to you. Poor dude. What is your job at McDonalds? Are you a cashier then?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I am a cashier.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a model that works at McDonalds.
1. Speaker 1's job is a model for a new clothing store.

s2.value: Speaker is excited to get her new modelling job next week.
2. She has a great job as a cashier at the McDonalds.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Why wait until you are older to teach piano?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I suppose i don't know if I'm good enough to teach people.  I'd like to be sure that I'm an expert first.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I understand. It took me a long time to learn how to become a surgeon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh well yeah I'm sure, that seems much more difficult than knocking on some keys haha.  What kind of surgery do you do again?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm an ER surgeon. I see some gruesome cases.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sure that must be tough work.  Well at least you get rewarded handsomely for the expertise you provide to the world.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do! I power through the tough times because I know that what I'm doing is important - I mean, people who go to the ER need someone to operate on.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes very true, probably one of the most important jobs out there.  How is your daughter doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: She's great. She is lonely sometimes though because we have no pets. I'm thinking we should get a dog or something.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a great idea!  We have a dog and it improved our lives so much, i think it would definitely be a welcome addition for you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I think it  would help especially with long shifts in the ER. Might pick up piano too, now that you mentioned it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah?  That's a great thing to pick up!  I could show you the basics if you like!  And it could be practice for my teaching as well!

s1.value: Speaker 2: I suppose i don't know if I'm good enough to teach people. I'd like to be sure that I'm an expert first. Speaker 1: Yeah, I understand. It took me a long time to learn how to become a surgeon.
2. Speaker 2: Oh well yeah I'm sure, that seems much more difficult than knocking on some keys haha. What kind of surgery do you do again?
3. Speaker 2: I'm an ER surgeon.

s2.value: I do not have a piano as of yet.
2. I am an ER surgeon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Can you tell me more about stamp collecting? I don't know much about that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Just involve collecting and pilling stamps in organized or systematic manner. What is your hobby?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like going to new places and learning about their culture.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, Which places have you enjoyed most visiting?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I really enjoyed visiting Canada.  Crazy place.  Have you ever travelled abroad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really, I love it indoors. What is crazy about this Canada?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: If you go to the east everybody speaks French.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What? really, I would love to hear their accent.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's awesome, the rs are very difficult though.  Takes a lot of effort to get them right.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow what do they commonly eat there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: A popular dish is called "poutine" which is like fries and cheese.  It's delicious

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Year it really sounds delicious hope you learnt how to make it. I would like you to take me through the recipe.

s1.value: Speaker 1 doesn't like to travel outside of the state he lives in.
2. He is a collector of stamps and also likes to collect baseball cards.
3. The only hobby of Speaker 1 that makes any money is stamp collecting.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Has never been inside Canada or the east.
2. Speaker 2: Is also passionate about stamp collecting.
3. Speaker 2: Has an average intelligence.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I heard from my dad in the service.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! Did you get to video chat with him? Or was it just a phone call? How is he?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, just got to hear his voice, but it was SO great.  It had been too long - it's hard to do when we're both on active duty.  He sounds good, but maybe a bit run down.  He's stationed in Korea right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad you got to hear from him. When is he due to get home? Will it be before you head out on another tour?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You never know when things might suddenly change, but right now, it looks like he'll be home in July, and I won't have to go anywhere until October.  Looking forward to that time - even if it means giving up "my" truck for a while...

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha. I get that. But there more you share it, the more time you'll have to spend together. I couldn't imagine being away from my dad that long. He lives on the next street over and I can walk to his house in 5 minutes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow. That's so great that you appreciate that closeness.  It's hard to think about a time when my dad's not around anymore. Hey, I mentioned you to him. He says you haven't even lived until you've tried steak in Korea. They take their meat very seriously there!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, really? I'll add that to my bucket list. I was already planning to go to Japan to have some Kobe beef at some point in the next 5 years. Maybe I'll have to add Korea to the itinerary.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Dad says you can get "real" Korean food on the west coast here, but not on the east.  He says if you're in the LA area, he'll give you the name of the best Korean BBQ in the states.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would certainly save me on travel expenses. I live about 3 hours up the coast from LA but I get down there a few times a year. I'll have to check out the place he knows next time I head down. Have you ever been out to LA?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Only when I was a kid. We went to Disneyland, and saw some USC basketball.  It was a great father-son trip, but a long time ago now. Hey - maybe I should see if he wants to go out there together again, this summer! That would be a blast. Maybe meet up with you and your Pa, huh?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be great. I could put you up at my place and we could make a trip into LA for a weekend. Definitely have to hit up that Korean BBQ.

s1.value: I am an active duty US Army Soldier who works at Fort Benning.
1. My Dad is currently stationed in Korea.
1. I hear he has already met one of his sons from Korea - they have been working out at the Fort together.

s2.value: Speaker 1: I got to hear from my dad in the service.
2. Speaker 2: That's great! Did you get to video chat with him? Or was it just a phone call? How is he?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What's your favourite kind of beer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Hey Abigail, how are your 300 cats? As of right now my favorite beer has to be Dos Xs. Do you drink beer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Beer, I love it! I actually don't have any of my cats any more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Really? you dont have cats, I thought you worked for Peta, and make their clothes from willow bark, you make socks and t-shirts for them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did. Unfortunately they all had a bobsledding accident

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No way! thats crazy Abigail, Are you okay? I cannot envision losing all of my beloved animals at once. Do you think you can still make 50k a year without your cats?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately I am unsure about my future income. I will get more pets at some point. Do you ever consider getting any?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you going to get more cats? losing your cats makes me want to drink more beers, for their honor. Pets are a lot of work, I dont know if I have the energy or time, thats why I buy a lot of beers

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will probably get more cats. If you drink so much beer, do you try to buy cheap beer so it doesn't cost as much?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have bought cheaper beer before but did not like the taste, my life motto is 'treat YOself' I want to live my life with quality items, you know? I dont want to die and be in heaven thinking to myself why did I drink 1 dollar beer? lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha! I guess i understand that.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: do you treat yourself? Im guessing you do since you did teat yourself to 300 cats, what breeds do you like to buy?

s1.value: She is a cat lady.
2. She works for Peta and makes their clothes from willow bark
3. She is a cat lady.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a comedian, he is a member of the Muppets. His best known role is as Fozzie Bear, Fozzie Bear. He started drinking beer around 9,000 bc. and is known as the "Godfather of Booze".
2. He was born in 1958 in Milwaukee, WI. His drinking habit started drinking a beer after every meal to counter the effect of the hunger he felt after a meal.

3. When he was in his 30's he decided to stop drinking all together. After a few months of not drinking all together he joined a karate class and quit drinking. He has participated in charity runs, 5K's, half marathon's, and even has a marathon and a 3,000m run.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What are your favorite things to do during winter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I like it when everyone in my family gets together for a Christmas party. That is something I really look forward to in the winter

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is really a fun thing to do! My family used to have an annual ski trip where we built this really warm fire.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh nice. I used to go skiing when I was young. But not anymore you know. I can barely do any physical activity. So I guess winter is your favorite season?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I do love winter. I hate hot weather. Though it has been quite a while since I've gone skiing. I love taking long walks though get into the nice outdoors without having to travel too far.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool. So what do you do? Are you a student or working?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm currently working for the corut system. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh cool. So you are a lawyer? I don't do much for a living. My body aches constantly so my doctor gave me something strong to ease the pain. I sit in front of the tv most of the time

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm a clerk not a lawyer. We just deal with docketing all of the filing for lawyers. Sory to hear you're in so much pain. I hope the meds are helping at least a little.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah some powerful stuff my doctor prescribes me haha. I see you have a great career and bright future ahead of you!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thank you. I wish I was moving up in my career instead of being stuck in the same entry level position forever. But the work isn't hard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You will someday for sure! I know how hard you work. Do you still bake bread?

s1.value: He is a clerk in the U.S. House of Representatives.
2. He grew up in the Bronx, New York on Long Island.
3. He studied law at Georgetown University.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has a favorite time of the year, winter.
2. Speaker 2 does not ski anymore and does not do much physical activity.
3. Speaker 2 bakes bread.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you go riding on your mountain bike at all today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not in the end. It got a little cloudy and cold. Did you go riding today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was able to get out for about 2 hours, did a tough trail in the Adirondacks.  At the end of the ride, I punctured a tire, so that was a bit of a bummer.  Hope you can get out tomorrow.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sucks, I'm sorry to hear. Practice piano at all?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not today.  During the week I have actually been giving lessons to my niece.  It is lot's of fun and she is like a sponge, absorbs everything.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's the best time to learn, I wish I'd learned as a kid. I made a dozen hard boiled eggs today to take mountain biking, I'm so excited!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love hard boiled eggs and making them for the bike ride makes a ton of sense, they pack a lot of energy.  I am actually boiling some water for a cup of tea and will probably boil some eggs too now that you mentioned it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a smart idea. If you make extra you can pickle them, too. Makes a nice change in taste!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Absolutely.  I am actually thinking of getting a few chickens so that I can have fresh eggs whenever I want them.  Have you ever had fresh eggs?  They're a lot different from the ones you buy in the store.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Only once, but my goodness they're a world away aren't they? Totally different. Thankyou for reminding me, I should find a farm nearby.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Always good to support the local farmers.  I try to do the same, in fact I often stop by a local fruit stand when I am out mountain biking to pick up an apple or two for the ride.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's another great idea! I should really eat more fruit.

s1.value: Speaker 1: Did you go riding on your mountain bike at all today?
2. Did you go riding today?

s2.value: Speaker 1: Did you go riding on your mountain bike at all today?
Speaker 2: No, it got a little cloudy and cold. Did you go riding today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How was your day teaching today?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was rough, I swear these kids are trying to break my will to teach. Have you ever felt like someone so innocent was out to get you for something you didn't even know you did?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It wasn't going too well

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would say not. I have been tripped, spit on, had my test papers shredded while the class ran around and laughed. Worst of all the administration won't do anything about it. What do you think I did to deserve this?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You do need to cheer yourself up a bit, how about cook a lovely meal or treat yourself to a nice restaurant?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am not sure we are speaking the same language, will you not even guess my actions to merit my misfortune? I will not have my love for steak and veggies be ruined by my horrible mood, so if you are just here for more pictures of my sous vide steaks then I think its time we parted ways.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, just trying to help here, anyways hope you enjoy rest of the evening, bye

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah help yourself to my delightful food pictures so you can do who knows what with. I can't believe you would pressure me to grill at a time like this. I can't even be sure you aren't one of those heathens.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Goodbye, I am off to a new movie, really gotta go.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aha so you are one of those kids. Which one are you? Michael, Jason, little Tonto? You can hide in the darkness of the movie theater but I know the truth. Why must you stalk and haunt me so?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You are funny but I ain't. Movie is starting so...and wishing you best of luck with your teaching.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Little Tonto, now I know its you. Using that deplorable contraction, ain't. Didn't your mother ever tell you, "Ain't, ain't a word, because ain't ain't in the dictionary."

s1.value: A married woman who goes around teaching elementary school students.
2. Teacher and principal refuse to take action on her harassment, claiming she didn't do anything wrong.

s2.value: The only subject Speaker 2 taught is science, the other was music and art.
2. Speaker 2's favorite subject was art.
3. Speaker 2 was fired for having a bad attitude.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: One of my professors dropped a big project on us.  It's going to count for a major part of our grade.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh, what subject is it in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is on philosophy. I think I am going to enjoy the project but my panic is on the weight of the project on my grade. The Professor can be unpredictable sometimes with his grading.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's too bad. I can imagine that would be the case with philosophy, it's so subjective. Hope you do well! Do you think you're going to any concerts soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, you are right. What! Concert when I have such project on the way. I have abandoned everything that has to do concert for now. What is your plan for the week?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think I'm going to go shopping for an antique dresser-I'd like something nice to store my clothes in. I was thinking I might try to eat vegan for the week, try it out, you know?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is great! I bet you will enjoy vegan. I love it a lot and it makes me feel good.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'll see how I like it-I love falafel and that's vegan so I plan to eat a lot of that haha. So you grow food right? what kinds of food do you grow?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What do you think about philiosophy?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I like it, but I'm a little scared of it because it's so subjective. That's why I never decided to study it haha, I'm afraid of professors like yours.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Smile! You should allow fear to conquer you. It exposes you and makes you see the world in a different way. Try it and you will enjoy it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a good thought! Spoken like a true philosophy student! There are some community colleges that take classes, maybe I'll try one out!

s1.value: Speaker 1: One of my professors dropped a big project on us. It's going to count for a major part of our grade.
2. Speaker 2: It's on philosophy. I think I am going to enjoy the project but my panic is on the weight of the project on my grade. The Professor can be unpredictable sometimes with his grading.

s2.value: The project was on philosophy which he believes he will enjoy learning a great deal.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How was your engagement is going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's great! Planning our wedding soon!  How's school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Awesome! Where will the wedding be? School is ok but super busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably somewhere in Kentucky--close to the family.  What's your favorite subject in school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok, outdoors or inside? My favorite has to be science. It's hard but I like it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably indoors, there might be snowy or rainy weather and we don't want to risk it.  What area of science do you like? I love physics, but biology is just not for me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah that makes sense. I enjoy chemistry believe it or not. Physics is intense though! Have you been working out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Chemistry! That one seems interesting, but I've never taken it.  I work out every other day now.  By the way, have you listened to any music recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah I've been browsing, trying to find some music like Charlie Daniels. Do you have any recommendations?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, I don't.  I only really listen to heavy metal music.  You know, Iron Maiden, Slipknot, that kind of thing.  What's your favorite Charlie Daniel's song, though?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah ok. Still in Saigon! It's great. Have you heard it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I haven't.  I'll listen to it right now, though!

s1.value: Speakers favorite subject in school is science.
2. They plan a wedding in Kentucky.
3. Speakers engagement is going great.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a photographer.
2. She and her fiance are getting married in Kentucky.
3. Her favorite subject in school is science.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you ran on any cool trails lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have! I went to Gainesville last weekend and they had this really challeneging trail with beautiful trees. They have great hiking too, so let's hit it next time you are in town.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ok but if I come in summer, I'd rather go swimming. It's too hot in Florida for hiking in the summer!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Fair enough! Bring your three best friends since they enjoy hiking too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will! Are there any National Parks around that we can explore?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes! Paynes prairie is beautiful and has a wide array of wild horses, gators, birds, and deer.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's also near Daytona. Can we take a tour of the race track? I love car racing, does your fiance?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We must do that! You can teach me about all of the cars! My fiance loves racing too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Good! I wish I could drive but I'm only 14. How has your work been going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You aren't far away from 16. Work is busy, but interesting!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It sounds alright, but for now me and my friends will just enjoy school. We can wait for all the adult stuff. Does your fiance work in the same office as you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is a good attitude. You have plenty time for adult stuff later on. My fiance does work with me. That is how we met!

s1.value: Speaker 1: Have you ran on any cool trails lately?
2. Have you ran on any cool trails lately?
3. Have you run on any cool trails lately?

s2.value: He is not very fast with a bike and he enjoys hiking and swimming. He also likes the outdoors.
2. He has been in Gainesville for this weekend and he would like to run on some trails there next time he comes to town.
3. Speaker 1 is his mother's maiden name and he has been married for 2 years and has a toddler son.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How did your latest gig go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was great! The crowd was a lot of fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Fun, thats what we like to hear! Try out any new material?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We did. We tried out a song that I think we'll keep. There was another that was a little rough but the crowd were good sports. We'll have to work more on that one. Do you like live music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I do like it. Generly I don't enjoy dealing with the crowdes, so I don't take in as much as I would like.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can see how that would be an issue. Maybe you would like outdoor music festivals better. Although those can get crowded too. Unfortunately it's a bad day for a band if a lot of people don't show up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know many people that enjoy the crowds and the feeling that goes it the event. Thouse people need to show up! I'm just not one of them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can understand that. Do your dance competitions get crowded? I guess it's different if you're not out in the audience.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thats exactly right. There is a place to escape to. But they can be nuts too. What the average size groupe you play for?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We play a lot of bars and clubs, but we occasionally do bigger venues too. Maybe someday we'll play to a stadium!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How do you move equipment around? Is there a band van or a bus?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We have a van. It works for now.

s1.value: Sings for a band and performs at bars and clubs. The average size of the audience is small.

s2.value: He is an avid photographer.
2. He is a musician.
3. He is the host of a radio show.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Are you up? I figured you are since you are a night person!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You're right! I'm up working late. How's it going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I figured ! It is going great. Just wanted to ask you for a favor. I was wondering if I can post all my stamps in your online shop. Of course I will pay however much it costs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, sounds good to me. Have you heard of the continuation of the series?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have not, can you explain it briefly to me ? I am interested !

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There's a spinoff prequel that takes place in the same universe. Fantastic Beasts and Where To Find Them. You should check it out.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: OMG ! no way, I will investigate more tonight. By the way, Have you though of swimming again. You can join me tomorrow in my laps ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe if the weather warms up. It's still freezing where I'm at. I was actually thinking we could try making some music through videochat. I can sing and you get your cello?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds better. I would be willing to follow through with the plan. So, I imagine you would want to do this at night. Right?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, because I'm a night owl forever! Quick question, have you ever sold your stamps online before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sticking to your terms, I like that. LOL I have not actually, it is why I am going to request your service. Will you be able to ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sure, no problem. I was just curious. I've had quite a bit of success with my shop and I'd be glad to help you out.

s1.value: She is a night owl.
2. She works late most nights.
3. She is a talented pianist, she can read music, and she can play the cello.

s2.value: I love to play musical instruments, specifically the cello.
2. I'm a night owl and I love to work late.
3. I'm a little awkward when it comes to getting things done.

dialogue.author: 20526: Ha
dialogue.text: you decided on what tattoo you will get next time yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im thinking on doing a white circle on my neck. I have so many ideas, how about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds like fun.I might get another but im taking my time on that

dialogue.text: What do you like to do for fun?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love arts, so museums and galleries are where I spend my free time.How is school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: School is hard, but I cannot wait to be a dental hygienist. I wish I had some free time to do other stuffs. What are you studying?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Im majoring in psychology,and really enjoying it.We should meet up for coffee sometime soon

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Definetly, there's this new coffee shop next to your school. They serve chocolate croissant, I'm in love

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Great! Plus I would love to see what other tattoo you have decided to add

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Im thinking on completly covering both hands with white thorns. I'm not sure yet. What was the last exhibit you've seen at a museum

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I went to the go carts track and had a race.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow I would love to do that one day. What sort of training do I need?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: All that's required is a brief lesson by the instructor on duty! It's actually really simple and fun. How's your dog doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Lovely as always, that's my anchor right now as you know am single. Is there like a special track for the deaf ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't believe there is at my track, but I'm sure there is one available! It might be worth researching online to see if there is an instructor for the deaf.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I might try to get a feel of the adrenaline. How is your husband faring on?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He's doing very well, thanks for asking! He hates racing so he stayed at home and worked. He's a freelancer just like us.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's good for the both of you as you get to have a flexible schedule. Guese what, it would be really nice if he is in the stands cheering you on..

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, that would've been awesome. He's pretty introverted and busy, sadly, but I knew he was cheering me on in spirit!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah at least you get to go back home to someone. I hope he likes you guitar plays though?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, he's a big fan. He plays drums himself. At least I can get him excited about that!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: We should plan we meet over pistachios I get to meet him formally...

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was playing the drums just now and my neighbor got really mad at me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear that. My neighbors don't get upset when I play the drums.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: You're lucky! Mine are so mean.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Mine are horses! They're very silly animals.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh wow lucky! I love horses.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I raise them so they have to put up with my music.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool, I want to visit your horse ranch some time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You totally should. We have lots of room for visitors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing, I can't wait to see your horses!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'll let them know they have visitors on the way.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's so funny, do they like strangers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not usually but they get used to you quickly.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I decided to make salmon and pita bread for dinner!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ooh that sounds delicious! I should make that for the kids. Did it take long to make?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was very delicious, and it took less time than I expected! My dog kept trying to eat some of it though haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow I didn't know you had a dog! What's it's name?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Her name is Lily, she's so cute that it's hard not to give her food sometime! Do you have any pets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No, I don't have time for pets with the kids and my job. I feel like adding a pet would just be added stress

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea that makes sense, it seems like it's so hard to find extra time these days. How has your job been recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's been tough but I have been remaining hopeful. I am planning to go swimming this weekend to relax a bit

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I hope you have fun there! I went to the pool myself last Friday, and there wasn't anyone else there so I had it all to myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a great time! Did you learn any new pool tricks while you were there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea, I learned how to do a headstand underwater! It took me almost the whole time there to get it right.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow I wish I had time to try that. It must take a lot of physical strength, huh?

s1.value: I decided to make salmon and pita bread for dinner yesterday! It took me about 2 hours.

dialogue.author: 14668: Ho
dialogue.text: you got some time away from work to play some basketball or even see imagine dragons!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah I actually went to see them last week! It was my first concert and they were amazing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Ah that sounds fantastic! Where were they preforming?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: At a place pretty close to where I live, it was only a short walk away. I've loved them for so long so it was awesome getting to finally see them in person

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great! Handy that they were so close by. I've not been to a gig in years. Must've been good to get away from work for a while. Has it been busy recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, very busy. I've been working overtime for weeks but now it's finally easing up a bit. How is your teaching going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a shame, hopefully your workload keeps easing off. It's been going well, stressful though with exam season approaching. I've been reading a lot on the weekends to relax though

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How's your service going in military?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: its have been an honor for me to serve this country. I heard about yours casino's?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is awesome! Thank you so much for your service. The casino business was a thrill. I was upset that it ended so abruptly, but working in the day care industry has been pretty fulfilling as well. I love children!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: sad to heard man I am sure you will make a lot of more things that you want. oh really kids are really nice. how is the business going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Business is good. We picked up alot of kids following the holiday season so that is exciting. Do you have any kids of your own?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2

dialogue.author: Speaker 1

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Aww how precious! I plan to have a few of my own eventually. How long have you been in the military?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: a few years its have been pretty hard on my kittens but they know i need to be there

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I understand. I would imagine anytime away is difficult but it's all for a greater purpose. Where have you been able to travel to during your time in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you seen any good episodes of The Simpsons lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not really. I've been so busy with work that I haven't watched Simpsons lately. I wish I have more money.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh??  same here.  I picked up a couple of side gigs.  One is at this place called Amazon Turk.  Have you heard of it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: LOL yes I've heard about it. I don't know if it's worth the effort though if the minimum wage will raise to $15. I might earn more getting a part time job in person.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I figure it is not my main source of income, but if I find myself laying around the house with nothing to do, I might as well attempt to make a little money.  And, it beats going across town to a job... and if I don't feel like working I can just close my computer.  I can't imagine relying on it as my main source of income.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is true. Same here. If I don't have much going on at work then I would check mturk and see what's going on. It's a nice side gig to earn some amazon gift card money to buy random stuff you want lol

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah.... I use my money I earn to by cryto currency.  I mean, if it fails, I am really not out anything.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: oh... You may have made a smart choice than me lol. I didn't link this to my account, and basically transfer money to amazon and buy stuff using this.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's alright... everybody needs stuff.  So, it is more or less like it is free stuff.  Are you able to change your financing choices?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: BTW bitcoin's been increasing like crazy recently. Did you buy bitcoin or other currencies? My financing hasn't changed remember I can't even afford meatloaf as I mentioned before :(

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I know... that is why I am suggesting changing from being into material things and instead getting the cash.  And I bought some bitcoin, but I spend a lot on cosmos.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I need to change my strategy. Thanks for the recommendation. I had a couple of cents of US dollar bitcoin a couple of years ago and now it's $500.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My mom told me my fortune.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What did she predict for your future?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That I'm going to have a supernatural experience which will go viral on youtube.  Can you believe that?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds a little scary, honestly.  Not a big fan of ghosts.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not as scary as vampires and werewolves!  I think ghosts are mostly friendly.  Have you ever seen a ghost?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's true!  I would like to believe they are mostly friendly, but I've never met/seen one.  Have you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The ghost of my mom's grandmother lives in our house.  She used to sing lullabies to me when I was young and now to my daughter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I would move!  Do you find the singing comforting?  How old is your daughter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I find it very comforting and sometimes it the only thing which gets my kid to sleep.  She's 3 and sometimes has nightmares.  Do you have any kids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes it a little better.  No, I do not have kids.

s1.value: She's my mom.
2. I always get a lucky phone number with my fortune teller.

s2.value: He is an American Christian who, in 1995, made a shocking claim about his supernatural experiences.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I tried reading a book to someone, to see if they like it like you do.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Did they like it? Which book did you read aloud?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They did! I used the first Harry Potter book since they've never read them! Can you believe it?!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Nice, I'm glad that they liked it.  Maybe you can read harry potter to me, too.  I've never read that one.  Is that one of your favorites?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It is, it's an easy story to get lost in. Lots of adventure and action. What are some of your favorites?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I really like The Hunger Games.  I had to read it for school, but I really liked it.  Have you read that one?  Now I want to see the movie version.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't yet, but it's on my list. I haven't seen the movie either, I prefer to read the book first. Do you like audio books?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, it's almost like someone was in person reading to me.  I'm a slow reader, so I like listening to someone else read to me.  Do you listen to a lot of audio books?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like listening to them while I work or do other activities. I get them from the library.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's a great idea so you don't have to pay for them.  I love getting movies from the library since it costs so much to go to the movie theater.  I love movies.  Do you have any favorite movies?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love watching movies too, I watch so many different types I don't know if I have a favorite. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea it's hard to pick a favorite.  I really like Will Smith movies.  He's a great actor.  I like Denzel Washington and Natalie Portman too.  Do you have favorite actors?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you been golfing lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have, I live in Florida, so I spend a lot of my time golfing or at the beach with my family. Have you mini golfed lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: yes i golfed yesterday and got hit in the head by a ball im in the hospital right now, how is life in Florida ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh, that's terrible, I'm sorry! Yes, life in Florida is really good, my job is amazing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: good i am glad you enjoy your job, i have a new dog named peter pan

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's such a cute name, what kind of dog is it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: thanks !  its a boxer dog its only a puppy, have you got any pets ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a golden retriever dog named Comet, he absolutely loves playing at the beach with my kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: aww Comet thats a nice name, i love the beach but i need to stay out of the sea i keep nearly drowning

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes the beach is very nice, but not if you almost drown. Maybe stick to the sand!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: i do stick to the sand.. after its melted me to it ! have you got any holidays booked

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Since we live in Florida by the beach, it always seems like a holiday. But my husband and I are planning on taking a trip to Vegas soon. What about you?

s1.value: Speaker 2: Have you been mini golfing lately? Have you been golfing lately? I live in Florida, so I spend a lot of my time golfing or at the beach with my family. dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are your pre-law studies going? How's your dog, Biscuit?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Studies are going good. My dog Biscuit is doing good also.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It would be hard for me to study law. I would do well when I am up, but would struggle when I'm down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It is vary hard you really have to want it, there is definitely a price to pay. How have you been with your moods?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's not too bad when I remember to take my medication, but if I forget, then I really struggle. It would be fun to climb trees with you, when I'm in a good mood.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You need to set a alarm with a special bell to remind you to take your medication.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good idea. I can set an alarm on my phone, but then I also need to remember to bring my meds with me when I go out. I would really need to take them if I were going to climb trees.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not to sure climbing trees is a good idea right now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you ever climbed a tree? You said you like to play ultimate in the park. Is climbing trees part of playing ultimate?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have climbed a tree before but not when I pay ultimate.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Cool! Do you take Biscuit with you when you play ultimate or does your screaming scare him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No that scares her so she stays home.

s1.value: Speaker 1: You can't really study for law. You would do well when you are up, but would struggle when you're down.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey what songs do you sing the shower?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I usually just sing along to whatever is playing on the radio!  What about you?  Or do you mostly just listen to piano music all the time?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually like all forms of classical music. But piano is my favorite.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, that makes sense.  How long have you been working on playing the piano?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I started when I was five so that is twenty years now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow!!  That is a very long time to dedicate to that!  I bet you can play just about anything!  Do you write your own music or just play already written music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm afraid I'm not very good at composing. My favorite music to play is anything by Mozart. Are you familiar with him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm sure that would be a whole different kind of hard.  I can't imagine trying to write music like that.  I have definitely heard of Mozart but I'm not super familiar with much classic music.  Do you have a specific song by him that you would recommend?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I would recommend The Magic Flute Opera. That is my favorite, especially the Queen of the Night Aria. You can also check out the movie Amadeus although there are some inaccurate parts in the movie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: OK!  Thank you, I'm going to write all these down so I can make sure to look them up, it sounds exciting!  I love watching movies so eve if it's a little inaccurate I'm sure I'll enjoy it.  Do you have a favorite movie?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Amadeus is actually my favorite movie ha ha. Some other favorites of mine include Pleasantville, The Power of One, and Amelie.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'll definitely have to watch that one soon then!  Oh my goodness, I haven't seen Pleasantville in years!  I do remember liking it though!  I haven't seen the other two you mentioned though.  i really like superhero movies like al the Avengers ones!

s1.value: Speaker 1: Hey, what kind of foods do you like? (or music choices too please!)
Speaker 2: I usually just don't eat anything at all.  I get my entire meals in my car, so there's that.

s2.value: Speaker 2 has been a professional pianist for 22 years.
2. Speaker 1 doesn't like to listen to music while she is at work because she's already been trained in it for so long.

dialogue.author: 13054: I
dialogue.text: s lifting weights at the gym and saw a yoga class going on and thought of you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thinking of going? It's great for stretching out those muscles after you have a good lift!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am considering it.   Can I bring my kids?   Does your son join you in yoga?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did baby yoga with him when he was little but he's too all over the place now for an adult class. We do some kid-focused yoga that's a little more active and game-oriented. I bet you could find one in your area that both your kids would enjoy. How old are they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are 8 and 12 and are fairly well-versed in meditation.  I'll have to look for local yoga for them.  Have you been to the beach lately to look for shells?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: There's also hip hop yoga - you might like that with you musical taste. No, I haven't been to the beach yet this year. Hoping to take a trip soon and find some good ones. What kind of meditation do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hip hop  yoga sounds fun.  I've dabbled in transcendental meditation, but it's a little difficult to relax. I'm trying so hard to slow down the pace. I'm even trying to drive slower!  Thinking about getting a  minivan like  you have.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you tried alligator meat yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have not tried alligator meat. I find that it is too close to crocodiles, which I consider my pets, and I can't bring myself to eat it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I completely understand but they're actually sworn enemies which is why I DO eat them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I never realized that. How does it taste? Is it your favorite meat? Do you go shopping for it online or in a store? I've never really even seen it anywhere and I've done a lot of traveling.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It has an acquired taste, it's a bit rubbery but I suspect that's due to my poor cooking, as for getting the meat I actually hunt the alligators, they come on to my land and disrupt my crocs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, I didn't realize that is how you got them. That seems a bit dangerous to me. Have you ever watched that alligator hunting show on television? You should look up some recipes, or perhaps cook the alligator in a slow cooker for better results. How is your yoga coming along, I've been thinking about trying it out. I need a new routine for my physical health.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have watched a show similar to the alligator hunting show but it was called crocodile hunter and is obviously superior, as for my yoga I've been making strides with a particular hard position called the crocodile. How have your crocodiles been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's interesting, a position called the crocodile, I'll have to look into that. My crocodiles have been good. They are a lot of work, they want a lot of attention, not to mention food. I am thinking about downsizing to two crocodiles and finding a home for the other two. Would you like to have them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Of course I would but it depends on their names or do you think I could rename them?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You could rename them, they really don't listen to me when I call them by name. You can come over and pick out the two you want, as long as you have a way to transport them.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Of course we'll create an impromptu water van, so they can stay in the water as I drive them back to my place.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Okay. Let me know when you're ready and you can come over and pick them up. I will be leaving for vacation next week, so if you want them this week let me know.

s1.value: It is often referred to as the "Bounty Hunter". The speaker is a bounty hunter.
2. The speaker is known for hunting gators and crocodiles.
3. The speaker's family has been hunting alligators for generations.

s2.value: She's a foodie and has a low bar.
2. She would consider eating the alligator meat if it weren't too close to her pet crocodiles.
3. She only practices yoga in her own time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Tell me more about your book.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's about my brothers and I growing up on a homestead in Alaska with a tryanical step-father and an indifferent mother.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow that is really interesting. If you don't mind me asking is it based on your life or is it fiction?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's all true but I tried to make it an treatsy on childhood written by a twelve year old with a sense of humor.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well let me know when it is out I would love to read it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Already submitted. Available on Amazon Books. However I have sincere doubts about it becoming a best seller. I probably won't make enough to cover the cost of printer paper but I felt I had to write it. Therapy, you know.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, sometimes it is good for the soul to get things down on paper. So did you get a chance to take your shih tzu out since we last spoke?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Everyday. We both love to walk but the weather is changing. Supposed to get really cold with snow starting today so we might bail for a couple of days. Do you plan to get another dog soon?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been thinking about it. I loved my dog, but they are a lot of work. Sometimes it is hard to figure out where to leave him when I'm on vacation. I think I would get a big dog next. Maybe a doberman.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are such good companions even though they can be aggravating from time to time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are also great for meeting people, but I'm sure you know that. I bet you talk to a lot of new people when you're at a dog park.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It depends on the other dog owner. Some of them are more neurotic than their dogs.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an author of a children's book,

s2.value: His brother and sister were children at the time he was born.
2. He never really knew any one else but his mother.
3. He grew up on a homestead in Alaska.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What kind of music do you like? Do you listen to French music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I listen to mostly English music, what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Same, my favorite performer is The Weeknd. Did you watch his performance during the superbowl? The reviews have been pretty mixed

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I haven't, what songs did he play?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: most of his recent songs, my favorite is Blinding Lights which he played. Who is your favorite artist?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Starboy is a good The Weeknd song, have you heard of Lil Peep?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have! He passed away right? So sad. Do you listen to his music?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea I listen to his music, have you listened to any of his songs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I actually haven't.. but a band that I listen to called The 1975, one of their lyrics is "Rest in Peace Lil Peep your Poetry is in the Streets" so I've been meaning to listen! I'm sure he has some great stuff

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He has a lot of great stuff, have you heard of Me by The 1975? one of my favorite The 1975 songs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I love that song! I saw them live in Philly once. Do you ever go to concerts?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I don't get to go to concerts much, what about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you make your students draw unicorns? How did that turn out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did. They did really well. The girls better than the boys, I am not sure why that might be. What do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's good to hear! I'm sure it may have something to do with girls and their obsession with unicorns. Haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes I think so. What do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My apologies. I didn't mean to press send yet. I teach science. When did you last have the chance to play pool?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No problem, technology has its pains. That's great! Do you get to do many crazy experiments? I haven't played in a couple months now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's for sure! We do try, but the students tend to get a bit rowdy if the experiments are too exciting and the other teachers don't much appreciate dealing with that in the following classes so I try not to do the weird and wacky ones too often. That's a shame that you haven't been able to play, hopefully soon. What is it that draws you to want to visit the pyramids?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My science teacher lit a strip of magnesium one time. Would highly doing that one if you can, I am sure the kids will love it. I guess I love trigonometry and angles and design. I guess maybe thats why I enjoy pool too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We definitely covered that one in the first lesson. An all-time favourite that I remember fondly from high school also. That makes sense, it's certainly al relative. What's your favourite thing to draw?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha yes, cant replace that wide-eyed amazement in high school. I love nature and like drawing landscapes. We should do hiking together sometime?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Certainly! I can totally relate to that. I think if I could draw anything other than a stick man, it would certainly be the beautiful sights I've seen while hiking, especially from the top of mountains. They're a bit greener than the pyramids but certainly just as breathtaking! It would be amazing to be able to share the view together one day when we can make it happen. Maybe we could play pool after?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, I agree. It is a great break from the kids too. Nothing to make you appreciate peace and quiet like being a teacher. Yes, let's do it! When are you in town next?

s1.value: Speaker 1: I teach science.
2. Speaker 2: I do. I do some teaching too.
3. Speaker 1: I live in Toronto.

s2.value: Speaker 1: Do you teach science? Speaker 2: Yes. Speaker 1: Did you make your students draw unicorns? Do you teach math?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your driving going, are you being careful?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: After the incident I am driving much more carefully, I never want to be in that situation again!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Glad you learned your lesson I suppose. I can see why you wouldn't want to go through that again. Maybe buy yourself a junky car too. One that doesn't even go fast.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm trying to reduce my driving anyway, been riding my bike a lot more! Do you ride a bike to art school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I take the bus. Actually just got a brand new bag to carry all my supplies in. Really excited about it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh that's good, must be a nightmare having to carry all those loose items, have you picked up any new paints recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haven't been able to. Blew all my savings on the bad. I've got my eye on this crimson color that I think will bring some nice depth to my work though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Crimson is definitely a great colour, would really stand out! Hopefully you can recoup all your savings and quickly too.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Trying to sell some of my pieces at a coffee shop right now. You should check them out. They are up at brew station on 5th.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd love to, I'll ride my bike there some time, anything to support you. How is school coming along?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Still going well. I heard that second year is when it gets really tough though. You doing any painting yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm not all that gifted at producing art but I definitely can admire it! I'm sure I'll admire yours.

s1.value: The driver that cut her off crashed into a dump truck. The driver suffered a bad head injury and was rushed to hospital. Speaker 1 says she is sorry and learned her lesson.

s2.value: Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 were driving in a highway accident. Both drivers had to be hospitalized and Speaker 2 had to have a broken leg.
2. Both speakers are trying to reduce their driving.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am thinking of starting my own Facebook page.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a cool idea. What would the page be marketed towards?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: towards raising funds for the handicapped willing to participate in professional handicapped horse racing

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I didn't even know handicapped horse racing existed, to be quite honest with you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well, its rather a new concept and only very few handicapped individuals participate in it. My plan is to increase the number and make it a competitive sport like other conventional sports

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How exactly does it work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There are supporting equipment's that are usually placed on horses to help the handicapped stay in place and get that balance required to ride a horse

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That is so cool. I have a friend who is blind. Would she qualify?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Most definitely. The horses are well trained too to handle most of the human disabilities

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would be so much fun. I'm so happy that people like you exist.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Im glad to hear that. It's great to try and make the world a better place for everyone

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, equality is not valued enough.

s1.value: Speakers name is Speaker
2. Speaker 2 is a business man.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is the president of the World's Most Valuable Horse Racing Club
2. He also has created a "Handicapped Champion" award
3. He is a business man with a social conscience.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you enjoy the snow fall the other day?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did! Did you play in the snow with your family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sure I did. I adore my family. How is work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's pretty busy at the moment. How is work going for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am quite busy too. There is quite a lot on my table right now, but I am hacking it. I like the interactions I have with the kids.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great, kids are fun. What grade do you teach?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I teach fourth grade. Things are different now with online school. We try to make the most out of it though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That would make things interesting. Do your kids go to the same school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, my son attends a special kids school and my daughter is at a different one.  What are you doing this winter?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That makes sense. I'm planning on going snowboarding when work slows down. Do you like any winter sports?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like hiking. I haven't tried any winter sports. My daughter likes snowboarding though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: snowboarding is so much fun, you should try it!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a teacher, they enjoy snowfall and playing with children, and teaching their class. They also enjoy video gaming and computer time.

s2.value: She is a teacher.

dialogue.author: 23666: I
dialogue.text: tched 2 seasons of a really good anime.  I hope there will be another season.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What was the series? I haven't watched any anime for a while

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's really great. It's a series based on Kurosawa's film The Seven Samurai. But so much better than the movie. You can do much more stuff with animation than you can in live action.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe I should give animated shows another chance some time. The film of Seven Samurai was very good. I tend to watch films after work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What have you watched recently?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I watched La Haine last night. I really like French films. Do you watch a lot of anime?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, loads of anime! It's all I watch. Every since I was a kid, I just loved it. Especially the proper Japanese anime. Sometimes other groups around the world have tried to copy it, but it's just not the same!! You really should check it out!!

dialogue.author: 13609: Ho
dialogue.text: is work going? Have you performed at any bars or clubs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I did that once years ago.  My friend Bob helped me a lot.  It was difficult but kind of fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It would be quite interesting to see how you are performing as a DJ but I think I am quite old for bars and clubs. Where do you work at the moment?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The radio station here in town.  I have a good time taking calls from people on my local interest show.  Spinning records at a club is very high energy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Maybe I should call on your show so we can give few recipes of healthy food? I have few in mind which I think will be interesting

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, that it the kind of thing people seem to enjoy.  Do you have a fudge brownie with sunflower seeds recipe?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Never tried to make a brownies before to be honest. Mostly  I like to experiment with vegan food lately. Did you had any celebrity on your radio show?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Some guy named Nathan Fillion called in.  He was trying to get some science fiction TV show he was on from getting canceled.  Honestly blind people watch TV, but the difference between science fiction and sap operas is small when you can not see the space ships.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your second child doing, how long till you have him?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Have you got a chance to get a break from your nursing career and relax for a few days yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been trying to take breaks on my day off and decompress.  It's hard sometimes to get time off!  I'm sure you can understand being a mom!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes, and I still haven't had my second little guy decide to come visit yet. I have about two more weeks left.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet you're so excited!  How old is your first, I can't remember.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My first is 2. I think I'll have my hands full. I was concerned that it might add a bit to my anxiety, but my husband is going to take a bit of time off and work from home more.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's great that your husband can take time off!!!  I bet that will help alleviate some of your anxiety!  I see a lot of people in the ER with anxiety issues!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I imagine you certainly do. How long have you been a nurse?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: For 25 years!  It's my passion!  Even though it's such tiring work!  What did you do before you started a family?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I met my husband while he was in college for Engineering and we married after he graduated, so it's been 10 years now.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Does your husband like working in engineering?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He loves it. He's so good at it, that he was promoted to senior engineer in 3 years, which is quite fast. I know I'm bragging, but he's just great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: What type of food do you produce at your farm?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I produce all kinds of veggies, wheat, corn and I have varieties of fruit orchard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How long have you been a farmer?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's been more than 20 years now. I love farming. Why you moved so many times?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My spouse works in the military so we end up moving every few years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's interesting. You must have seen so many places and might be a tiring too. I love exploring new places, but don't have time due to farming.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Traveling to new places is fun but you don't get to make a lot of friends that way.  Do you own your own land?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I can understand that, sometimes it is hard to find good friends. I have my own land which is inherited from my grand parents.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There's not nearly as many farmers nowadays as there use to be, it must be tough for small farmers like yourself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah it gets pretty tough sometimes and crops don't turn out as well as I thought they would. The revenue nowadays is pretty low and the markets are less lenient to take my produce.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I respect farmers, I know I couldn't do all that work.  The most I can do is manage a small vegetable garden in my backyard.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Managing a vegetable garden is not even easy. Keep it up! I respect people who serve in military.

s1.value: Speaker 1: What type of food do you produce at your farm?
2. I produce all kinds of veggies, wheat, corn and I have varieties of fruit orchard.

dialogue.author: 7710: I j
dialogue.text: t learned the most interesting thing about why certain cultures paint animals on cave walls.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What did you learn about the cave paintings?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They were using them to document the migration of the animals! Isn't that amazing that people that long ago, figured out the animals' habits?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's amazing! I've always been fascinated with how ancient civilizations interacted with animals. Did you watch a documentary on it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've actually been reading a book about ancient cultures. It's really interesting. How has school been going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: School's been going great! It's my last semester until I graduate so I'm excited to be finishing up my teaching degree. How's work been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's wonderful news! You've worked really hard for it. Work is work. It's the same as always, but now I'm working from home full time instead of part time. I like it better that way. I've been building a new gaming computer for my nephew, so that's keeping me pretty busy.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great that you get to spend time with your nephew. I built a gaming computer last year but I haven't been able to play many games because I've been so busy with school. Have you seen any new movies or shows that you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I watched the Queen's Gambit, and that was really interesting. Have you seen that yet?
