dialogue.author: 21897: Wh
dialogue.text: are some cool things to do in Denver?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well there's great skiing not too far from the city. We also have great sports teams - you like hockey right? Avalanche games are super fun to go to! What about Oklahoma?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It would be so amazing to see an Avalanche game! I do wish we had skiing some place close, that sounds like a lot of fun! How is the job search going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's going well. I submitted a bunch of resumes and got some callbacks for interviews for next week. I'm hoping one works out. What line of work are you in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh I manage a call center for a telecommunications company. What kind of work are you looking to get into?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: How do you like doing that? I'm looking for something in advertising.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's fairly rewarding. I mostly engage with the team supervisors and work on mentoring and developing them. I have a great team and they are wonderful to work with. Advertising sounds interesting, have you worked in that line before?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds like a really fulfilling job. How long have you been doing it? Yes I majored in marketing communications and got a job with Coors, but I was recently let go unfortunately. I'd love to get back into the game - "Mad Men" is a big inspiration haha - have you watched it?

dialogue.author: 21897: I'
dialogue.text: been doing it for over 10 years. And yhes I love Mad Men! That's a great show! Who is your favorite character?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I tried making some cinnamon rolls myself, but i messed them up.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's okay, I'm sure you will make them better next time. Sometimes when I make them they don't work either.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Do you have any tips to make them well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think overpreparing the dough can be a big problem. I try not to work it too much. Is there anything else you enjoy cooking/baking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I enjoy baking brownies, they always turn out great.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's true, and mostly just sugar so they taste phenomenal as well.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I use sugar alternatives so they are a bit healthier. Have you ever found anything neat at GoodWill?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's definitely a wise idea, anything to reduce the amount of sugar is good. Loads! There's always bargains there. My favourite purchase recently was an expensive coat that I got for around $3. Do you ever go to GoodWill yourself?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have a few times. The good will store near me never has much but I found a huge beautiful mirror for only $5 and I cleaned it up and sold it for over $200. I need to go more. I just never have time to go through all the clothes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow, that's an impressive turnover. Loads of people I know do that, thrifting and reselling. There's something really thrilling about it. You are right, things can be chaotic in there but there are real gems. Beats a high street store for sure.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I never can feel good about what I buy if I spend a lot on it. I love getting it for lower.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me too, and it's so much better for the planet. Do you try to be sustainable in other ways too?

s1.value: I am a vegetarian.
2. I live in Ontario.
3. I love to bake and cook.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is the LARPing going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Been going well before COID hit. Now, we can only LARP over Zoom. Really not the same.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it isn't. You can't be as creative without being in person. I've never LARPed before, but I plan on trying sometime! What other creative/gaming activities do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, LARPing is my main hobby, but I also like to make new outfits for my LARPing hobby.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh that's fun! I've never made my own clothes before. How hard is it to make those outfits?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, it is not too hard to learn how to sew, how to pick between fabrics, or how to know which materials to use. It isn't hard, it just takes a bit of tie for it to 'click' with you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's a good way to put it. Maybe I'll have to give it a try during my next vacation! Oh, by the way, what was your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am a Senior Network Engineer. I basically build and design computer networks for clients. What's your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's awesome! I'm still working at the bank. It sounds like we both have our hands full!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeaj, hopefully, I can pick up where our LARPing group left off.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm sure it'll be like old times once it gets going again. It might be better than ever since it's been so long since you've done it in person!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, can say one thing: this extended break has allowed me to come up with some new ideas for my LARPing group.

(Topic: Speaker 1)

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I baked a cake today.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: What kind of cake was it? I haven't had a piece of cake in a long time and I've never tasted any of your cakes.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It was just a plain vanilla cake. My mom is still teaching me how to bake, and I'm just starting to get good at it! I hope to learn some fancier recipes in the future though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Is your mom a baker? Perhaps you will have a career in baking, or maybe even your own bakery one day. Have you had time todo some dancing lately, or has it just been cake baking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, but my grandpa was a baker and she learned a lot from him. I have thought about owning a bakey one day, but I am not really sure yet. I mostly just do it for fun right now. I practice dancing almost every day.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good for you Oliver, I'm glad you have time to keep up with your dancing. Are there any dance classes in Junior High School?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not at the school no. I have to go for separate tap dancing classes after school. Do you do any dancing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: No I don't dance at all, I have two left feet and I'm afraid I'm not very artistic. I do read a lot in my spare time, I love to read. Have you read anything new by Charles Dickens lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I haven't read much lately, since I've been busy with baking and dancing, but it'd be nice to start a new book if you have any suggestions.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't think you would be interested in the types of books I have been reading. I like to read books about activism, mainly about political or social issues. I do like to read a good piece of literature by one of the masters from time to time also.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that's too bad. I wonder if you have any interest in baking!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do like to cook, but I have not tried very much baking. I usually just go to the local bakery and pick up my breads and cakes. I'm glad some people love to bake cakes because I sure love to eat them.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I baked a cake today.
2. Speaker 2: What kind of cake was it? I haven't had a piece of cake in a long time and I've never tasted any of your cakes.

s2.value: Speaker 1 is interested in baking.
2. Speaker 2 likes vanilla and plain cakes.
3. Speaker 1 is the only one who can bake a cake.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been swimming regularly and looking into getting a dog.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Aw nice you swim too ? I usually go to the local pool on Thursdays , you should come with me it'll be fun

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Or you can come to my apartment? I have a pool and, well, its nice and private if you'd like...

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: You've got an apartment in your pool ? wow that's awesome , yeah I could come hang out tomorrow if youre free? Maybe we could do some yoga afterwards.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: mhm :) And I like your thinking. I'd love to see your downward dog hehe. Come over!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha my yoga instructor did say my downward dog form was pretty good, I would love to try some more advanced positions out , maybe you could show me some.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha I'll put the dog in the kitchen and then we're free to experiment. Maybe I can take you shopping too?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah I thought we could go shopping afterwards , I wanna get some cute outfits. Oh yeah , I forgot you had a dog lol , how is he?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He's good. I just dont think we need his company. Keep the outfits for my eyes only ;)

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha yeah you could help pick them out for me. Im super excited to go , maybe we could even go out for a few drinks after

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah there are some good bars near my new place and a couple ive not tried yet. You can stay over if you like

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow I was gonna ask if I could stay over, since the journey from my place to yours is quite long, Do you have a spare guest room for me or would I have to share with you ?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Have you got your car repaired?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It isn't repaired yet, but hope to have it fixed soon.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you bring it into the shop or is it just chilling in front of your house for now?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's actually at a friend's house. He's a mechanic and working on it for me. How many sisters do you have?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great! When do you think he'll have it done by? And I have 2 sisters.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't know how long it will take. There's no rush since I work at home and have another vehicle. I have 1 younger sister. Are you older than your sisters?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm the oldest kid in my family. But I am a bit immature haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Why do you say that? I'd think being a paramedic you'd consider yourself to be mature.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: At work I'm all serious. But if you find me on the street I'm all fun and games. I love pulling pranks on my friends lol.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Somewhat of a jokester then? I love it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, last week I put plastic wrap in the doorway to my friend's kitchen and he walked directly into it face first haha. I recorded it with some other friends. It was hilarious!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I bet it was utterly hilarious!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Did you play badminton this weekend? How did it go?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It was fun even though I played terribly and lost, haha. Seen any good movies lately?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha! I need to get out and try a game sometime. I recently watched the Titanic again ha. Haven't seen that in ages!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh me neither! I remember when that came out which makes me feel very old. It was one of those that EVERYONE rushed out to see. And it won so many Oscars! What did you think of it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Me too! I saw it in the theater back then too. I enjoyed it this time around as well!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good to hear, I'll have to rewatch it again. Did you see Avatar? Same director, and just as expensive!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've seen that too! Great movie. Another one I haven't watched in years.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Me too. I saw that in the cinema but I didn't like it as much. How has work been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Work has been going pretty well, just super busy. How about you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good, busy. People are making an effort to shop at smaller farms instead of big box stores which is wonderful!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Glad it's going well for you! I forget what area your farm is in?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: On the southside of town. We have 40 acres and a huge red barn, you can't miss it!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your tour going?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's been crazy, just crazy! Definitely enjoying seeing all the sights in the States and all the different food!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's cool which cities have you been to so far?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: New York, Chicago, and Rochester! NYC and Chicago were crazy and really busy, but Rochester was really nice. All the people were great and it wasn't so busy! Have you ever been to NYC?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Not yet and I really can't wait to attend one of your tours, will you guys be coming to Miami?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, we'll be in Miami in a couple of weeks! Maybe you could show me to some cool places to eat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah that will be an honor I really like your rap style, okay so where can I get the tickets?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh man, I don't really keep track of where the staff sell the tickets haha! They're probably online somewhere, but DM me on Twitter and I'll hook you up with some freebies! Got any places to eat in mind?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeeeeeey you are certainly the best man. I know I joint down from my place. Man it has got the best burgers and pizza

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh I am so down for that. Japan has some amazing food, but everything gets old after a while. America has such a crazy mix of food; I love it so much!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's true and then I'll show you a secret place which lights up just after midnight, I tell you the best street food and car show ever

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh even better! American cars have such a unique vibe to them; it really rocks my world! You're definitely gonna have to take me around after the show!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hey there! How is your family doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My family are doing well. wifey is out for work though.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh no, I am sorry about that, What happened, as I remember she worked there for quite a few years didn't she?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She went to work I mean.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Oh my, need to listen carefully. So are you with your little ones by yourself? You must be having fun.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's no fun, I tell you. Having to be with 2 beautiful active kids is stressful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I can imagine, kids have so much more energy than us. I remember my parents having hard time with me when I was a kid. How old are yours exactly?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are just 5years and 2years old

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's good there is no big age difference between them so they can play together. I am sure they are fighting lots aren't they. I used to with my sister as I remember.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They fight a lot over toys and attention. They both want my attention at the same time.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: And I am sure they always want the same toys at the same time as well. My kids used to do that when they were little. Million toys at home but they always needed the same to play with.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Exactly, I'm clueless at the moment as to what to do.

dialogue.text: What do you call your horse?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I call her Becky after my mom, she is the person who adopted me. Do you like horses?

dialogue.text: i do like horses.  although i do not have much experience with them.  do you ride a lot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I try and ride at least once a day, I would be glad to show you the ropes one day if you are willing

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: would love to.  it is great that every horse has their own personality.  much like dogs and people.

dialogue.text: same here.  not a fan of large crowds unless i am at s concert.  love live music.  but would prefer the mountains, woods, or a sandy beach.  do you travel much?r

dialogue.text: Sadly I do not travel much given my workload at my accounting firm. Which kind of video games do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: bummer.  i travel a lot for work so it's part of my job.  i definitely don't have time for video games, but do enjoy reading books.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I enjoy super mario, what kind of books do you like?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Who is your favorite Game of Thrones Character?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably Jojen Reed because I really like that actor lol.  Do you have one?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Honestly i like them all.  The show is so engaging.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's very exciting!  I like all the fighting and the action.  Keeps me wanting to always watch more!  Same reason I love playing Halo I guess haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Exactly..Halo is definetly full of action.  So tell me why you enjoy cold showers?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I don't actually like them....haha!  But...I did a lot of research and there are a lot of benefits to them.  They make your body adapt to things that are stressors, so you handle stress better, it can help with sleeping too.  There are a surprising amount of helpful things from doing it, even if it isn't pleasant.  Have you ever tried it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow I would think it would wake you up an not help you sleep.  I am going to have to do some research

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, if you do it right before bed it would probably wake you up.  I usually try to in the morning first thing and it helps me feel invigorated to start my day.  It's definitely worth looking into.  The first month is kind of hard but after that it really doesn't feel too uncomfortable anymore

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well I will look into it for sure.  i am always looking to bette my health

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Cool, you'll have to let me know if you end up trying it!  There's a lot of research out there on it.  What kinds of things do you like to do for healthy exercise?  I like running and hiking.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I like riding a bike..I love riding on a great trail.  I get my exercise while enjoying a beautiful view

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's true!  That's why I love hiking!  I want to try riding a bike on a trail but I'm scared to crash!  Have you ever had a bad fall?

No, no, no, it's so hard lol. I like them all. I don't like to say. I like the fighting.  I really like the action.  Keeps me wanting to always watch more! same reason i love playing Halo I guess haha

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I had a terrible day working at the bar. My customers were so rude!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh my goodness! What happened?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: There was this lady that was super demanding, ike she was the only person I had t serve. I got to her when I could and she screamed that it was the worst service she has ever received and stromed out. The energy was like that pretty much all night! People were so pushy!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yikes, I witnessed something similar the last time I went to a honkeytonk down south. Do you have a good bouncer there?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah. Pretty big intimidating looking guy, but he's super cool. It's been a while since I've been to a honkeytonk.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It's one of the main reasons I want to move down there, well that and the Applachian mountains.  I've found it very tough to move though, my wife lost her job and we can't afford much anymore.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry to hear that. I know it must be stressful situation. I hope you are getting plenty outdoor time.That always seems to bring me a little peace. Especially when I am out on the water. Have you ever tried surfing? It's incredibly soothing.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That does sound fun. I like anything to do with nature, although I've never actually been to the beach. Is it hard to learn?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It took some time for me to learn, but when I let go of my fear of it, it became much easier. I've seen some cool critters out on the water.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I might have to try it whenever I go. As weird as it sounds, I really want to see a crab. They're like my favorite animal even though I've never seen one.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They are so cute! I see them often here. They are fun to watch. If you could move to any country, which would it be?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Probably Canada. Living in the wilderness like that, away from everything is a big dream of mine.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I just made some cauliflower nachos after you mentioned them. They're great!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I hope you love them! I did when I first made them. Did you enjoy making the dish?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes, I did enjoy it. And they came out really good. I used vegan cheese. Thanks for the idea. What did you have for dinner tonight?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have some steamed veggies with baked salmon. Delicious after playing rugby all day with my friends.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds good and healthy. How was rugby? Do you play competitively? I would like to watch you play sometime.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't play competitively, though I do try to play a game at least one a week with friends. The rumble and tumble of the game is what drew me too it as a boy. Been playing the sport since middle school. Even though you don't like them, what sport would you play if you had to pick?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yout must be really good at it. Hmm. Watching sports is ok, but I have never really been into playing them. I think I would play something like golf, a game that I could play alone and out in nature.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: So it seems you like the slow, relaxing nature of playing a sport. Is it because to too much like exercise?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am not against exercicing. I just don't enjoy it at all, so it is hard for me to get motivated to do it. But, yes, I don't like anything too high impact. I would like to play a sport that is peaceful and quiet. What other sports do you play a lot?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I understand. Getting into exercising can be tough and a bit intimidating. As for other sports I play, I also play basketball with friends.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That is good that you keep the sports and exercising up even when it is cold out. I really like the cold, but I don't know if I could play rugby out in it right now. You are impressive.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Thanks. I've been pretty active since I was a kid. Sticking to one place for too long annoys me to no end.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I just made some cauliflower nachos after you mentioned them. They're great!

2. Speaker 2: I hope you love them! I did when I first made them. Did you enjoy making the dish? Yes, I did enjoy it. And they came out really good. I used vegan cheese. Thanks for the idea. What did you have for dinner tonight? I have some steamed veggies with baked salmon. Delicious after playing rugby all day with my friends.
3. Speaker 1: That sounds nice. You should also try out steamed veggies prepared in the pressure cooker, like broccoli, if you are afraid of the microwave.

s2.value: They like to listen to classical music.
2. They go to many concerts each year.
3. They are very active people.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been working on building a new tropical aquarium since we last talked. It's coming along nicely.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great. Is it big? How many fish will live in it?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's a 100 gallon tank. It can fit several fish in it or a few big fishes in it. I think they people that I am making it for want to put about 4 or 5 big fishes in it for their office.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Do they give you specific instruction on how it should look, or do you get to make those decisions yourself? Is this an artistic project for you?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Some have specific instructions, and some others are familiar with my work and trust my artistic decisions so they give me free range. I prefer the latter. I feel like I work better when the creative process is rooted in self-expression. This is one of those projects that I have been given the freedom to do with what I please.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds rewarding. I love being a scientist, but never really developed an artistic side. It's not really creative.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yeah, science and art tends to come from two different sides of the brain. What does your job typically entail?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I work in a reproach lab with a few others Biologists. I do experiments with bacteria, record them, repeat. Very technical. Kind of soothing. But the results take a long time to be meaningful.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Wow, that sounds really interesting! I can see how the repetition, the orderliness of the scientific process, and waiting for the reward of those results can be calming. The long wait makes those results all the more sweeter.  It's kind of like art in the sense that it's hard work but the end results make the process worth it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I think the difference is you probably know when you'll finish an aquarium, whereas we're not really sure when our findings will be useful. Plus, I'm dealing with smaller creatures (bacteria versus fish).

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Hmm you make an important distinction. The waiting therefore is more uncertain than I face with my process. I don't know if I have that level of patience myself. Everyone once in a while, I have the aquarium maker's equivalent of writer's block, but that eventually works itself out before I grow impatient.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's why I like exercising and gymnastics. It's something I can do on a schedule. Every session, when I finish, I feel like I've completed something.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Where is the most interesting place you have traveled to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite trip was when I studied abroad in Italy. Although, there was no beach there. What beach do you usually go to?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I'm near Jacksonville so I go to Atlantic or Jax Beach.  Sometimes I go farther south to where the shore is deserted.  What's your favorite beach abroad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My favorite beach I've visited abroad would have to be Montego Bay in Jamaica. It was so relaxing. That's pretty cool! I've never been to Jacksonville, only Miami!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The beach sounds fantastic!  It does get cold up here but I bet it's warm there at the time.  I can't imagine jetting around so much, do you have a favorite region in Asia?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I love them all! There's so much to see and so much to do. I'm very curious, what is it that you don't like about adventurous trips?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't really care for change.  You have to get on the airplane now with TSA, and I haven't traveled since before that mess.  And who knows what foreign governments are poking around in!  The thought of Chinese communists poking through my copy of Wealth of Nations makes me see red!  How do you cope with all the corruption and uncertainty?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well, I didn't alwasy love to travel. Once work required me to I sort of just got used to it, and then once I saw all of these wonderful places I couldn't get enough! TBH, if they want to do any snooping on me all they will find is my search history of calculus theories! Ha perks of being boring i guess!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Well you're certainly not boring with all of those travel experiences.  I bet being a rich Wall Street fatcat really makes 1st Class travel possible!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Who said anything about Wall Street!!? I'm a financial analyst for Bed Bath and Beyond! They have locations everywhere! But if you know anyone on wall street that's hiring. let me know! LOL

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha!  I bet your living room and entryway are decorated perfectly!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh ya, I get the 20% employee discount that everyone else who shops there get! At least I can vent to my coworkers, though they can get on my nerves. It must be nice not having any.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have never been to New York City. I'm a fan of the beach. I don't mind jetting around if there is no beach. Where do you like to go?
Speaker 2: My favorite trip was when I studied abroad in Italy. Although, there was no beach there. What beach do you usually go to?
Speaker 1: I'm near Jacksonville so I go to Atlantic or Jax Beach.  Sometimes I go farther south to where the shore is deserted.  What's your favorite beach abroad?

s2.value: He's only traveled to Miami, Jacksonville, and Montego Bay in Jamaica. He doesn't like changing, likes to study, and is a financial analyst.

dialogue.author: 10714: I
dialogue.text: w some neat sights here in Sydney, visited some local tourist destinations. I even found some people to salsa dance with!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Sydney truly is a sight-seer's paradise! After your salsa dancing you may want to go to a very nice Greek restaurant nearby, it does delicious food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Sounds amazing! Can't wait to try something special. What is you favourite?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: The gyros are to die for, I highly recommend them! We had them when I went to Sydney with my dad, we used to travel a lot when was in the army.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I will definitely try them! thank you for the tip. How old is your dad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He just turned 60! I baked him a huge cake to celebrate his birthday, he really enjoyed it. When is your birthday?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My birthday actually is next week. My favourite cake is the red velvet. Do you take orders? Can you make it for me?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course! Will you be back in time? I know you're going to Tokyo next and I don't think a cake will survive a flight across the world!

s1.value: Speaker 1 is in Sydney.
10714: I saw some neat sights here in Sydney, visited some local tourist destinations. I even found some people to salsa dance with!

s2.value: Speaker 1: I love to travel and try new things.
2. Speaker 2: A great and loyal friend.
3. Speaker 1: I will go to a sizzling hot Greek restaurant to celebrate my birthday.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How are your dogs doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: They are doing great! They are super happy and spoiled as all dogs should be!  Right now they can't wait for this winter weather to go away so they can spend more time outside.  How have you been?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I've been doing really good and I can't blame them for wanting it to be warmer. What are your dogs' names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I have a Sheltie named Princess and a Beagle named Turtle.  I can't remember, do you have dogs or are thinking of getting any?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I don't have any dogs, but I've been thinking about how it would be nice to have another reason to get outside. What kind of dog do you think I should get?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Well I am pretty biased but I think Shelties are great.  I know I have a Beagle to but Turtle can be kind of lazy.  Shelties like to run and play a lot so they're great for outdoors.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds like the right dog for me. I don't want a dog that's lazy. I want a dog that's going to want to play fetch with me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Beagles will when they are young but they are prone to weight gain and laziness with age so I advise a Sheltie or something along those lines.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Thanks for the suggestions. How old are your dogs?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Princess is 4 and Turtle is 7.  Oh and don't go by the fact that I have two as the number of dogs to get. I have been considering getting a puppy myself.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yea, I think I just want one dog. I feel like two dogs would be a lot of work.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Maybe at first but once you get used to it it becomes a normal routine.  That's why getting a third is nothing for me.

s1.value: They own a cottage in the woods.
2. They live on a lake.
3. They've always been dog people.

s2.value: Has a Beagle and a Shih-Tzu named Turtle.
2. Can't really recall about his other two dogs.

dialogue.author: 20230: Wh
dialogue.text: are your pitbulls names?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Their names are Spikey and Sharpy.  I gave them those collars that have the little studded spikes on it so it felt like appropriate names.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Those are great names! Do you ever get to take them to work at Facebook? I understand they are pet friendly over there.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, they are very pet friendly over there.  They have a big dog park out back, where I can work on my laptop outside (on nice days) and they can run around with other dogs, it's great!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's really cool. I wish I could take my dogs to work but being a doctor that is not really an option haha. But they do like to go on fishing trips with me.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Haha, yeah that probably wouldn't work out too well. They don't scare the fish away by barking do they?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: No, they are usually pretty calm until I actually catch something. Once they see the fish they go crazy thinking its their dinner.

s1.value: Speaker 1 is a doctor.
2. Speaker 1 lives in California.
3. Speaker 1 owns a dog park.

s2.value: They are 20 years old.
2. They got their name from Spike Lee.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I woke up early everyday this week to walk my dogs.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Are you used to the early hours yet?  I'm sure your dog enjoyed it.  I love getting up before everyone else.  I feel like I can get so much done.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It's been tough I won't lie, especially after doing it a few days! My dogs did seem to enjoy going out while it was quieter so that kept me going. Plus it gave me extra time to get some gaming in!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Give it another week or so and you'll be an early bird for life!  Oh yeah, did you get that new game your were talking about?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Haha, we'll see! I did, I've been playing it the last few days it's great! It's Assassin's Creed Valhalla, have you played it yet?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not yet.  It's on my birthday wish list.  So hopefully some in my family will gift it to me in about a month.  Did you enjoy Witcher 3?  I'm wondering about adding that to my list.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I did, it was good and had a lot of play value too, I was playing it for about 6 months overall so it's definitely worth the money. I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy it, it's right up your street!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Good to know.  Is it a multiplayer game?  Maybe if I get it we can play together.  You can show me the ropes getting around the game.  Is your dogs tummy feeling better?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Witcher isn't, but Assassin's Creed is, we can link up online after your birthday if you want! Ah yeah, he's doing better now thanks, adjusting his diet seems to really have helped bless him. Who knows, maybe the early morning starts helped too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds awesome!  I'm glad to hear that he's feeling better.  I'm sure the walks will at least boost his mood and help your other 2 dogs with weight loss.  I learned to like walking dogs at a young age.  It was my chore growing up.  Sometimes I feel like our dog walked me!  Are your dogs big or little?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: They're pretty big, golden retrievers, so they're always full of energy and on the go! I get what you mean about them walking you, ours are always super excited when it's walk time!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yes they are!  My older brother has one and that dog is a handful.  But so loveable.  Are you thinking about breeding your dogs?  I'm seriously thinking about adopting one.

s1.value: Speaker 1: I'm a full time employee and a single mom of 2 kids.
2. Dog walking is my career.
3. I work nights and weekends and I love it!

s2.value: Speaker 1: I always like the night before work, I always walk my dogs before anyone else does.

Speaker 2: I hate it.  I would much rather go out when everyone else is already there, even if it's just to the store.  That way, I don't have to get up to walk them.  Do you get to play your new games like you said?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How was your hike? Did you have a nap when you got back?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Not quite sure I get you right, but yeah, I had plenty of rest time after my workout this morning. And how is your new job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I absolutely love it! There is nothing like a good nap after a workout.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I find you interesting, actually. Your career and dietary lifestyle are animal-centered, sort of. Vegans don't take meat, right? And here you are, a vet that takes care of animals. I'd wonder, what is your religion, if you don' mind me asking?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I guess you could say I follow a path of spiritualism of sorts.  I am very big into nature and animals!  Some people have been known to call me a tree hugger lol  How is your new chair and keyboard working out?  Do you like them better then your old ones?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Of course, I do! It is ergonomic, so it is way more comfortable than the previous ones. And the keyboard is quite as fun as I do not have to double-tap on any letter.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That sounds amazing, you will have to teach me more about ergonomics.  And to answer your earlier question, no vegans don't eat meat!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'd be very happy to teach you about ergonomics, as I would my daughter

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That would be wonderful, I love learning new things and I must say, I don't know a whole lot about it.  How is your daughter doing by the way?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: She's holding up well per yesterday when we talked. Almost sitting for her end of semester exams in Michigan State University. And where did you get your vet degree?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I bet she is glad to be almost done with college.  I studied at Ohio University. Oh I remember the long hours of clinicals so I can totally relate to how she is feeling!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yeah. I'd like for you two to meet; she can appreciate a mentor her age. She's taking something to do with zoology

s1.value: Speaker 1: I have a new job. Speaker 2: I have a new job as well. Speaker 1: And my new chair and keyboard are working out perfectly. Speaker 2: I am curious, what is your religion, if you don't mind me asking? Speaker 1: I follow a path of spiritualism of sorts. Speaker 2: Is that what Veganism is?  If you are a vegan how do you deal with eating meat? Speaker 1: I am a vegan. I try to eat meat sparingly. I do not eat animals. Speaker 2: That makes sense.

s2.value: She practices veterinary medicine on farm animals.
2. She is veg and she takes care of the animals.
3. Her religion is spiritualism and she practices it.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: How is your dog? Have you been doing lots of neighborhood walks together?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: He's doing well, thank you for asking! How about yours? What is his or her name? Yes we have, literally everyday haha.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: My dog is good. His name is Ruffles. I try to walk him when I get breaks from work

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I don't know if I mentioned it before, I am forgetful these days but my dog's name is Leo. Ruffles is a cute name!!!! Love it! Cool, what do you do for work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I work in advertising. Do you miss being a teacher now that you are retired?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I do actually, it was a very good career for me. I still think about my kids sometimes and what they're up to in life now. How is your advertising job treating you these days?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: It has its ups and downs. It can be exciting some days. I'm sure you miss your former students. And I'm sure they probably miss you too!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I get very excited when former students email or reach out to me. I see them while walking Leo sometimes too. What is the best part of your job?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: The best part of my job is probably interacting with different people from across the world. I meet new people and get to learn a little about their culture. Is your husband excited about retiring?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Yea he's very much looking forward to it. I think we will travel more once he retires. I want to visit Asia and Europe! Your job sounds awesome!

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Traveling is great! I wish I could travel more. Where would you visit in Asia?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am thinking Japan or Korea. Which places have you travelled to? Do you not have a lot of time to travel?

s1.value: Speaker 1 is an ad man.
2. Speaker 2's dog is Leo.
3. Speaker 1 has been walking her everyday.

s2.value: Speaker 2 is a retired teacher and animal lover.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I was pulled over by a cop and thought of you.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Because of my father? Why were you pulled over?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes. I ran a red light. It was late and I miss judged the light. It was my first experience getting pulled over. Have you ever gotten pulled over?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry you were pulled over. I have been pulled over before, but for different reasons. Was the cop nice?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: He was nice but I still got a ticket. But I took it as a learning experience. Do you want to become a cop like your Dad?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I'm glad he was nice. I do not want to become a cop, I don't have the right personality for it. What do you do for work?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I am a writer. I do a bit of blogging and write some articles for websites as well. What do you do for a living?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That sounds fun. I am a server in a restaurant. Do you like eating out?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes I like eating out. What is your favorite thing to eat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I am vegetarian, so I enjoy Ethiopian food quite a bit. What is your favorite thing to eat?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I love Chinese food. I like how they prepare the spices. I like any hot and spicy food.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: I also enjoy Chinese food. They have a good variety of vegetarian options. What other types of food do you enjoy?

s1.value: Speakers 1 father was killed in a car accident when he was 20 and his mother had died. He has written several books about his experiences. He was pulled over by a police officer because of his dad.
2. He has a writing career.
3. He is a vegetarian.

s2.value: She was pulled over by a cop because of her father.

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I found a great website for coupons? Do you want to take a look?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Wow,did you indeed? That's great. But let's leave it for later,since I'm a bit tired now. But what are you doing? Have you been to school?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: I have been to school.  I'm so sick of it.  I'm studying on the dock by the lake. What about you?  How is the charity doing?

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Ohh I know you don't like school,but it'll soon be over.It's almost summer!! The charity is good now,apparently my donation has been really helpful. How about going for a walk later,after you finish studying?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: That's very true.  Cannot wait for summer.  You got any plans?  That's great for you to be involved with that.  A walk sounds good.  Might help clear my head a little.

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: My plan for this summer is to travel and relax..I need this indeed!! I'm a bit stressed as well,but I'll tell you more when we meet.When about would you like to go out? Is your partner coming as well?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: We can go in a couple hours.  It will just be me.  Want to grab something to eat after the walk?  I'm getting pretty hungry

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: Oh okay this sounds great!! And regarding the food... of course! Would you like to go to Burger King? Or fancy something else?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Burger king is great!  See you soon!

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: That's great! Okay then. Shall I come and pick you up?

dialogue.author: Speaker 1
dialogue.text: Yes if you dont mind that would be great

dialogue.author: Speaker 2
dialogue.text: It'd be my pleasure. If you'd like to swap Burger King for a late picnic,just let me know
